3 Bars AT&T LTE.  It's June 23rd and there are almost no mosquitos. Road noise is not bad, despite proximity.

name: Anchor Way Pier/Boat Launch
description: big flat, mostly dark parking lot and only one ‘no camping’ sign waaay in the back in front of a little “beach”. there are multiple spots along this road you could park aside from that “beach”. there are decent bathrooms but they get locked around 10pm. when the person came to lock them, they did not come over to me and ask me to leave; however, i did not camp here because of the noise. there was strong ocean wind, a fog horn (every 8 seconds) and a buoy bell. if noise doesn’t bother you, i’d say it’s a decent spot. there are a couple restaurants on this road closer to 101 and during the day this is a fantastic spot for fishing and bird and seal watching! full bars verizon

name: Gas Station - Subway Parking lot
description:
There are several huge spaces to park any kind of rigs. Several trailers slept here as well. No one bothered us. Many mosquitoes as expected.
--------------
Hay varios espacios enormes para estacionar cualquier tipo de campers.  Varios remolques durmieron aquí también.  Nadie nos molestó. Muchos mosquitos como se espera para esta fecha.

name: Pocahontas
description: All primitive sites with picnic tables and fire rings, one bathroom, tucked away off SR92. $8/night

name: Valero truck stop
description: Good level space behind the gas station. Toilets in Valero Allsup's shop.

name: Schaben Park
description: County park. 12 RV sites with 50-30-20amps. Water. Dump site. Plenty of trees. Camp fire and picnic table. $20 for RV site with hookups. $15 for tent site. Bathrooms and showers available.

name: Stone Cabin BLM
description: Eight, wonderful, shady, designated sites (do not make your own), above the fabulous Arkansas River with short descending trails for river access. Only one other person per night in the past 6 days. Metal fire rings, pack it out, two clean, central porta-Johns, serviced weekly. Mountain views, river music. I feel like I hit the camping lottery. Sites far apart. If you have 4wd, there are more remote, designated sites with metal rings off the dirt road on the right as you turn off the highway. And yes, there is a stone cabin.

name: Niobarra River Access
description: Large parking area beside the river . Launching for kayaks. Tubers  . Good for one night sleep. Other cars parked here that would be floating or paddling downriver   . River not suitable for swimming due to current

name: Buffalo Run Casino
description: We intended to go to the Oklahoma welcome center but you can't get there from the south without overshooting it and and coming back so we decided to try this place and it worked out. Kind of noisy but no knock on the door!

name: Stagecoach State Park
description:
State Park, admission is 9$.  Acces to dump station, water (witch is brown but potable).  Very Nice place for day use, nice picnic table by the lake.  Nice trail for walk or bicycle.
You can also take a hot shower for 1$ (4 minutes).
There is also some camping spot, the price change with the service you take.

name: Crackle barrel
description:
Quite place 
New Crackle barrel 
Park on the back lights go out at 11

name: Dispersed spots
description:
From McClellan trailhead to here it is all national forest land. Several large clearing under the trees for tents. At least 3 pull offs from road good for a class B van or small tow trailer, might not be able to turn around well with trailer. Lots of people camping. A little trashed so please pack in and out.
Gravel roads not bad, seems freshly graded and graveled. No trouble in 2 wheel drive van. 
Some Noise from highway. 
1-2 bars on verizon at worst spots. 
See photos for a few of the pull offs.

name: U-Haul
description: Open 7 days a week except Christmas. Pay at the pump

name: Cow Lake
description: Beautiful spot next to Cow Lake. A lot of pull outs along this road for camping or fishing access. Get 1 or 2 bars of verizon

name: Worthington BLM Trailhead
description: This is a small turnout/trailhead. It could fit 2-3 vans if parked strategically. We spent 1 night here and had no problems. There are no “no” signs, just a closed and locked yellow gate at the entrance of the trail. 3 bars Verizon was able to work and connect to vpn. Not many visitors or people driving by. Decent spot to spend a night or two.

name: Salk Institute
description: Quiet street parking across from Salk Institute. Closest legal spot to Black's Beach that we could find. Don't park beyond the employee only sign.

name: Darby Wells: 4-Bar Verizon spot
description: BLM boondocking area has 1-4 bars of Verizon bars, this spot has four bars

name: Kalopa State Recreation Area & Campground
description:
Located on the gorgeous Hilo–Hamakua coastline, this state recreation area is beautiful and underused. Cabins and tent camping available, need to reserve online  or just visit and hike native Hawaiian forest.
Cabins have electricity etc, and camping area has shelters, bbq pit, toilet and cold showers!

name: Spruce Knob mountain parking lot
description:
Top of the mountain. 
The Highest place in WV. 
35 degrees cooler than the valley floor.

name: Love's
description: As there isn't any dumpstation reporter between Chicago and Milwaukee we though to would put this one in... Classic Love's truck stop with 10$ dump station.

name: panther pond campground
description: state forest primitive campground. super quiet, semi-shady, pretty private sites. tents only but stayed in honda odyssey minivan no problem. no water, port-a-johns. little pond full of fish attracts lots of birds. must register online to reserve. $16 per night

name: Food waste drop off site
description: There are a handful of bins at this location where you can drop off your food scrapes/waste. Make sure you follow the accept and not accepted signs to not mess up their compost.

name: Behind The Rocks #7
description: It's about a mile in from the pavement on the left. On your way in, stay left at the first fork. Follow signs to Picture Frame Arch. Some parts of the road are bumpy but take it slow.

name: Potable & Non-Potable Water Station
description: Donation based dump station and potable water filling.

name: Road to Snag Lake spot #2
description: You will need a discovery pass to stay here.  I purchased one from Cape of Disappointment State Park.  The first boondocking location on this road was covered in trash, but this spot isn't, so please keep it clean.  You will need to back into the spot.  We have a 16' trailer.  There is a nice gravel road leading up to here.  We did have pretty strong Verizon internet.

name: Marked Campsite in Custer Gallatin NF
description: This is a free marked campsite, cleared, with a fire ring. 16 day limit.  bear country.  very private. good at&t service. near West Yellowstone.

name: Parking at the Mitchell park
description: There are 3 geodesic domes here that are quite nice to see and a huge parking in front. Nice and quiet. No signs saying anything...

name: dispersed campsites along forest 482/state road 1227
description: couple of dispersed campsites just on the way to Curtis Creek campground along forest service 482. some of them are blocked by stones maybe indicating it's closed. the road to campsite is very rough and takes a good awd if you want to drive right to the site. otherwise you can park on roadside of the main road and walk there. during summer time there are exceptional amounts of bugs so watch out if you can't stand them

name: Henry's Roadside Sunset
description: Overlooking the lake for sunset, little turn off right before you enter the state park. no "no-parking" signs... good for 1 night, would recommend leaving early. 4 bars verizon

name: Loop Loup
description: Fabulous site a ways away from the parking lot. Very quiet and secluded.  Pit toilet and fire rings. Beautiful forest views

name: Shenandoah Valley Campground
description: Beautiful setting by river and waterfall. Campsite with full hook up to primitive + cabins. Clean bathrooms, hot showers, pool and hot tub, shop, game room etc

name: Dirt Pull off
description: decent sized dirt pull off/turn about alongside 154N. Big rigs may fit but not 100% sure due to how dark it currently is.

name: Under the bridge
description: Nice spot next to the colorado river. We stay there for one night. Another van was there. Our bus is 33' long. Very calm place. There is a pitfire. for Full cell bar

name: TRA RV-park
description: Nice level spots. Not much shade. Clean toilets and showers. Dry camp 12$, 30A 30$, 50A 32$. Cheaper for escapees members.

name: The Grommet Island public showers
description: Free Public showers. Not warm water but not cold. It was great to clean off after playing in the beach.

name: North Bay Shore Campground
description: Established camping. Tents and full hookups sites. Paid $36 for a tent spot. Clean bathrooms, showers and laundry. Pool. Boat launch. You can also fish right from the campground.

name: Waverides Cafe
description: Fast free Wi-Fi. Great coffee and food! It was a perfect place to work for a few hours.

name: City Park
description: Big site for RV with full hookup for free. The Place is in the near from the Rodeo Arena. Very quiet in the night. Restaurant and supermarket are in 0,5 mi. We stood here for 1 night.

name: DWP Railroad Tunnel, Ely's Peak
description: Gravel trail that spans a total of 6 miles. Part of the trail just past this parking location goes through an old train tunnel. Parking available at Short Line Park but it will only fit regular vehicles, trailers won't fit

name: lions family park
description: just a park, no "no overnight parking" signs. there's a highway and a train but nobody bothered us and there's a pond that was nice in the morning.

name: Street Parking Near Golf Course
description: This is a spot we found visiting Hollywood Florida with a friend who was staying in a hotel up the street.  We parked here for 5 nights straight with no issues.  Quiet, across from residential neighborhood on one side and golf course on the other.  If you have small pets, watch out for wild life.  Came across a few iguanas.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Parked here for the night.  Quite, nice facility.  No signs restricting overnight parking.  Walmart and Kroger near by.

name: Gravel Pit ~21 Mile Taylor Hwy
description: Small gravel pit just off of Taylor Highway at approximately 25 mile marker. Nothing special, but it’s flat with a fire ring and a bit of privacy behind the gravel piles so a bit better than the pullouts. We tried a few of the forestry roads, but they were super muddy and steep. We were spinning out even in 4 wheel drive. Alright for a night.

name: Castner Ice Cave Parking at ~217 mile
description: Approximate location of parking lot for hike to the Castner Ice Cave (based on my Garmin). The trail is on the north side (opposite side) of the Castner Creek bridge where there is another small parking area. There is no signage, but follow the road just north of the creek upstream (not the ATV trail on the south side of the creek). The hike is easy and follows the road and then the creek floodplain for approximately 2.2 km or 1.25 miles to the ice cave. Easy flat hike, but quite pretty along Castner Creek. May be more challenging depending on peak water flows. The ice cave is amazing although you can’t go into it since the creek rages out of the cave mouth. Wish I had my phone to take photos. Look it up online for more info.

name: wildflower vista
description: Gorgeous meadow spot with plenty of flat space for any sized rig. The road coming up from Craig is easy for 2wd+low clearance but has switchbacks, unsure if okay for big rigs. There is a picnic table in the shade here, perfect for a sunny afternoon, and an outhouse that looks to be owned by “Craig Wild Bunch”.. unsure whether camping is legal, but Leave No Trace is always the best policy!

name: Campsite 6
description: Good large spot. Has a fire ring. Not much shade or privacy

name: most expensive laundromat
description:
Crazy expensive.

4.50 for a small load. 8.00 for a large load. Reduced prices 6a-9a daily. $.50 for 5 minutes of dryer.

Absolutely ridiculous. The machines are older and don’t even wash well. I would avoid if you can.

name: Zach wash and Dry
description: Small Laundromat in Ashland. Average. Laundromat,  6- 2x load machines $3.50 / 1- 4 loader $7.00 and 2-6 loaders $9.00. 7 dryers $2.00 for 30 minutes.  All are Huebsch machines. Bathroom but it's locked and no one around. I would visit again.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart superstore open from 6am to 11pm. Parked in van o/nite with no issues. AT&T good signal. Verizon no signal. Quiet thru night.

name: Elite auto and diesel repair
description: Had a small problem and they got me in the next day. Awesome Donovan and Connor. If you are in the area and need something done go there

name: Common Cents Gas Station
description: Water spigot on the right side of building between ice machine and propane exchange. Asked manager and they were OK with us filling up our containers.

name: Beaverhead campground
description:
Dry camping free wherever there is a fire pit! They have about 20 sites. 
Google it or use this address 1-15 Dillon MT. 
The coordinates on this check in aren’t correct because I checked in when I was 11 miles north of the site. 14 day limit. Right on Clark canyon reservoir. 
It looks like a campground you would pay for but as long as you don’t camp at a spot with hookups it’s free! Enjoy!

name: Valle Seco
description: Great place just off Hwy 84. Quiet, great views, fire rink.

name: Wolf rock road pull off
description:
Good size dirt spot. Somewhat level. Zero bars on T-Mobile, but I did see a nearby ATT station, so maybe ATT users will have a connection. 

There appears to be a few smaller pull offs around this area

name: Ouchita state park
description: Supposed to register but it's free. Great spot, good views, clean, picnic tables, grill, very clean bathrooms and shower. No phone connection. Potable water

name: Whits Lake Trailhead
description: this is at the end of the road. it's a turnaround spot so would be good for trailers.  fire ring.  good at&t.

name: big BLM flat spot
description: very large flat open BLM spot nestled between hills and berms for privacy and shelter from the wind. nice view of the surrounding area. just off the main road through thermopolis. three to four bar Verizon. it's a dirt road once you get off highway 20 but it's well maintained with minimal washboards and any vehicle can make it

name: Forest spot near spruce pond
description: There are about 6 primitive drive-to camping spots at Spruce Pond but we found this one tucked away in the forest. Looks like it was a road a long time ago but there are boulders and overgrown grass now blocking the path. We got enough t-mobile to watch Netflix but it can be slow. Good enough though!

name: Riverton Laundromat
description: Good laundromat, lots of machines. About $3-7 for a washer and $2.50 minimum for a dryer. All machines accept quarters only.

name: Point Molate pull off area
description: Pull off next to lightly traveled 2 lane road “Stenmark Drive”. Quiet, flat, overlooks the bay, views of the Richmond-San Rafael bridge and mountains of Marin County. No posted signs. Wi-Fi. I’m in a class B RV, towed trailers would have easy pull through access.

name: Lake Louise State Recreation Area
description: Nice campground on the lake near the boat launch.  Picnic tables & fire rings on gravel.  Little privacy as sites are close together or doubles.  The road in is rough from frost freeze so take it slow first half!  Quiet…. Apparently popular for fishing lake trout.

name: Fairport parking lot
description: 24 hour parking lot on the left side of Lift Bridge Lane. No problems overnight, stealth camping in a van. Larger rigs would have an issue. No amenities, but several cute restaurants nearby.

name: Pioneer Park Potable Water
description: Potable water fill up near the road entrance to the park. Free fill up and you can pay to spend the night in the parking lot as well

name: Red Oak Campground
description: Nice campground with trees and semi-secluded sites. $20/night for a tent site. Includes a shower, flush toilets, spigots laundry, outdoor pool, and playground. Volleyball courts and basketball courts. Hookup sites for RVs. Plenty of sites.

name: Hidden pullout by the river
description: Beautiful spot, private, covered from the road by trees, no “no parking signs”, lots of space, super close to the river (there’s a little trail full of flowers leading to it), you can hear the water from where the car is parked while falling asleep. Very quite, barely no cars driving by after night fall. One of the best spots we’ve found, please keep it clean, this place is awesome.

name: Lava Campground
description: Clean beautiful park but that's where it ends. This place is filled with kids! Running through campsites all day and nonstop ringing of a large bell on the playground and it goes on into the night. It's also located right on a highway and train tracks that run all day and night. Unless you have kids and looking to entertain them avoid this place at all costs. Lava Campground is the Disney World of RV parks.

name: Painted Hills Picnic Area
description: There is free guest wifi next to the information center, near restrooms, and a tree-covered picnic area.

name: Trail head parking lot.
description:
Mountain Trailhead, George S. Mickelson Trail, overnight parking lot.  Milepost 39.6

We stayed here overnight in our skoolie. it has a pit toilet and a hand pump water station with no threads which we used to fill up or 6-gallon water jugs to fill our water tanks. has horses nearby and is a convenient distance to most attractions and hiking.

name: 76 Gas Station
description: Free dump station next to the car wash at the gas station. Water is not potable.

name: Fred Endert Municipal Pool
description: $6 for an adult day pass to use the pool and shower after your swim session. Showers in the locker room are not private but there was no one in there the whole time I was in there.

name: BLM Land
description: Nice open area and views. Steep drop off coming in and rutted road. Beautiful stars shining at night.

name: Twin Mountain Campground
description:
ETA: looks like there are spots for larger rigs closer to the entrance, on open grass - no shade and no overhanging branches.

Established campground. Offers campsites with various amenities including 20A hookups. I paid $47 for a “tent/rv” site.

Pros:
- Site available last minute on a Saturday night in summer after striking out at nearby dispersed campsites 
- booked online quickly and easily
- pretty quiet, even on a full Saturday night
- pets allowed
- lots of grass and trees
- spacious spots (for a developed campground); you can see and hear your neighbors but they’re not on top of you

Cons:
- not for large vehicles
- low hanging tree branches all along the one narrow road through the campground, as well as above my site which was designated as a tent/rv site. Too low for my camper van (tall version), and would scratch any roof taller than a sedan.

There are lots of other campgrounds nearby (established and dispersed national forest). I was glad to have this one in a pinch, appreciate the trees but could have done without the scratches.

name: East Boulder dog park
description: Gets very quite and dark at night. Although you get people early here to take their dogs to the park

name: Mountain View Laundry
description:
Not the cleanest laundromat, but there's not a lot around here.

$3-$3.25 for washers
.25 for 8 min dryers

8am - 8pm

name: Mountain Hideaway
description: Long pull out good for a van or similar rig. Longer rigs will find it hard to turn around as the dirt road ends abruptly. Made it fine in a long sprinter. A good place to hide from all the meth heads in Kalispell as you prepare for or depart Glacier National Park. Small fire ring and plenty of firewood available. Watch for bears.

name: Swift's Bridge
description: Clearing at the end of Swift's Bridge road. The site is level and can fit 2 tents. It's accessible by motorcycle since the bridge is closed. we saw a couple of local people who were taking the trail to go fishing and they said we would have no issues camping here.  There is a stream nearby and it's next to some railroad tracks. It was a great location for a night.

name: Tolo Lake Access Area
description: 10,000 year old lake. No overnight camping, but pit privy, covered picnic tables, fire pit. Located in the middle of farm fields. 2 piers for fishing (for ?) Flat trail around lake. gFi worked fine. I'll visit again ...great place to hang for the day.

name: Millersburg Public Parking
description: Directly in the center of Millersburg. It's a public parking area, which hast 9 designated lots for 24hrs parking. An RV Up to 20" fits.

name: Gravel parking in field
description: It’s a gravel parking near the highway 191 near windturbine and in the fields. No services. No water. You can ear the noise of the road but ok for one night on the road or just to stop for lunch time. No « No parking » sign.

name: Cape Perpetua Lookout and trail
description: Super gorgeous views and stunning Amanda trail. It is $5 a day to park your car at the lookout, but worth it!

name: Big Hill Pond State Park
description: There are free tent camping spots, which I just slept in my van at. It's free but you need to register. I have a small astro van but you could easily park a 170 in most of the spaces. Showers, water, fire rings, 3/4 bars with ATT. I was the only one on Saturday night. there's about 20 spaces

name: Northside Park
description: This Lusk WY city park has parking areas surrounded by a swimming pool. Childrens play area and a short walking path  Also a washroom by a ball field  which was open all night. We parked under two gigantic poplar trees . 4 bar T-Mobile. There were two trains passed. Had fine sleep with earplug

name: Buffalo Creek Road BLM LAND
description:
Make sure you are not on private land which is sandwiched between BLM lands and private’s. This location has spectacular views of red buttes and desert sages and grasses  today 15C-low6C
. Met the proximate rancher land owner. Very friendly when you are in BLM   Land.

name: Flying J
description: Dump station and water at gas station for $10

name: Venezuelan
description: Gas station with free Dump station & water in back.  Showers for a few.

name: in front lake
description:
quiet, in Midlle jungle. many spots.
Place to make fire. a lot of mosquitos
.

name: Bonnie Claire dry lakebed
description: Large area dry lakebed without facilities. Level area.

name: Free water
description: Potable water on side of gas station. Small threaded hose and easy to turn handle. Large pull through parking. Large rig friendly.

name: Gibbs Eddy Access - large pull off by river
description: Giant gravel area right by the river. Put toilet, boat launch, and plenty of space for numerous rigs. Large rig friendly. Level. No cell service.

name: Platte River Fort
description: Really nice spot! $45/nite for RV, 2 nite min. RV and tent sites, plus yurts and a covered wagon right near the river, huge mature trees, grass, fire pits, outhouses and lots of space between neighbors. No hookups. River is swimmable (sandy) and people are fishing too. Best part is owners don't patrol around- you get privacy and freedom. Pricey but worth it!

name: lake Sara campground
description: very nice owner and campground. electric and water and showers included $15/ night. also had laundry facilities. lake Sarah is a very short walk with swimming, boating, fishing. there's also a restaurant and bar next door. I'd definitely stay here again if I'm thru this way.

name: West Virginia I-79 mile 123 Rest Stop
description: Rest stops along 1-79, both north and south bound. We stayed heading southbound. Standard rest stop, clean facilities.

name: Goose Bay Dispersed Camping
description: This is a very popular spot with lots and lots of dispersed camping around the lake. Pit toilets and fire rings and picnic tables throughout. Excellent AT&T 5G service.  I came in on a Sunday afternoon and got one of the few spots available. This is probably extremely packed on holidays.

name: Cedar Bluff Overlook
description: Rather out of the way for most, but the view is worth it! There is a sign saying no trailers at the turn off to get here, but I haven't seen anything that says "no camping". Very windy, but should be a great sunset tonight! 4x4 not needed, longer vehicles might have trouble with the steep hill near the end. 3-4 bars Verizon service, with 4G LTE.

name: Railroad Point Natural Area
description: Trailhead parking lot, no no-overnight-parking signs. Nice trails to the lake.

name: 340 North Campground Waynesboro
description: Established campground with RV sites and tent sites. Bath house, laundry mat and a pool.

name: In Town Campground
description:
dump station fee $15.00
tent camping or rv camping

name: Cut Bank Rest Area
description: You can sleep on these quiet parking in Cut Bank. Good cell coverage. No water. You can ear the noise of the street but quiet on night. Ok for a night on the road.

name: 76 gas station dump and water
description: $10 for dump, free water. Clean and easy

name: Lyle Lake Access
description: This place is located in a recreational area located next to the Columbia Wildlife Refuge south of Moses Lake. Most spots are for tents or truck campers but this spot can handle our 30' trailer. Some spots have a vault toilet. All seep lakes have great fishing. $10 per day or an annual recreation pass required.

name: Crowley Park
description: The park is good has showers and it on$20 anight or $480 a month the only problem is it's right by a loud train track that runs all hours of the day and night

name: Cracker barrel
description: It's a parking lot!  Free and easy for a night.

name: Fort Boonesborough SP
description: Amazing campground with water and electricity at almost all of 120 sites, 18 with sewer too. open year round. clean nice restroom and showers. great water pressure. working fort with old time demonstration of the old ways. fort is open summer months. small general store on site. tons of water spigots and 3 dump stations.

name: Fort Boonesborough SP campground
description: Tons of public water spigots here to fill up from. dumping is included with campsites.

name: Roadside - 101
description:
Long gravel road with a few pull off spots - some spots have fire rings, others don’t. Would probably be better if you were staying in a vehicle, the ground doesn’t seem soft for sleeping on. I slept here in my van for a night - saw about 3 other vehicles pull by me to other spots. 
It’s just north of the Kalaloch lodge / grocery store

name: Dragoon Creek campground
description: This is a free campground that you can stay at for 3 days in a 30-day period as long as you have the Discover Pass for Washington State parks. The annual pass costs $35 and you can get it from anywhere that sells fishing or hunting licenses (Fred Meyer, Sportsman's warehouse, etc). There are 23 sites here, and it is less than half full right now. Open Memorial Day through Labor Day. 2-3 bars LTE. Most sites are far apart.

name: Great Escape Food and Spirits
description: Overflow parking lot across from restaurant.  A local biker/motorcross bar. Large sandy lot... part of lot with a concrete pad that could fit 2 rigs with trailers. I asked permission of owner to park overnight, but if arriving after restaurant is closed, this is a block off freeway 8 and it s easy to park here.

name: Chevron Gas Station
description: Chevron Gas Station @ Exit 601 East side. Gas Station with ample parking for big rigs and trailers/campers. I parked behind/ south of Gas Station to be away from light and be on actual level road. Feels safe. several big rigs and one other camper.

name: Quartz Creek
description:
Amazing views. Super quiet, and awesome views 
Full LTE and 4 bars.
CLEAN AFTER YOURSELVES the place was full of trash when we arrived. We cleaned it. Make sure to leave it better than you found it.

name: KOA Leavenworth
description: Showers here are unlimited with a $15 day pass. Also laundry for $2.50 a load. They're a little intense about the showers. Didn't want to give out the code, had to have someone let us in.

name: Walmart
description: Called the Store and asked if it was okay and they said yes. Decided to park near the outdoor living section. Several other RVs and car campers here, Skoolie, as well as a few Tractor Trailers. Good spot.

name: Roadside
description: Dirt road, can access with any vehicle. Good service with T-mobile and Verizon. It is pretty cold at night but worth the drive.

name: Off Seward Highway
description: Gravel parking area on hilltop clearing below paved pulloff going north.  Kenai Mountains - Turnagain Area.  Reasonably level but blocks will help.  Room for a number of RV’s, all sizes.  The mountains & valley view make up for any road noise which is less at night.

name: Olympic Hot Springs Road
description: This is a small pull off along Olympic Hot Springs Road that is large enough to fit one or potentially two vehicles. There are no private signs or any signage about' no camping'. There is a small fire ring, a path down to the river and what looks to be a homemade trail in the pull off area. Cars stopped driving by around 9:30 PM. It was peaceful and you can hear the river all night!

name: Gravel hidden pull off
description:
Found a gravel bath pull off, off the side of the road. No ‘no signs’. Ground isn’t very level so if that’s important I wouldn’t if I were you. 2-3 rigs could fit in here anyone pulling a rig I wouldn’t recommend.

Barely any T-Mobile and 2-3 bars Verizon. Plenty of shade, but also some sunny patches. Road noise isn’t too bad & you’re barely visible from the road depending on wheee you park your rig. I drive a two wheel 3500 Chevy express and I was fine getting in and out. 

There is a dispensary a half mile up the road and I’m pretty close to Walmart. Nice little secluded nook definitely good for a few nights

name: Millersburg Post Office
description: Directly across the post office. 8 lots for 24 hours parking. In the City center. No problem for up to 20' lenght.

name: Large Roadside Pullout
description: Large pullout of hwy 105. No restriction signs posted. Hard packed gravel. Level. Room for multiple rigs. Good Verizon signal. No toilets or trash receptacles. Probable light road noise. Not busy. Seems safe.

name: Center Manor
description: Located in Beaver County, Center Manor is located along the Ohio River. Outdoor enthusiasts will enjoy the numerous nearby ballfields and parks. Camping at Center Manor will put you close to entertainment, shopping, delicious restaurants, gym options, and access to healthcare services and further education opportunities. Our RV site is the ideal camping option in Monaca with a great location, and a friendly onsite staff.

name: Street Parking
description: I didn't stay here but when I was here taking a picture of the lighthouse I noticed a sign stating "Overnight Parking Allowed May - Oct".      Parking is next to the Michigan Lake ferry.

name: Illinois State Beach
description: $5 dump station right along road near beach.

name: Walt Woodward Wildlife Viewing Area
description:
Nice little spot off of county road 11 a few miles outside of Radium. It’s a trailhead of sorts, tucked a few hundred yards back from the main road with a very small loop turnaround. The short nature trail is quite overgrown and seems like it hasn’t been maintained for many years, but it’s still a nice walk along the creek. 
Easy access to fresh water from the creek, and the mosquitoes aren’t terrible. There’s an established fire ring (for when burn bans aren’t in effect, high fire danger at the moment), can get shade during the day but still able to get a good charge with my solar panel. 
Very quiet area even on the weekend, only a few dirt bikes and some cows passed by. No cell service. Easy 2wd dirt road coming in, although it’s pretty narrow and winding with steep drop offs in some places - not ideal for big rigs.

name: Secluded Paria Nook
description: Absolutely beautiful spot near the end of the Paria trail! Perfect for overlanders (RTT or Truck camping). The road is a bit rough to get back here. You can do it in a 4x4 but it’s rough enough to mix a margarita in a shaker on the way in, if you’ve got one! Secluded spot with two solid flat/level spots for car-camping. No bugs as far as I can see in mid-June. Quiet & beautiful views on the way in as well. Driven into w a lifted Jeep JL & a stock Tacoma.

name: Shady Creek Pulloff
description: Multiple pull offs without the feeling you’re on top of one another. Grassy/gravel spots that are mostly level.

name: NFS camping - small pull out near River
description: nice area just before the bridge on the right-hand side large enough for a van (or two if you are friendly), pickup and camper or SUV. there are paths down to the creek and to excellent tent spots a little further back from the road. There is also a well-defined fire pit

name: Bacco's Grotto
description: South city tucson on a quiet court. 20wx 90l enough some for 3 vans at a time with electric cords to be run out for plug in. Water on tap at spigot next to spaces. Wifi reaches van life area. Gas three blocks away and major shopping center.

name: Moose Creek Ranch
description: Very nice campground with breakfast, various yard games, nice hot showers and great internet. Don't worry, not KOA feeling at all. Definitely nicer than we typically splurge for but had an event in town and just had to make sure we had something set. 1 bar Verizon but super fast Internet.

name: Creek river bank
description: Large gravel lot along creek all leveled. Can accomodate all type of RV. Nice view of mountains around. Gravel bank perfect for tent and small RV. 4x4 and camper can go down all the way to main river if not rainy. Place is windy with few mosquito, so perfect to enjoy the view outside.

name: Belaustegui picnic area
description: 4 small lots. big rigs can park next to them.

name: Cracker barrel restaurant
description: RV overnight parking at cracker barrel old country store. go inside and have some food and stay for free. good for one night

name: Soda Creek
description: There's lots of spots along the Eel River here.  I pulled a teardrop trailer onto the gravel bar with my 4wd pickup. There were a few other all wheel and two wheel drive rigs as well. They were all bathers. Not difficult. we have it all to ourselves this evening.  No cell coverage.

name: Lindenwold Station - Parking Lot
description:
Huge parking lot for the train into Philly. Boondocked 2 days, no gates, no cost. We park far away from the terminal in a 37’ A-class. Very quiet, well lit, solar panel roof coverage, great place.

We’ve learned that boondocking in the larger stations and taking the train into a city center is the way to go, Philly, DC, Baltimore, NYC, train in!

For this Lindenwold Station here are the details:
• Train map - see Place Website

name: Chevron
description: The Chevron station refills kerosene and propane. Inexpensive too.

name: Riverside Campground, Watoga State Park
description:
Watoga State Park has two campgrounds: the 38-unit Beaver Creek Campground and the 50-site Riverside Campground. 

Riverside offers 50 sites with electric hookups. Each site includes picnic tables, grills, and a central bathhouse with coin-operated laundry and dishwashing stations. Riverside Campground offers free guest wifi at each bathhouse with firewood and ice available for purchase at check-in building.

Campsites may be reserved anytime online, by phone, or at the campground office. Watoga campgrounds are open spring through fall, weather permitting. Reservations may be made for no less than two consecutive nights on weekends (Fri. and Sat.) or one night (Sun. – Thurs.) There is a 14-night maximum stay.

name: N.C. boat ramp
description: There is no room at the local campground so I'm going to try to stay here tonight.  boat launch .. Camping not allowed but staying a night in the motorhome.  Will update if any issues but so far so good and heading to sleep in a few hours.

name: Patchen’s Point Swimming Area
description: This is a nice little swimming area that is just off the road. A two minute walk from the parking pull off and you are at the river.

name: Palisades Dam
description: Lots of dispersed camping along the Snake River across from Riverside Park campground. Pleasant area. Dump site and water available at Riverside Park. Fairly good Verizon service.

name: Arlene’s Truck Stop / BP
description: Official truck stop that also has regular size parking spots specifically designated for overnight parking (on the side of the building). The building/gas station is NOT open overnight but there is a porta potty if needed (didn’t try it!)

name: WinCo foods
description: Simple 24 hour market with many overnight and homeless sleeping. No signs warning against overnight. no police or employees acting against it.  Noisy but safe. Plenty of cell signal and some shade.

name: Gravel pullout
description: Large gravel pullout overlooking the lake. There are no signs about camping or anything.  No toilets.  No garbage bins.  The lot is large though, several big RVs or truck and trailers could fit there and it overlooks a lake.

name: Street Parking Near Foxtail Coffee
description:
Street parking on a low-trafficked street, within walking distance to Foxtail Coffee. There are no restrictions or any signs stating otherwise. Be careful not to park in the lots nearby, as those are permit parking only.

Be warned, this spot is less than 20 yards from the train tracks, so I recommend ear plugs if you’re a light sleeper. It seems to be busy on some nights, and not at all on others.

Foxtail is a great spot to plug in and get work done for the day. Downtown Winter Park is a 5 minute drive, and downtown Orlando isn’t much further. This has been my go-to spot for much of my stay in Orlando.

name: Parking Lot
description: A friend tipped me off to this spot. Slept here all night no problem. There were quite a few drunk college kids roaming around when the bars got out but that’s the only downside.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Open 24 hours mon-fri. Well lit parking lot. A bit of road noise. Stayed here one night and no issues at all. There was one other van there with me. Would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you’re a member! Free 24 hr workouts, toilets, and showers. No complaints here

name: Zilker Park
description: Huge gravel parking lot right in the park. Has a view of the city skyline. Very quiet, besides a train going by once in a while. When I got there, there was a cop in the lot but they left at around 10pm and didn’t bother me. Lots of people walking dogs in the morning. Great and peaceful place to stay for a night!

name: Thomas Mountain Road
description: Several pullouts on this road with really nice view of the mountains! Right near beautiful trees and a little creek when it rains. The road coming in can be flooded a bit but you can drive your vehicle right through the center. Drove my Ford van through it and a Westy no problem.

name: Pilot
description: Blue spigot next to the air fill up! Easy and accessible

name: Blue Star Memorial Highway
description: Medium size parking lot (fits a semi large motor home nicely) with 24-hour restrooms.

name: Bidwell Park
description: Can park on the street for free, summer months only. Houses on one side, grass parkway on the other. Very trendy area, lots of restaurants, bars, breweries, etc…. Maybe the best part of Buffalo. Would probably only park a stealthy rig.

name: Five 1/2 Points
description: Informal camp on the Arkansas River. It is managed by the Arkansas Rivers Headwaters Association. Room for two vehicles. Vans, not RVs. 2 fire rings. No bathroom.

name: Riverside (Miner's Camp)
description: Free camping area managed by Colorado Parks and Wildlife. Large parking area with two picnic tables at either end. Popular with river runners and gold prospectors. Porta-potties in June 2022.

name: Walmart Napoleon
description: Walmart. overnight camping ok. Big rig friendly.

name: Sand Dunes
description: Beautiful ocean and rock view. Large pullout next to sand dudes with beautiful rocks sticking out of the ocean.

name: Diamond Mall
description: Abandoned large shopping mall above the intersection of Rt 4 & 7, so there is some road noise. Lots of options of where to park. Very few vehicles came through. Mostly walkers and dog walkers. Mountain views and sunsets. Level or gently sloping parking lots. No signs or issues. No facilities at all.

name: Seward KOA
description: Larger than average sites with table and fire ring. Newer park so lack of trees between sites. Lovely big showers but only four for the entire place. Wi-fi signal was strong but not enough bandwidth for all users. AT&T signal was good so used cell plan. Large pack of dogs at place next door would howl at times. Overall would not stay again for price vs. amenities.

name: Walmart Parking Lot
description: Lots of open space In the back to park.  Backs up to a nice field.  Very quiet.

name: Walmart
description: Decent place to stay. Saw several other RVs, vans, car campers, and tractor trailers. Relatively quiet, although heard several trains. No big deal. Good nights sleep

name: Hells Canyon campground/resort
description:
Snake River sunsets are magnificent and the facilities are one of the very best in the Pacific Northwest. Clarkston., WA on the Snake River 

intersection of hwy 12 and 128 in West Clarkston, WA

name: LaCueva Restaurant
description: Informal parking behind LaCueva Restaurant/ PetroUS gas station, near Capitol Reef NP. Little traffic at night. Felt safe, and not too noisy. About 50m from Utah SR 24, 8 miles west of NP visitor center. Gas station / restaurant closes normally at 9 pm. Gas station staff confirmed that it is ok to park there overnight.

name: Gee Cee's Truck Stop
description: We called to make sure that it's ok to sleep there overnight (we're a hatchback) and they said no problem, and told us to sleep on the right side of the building. We had a quiet night, the bathrooms are clean, and there is a restaurant (with good food) that is open 24 hours a day. We came here from Portland after trying two rest stops that had many permanent residents, and this one felt much better.

name: Forest Road Pull-off
description: This is just a nice quiet pull-off on a seldom-used Forest Road. Looks like there are a handful of spots on this road. I had the best Verizon signal ever at 60 meg download. A few cars went by but otherwise very quiet. High altitude helps on hot days.

name: The Aspens
description:
Nice single spot in the woods off of the road. Fire pit established. Unsure of who owns the land as it's just outside of the NF. 
Steep but reasonable road for our FWD van. We did air down for a smoother ride.

name: Sheridan Recycling Center
description: Nice recycling center. 24/7. Also glass.

name: Trinidad. One-car pullout
description: A small pullout on a quiet road. Takes one to two cars. Or a van. Nice view. Good AT&T signal. Bad Verizon. Ok for a night.

name: NF near La Grande
description:
Great wilderness camping spot off the main Forest Service Road. Super quiet and easy access to many ATV trails that are also fun for mountain biking. This is definitely 'pack-in and pack-out'. You are roughly 3/4 mile to nearest stream so bring plenty of water.

We enjoyed 3 days here in 85+ degrees and sunshine. Perfect weather for short hikes with the dog before she got too hot. Definitely recommend.

name: Sunny Acres Campground
description: Lieber State recreation area/ Cagle's Mill lake. A beautiful large campground with many activities and facilities. Pool, large beach with swimming permitted, boat ramps, marina and rentals, grocery, showers, fishing, tons of trails, nature center. Much more. just a few miles away from the Cataract Falls SRA which is day use only and very beautiful. Basic site in the Sunny Acres Campground was $19. I did not make reservations but there was no need as hardly anyone was here except at the beach. Very quiet at night. It's kinda expensive but it's worth it.

name: Dutchman mine
description:
Best spot along American Fork river.
Access road is a bit tough and narrow.
Not for big trailer and RVs.
Spot is next to the water under the shade of 2 huge pines (perfect for hammock).
Fire pit with plenty of dead wood around.
Two negative aspects however : lots of dust but not more than any other spot in this area. You can hear herds of OHVs in the distance during the day but with less noise than other spots that are literally on the dirt road. No cell service. Very few mosquitoes. 14 days limit applies.

name: Whalen Island County Park
description: Camp sites on Whalen Island in sand lake. Nice open sites. $10 per night

name: Hillyard Aquatic Center - FREE Showers at open swim
description: Awesome city pool (one of 6) that are free during Open Swim! This location has a small parking lot and street parking. We arrived an hour early for the 6:30-8:30pm Open Swim. We were in the first 10 in and there were hundreds of people behind us by 6:30. Great place to swim and shower.

name: Hancock campground Street parking
description: when we arrived we saw many cars parked on each side of kancamagus hwy. The nearby campground allows people to park next to the highway entrance. At night the road was very quiet and only a couple times did a car drive by us

name: dispersed campsites FS 210
description: along forest service 210 traversing Linville Gorge there are some dispersed campsites that are free to use. this location is one of them. the road has many trailheads which belongs to the Linville Gorge area. the campsite comes with a fire ring, a little space to pull your vehicle off the road

name: Laundry Lounge
description: Laundromat in Coronado. Super clean. Open from 5am to 10pm. $3.95 to 7.95 for the washers. $.50 cents / 8 minutes for the dryers. Lots of parking in the street. Restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

name: Forest Road Spur
description: 30' pull in off the FS gravel road, no outlet. Almost flat. Didn't want to keep driving and this was the first reasonable pull off we found. Small creek within earshot, didn't want to bushwack down to it.

name: Ute Lake state park.
description: November camping- only one other camper in the whole park. This park has different levels of camping- primitive was $8, developed (with picnic table and shelter) was $10, then a $14 level with electric and an $18 level with electric and sewer. Restrooms and campsites w electric/water/sewer closed in winter. Lake was beautiful! Woke to 25 turkeys surrounding us! Very quiet. Got down to 47 degrees perfect sleeping in a van.

name: Turn out next to historic bridge
description: Easily accessible turn out next to a small bridge. Coming from HW1, just use the Stewards Point-Skaggs Bridge Road (this is an established road, so no problem to come with a 2wd. It is quite big and can easily fit multiple cars/RVs and Trailers. Also relatively flat, so we were able to put up a tent. It was very quiet at night and no one bothered us, in the morning a handful of cars drove by. No cell reception. Great spot to stay for a night.

name: Holiday Dump with flush
description: Easy access free dump with flush water.  located between two entrance drives along Phillips Field Rd

name: Avery Park
description: There is a water spigot at the Fire Side Shelter that can fit a 7 gallon Jerry can under. Tastes great!

name: Dispersed Camping on NF-32
description: Dispersed camping on a forest road, deep in the woods. Several pull offs and very secluded. Highly recommend. Might be better for an AWD vehicle.

name: Paul Miller Park
description: Swimming, picnic tables, boat launch, walking paths and more. Nice little spot to relax or let your dog release some energy.

name: Blue Creek Lake Campground
description:
Jackson County campground with sites for all types of equipment
 Not far off I-470 and I-70 but quiet. Grounds are well kept with lots of grass and trees. $30 for electric only. Poor cell service on my site.

name: Half Moon Bay Library
description: Free wifi, you can use the computers for sixty minutes then there is a fee. You can also use the printer to print twenty five pages an after that there is a fee.

name: Desert Moon camp and RV park
description: If you like nomads and hippies you’ll love this place!  Owned by the friendliest young couple, there are full hookup rv spots, tent spots and even a little boutique hotel. They have food with a cute little outdoor cafe.  Super pet friendly

name: Town of Russell campground
description:
Really beautiful campground on the apostle nat lakeshore. Nicest campground hosts too.
20$ for camping, 30$ for electric. Showers are $2 for 4 minutes

name: Anchor Bay Marina
description:
Parking behind the big blue warehouse/barn by the railroad tracks. Parked here overnight very safe and very quiet. Only one train went by and it was quiet. Great restaurant called the hard yacht Café. Really fun spot. 
Feel free to ask if you can stay here.

name: Dispersed Camp Spot N of Butte Creek CG
description: Butte Creek CG is temporarily closed after the forest fire. This spot is on the opposite side of the road, up a spur rd just W. of the CG entrance. A simple pull off on an old dead end road. Perfectly quiet, very little mosquitoes and reasonably flat.

name: T9DC202 camp
description: nice big camp site with rock fire pit. road is ok but rough in a few spots. right next to the creek. lots of bugs

name: Homestake BLM
description: This is an established dispersed camping spot along the long gravel road. Large clearing. Fairly private. Mosquitos. Suitable for big rigs. Several spots along this road but they were mostly full. OK AT&T coverage.

name: Farewell Bend Campground
description:
very nice, fast river few swim spots. trail runs between rogue gorge and natural bridge.
61 Site campground on Rouge River many sites facing river. water, bathrooms, no dump or power.

name: Multiple sites along Strelna Creek
description: Multiple spots just off the road to McCarthy, on Alaska State land. Multiple fire rings. Should be easy access for larger rigs as well.

name: coldfoot
description:
potable water $20 fill up RV
in front the gás station

name: Golden Wheel Amusements: Travelling Carnival
description: Family business with space for repairs and quiet camping. Close to hiking, grocery and fuel. Contact Chase @ (602)663-1691 for availability.

name: Wildcat
description: Beautiful, with many camp spots on the lake. It was very empty when we were there . Pay fee at park entrance, with money in an envelope. Bring cash!

name: Lone Duck Campground
description:
Campground Near HWY 24

Nice place, we were in T section, lots of place, quiets, hot shower (free), place too wash dish, fishing pond for kids (6$), pool (free), firepit on site, hook ups possible, big rigs friendly, free coffee and tea, tent section available,

Near pike peaks

T-section & no hook ups was 49$,

name: Mountwood Park
description: County park just north of US 50. Very quiet and peaceful. $30 per name night electric & water. $35 per night full hookup. Facilities are older and could use a bit of maintenance but VERY CLEAN. Mid week visit and only two other sites of approximately 50 sites occupied by family groups.

name: Rest stop with overnight camping area
description: Nice overnight camping area. Many RVs, tables,  trash cans, water. Stopped in heat of summer and was 73 at night.

name: Kenmare campground (city)
description: City campground with 3 services 25USD per night. On highway 2. Easy pull thru. Restaurant on site.

name: Turquoise Lake Dispersed
description: Dispersed campgrounds around Turquoise lake.  Stop at Floyd's of Leadville for fine cannibis products.  He is a local boy!! Quiet. 2 Bars Tmobile.

name: Boothbay Craft Brewery, Taphouse & RV
description:
This is an awesome place to stay! They offer full hookup pull throughs, W/E sites, and dry camping. They are also a Harvest Host location. Their WiFi has been excellent, 10-40 Mbps!

They have an on-site restaurant, brewery and tap house to visit. It’s close to the local attractions and easy to access! The owners are friendly and welcoming and have a really great facility! We are so happy that we stopped in!

name: Sunshine Campground
description: This is a forest service campground with 17 sites for rvs less than 35 feet long. Sites have a fire ring ,tent pads and picnic table   Sites are gravel, some what level. Sites are nestled among aspens with some having a view of a marshy pond. There are water spigots but no water at this visit.  2 sets of portable potties. $20 per night.

name: aqueduct lot
description: Big parking spot. The road is really near, so you will hear the car. You can walk around an artificial lake (no swimming allow). Rubbish and dry toilet at disposal.

name: Los Alamos Main Gate Dump Station
description: Free dump with clean-out water on the East side of the building. Restrooms in the building.

name: Big Bundles Laundry
description: Coin laundry.Plenty of large washers and dryers.change machine, bathrooms, complimentary coffee, comfy seating, drop off service available.

name: Cattlerest RV Park and Saloon
description: Located just outside the town of Willcox, AZ. Full hook up camp sites available, bathhouse with hot showers are very clean. Must go into the saloon to register. Saloon has pool tables, live music, dancing, and serves drinks and bar food. Park is well maintained, near, and sites are level. There is a corral for livestock, a dump station, and a large dumpster for trash. Large, pull-through sites for large rigs.

name: Sheep Bridge Road Dispersed Camping
description: 50-60 sites off Sheep Bridge Road. Clearly marked with numbered posts and fire rings. Some are more level than others. Great for tents, vans, fifth wheels, travel trailers, buses, and anything else people live/camp in. Pit toilets at bike trail head. Multiple bike trails in area. Beautiful vistas all around.

name: Michaux State Forest - #9 - Haunted Hollow
description: Established campsite with picnic table and fire ring. Requires permit to camp here which can be obtained online. Large gravel pad on a slight grade. Grassy area for tenting. Extremely quiet, not much traffic going by. Leave it better than you found it.

name: Epic views of the butte
description: This site feels like you’re in the middle of no where. There are incredible views of the butte and meadow all around. This is all BLM land and there are tons of places you could pull off and camp. when we arrived, we only saw one other vehicle out here. Any vehicle with solid ground clearance could make it out here. A little windy in the early evening but it all died down once the sunset. We had a couple bars of Verizon service at our site.

name: Hines Park, Park Falls, WI
description: A municipal park close to downtown Park Falls. Nine campsites, all with 20/30/50 electrical, water, and sewer. Non-reservable, first-come-first-serve. No showers, but there are public restrooms. Very pleasant location on the Flambeau River and a short distance from downtown. Playground, walking trail, shelter, basketball courts, and other things for families. $25 per night.

name: Napa Auto Parts
description:
Small Napa store, so larger rigs that can't remove tanks for filling might have trouble, but I pulled my Class B van up and was in and out in no time.

I didn't realize Napa locations sell propane, but a local directed me there. Not far off the Interstate.

name: Big Timber Fairgrounds
description: Fairgrounds at big timber, toilets, no other facilities, good safe place to park up for a donation at the hut on the left as you drive in. Shared the paddock with some horses when we were there. Good stop over, has cell phone reception.

name: White Star CG
description: Large shady sites, kayak rentals, fishing access, pit toilets, Day use area at the water is $8 a night, even to park or put in. I was told the potable water is off due to  new water line installations. Overnight camping is $24, (about 5 gallons of gas) a little high when there is free camping nearby in the forest up on the ridge overlooking the lakes. Free sites mean more gas money! Nearby cute Twin Lakes Village which has a general store, a coffee van, a gift store, and a restaurant.

name: In the Aspens
description: Short back in spot with a trail down into a young aspen grove. Fire ring a short walk away with a possible tent spot. Took a little over an hour for me to make it up here from town. Poor Verizon signal.

name: Nebraska National Forest.
description:
Two sites marked 766 with picnic tables and fire rings. Beautiful nice level shady spot next to a very small clear creek. Completely private. 

To get in here turn left off on NE 20 about 12 miles west of Chadron. The sign says NF 6 miles. After 3 miles you come to a T. Turn left and continue for another 6 miles or so. The road in is dirt and very fine sand. 4WD is helpful but as long as it’s not wet you can reach the site with a 2WD. 

No fee, 14 day limit.

name: Outdoor shower by beach
description: Outdoor showers by restrooms near beach. Strong water pressure. No privacy. Four shower heads and one to remove sand from feet. Restrooms are giant and super clean. You can park at the beach or the campground and walk down a short gravel path. Coordinates are for the dump station at the campground (free potable water).

name: Steleiko Lookout Trail
description: Fire ring about 100 feet from the road, enough space to park off the forest device road and pitch a tent. Gorgeous views, high clearance 4x4 recommended.

name: Big Wash Road Fork
description:
Before proceeding up Big Wash Road, you can start your search here. The unnamed road that forks here has a site with fire ring right at the beginning.

According to the Public Land Layer of CalTopo, this is already past the state land (sites, but unknown legality) and firmly in BLM land.

1-2 bars of Verizon 5G, but the connection seems reliable.

name: Range Creek Trailhead Campground
description: Established campground, probably managed by municipal, about 7 sites. fire ring, picnic table, pebbles on the sites, pit toilet,  free, nice place to stay a night or so. there were 3 - 4 campers while we stayed.

name: Potable water on south end of bathrooms
description: Says up to 10 gallons max of potable water. Spigot outside of bathrooms.

name: Shady Rest Campground
description:
Family campground open year around with electricity water sewer. Site are reasonably separate for a private operation.
Dumping station facility 
Short and long term possibility 
Website:Showed on google map

name: Potable Water Spigot
description: Water spigot at the restrooms. Says it is Potable and up to 10 gallons.

name: Safeway - water spout
description: There is a water spout on the left walkway if Safeway. You will need to bring containers.

name: Lester Davis Rest Area
description: Water spigot to the left of parking, next to shaded table area. You’ll need to use a hose.

name: On-street parking across from post office
description: Quiet spot near 101, parks and Port Orford amenities. No no-parking signs.

name: University City Park
description: Flat spots at various locations around the park block. 2-hour parking between 7am-6pm. Bathrooms in the park. Not sure when and if they close.

name: Truck stop
description: Free water. This is a truck stop. Also has a bathroom

name: Pocomoke Laundromat
description: Laundromat with many sizes of washers and dryers. Vending machines for detergent and change. Easy parking in a shopping center where you can pick up some needed odds and ends.

name: Pull out Near Jedediah
description: No amenities. Cell service with Verizon. Quiet. View of sunset, although trees and powerline obstruct to a point. Can almost see ocean through trees.

name: Virgin valley campground potable water
description: potable water at free camping area.  hot springs and showers as well

name: Teton County Recycling Center
description: Recycling center takes, propane gas tanks, aluminum cans, tin cans, plastic bottles, paper, cardboard, glass bottles, plastic bags. Does not take plastic food containers

name: waquie propane
description: great propane stop. closest to the trails.

name: Coffman pool
description: 7$ for the swimming pool entrance and then acces to the showers… need cash and exact amount they do not have change. Also say you are here for swimming otherwise they might refuse . Commun bathroom, hot shower and easy to park in front of the pool

name: Moss Cove Rest Area
description: Rest area just off the highway with toilets. Rooms for about 8 cars. Nothing fancy. Two bars Verizon.

name: C-A-L Ranch Stores
description: Propane fill up. Plenty of space to maneuver.

name: street parking
description: Riverside drive... found spots available on this bridge... same as reg street with a Thursday 830am street cleaning. nice views feel relatively safe... 1 train at 125th down the stairs nearby.

name: York Harbor Inn
description: Free 2 hr street parking on a lovely hill overlooking York Harbor with a beach below. Good wifi signal from the nearby hotel. Someone said there’s free all day parking depending on the signage.

name: Recycling at Albertsons
description: Recycle dumpsters at back of parking lot towards the main road. Alumni and tin cans, paper, cardboard, plastic bottles (#1&2 only), shopping bags. No plastic food container recycling

name: Booney Bash Aquine RV Park
description: Simple smaller RV park that caters to those traveling with horses. For the rest of us there is a pasture with no hookups for $25/night. Hookups are $40. No services really but good place to stop for a night. Owners are super friendly. It does sit on a 2 lane highway but at night it was quiet. No wifi or Verizon service.

name: Beaverhill Lane - Coos county service road
description: Right off hwy 101, it’s a about 100ft of pavement to the gate (closed). A lot of traffic noise but good privacy

name: Idyllwild Regional Park
description: 88 maintained campsites for tent and car camping. Full shade, partial shade, and full sun available. A few RV spots available towards the back. Some premium sites (newer fire pits/grills, larger area), mostly basic sites. The road in is paved, the camp site itself has no established parking; park as is convenient to you! Max 2 cars, dogs allowed, and well maintained bathrooms and showers (coin operated) available! Walk up and pay or make reservations online. Also has a large day use area and fishing nearby.

name: backside of Hovey Lake
description:
We tried to get into Hovey Lake, but with only 4 sites we were out of luck. Fortunately one of the campers directed us a little further up the road. 

The drive in is a little sandy but we had no issues. I'm sure you could get bigger vehicles in there if you wanted to, but use your own judgement. Theres a pit toilet. Poles to hang your stuff on. stone fire rings. I didn't check to see if water was available here, if needed Hovey Lake Campsites have water, campers did say it was a little brown so make sure you run it and/or treat it.

not sure how many sites because we didnt explore but there is at least 2 decent spots plus a large field that was pretty overgrown but would accommodate a lot of vehicles if needed.

name: Homer Dock ‐ Free Parking up to 7 days
description: There are a bunch of spots on the main road side and on this side of the dock that have signs that say "Free Parking up to 7 days". I stayed 3 nights (1 in first spot and 2 in the second) without issue. There are bathrooms (flush with sinks) and potable water spigots outside. Area for dogs to pee (please clean up after them). The area is beautiful and other than the gulls (which are everywhere in Alaska) it was pretty peaceful. I will definitely stay again.

name: The Pineola
description: Lovely campground, motel, cabin rental, and taproom!  Music on many weekends.  Pickle ball courts available for free to guests.  Very clean washroom with laundry facilities available.  Food truck open latter part of the week with coffee and breakfast items and burgers.  An Italian restaurant is also within walking distance.

name: Rock Cut State Park
description: large campground that will accommodate big rigs to tenters. Quiet. Not very busy on a Wednesday night in June. Lake for fishing and paddling. Bike routes and hiking trails.

name: Little Flat Tower Road
description: Small spot suitable for two vehicles beside the turn around at the head of the road.  Super quiet only the odd mountain biker or hiker for company.  Road a little rough but no issue for standard car wheels.

name: Edgar Evan's State Park
description:
Tennessee State Park. 
many,very nice spots with water and electric. Toilets and showers available. 
Stayed one night here. I would absolutely stop here again. I stayed here mid week and it wasn't very busy at all. There is a camp store on site as well as a sanitary dump.

name: Cow Pasture
description: nice flat grass area overlooking a great pond

name: Colorado Campground
description: Established USFS Campground - can be reserved on recreation.gov. Approximately 60 sites, potable water access, pit toilets. Camp host on site. Sites vary from pull through to back in and can accommodate wide range of camper sizes. All sites have fire pit and picnic table.

name: NF Dispersed for Beehive Buttress
description: Dispersed camping along 705J. My Promaster handled the road fine. A bit hilly at times. Probably 6 spots along the road. Each with fire rings and enough space for 2+ vehicles and a tent or 2. Anything over 25ish ft may struggle. But I'm not sure. I was here on a Tuesday and Wednesday night. It was definitely not as busy as Veudawoo to the south, but it probably fills up on the weekend. As a plus the closer to the end of 705J you get, the closer you are to the Beehive Buttress sport climbing approach trailhead. Could be fun to post up for a few days to climb Beehive. Great Att service.

name: Twin Oaks Campground
description: 122 Twin Oaks Ln, Schlocharie. Good WiFi plus very good Verizon and good AT&T. Very clean and well maintained. $40 p/nite. Hot shower 25c for 9 mins. Laundry $3 each for wash and dry. Small lake with activities. Access to mountain trails. Beautiful setting, friendly on site owners. Room for all sizes. Stayed 3 nights. Peaceful.

name: Spaces before the Bridge
description: Two perfectly flat spaces right before the bridge. Shelter from noise of the highway by the low hills. Excellent spot for a night or two or three!

name: Albertsons
description: They have free WiFi. Maybe not the best place to work but definitely helpful to know about it!

name: Cottonwood AZ
description: wild camping near cottonwood az free no amenities

name: Mason's Draw campground.
description: First come, first serve, pit toilet $10 a night. 5 campsites  in an aspen grove, not the most level spots but we were able to level out. Very quite and we had the whole campground to ourselves the thursday and friday befor July 4TH. Great spot to beat the heat in Moab, amout an hour from Moab.

name: Shadow Mountain - Site 23
description: Large group camping spot within the Shadow Mountain camping area that can fit about 4-5 vans. The road to get here is bumpy and rough, but I did make it here in my 25ft skoolie. No Verizon service. Free, 5 day max stay. The site has a bear box and fire ring. The smaller site 23B is also right next to this one. Good proximity to the Teton mountains but you can't see them from the site due to the large pine trees. Quiet except for the occasional ATV group that comes through. A bit dusty and some mosquitos/flies in late June.

name: Dearborn County Fairgrounds
description:
recommended by a local. there are several level spots for RVs (I'm assuming for fair workers) with trash cans and even bathrooms. the gates stay open and the only sign says no campfires. it's well lit and quiet.
there is also a big parking area in front of the gates where several cars and a semi were parked- looks like it is maybe used as a commuter lot during the fair off-season.

name: Free dump station at Spring Canyon campground
description: Free dump station at entrance of campground. We spent nearly two hours here flushing our tanks, cleaning/sanitizing our fresh water tank, sanitizing our four scepter containers, filling our water, etc. Not busy at all (it was a Tuesday evening). Camp host is fun and friendly! Also have a free outdoor shower at the beach.

name: Rest area
description: Garden corner rest area. Good for a night. Bathrooms right there.

name: Scrubby’s car wash
description: Free dump, no water. Car wash optional. All self service.

name: I80 turn out
description: A small pull over next 80 west freeway. Spent a night with no one bother, but there is a train track next to it. It gets very noisy at night with the cars running in the freeway and the train going at night and morning.

name: North Anna Battlefield Park
description:
This is a small local park, about 20 parking spaces on gravel. Mostly level, hiking trails and porta potty. Sheriff drove by about 7 PM and then again the next morning at 7:30 AM, with no problem. Absolutely quiet and absolutely dark but felt very safe. There’s a gate at the entrance but doesn’t appear to have been closed in years. There’s plenty of space for big rigs but on the way in, some tree branches that have a max height of about 10 feet. 

A picture of the rules is included. BTW, Hot air ballooning it’s not allowed.

name: city of Dell rapids campground
description: Unmanned campground that offers full hook up and w/e only sites.  showers located at front of campground.

name: Greycliff Rest Area Eastbound
description: There is a water spigot in the east end of the rest stop.

name: Big parking lot
description: Big parking lot that is able to accomodate RVs or rigs of any size, has pit toilet and few tables hidden in trees, campervans can park next to the tables. You can hear Sewart Highway in the distance depending on where you park in the parking lot, but you are mostly covered by trees. Severa firepits are available. Water is available from the river nearby.

name: BLM dispersed camping
description: Lots of dispersed camping around here. There were a few people camping but sites are apart enough for privacy. Some have fire rings. got to spot with 2WD. No service with ATT (have to drive about 30 min from here to get any). Perfect for one night or more! Felt very safe. No bathroom that is walkable to from this site but you can drive a few minutes where there is one.

name: coin laundry
description: A nice clean laundromat near Uwharrie National Forest.

name: Indian Creek Campground
description:
Corp of Engineers campground on Mark Twain Lake. All sites with 50/30/20 amp electric some with “full” hookup. A very nice beach for campers with boat ramp near by. Visit the marina for boat rental or pick up some snacks and ice. 
Over 200 campsites lots of shade trees and hot shower to boot. 
Stop in Monroe City for your camping needs before going to the campground. 
Closes for winter

name: Mid canon
description: Lots of pull offs on this gravel/dirt road. doable in most vehicles.  The passing of oncoming cars requires planning.  good for mountain bikes and hiking.

name: Down overgrown track
description: Not many wild camping opportunities around Skagway. This is an overgrown track, next to a clearing (next to a bridge) with no 'no camping/overnight' signs. Conveniently near dyea if your looking to check the area out. I looked up Skagway  and sleeping in the city itself is prohibited

name: Corner gas
description: 24hr with credit cards. Does not ask for US zip code so international cards work. Cuts out at $75 and you have to start again. 29/6/22 $6 per gal which is cheaper than Whitehorse and  Carcross.

name: Navajo Rocks Mountain Bike Parking
description: A small parking lot just off the road - we arrived at sunset just as the last mountain bikers were leaving and we were the only ones in the lot overnight. There’s no “no overnight” or “no camping” signs here - a good place to stay for a night if you’re going to Arches or Canyonlands for the day. 1-2 bars of cell signal (T-Mobile and Verizon were similar)

name: Love’s Travel Stop
description: $15 for a shower which is pretty expensive, but they were nice and clean. You get your own room, and they have towels if you need them. Would recommend if you’re in a pinch, just because of price, otherwise, they’re great.

name: Top of the World Hwy
description: South side of road next to a noisy creek. Nice fire ring and somewhat away from the Hwy but who cares as there is no traffic anyway.  A nice guy came by and said it was cool to camp here but absolution gold panning as this is an active claim. Keep your bear spray handy as there is lots of scat around.

name: Planet Fitness parking lot
description: Clean and quiet parking lot. If you park closer to the entrance you could probably also pick up the Wifi. There's a bonus water spigot located on the front left corner. Traffic noise started at 6am when we slept there. There isn't much shade.

name: Lowes Rapid City
description: Lowes parking lot allows overnight parking and has wifi and a bathroom during open hours.

name: Emmett City RV Dump Station
description: $3 to use the dump station. No potable water.

name: Barnstable Land Trust
description:
A very tiny parking lot at the end of a street, backing onto a small marshy area.   No signs prohibiting overnights, but please respect the locals - be quiet, be respectful, and don’t leave trash behind.   Nice marshy area with some walking paths to catch sunset and sunrise and watch the boats come in and out of the nearby harbour. 

Best suited for camper vans or VERY small (under 14 foot) trailers with experienced drivers who can turn around in a very confined area, or back some distance to turn around if the SMALL lot is already full. If you have any second thoughts about either do NOT come here as you may get yourself in a pickle - it is a dead end.     

It was empty and very quiet the entire time we were here and nobody bothered us all night.  There was even open wifi from a nearby house!

name: Lagoon Park
description: I slept here peacefully for 2 nights.  Google maps says it’s a 24 hour park.  No one bothered me and it was the most peaceful sleep especially in an urban setting.  Bathrooms were also open and right next to a beautiful lake, playground and dog park.

name: Archway RV Park
description: Beautiful Campsite with potable water, electricity, showers, playgrounds, laundry, food, and amazing people running the facility.

name: Saddle Sore Ranch
description: Off grid event venue. Privately owned. Pack it in, pack it out. Leave no trace. Please so not use our firewood. Near many area trailheads.

name: Walmart Belvidere
description: Parking of the walmart in Belvidere. Overnight is allowed. Very quiet at night. Good wifi.

name: Street parking in front of a park
description:
Little family park, chemical toilets ( not clean) , water fontaine , playground for kids, dogs park and see a lot dogs running freely after the ball in the park. 
Park on the side of the park like this you don’t bother neighborhoods… and keep low profile, the place is safe and very quiet during the night. Should be nice to keep it

name: Nicks lagoon
description: looks like an amazing secluded water front place. I think it’s just a trailhead/fishing spot. Such a pretty spot

name: Street parking
description: Street parking in business/industrial area. No parking signs or regulations that I could see. Stayed one night and it was pretty quiet night. Vehicles do tend to zoom past, but other than that, no complaints.

name: Cascade Lake, Forest Service Campground
description: On Lake Cascade. Many sites right on the water. $15 fee to camp. 1/2 off if you have a National Park pass. Lovely sites with large tables & fire rings. Pit toilet. On a paved road. There is also a boat ramp.

name: Forest road 213 dispersed camping
description: Forest service rd 223 out side of north rim. There are a few campsites along the road. Safe place for the night. You can hear an occasional car off the road a couple miles away. Not big rig friendly. Pack it out, no trash anywhere keep it clean please.

name: Gravel flat off Twin Meadows road
description: Large gravel clearing in forest.  Easy to find a flat space. Shows signs of camping use.  Traffic noise from nearby route 22.

name: Lehman's Kidron
description: A very big parking behind Lehman's. They are fine with overnight parking. Nice park with picknick benches directly beside. Super quiet during the night.

name: Seeboomook Campground
description: Found this little place on rv life.  Off the beaten path.  Great staff but hybrid camping.  Beautiful place with a great view.  No cell signal but starlink works.  Electricity is not available 24/7.  Roads leading in are not maintained.  Also if you want to travel in from the north or travel north you have to register with north woods first.

name: Rest Area: Quartz Flats Westbound
description: Water spigot is located near dog relief area. Nice bathrooms as well.

name: Cameahwait Campground
description: Nice sites with picnic tables and fire rings. Clean vault toilet. Short walk to the beach but there is also an option to drive down to the beach from two unmarked splits from the dirt road to this camp area.

name: Lawler high
description: open turnout off NF road, no cell service, great views

name: The RV place
description: 4 miles west of Huntsville AR off highway74.  Gravel driveway entrance into large field that accommodates several camp sites for RVers with a few tent sites in the trees. This campground is a work in progress. Eventually electricity and water will be added. For now you have the creek and the woods to enjoy. Small fee 5-10$ per night. Email ldcram@gmail.com if you’d like to stay

name: Colter Bay Village Convenience Store
description: Free water filling station outside the convenience store

name: Illinois Bayou Park
description:
Beautiful spot on the opposite side of an I40 rest stop. Parking lot right on the lake, with pine trees all around. 

stayed here one night without issues, no other cars. no "no parking overnight" signs. a bit noisy from the nearby highways but well worth it for the beauty. 

some picnic tables but no other amenities.

name: Belwin Conservancy: Stagecoach Prairie
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Officially No camping is allowed here. "If people need to sleep overnight in their car passing through, that,s fine. But no more than a night. We do allow dogs on leash and their pet waste brought with them when leaving. "

Please do not stay more than one night, this place will be closed if misused, pack out your trash, including pet waste.  

Trailhead off of rt. 21, quiet, serene. 

Very few cars in the morning on a Thursday, almost none throughout the night.

name: City campground
description:
$2 hot shower. The shower operates by using finger pump for pressure. Very clean and well maintained. Showers are inside the campground.
