Also, plenty of water hookups and outlets.

name: Celtic Elk Campground
description: A very nice campground situated on farm grounds. It includes hot showers and a grassy area and picnic tables. There are also hookups but we were in a tent. The owners are super nice, they gave us a tour of the farm and explained their plans for each area- we got to feed the sheep and alpacas! The only downside (which they do write on their website) is that for now the campground uses porta-potties. We paid $20 for a tent (includes potable water) which was the best price that we could find in the area. Overall we had a great, slightly rustic, experience.

name: Lowes
description: Propane exchange.  Paid $20.98. Lots of other stuff here too!

name: Water spigots
description:
Moderator Note: Please check that it is acceptable to obtain water here.
.......
Spigots at campsites near an electrical pole. No apparent host at site.

name: Marblemount Library
description: Free wifi and strong connection in parking lot (next to community center). No camping allowed

name: Bird island
description: Nice rest area with toilets, water spigot , trash, 2 tables under shade

name: I-26  Henderson Rest area
description: New rest area. nice place for the night but right on the highway so it's loud.

name: Silver Creek
description:
Exceptional spot right next to the creek!
Right at the cattle grate turn into the Silver Creek public access road. The first site ( the most north one) with pit toilet, picnic table, fire pit, tent spot, creek access, and handicap accessible. Only slight leveling needed. With 4 bars of service. 
Stayed here with a 19ft van and had plenty of extra room
Even though the dirt road is very bumpy keep going it’s worth it.

name: West Gardiner Service Plaza
description: Nice service plaza with food, picnic tables, and fast wifi.

name: Hurricane Cliffs Trail Head
description: Great camping all around here, super clean  toilet, decent Verizon service, MTB trails and sewage dump. No water.

name: Transit Station
description:
Parking with full light and along the 101... so not the best, but a policeman referred  this place to us because the parking lot at the beach closed at 10pm. We move after 6am back to the overload parking lot. it is free and really near the beach (dog allowed on leash) with nice sand dunes and beautiful sunset.
there is water, outdoor showers and dump station (I don't know if it is free but is seems open) at the beach

name: Trailhead Black Cap.
description: Trailhead. Black Cap. Very busy. Spent the night with no problem.

name: Tillamook red house
description: Free water hose. Not for big rigs but for filling up water bottles.  It works.

name: Mount Dutton campsite
description:
Very large wide open area with four or so camp sites. Reasonably flat. Lots of trees as well as open areas. Barely any cell service. 1 bar TMo, 2 bars Verizon. 
Very scenic with panoramic views.

name: Love’s
description: Water filling and dump station at this gas station

name: Tsalteshi Trails
description: Great network of mountain biking trails with some single track and wider paths with easy access. Trails are well marked with maps at each intersection. Pit toilets at parking area. Really nice!

name: 4th Street Laundromat
description: Nice, clean laundromat. Standard change machine, soap dispenser out of order at date of visit (July 1st 2022). Bathroom clean. $1.50 for a wash, $0.25 for dryer. 8 parking spots and some street parking nearby.

name: Big Creek campground
description: Nice quiet campground. Lots of nature.  each site has room for one tent and a flat area for RV or trailer.  Each site has a grill and picnic table. Wood for sale by camp host. Sites can be booked through recreation.gov. The site is maintained by the Forest Service. https://www.fs.usda.gov/giffordpinchot

name: Edison Way stealth camping
description: Menlo Park is a tricky place to boondock, but this street has a few spots that are across from businesses and next to a park. I parked in my Skoolie two nights with no issues, but I did move during the day. I also saw some rvs near fifth street on Edison, so it’s possible nobody will bother you there too. Very quiet, few street lights, very little traffic.

name: By the Creek
description: Coming out of town, turn right before bridge. It's the only one that doesn't have a "no camping" sign posted and there was another truck camper already down here. I have 4 wheel drive, but you may not need it. Beautiful area and just out of town.

name: Campground dump station
description: It is on the right across from the campground entrance which is on the left. There are two of them and they are both pull through so it is really nice. The water is sadly not potable but you can use it to rinse your hoses. To get into the park you have to pay (resident: $7, non resident $12) so sadly this isn’t free but if you are already in the park it is a nice place to dump.

name: Angeles NF - Castaic Lake Overlook
description:
Wonderful location for 1-2 SUVs, Pickups/Truck Campers. 3 might be a little crowded but doable. Fire ring. Amazing view of the lake. 
The initial hill to start this trail can be intimidating and is deeply rutted. There is a path to the left but it's gated off. I'm not sure of 2WD vehicle capabilites, but I personally couldn't see myself in a Sprinter, Transit, or Promaster attempting this. The trail beyond is tight with some deeply rutted areas. Prepare for pin stripes and being at the edge of the cliff. I had to get out 2x to make sure the path was doable and within my own and the vehicle's limits. BUT it's worth it. There is a small trail off to the west of this. On the Satellite map it looks like a continuation of a dirt road but it's not. National Forest land.
(Pic of the large spot with Apiary is where the other pin near this area is).

name: Cracker barrel, Marion IL
description: nice parking lot. quite and clean. stayed for a night. good cell service.

name: Lion’s Park
description: Very sweet camp site in the small town of Aurora. There are 5 camping spaces on gravel that include picnic benches with sun coverings and electric hookups and there are a few camping spaces in a grassier area as well with hookups, picnic tables and fire pits. There are two potable water spigots by the campsite but more around. Dumpster on site, bathrooms that are open 24/7 with one shower in each near a dump site. Super gorgeous area, right next to a playground and a lake with beautiful flowers and sweet ducklings. There’s also a lovely cemetery past the lake from the 1800s. Donations of $15 a night are appreciated but not required. Sheriff was nice. Would defiantly stay again.

name: Ollie’s Bargain Outlet
description:
Parked at the far end of the parking lot overnight with no issues. No signs prohibiting overnight parking. Planet fitness in the same parking lot and a QT and Walmart marketplace just next door. Lots of lights that stayed on overnight so if you like it to be bright for safety this is a great option.

Update: slept 4 nights there without any issues, the main road can be loud at times but normally it dies down at night.

name: Walmart Supercenter - White Horse
description: Stayed the night here without any issues. Saw other vans and big rigs and thought I’d give it a shot. Don’t see any signs prohibiting overnight parking. There’s a planet fitness right next door and plenty of places to get food especially and ALDIs right across the road for groceries.

name: Hearthstone Coin Laundry
description: Decently clean facilities for a laundromat. And easy service. Just bring your own detergent (or don’t they have vending machines for them) and lots a of quarters.

name: Croixland Cleaning Service
description: I will use this one again. Pricing of the double load front washers $3.25. Dryers $3.00 for 36 minutes.  Has a laundry service, drycleaners and a self serve car wash.  See photo for attendant hours

name: A cul-de-sac with a creek
description: One of the (many) sites in the Sawtooth National Forest (wild camping allowed). It offers two level, grassy spots for vehicles (a tent would fit under trees), protection from the wind, shade from trees, a picknick table and privacy (because it's at the dead end of a track). To top it off, there's a creek with crystal clear water, with a waterfall 1/4 mile further up (on foot). Well worth the 11 mile unpaved detour from I84. The very last part is a little rough: not suitable for RVs or trailers.

name: Laverie Automatique
description:
Laundry place clean air conditioned friendly host 
1.75 washer
2.00 dryer 
1.00 Box soap

name: Recycling Public Drop off
description: PUBLIC recycling of plastic, paper, cardboard, plastic bags, aluminum, e waste. NO GLASS.

name: Pullout near river
description: Large pullout area with a fire ring and trails to a few more fire rings. Our class B fits nicely with space for another. A river and bridge are close by for exploring.

name: John Tanner Park
description: Electricity and water hookups. Dumping station on site but not at campsite. Not much cell service. Lake with beach and putt putt. Dated but pretty clean. Run by Carroll County, Ga.

name: Wildhorse Campground
description: The Wildhorse campground has 13 sites in a heavily wooded setting.   There are two handpumps that provide water in the summer months, and two accessible vault toilets. Nearby areas of interest include Boulder Creek Lake, Waterfall Trail, and the head of Wildhorse canyon.

name: Hummingbird Campground
description: Dispersed BLM campsite with several fire pits. Large flat meadow next to Wildhorse creek. Beautiful views of the Pioneer Mountains. Big rig, car, and tent-friendly. Plenty of nearby BLM sites along the road to Wildhorse Campground.

name: Forest Road 84 Near High Rock Fire Look Out
description: 2 Vehicles can fit. Next to a active creek make for a great sound. Establish fire pit. WIFI 1 bar Verizon.

name: Stewart’s
description: Water spout next to the air pump at this gas station.

name: Ellsworth Harbor Park and Marina
description: Water spigot connected to bathrooms with easy accessibility right up to it.

name: Roadside Park
description: cute little park with picnic tables and big maples. there is a free flowing spigot for artisan well water.

name: Lost Moose CG
description: Off the beaten path, on a gravel road about 7-8 miles from any main road. No cell service at all. Has RV and tent sites right next to a river. RV sites have power and water. Shaded. One pit toilet and multiple port-o-lets, outdoor hot showers (2), ping pong tables, cornhole, horseshoes. Main office sells firewood. Very secluded and lots of birds in the AM. Sites are large and not too close together.

name: Showers at Porter Beach
description: After entering the park take the second right in the roundabout and that will bring you to the parking lot with the bathrooms and outdoor showers. If you are looking at the lake from the parking lot the building is on the left. You have to pay to get into the park (resident $7, non resident $12). There is also a national park next door and to get into their beach I believe it is cheaper but I am not sure if there is a shower.

name: Fort Kearny State Rec Area - West Campground
description:
Nebraska checks for multi day camping at 2PM each afternoon. Camping cost and park pass is paid cash into an iron box anytime. We drove into primitive camp (parking lot was the backup plan) at 10PM and left by 5AM and did not pay anything. If you plan for multi day, make a reservation as it can get full.

Campground has mix of parking lots, campsites with electricity, pads, water, primitive. Toilets and showers are available.

name: Fort Kearny State Rec Area - West Campground
description:
Nebraska checks for multi day camping at 2PM each afternoon. Camping cost and park pass is paid cash into an iron box anytime. We drove into primitive camp (parking lot was the backup plan) at 10PM and left by 5AM and did not pay anything. If you plan for multi day, make a reservation as it can get full.

Campground has mix of parking lots, campsites with electricity, pads, water, primitive. Toilets and showers are available.

name: Falling Rock Road
description:
2 spots here
On the left side of the road is at the falling rock trail head (where I stayed).
Across the road is a very short dirt road (it's rocky) & there is a cleared out spot for camping at the end. 

No camp fires allowed here!

name: Desert Breeze Park
description:
Nice place for anyone with dogs or kids.

This park seems to be open 24 hours. It was only quiet for about 6 hours through the night, noise till about 11:30p and started back up at 5:30a.

It's a nice spot in the city for a night! 

I stayed in my sprinter van and had no issues!
Verizon has 5G

Garbage cans available everywhere, street lights everywhere, no hook ups.

name: Epic View Camp.
description:
Epic views. Take the two track off the main Manti Canyon road. Before the top of the pass.
Had to work a bit getting level in our Sprinter 4x4 but managed it. We’ll worth the effort.
Fire ring with plenty of wood.

name: Phillips 66 Gas Station
description: Potable water on right side of gas station free, propane, dump station $10 and firewood on the left side. There is also a campground Fireside Buffalo Valley at this location, didn’t stay here though.

name: Othello fairgrounds north lot
description: Large gravel lot on northwest side of fairgrounds. Have stayed in winter and summer and haven’t had any problems. Nothing fancy but good for a quick overnight

name: Robben rent a car
description: Used their hose to fill up and clean our car. The building is for lease so no one to see you

name: Lower Virginia Creek Primitive Campground USFS
description: USFS primitive campground - Free. Looks to be 20 some sites with bear box and fire ring. First come, first serve. 14 day stay limit. Mountain creek runs through the campground. Campground host. No trash service. No cell signal. Yours to enjoy protect and keep clean 🌲

name: Wilson State Park
description: We had an overnight primitive campsite for $10 at the Switchgrass location but then found a picnic table with a cement roof and no one around us. We asked the front office if we could stay at the picnic table site (refer to GPS coordinates) and management said yes. The picnic site has a picnic table with seating. No water. No outdoor grill. The site faces the bay. There is a path to get down to the water and swim. We were lucky to have noone around us except a white truck, perhaps the person went fishing. I don’t think management allows you to camp here but allowed us and our promaster to spend the night. Super quiet after 9:30 when the boats dock for the evening. Who knew that Kansas of all places has this gem in their backyard!

name: FSR 4057 (small loop)
description: Boltergeist Canyon. Absolutely beautiful views from this site! Far enough off the main road to let kids roam a little without worry. Leveling our trailer was interesting, but we were able to do it! There were 2 or 3 other sites on this loop. We saw some rock climbers down in the canyon, so I suppose there's a good starting point near here. Verizon decent signal with LTE.

name: VA Lakes Meadows BLM
description: A few dirt service roads of the Virginia Lakes paved road. Should be ok for most vehicles. Looks to be all BLM land in this area. Great views overlooking the Mono basin.  Suppose it could get windy. AT&T LTE but Verizon LTE comes and goes. Yours to enjoy protect and keep clean

name: Photo op Hollywood sign
description: closes and quickest foto opportunity to take  the Hollywood sign with an RV. Can't drive further up.

name: Priest Valley lane
description: On our way from kings canyon to Pinnacles it got late so we drove into this lane with our 25ft C. Found a spot in a corner by the trees and had a super quiet night. In the morning we see a farm in the distance but nobody bothered us and we left after breakfast. beautiful view across the field!

name: granite Creek
description: few spots on river.  beautiful view of mountains.  Fire ring at all 3 spots

name: Lake Halbert Park
description: Several established sites, some with electric and water. Some have covered picnic tables but all have water access. Each has a sign saying how to pay and what equipment is allowed. Looks like $20 per day for RV sites.

name: Pinehurst 1
description: Great off road site beside stream with fire pit.

name: Roadside Pulloff
description: Across the street from Thomas Fogarty winery. Was directed here by a local. Pulloff is at intersection - slightly better than ordinary pullout. Enough room for large vehicle.

name: Home Depot in West Ashley, Charleston SC
description:
Nice home depot in West Ashley.
pulled in late, other cars, trucks, and small moving trucks were parked. Very quiet. After about 20 minutes of blocking curtains and settling in, heard a car drive up and idle - nothing happened, but maybe it's monitored? Nice night in Charleston.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Overnight parking accepted at this Cracker Barrel with permission of manager. We were welcomed to stay. RV and truck spots are located in back of restaurant. Stayed on a Saturday night and area was relatively quiet except for traffic hum of highway in the background. Next to a Home Depot and a Mobil (no diesel available).

name: Public Parking lot 14th Street
description:
Public Parking lot between beach, Hotel Tybee and 14th and 15th street. Payment required and enforced between 8 am and 8 pm, $ 3,50 per hour, overnight free. Sign says “no RVs between march and october” - we asked a nice police officer: main concern is the noise from generators. But a class B, self-contained, making no noise, is no problem.
Place is safe, lit during the night, bathrooms open 24/7, an outside shower available (don’t take your bathing suit off, the hotel balconies offer front row seats :-)  There were people coming and going to the beach all night, talking and shouting, some radio noise, so it was not very quiet but it is 4th of July-weekend, so probably more busy than usual.

name: LOWE’s parking lot
description: Large parking lot, well lit, clean and safe, WiFi, no “no overnight parking” signs (we tried Walmart across the street first, there was a “no overnight parking” sign with a truck crossed out, so maybe for trucks only). Stayed at the eastern end of the lot, a lovely frog symphony orchestra was playing all night, other than that quiet, no trucks, no one partying.

name: Wal-Mart
description:
park by row 3.  you get electricity and water.
they are ok with you sleeping overnight.

name: abandon hotel Margaret hotel
description:
I parked right next to the abandon Margaret hotel.
  I use my power generator all night to power my AC  without a problem.  parked in front of the National Park. had a great hike and ate good food. location was perfect . shade and quiet.  enough parking for a class C Motorhome

name: walmart
description:
parking lot of wall mart.
please be respectful so we can keep on doing this

name: Trading Post Rest Area Dump Station
description: Free dump station at rest area off US-69. Rinse water available for dumping, no potable water.

name: Tonga Ridge Grove
description: Off NF Road 6830 on the way to Tonga Ridge trailhead. Big clearing that has enough room for multiple tents or campers if you can get you camping up the narrow driveway. Had 3 spots were people had made fires without a fire rings so we made a proper one. Nice breeze and plenty of open sky for star gazing

name: Parking lot
description:
It’s an open parking lot on the Oconaluftee River. There was another camper in here already, and semi trailers with cargo. 
Quiet, peaceful night. No signs about overnight parking anywhere in this town. Just a minute from the blue ridge parkway.  Excellent cell signal. 
Park in and pack out, keep it clean so they don’t close it.

name: Flying J
description: Dump for $10, rise water. RV lane, so easy to spot.

name: Conoco
description: Free dump and  water… propane for sale. Clean. Off to the corner. Easy access.

name: Pooltable Road
description: Was low on gas so didn’t make it as far as the others. At the top of the drive, this is a totally exposed flat area with 360• views. I will surely find out about the wind situation later but it’s calm now. There is only a little bit of activity for a holiday weekend. I want to vouch for the decent road!

name: Austin Creek Rd Pullout
description: Fairly flat pullout further down the road from Squaw Creek Rd Pullouts. Secluded and didn’t have any cars pass us. Stayed one night. Lots of pot holes in the main road but our sprinter van had no problems. But any bigger vehicle might not be able to back out.

name: Captain Clark Fishing Access Site
description: Multiple camping spots. Max 7 days. Pit toilet. Spots near the river as well. AT&T full bars.

name: Scherrer Road Trail Parking
description:
Big parking along a quiet road. Very large and flat !
No noise, perfect.

name: Birch Bay State Park
description: Great Campground in a state park ( much better than the one in town), plenty of space, price range $27-45 (full hookup). Dump station. Only 30 minutes from the border.

name: East Side Mart
description: This area has Permit Stays,  Diesel & Regular Fuel, Laundry Mat, and a Chinese Restaurant

name: East Side Mart
description: Dumping Station that is free. Running water to clean out tanks.

name: Forest Road
description: level, very spacious and quiet. did not see a single other vehicle. just outside of park boundary, near bend.

name: Enger Trail & Observation Hill: Trailhead
description: Parking lot at trailhead adjacent to Two Ponds park. We stayed here for 1 night in our campervan. We were the only people here after 8pm. Nice and quiet. Good cell signal. Just up the road, at Enger Tower, there are public washrooms.

name: Rock Cut State Park Campground
description: Campground with electricity and shower facilities. ~18$ to rent a spot depending on the lot. mobile data is accessible. pets allowed. firepit, elec outlets (big plugs/small plugs) and picnic table at each campground. courteous management. open 3 pm until 11 am checkout next morning. reservation a day early, or early that day before arrival is strongly recommended

name: Maverik gas station
description: Red spigot with hose connection at RV/truck pump 20 around the back of the gas station. Not sure if it's potable or not.

name: Salt Point State Park
description:
Beautiful fields and rocks right next to the ocean. Love hiking here.
You can park on the shoulder of the road. 
No camping here.

name: West Bound Rest Stop
description: A really nice rest stop right off of I 80. Tons of parking spots so you don’t have to worry about getting a spot. On the car side it was me and another camper van. Bathrooms inside with water fountains. Also aluminum recycling outside in a few bins.

name: Lotus Lake County Park
description: Decent outhouse style bathrooms and a pump well right on the lake. Paved lot with public boat landing and small playground.

name: Hatfield Park Campground
description: Small campground with full hookups. $5 dump station and water available for non-guests.

name: Loads of Fun Laundromat
description: Beautiful Laundromat,  20 washers (new Electrolux) multiple loads. 20 dryers Electrolux also . Super clean

name: Chesapeake House
description:
Rest area off of i95 accessible from both  Northbound and Southbound. 1/2 dozen people sleeping for the night. No “no overnight signs” or any other signage discouraging it.  Peaceful uneventful night. 

Similar setup with the Maryland House Rest Area 15 min. South.

name: Valley River Bed
description: Followed a gravel road, passing several gravel pits, to it's very end. You end up on a dry riverbed with 360-degree beautiful mountain views and you have the soothing noise of a running river. There is plenty of room!

name: Lake Irwin Campground
description: BEAUTIFUL campground next to Irwin Lake!!!

name: Crested Butte Library
description: WiFi here, but must go inside. Nice little library with free book shelf- where I dropped off magazines.

name: River Flats Campground
description: Walk-in sites off Slate Creek Road. Pit toilet here and parking.

name: Bagby under the bridge
description: Beautiful spot next to the river. River was low when we were here, so it may not always be accessible. Drive down the boat ramp (it's fairly steep) and make a left to go towards the bridge. There's a loop under the bridge that we parked on. Peaceful river rumbling. Nobody disturbed us. Fishermen started coming in the morning but didn't come near where we were. The river was super clear and the kids loved swimming in it. There's also an established campsite down the road (instead of going down the boat ramp) but they wanted $30 for non-electric and $40 for electric cash only. There were no river views from that campground. The place we found was absolutely amazing! We cleaned all the trash that we found, please keep it that way! There is absolutely no signal with T-Mobile, Verizon or ATT, even with our extender. We are in a 4x4 pulling a 32ft trailer (and very confident in our abilities). The dirt road coming in is soft but we had no issues with sinking.

name: Moon Lake Recreation Site
description: Established Campsite, maybe 14 spots, all fcfs at a nice lake. Great for swimming or paddling. 18$/site. GCI cell coverage. Potable water from a pump.

name: Mt hebo end of the road site
description:
we stayed here for two nights. very quiet spot with a campfire ring and space to let the dogs run off leash. it's at a fork in the road. the roads continue but are very overgrown and unpassable to vehicles. 

road in is steep but the surface is good. fwd corrola made it no problem.

name: Rock Climbers Paradise - Free FS Dispersed Camping Area
description:
This is a free, large forest service camping area with space for about 25 cars in a central parking area and approximately eight extremely beautiful short walk tent areas with rock pits and log benches off of it.  There is a porta potty provided by the Leavenworth Climbing association, because this is a huge rock climbing area.  This is an amazing spot for a tent, and a good spot for car camping. I would not recommend anything larger than a 144 inch sprinter in here though, as only about half of the parking spots are even remotely level.

Some rock climbers come here for weeks or even months on end during the summer, as one other post mentions there’s a lot of traffic on the main forest road coming up to Colchuck atnd Stuart lake trail heads, the main access to the enchantments.  But I really enjoyed my long weekend here!!

name: Chief Looking Glass Park
description:
Free Decent Wi-Fi - 2.4 hz & 5G

Day-use park on the river across from the high school with picnic tables, bathrooms, dumpsters, rv dump station, basketball & tennis courts. Propane refill across the street at the NomNom Gas Station.

Great spot to cool off on a hot day and utilize some free Wi-Fi.

name: Asotin NomNom Gas Station
description: This station can refill your propane bottles.

name: Gualala Supermarket
description: Water machine. Can fill up to 5 gallons. $0.50 per gallon.

name: Adventure RV Service
description: Dump and non-potable water. $10, cash only.

name: Hennepin Canal Parkway
description: An awesome park off of highway 80, there are really nice walking/running/biking paths right next to the canal. Sadly there is no overnight parking/camping but along the canal there are a handful of camp grounds at lock 6, 11, 17, 21, 22, 23, 26, bridge 14 & bridge 23 that are $8 a night. There also is a boat ramp here to put in kayaks, paddle boards, canoes, etc. At this spot there are public bathrooms but no water.

name: Acres Kwik Trip - Gas station
description: I was filling up here and asked about water. She pointed me to a hose outside to the left of the main door.  She said it was potable.

name: Community center
description: Water tap by the parking lot/playfield by the community center. Unlocked and working (and can thread a standard hose to it) in July, not sure about winter.

name: Pull out
description:
Lots of room. bumpy but 2wd is fine and any size is fine. 
Some rock fire rings placed around and right next to the lake! we even saw goats on the cliff sides.

name: Teton Dam
description: There are no signs informing you of campsites down below the dam. There are 10-11 informal gravel sites with garbage cans and that’s it for amenities . No service. Very beautiful riverside spots  Continue past the Dam lookout (where you can see the failed ruins) on the Teton Dam road. About 2 km from the lookout. No trees but shade comes 7 pm from the canyon rock banks at riverside whereas the scenic overlook has Sun till maybe 9:30 pm (end of June).

name: Bachelor West Public Shower
description:
Public shower at the West Lodge. 
It’s clean, but expensive! $5 for 5 minutes

name: Ward - Drinking water fill site
description: This is a pipe with water flowing with a sign that says drinking water. You pull off the side of the road and fill up. They provide a funnel to make filling jugs easy. No cost

name: Public restroom
description: Public restroom and purified water bottle fill up.

name: Little Manatee River State Park
description: Camping site area. Boring. Does have showers, washer and dryer. Hot. Bugs.

name: Rocky bumpy dirt road
description: Very bumpy and rocky going up hill but once to spot it’s beautiful! 2WD mini van pulling trailer made it up just fine! Will b me staying the night. AT&T service great!

name: Mountain View Car Wash
description: Free potable water and dump station behind car wash. Car Wash is very clean and tidy. can be accessed by big rigs. please patronize the car wash to help support the dump station. Bring your own hose!

name: New Mexico badlands picnic area
description: Parked at the picnic area because the road to the campground was too muddy from recent rain. Do not attempt to go to the camp ground if it has rained. I had to back down a mile before being able to turn around. 4x4 maybe ok. I was in a 2x4 transit 150. Camped at the picnic area just past the overlook.

name: William G. Stratton State Park
description: Boat ramp. Open 24 hours. State park. Very quiet.

name: Slate River Designated Camping
description:
Around 20 spots along the river valley, several pit toilets. More spots if you continue past a section of private property.
Very quiet (Monday night in early Oct), 
good scenery.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Generally quiet. Couple other vans were here. Gets busy around 8 with car and plane noises. Great stopover with central locations to necessities

name: Riverfront Close to Denali NP
description: Two small spots along riverbank. Large gravel area to pull into, spots are located down a small hill on the left side of the large pullout (could prob also stay in the larger pullout, though road noise could be a bother). One spot can fit a car/suv/truck camper, the second spot is big enough for a rooftop tent/van/small RV. Fairly level, though there are large rocks nearby to help with that. The sound of the river helps to drown out any highway sounds.

name: Sunshine Campground
description: Clean US Forest Service campground with 17 sites. Each site is first-come first-serve and they have a picnic table and fire ring. $20/night. Some sites are private and some have views of Sunshine Mt. There were hose bibs to fill an RV but there was no water turned on.

name: School Parking Lot
description:
Moderator Note: Please check that overnight parking is permissible.
......
Parking in front of the high school. No signs.
We stay here one night when the school was close for the summer

name: Hansen Creek Railroad Trestle
description: Up a fairly bumpy (but not potholed) service road leading to a hiking trail. I did not get bothered while I stayed one night. Travelling in a minivan.

name: Fire Wood
description: Private home, sells firewood year round. $4 bundle

name: Weiser State Forest
description: No formal spots/no amenities, just have to check in at the ranger station if you’re staying overnight. Lake has good fishing and hiking.

name: Little Pine State Park
description: Fee-based water and sewer dump, which is the only place around that I could find that does so.  It's a state park, so you don't feel like you're breaking any rules by asking for a fill and dump.

name: Dispersed Camping next to Snake River
description: This spot has 2 sites next to each other with access to the river & enough room for 5 vehicles to park. My 21’ van fit with plenty of room behind it so if both sites were empty, someone with a longer vehicle (either RV, 5th wheel, or bus) could fit easily with room for more vehicles as there is a curved drive through the middle to pull in one side and out of the other.

name: Beartooth campground
description: established campground, wooded but short walk down hill to Beartooth lake with great view of mountains.    fire rings, clean pit toilet, water.   7.50 a night with access pass

name: Nort Carolina Welcome center
description: like any other rest stop clean bathroom, no sign prohibiting overnight parking, a go for Car, Trick or Vanlifer.

name: Lake Como Dispersed
description: Nice spot just off of Lake Como. Lots of room. Fire ring, flat, space for a couple vehicles and tents. Only 3.5 miles off of route 93.  This is a fee area so you do need to display your NP Recreation pass.

name: gingko petrified forest interpretive center
description:
it's a nice stop overlooking the river with picnic areas, a little museum and walking trails. potable water spigot and flush toilets available even if the museum is closed

discover pass required as per usual

name: Abilene YMCA
description: $5 for a day pass ($7 after 4pm). Clean, hot, newly remodeled locker rooms!

name: Truckee Donner Community Swimming Pool
description: $5 for an unlimited hot shower. They have weird hours so check before you go

name: Finland Community Center
description: Dump Station wich non potable water only. Donation requested

name: Camping World Harrisburg
description: Free dump station and non-potable water (hose available on-site) 24/7.  Propane available for additional charge (unsure if propane is available after business hours).

name: Pressey State WMA Campground
description:
Established, free campground. First come first served and maybe 20 spots or so. Very pretty place. Some of the spots are right by the river among pine trees.

Some spots have electrical hookups. Most have fire rings. Pit toilets and one water spigot (unclear if it's potable). 

No cell signal

name: Lowe’s Home Improvement
description: No signs saying you can’t park overnight. I parked on the lumber side behind some work trucks. There was a box truck camper, my van, and then a car parked there overnight. No issues.

name: Coo Creek Yellow Posts
description: 19 yellow posts along the 1N02 forest road, off highway 38. Road is a bit rocky but nothing my AWD Transit couldn’t handle. Just take it slow. No amenities so pack it out and leave no (human) trace. No cell reception. You can stay up to 14 days for FREE. You need a fire permit even to use your propane stove inside your rig. Park rangers patrol the area and will issue one. Super quiet (I spent two nights on July 4th long weekend and was all alone in my area the second night). Some good hiking around (PCT crosses at the end of the road).

name: Sinclair Gas Station
description: There is a water spigot on the left side of the building. no lock.

name: Dead end loop off NF-58
description: NF-58 is paved and well maintained. There are some pull offs good for vans or shorter rigs. The road we stayed on was mostly  loose, wet mud that had lots of ruts (no issue with 4x4) and dense tree coverage so all shade. Area is quiet but lots of trash left behind in some instances. 3 bars LTE with AT&T.

name: Lucky's Travel Plaza
description: $13 for a shower, no time limit. There are only 2 showers but no line when we went. Pro tip: if you are traveling as a couple, just pay for 1 shower and shower together!

name: Prairie Dog campground at Prairie Dog state park
description: Nice established campground. $9 for the night with electric hook up. The cost is based off utilities used (primitive, electric only or electric and water are the options). Any spots with a yellow tag are available. Self pay kiosk when you come into the park (outside the ranger station) accepts credit cards. Flushing toilets & showers available. There’s a big lake to swim or fish

name: BLM free camping
description: Free camping sites, it's beautiful. Fire pits, trails and 5G service AT&T!

name: Lakewood campground
description: Huge campground with everything you need!!

name: Cheyenne Aquatic Center
description: Showers and pool available. Need to book a time on website to visit. Next to a nice park.

name: FS 52 Pull Off - Slightly Overgrown Dirt Road
description: Stayed here last night. There is a slightly overgrown dirt road you can turn at. Tree on the left at entrance has 2 white diamonds and a sign to not cut any wood. Short drive (1 min) gets you to a clearing with a fire pit. The road continues, but is very overgrown. Nice and secluded!

name: Forestry Road in Santiam Forest
description: 4-6 spots along a dead end forestry road. Slightly steep incline when you turn off main forestry road, but our sedan did fine. Larger clearing at dead end would easily fit a larger group.

name: Valdez Glacier River Bed
description:
Very large river bed that can accommodate dozens of campers. You can access the river bed, when dry and when the water is not high, by following the road on the southeast side of the bridge that cross the Valdez glacier stream.

4wd somewhat recommended depending on where you want to go. High clearance necessary, especially if you want to go a little further from the road. 

Close to highway, but the noise is minimal if you go a little further south.

Very convenient spot, beautiful views all around.

I camped here during the 4th of July for 3 nights, and they were a lot of campers.

Strong cell service. 5/10 minutes from town.

name: Lake Holbrook Campground West
description: Free camping right on the water of Lake Holbrook. There are fire rings, camp tables, and camp grills around the campgrounds. there is a building for restrooms but they were locked when I visited (possibly because it is winter time?) Fairly quiet spot, with some light road noise until around 10pm it stopped.

name: Mile 82.5 Denali Hwy.  Best view on Denali Hwy
description: Very large gravel pit on north side of road. Beautiful view of mountains a glacier across a wide open valley with ponds and lakes.

name: Along NF 2931
description: This spot is directly on the Route so not hidden but fairly flat and alone. Far away from the main street so that nobody bothers you

name: River Gorge View Turnout
description:
One of the many spacious turnouts along this portion of the 89. Was easy to find a relatively flat spot at a very safe distance from the highway. No signage prohibiting overnight parking. Four minutes drive from the Brewing Lair. 

spent one night, arrived near sundown and left at sunrise

name: Flying J
description:
This is a small parking lot adjacent to Flying J. 
At the end of the lot is a small pet relief area. Flying J has restrooms, coffee. I slept there few times. The place is not super quiet, but better than any rest area nearby. Few other rigs were camping there overnight. Decent cellular coverage. McDonald’s just across the parking lot.

name: Casey's
description: Gas station with very large parking lot.

name: Mackay Reservoir
description: Dispersed camping on the reservoir. There are sites down by the water as well as higher up. Pit toilet near the boating/fishing area. Pack out your own trash as with any other dispersed sites.

name: Big Brutus Coal Shovel and Museum
description: Set in the coal fields of Southeast Kansas. Big Brutus was one of the largest electric powered coal shovels and museum. 2022 was the second annual Bigiron Overland Rally camping and music festival

name: Public Parking
description: Free public parking! It is somewhat hidden so it is not used as much as the other parking lots near the beaches. We did not overnight here however the are no signs prohibiting it. Not sure if it is allowed so we did not risk it.

name: Wayside by lake
description: Parking right by the lake. There is a pit toilet 50-75 feet N of parking area. Minimal road noise

name: Walmart
description: Walmart located in more central area of Grand Forks. Stayed here one night with no issues.

name: Paxton Lake Campground
description: Beautiful campsites on Paxon Lake. they have 40 sites. we are here Fourth of July and there are many available sites left. pit toilets but that’s about it. Boat landing was closed for the season. Don’t know why. Self checkin $12.00. Bear pooh on the road by our site. 3 bars tower service.

name: Prune Creek
description: established USGS campground.  pit toilets sites 10.00 with access pass. on stream. grills and fire rings picnic tables each site.  saw moose nearby.

name: Circle K
description: Water beside tire air fill station. Slow fill

name: Roman Creek Road
description: Decent spot overlooking Frenchtown. You can barely hear the trucks and trains. I drove up on the small hill at the end for the view. Wildflowers and birds everywhere. Decent Verizon service. Looks dirty from locals partying. Religious nuts have sadly carved crosses into trees.

name: Elk Refuge overlook
description: three spots at this location with fire pits, deer, elk, bears and trails.  many spots along this road. yes, the road is rough, but doable. there was a Toyota Fit that showed up the other day. nice view! 5 days max

name: Dead end gravel road by Snag Campground
description: Very quiet spot at a dead end gravel road on WA DNR land (dispersed camping allowed).  The site was level enough for our camper van with some positioning and adjusting our airlift.  There are no amenities- there was a rough fire ring that we improved.  Not much slash or firewood lying around, and the stuff we found in the woods was damp. Bugs were ok, not as dense as Western Lake Campground.

name: Amherst Public Land
description: Just off route 9 west of Amherst. Sign at road says Amhurst public lands. About 2/10 of a mile down the road a pull off just before the bridge. Good place to spend the night. About an hour from Acadia national forest. Can hear traffic but very private spot.

name: Blackrock Meadows Trailhead RV Camp
description: Large open gravel lot not extremely level, has bathroom and joy to camp here. Can fit any size rig and plenty of space for multiple campers. Has put toilet and no trash. Hear some highway noise but there is barely any traffic at night. There is about 100ft tree buffer between you and the highway. No Verizon service.

name: Nelson’s Ace Hardware
description: Smaller parking lot but filled RV with propane. Super friendly staff. Was pretty impressed with the RV aisle if you’re in need of any goods on the road.

name: River access
description:
just off Hope Hwy 1/2 mi west of roadside 911 callbox. narrow rough gravel road easily done in Subaru sedan or truck camper.
bugs are terrible! NO CELL svc.
Off Hope hwy through overgrown trees on narrow & rough gravel road to large opening for several vehicles. Initially entered wrong gps coordinates. Stayed in 18' truck camper for 4 days.

name: Ufo Highway Pulloff
description: Nice little pull off near Ufo Watchtower.  Room for several rigs. The view of the night sky is amazing.

name: Munds Park Boondocking
description:
Beautiful spot just off the main road of town. 14-day maximum. Lots of big well-maintained spots. This is a popular area for hikers and ATVers, so you will see people passing by. 

It gets crowded on weekends but it’s pretty peaceful on weekdays. 

Weak/moderate cell service on ATT. Our family has a cabin nearby and we stay here when visiting.

name: Stunning Multiple Site (Free) Dispersed
description:
This is a stunningly beautiful dispersed camping spot off of icicle Road on the right hand side, about four rock fire pits, stunning views, and surrounded by Ponderosa Pines.

Stayed one night during Fourth of July weekend and had it to all to myself! No traffic, no visitors.

It was fairly mosquitoey, but not bad! I assume it’s just right now because of all of the rain.

name: Washington Creek Campground
description:
This is a very nice forest service campground deep in the Bitterroot
Mountains of North Idaho. it is along the North fork of the Clearwater River. It is separated from the main road by a bridge so it stays dust free in the summer. Sites are spacious and mostly shaded in an old cedar forest. Some sites are right along the river. Sites are well spaced out for privacy. At this time, June 2022   USFS fee is $10/night.

name: marathon fuel station
description: marathon fuel station with a diesel bay. water spigot on the building, asked attendant and she gave me the go ahead. so water and diesel tanks are full and ready to head into the forest for a couple weeks.

name: Cedar Mountain BLM
description: Lots of big campsites with fire rings along Cedar Mountain Road. This site in particular isn't very private but we saw maybe four other vehicles in a full 24 hour period (granted it was a weekday). Some other sites looked like they had better privacy with low cedar tree cover, we chose this one out of laziness. Good cell coverage for Verizon and AT&T.

name: Pokegama Dam rec area
description: Small rec area near dam of Mississippi River headwaters. There is a water fountain with spigot underneath. Bring a bucket. Near entrance to bridge and close to parking lot. Most certainly only running during summer months.

name: Burnett’s Laundromat
description: Laundromat on the main street of Burney, right across food shops and other stores. $3.50 a wash. $.25 for 5min dryer.

name: Al’s Oasis
description:
There is a parking lot across the street from Al’s Oasis that is designated for semi trucks and larger RVs. No signs are posted banning overnight parking. I called their main number and spoke to an employee who said that lot is specifically for RVs and truck drivers to park overnight. He was very friendly and welcoming. 

When I arrived at 8:45 PM, there were only 2 semis parked. I always scout my area in the daylight and everything appeared level and paved. I left for a few hours to watch the fireworks display on the river. When I returned to the parking lot, no other vehicles or semis were parked there. There are lights in the parking lot. It feels safe and is fairly level and well-maintained. It is right off the interstate…so there is quite a bit of road noise.

Al’s Oasis is a restaurant and gift shop, attracting tourists to eat their food and buy their trinkets. Don’t expect some natural wonder…and you may be tempted to say “tourist trap”. It’s a business parking lot that allows overnight vehicles without amenities. There are public restrooms inside their building that are available during their open business hours. They are nice enough to offer this place to stop for a night…so please be respectful and keep it clean.

name: Lake Perry Campground
description: 15 site campground on Lake Perry. Operated by Mississippi Fish and Wildlife. Sites are $22 per night and have 30A electric and water. Dump station at top of camping loop away from the lake. Camping loop is a little tight so may require some maneuvering skills.

name: Ten Sleep Rd NF27
description: All along Ten Sleep Rd is 40 free designated camp spots. We stayed 3 days in #37 near the trailhead. The road is a bit dusty but luckily the breeze was blowing away from us. Ok for larger rigs and tents. No cell service.  Pack it out including human waste. Water and pit toilets at trailhead.  Cold, quiet and buggy at night.

name: Little White River
description:
Remote spot on a lake. Fire ring and bathrooms. Overnight parking is allowed in the Little White River Recreation Area - you can check out the website https://www.fws.gov/refuge/Lacreek/visit/plan_your_visit.html

It's part of the Lacreek Wildlife Refuge. There's a sign by the turn off down the dirt road. It's quite muddy and a little windy, but there is a bit of shelter from the wind behind the cedar trees.

name: Green Creek Road
description: Access road to USFS land. Two small cul-de-sacs located on north side of road large enough for several rigs in each. USFS land adjacent to private property. From US-395, turn west onto Green Creek Road.  Scrub brush with no trees. Slight noise from the highway and vehicles entering the backcountry but overall very quiet. Awesome views.

name: Mobil Gas Station Water Spigot
description: Mobil Gas Station —Two water spigots at the pumps, no cost

name: Seafood Market
description:
Seafood!!! There’s no store, but you can order and pickup. Smoked Salmon, king crab, scallops, prawns, shrimp, halibut, lobster. Curb side pickup only. 

Seafood processor that ships to the lower 48. Local recommended.

name: Shaded Cul de Sac off Old Sierra Madre Rd
description:
Cul de sac with some trees for shade and a fire ring. Pretty windy when I was up here. A bit cooler temp than the bottom of the valley - you gain some elevation coming up this road. Not bad views. Quiet. Some broken glass.

Not totally flat but not bad. Perhaps a bit tough for a big rig.

A couple trails connect to the cul de sac, one going down the hill and one going up (perhaps they are actually both part of one trail).

Two-ish bars AT&T.

name: loop off FS2841A
description:
There's an informal loop road here off FS2841A with several good spots.  some of the road is deeply rutted but several spots are reachable with a regular car; all are reachable with a higher clearance vehicle. Not sure if you'd want to take a long rig down it.

No amenities but I had 2-3 bars of cell service in the spot marked, less at the entrance off the FS road. 

Marked no campfires,  shows up as national forest land on my maps. signs of a campfire ring at one spot. 

I saw no trash walking the whole loop,  but there does appear to be signs of an abandoned water collection setup, old and rusty, off the loop a little ways.

name: Parking/pit toilet cleaned daily/picnic tables
description: Small dirt parking lot used by people fishing in small Mary’s Lake - picnic tables, pit toilet (cleaned daily).  Good Verizon cell service. Very scenic place to work for the day or rest. No overnight camping, no swimming (dangerous undertow). Free, no permit needed.

name: Visitor center bathrooms/day parking
description: Bathrooms open 8:30-3:30, free public day parking

name: Forks Transit Center/Rest Stop
description: The sign says 'one hour parking 8am-6pm', so we understood that we can park overnight. (also, other reviews on ioverlander said that the sheriff referred them to sleep here). After the fireworks finished we had a quiet night. The bathrooms were ok, but we're not sure what hours they're open- at around 8pm they were open and when we returned at 10:30ish they were closed.

name: Mt. Whitney lookout
description: Great place to spend a night. Flat spot and big enough for bigger cars. The other spots have signs “No camping”. This one doesn’t. There were a few fire rings with signs “no fire” dated from June 2022. Beautiful place with spectacular view to Mt. Whitney and Mt. Lone Pine. We arrived at 7:30pm there was a shade thanks to a little rock.

name: Teec No’s Pos, northeast Arizona
description: An abandoned paved street in the village. Along the entrance street, with a magnificent view on the sculptural mountain. Very quiet. Easy to get in. Turn left from the entrance street.

name: Page, Arizona, Page Sports Complexx
description: Very large parking, with grass and picnic table, quiet and nice view around, few shadows,

name: Walmart
description:
Boondocked here one night, to the left (if facing the store) by the grass. There were lots of vehicles throughout the parking lot, maybe night shift workers. It was well-lit, had some level spots, and there was an SUV near me with someone sleeping in it overnight. They had the door cracked, which surprised me. Judging by the cars and businesses I'd say this is a decent suburban area and I felt safe. As I'm writing in the morning this I see a Sheriff driving through the parking lot and he didn't bother me. The SUV was parked by me all night and left after 8am, so they apparently didn't get bothered either.

Some intense sprinklers went off and were spraying my van which was overhanging i to the grass quite a bit. My vehicle is extended in the back, so regular vehicles may not have this problem.

name: Stavis Bay rd. Pull off
description: Decent size pull off for a transit van right off the road. It’s a dead end but still several miles of road. Traffic slowed in the night but was still sort of loud because pull off is right beside the road. But nice that it was free - most places require a discovery pass but this is just a free pull off

name: Whitewater Park
description: Next to the bathrooms at the whitewater park there is a water fountain that has a spout on the side that we used to fill two jugs.

name: Terra Sol
description: Terra Sol is next door to Patagonia RV. If you have a rig less than 25' long, it has less of a RV park vibe and Mary was super cool. She is a former van life nomad that has settled down and opened up a camp. There is an outdoor kitchen, multiple device charging stations, an outdoor shower, flush toilet, laundry buckets with clotheslines, and even bicycles to ride to town! If you are looking for a place with a much chiller vibe than a busy family RV park, Terra Sol is your place in Patagonia. Rates are on the website. Patagonia is a birders and gravel bikers paradise.  3-4 Bars of AT&T service no problem streaming video. Pets must be leashed the whole time.

name: Rest area
description: Small rest area before you have to pay to camp and park at the pedestrian bridge (there is no public access bridge that you can drive across, you have to park and walk across). There is a National Park information site further up, it too is only day parking, like this one. There are bathrooms and picnic tables here, as well as a fire ring (not sure why if they don't allow overnight parking). It is set a little back from the road, other than the road noise and dust, it's a peaceful stop.

name: campground with water
description: water spigot at bathrooms. camping is $10 tent

name: moss glens falls
description: A small parking spot by a beautiful waterfall that you have to walk to in 5 minutes. no signs of 'no parking'. Porta-potty on site. Woody, some neighbors across the road, but behind trees.

name: Buffalo Valley Road, campsite #4
description: Pull off from main road, wide open space, great view of the river.  Open fire pit, too.

name: Siana River Rest Area
description: Designated Rest Area, partially paved, with pit toilets and a picnic table. You can park next to the picnic table or drive down by the river. Nice area with lots of space.

name: Black Beach Campground
description: Established City  campground. full hookups und electric only sites. Located at Highway 61 but quiet during the Night. € 30 plus taxes per night. WiFi available.

name: Parowan, Utah, Iron county fairgrounds
description: Very large paved parking, closed to baseball field, very quiet, little grass for tents, picnic tables and toilets.

name: Flat Pullout with waterfall sounds and Snow-Cap Views
description: This spot is up Thornton Lake Road (off SR-20, there’s a sign with a Thornton Lake hike). It’s a decent ways up the winding, some what steep, shelf road. Once the road straightens out a bit, you come to a flat pull off with a cut down tree just past a small waterfall. Through the trees is a snow capped peak. Enough space for 2 trucks/vans, would be hard to get an RV/long trailer up this road, but possibly doable. That said, we didn’t see any turn around spots that would accommodate a trailer/RV. Wonderful spot, secluded, and a great waterfall. 2 strong bars of Verizon

name: Top of mount. Free - backcountry rd
description: Tried getting to “Top of Mountain in Rogue River NF” just up the road but was next to an absolutely trashed old mining site with no views. Pack in, pack out people!!! This spot is way better with 300° views of the forest. 3 different established fire rings. 4WD in 4Runner to get up cause raining but should be fine with 2WD. View is worth the drive. No shade but no bugs.

name: Rest stop
description: Nice rest stop, very quiet and right off of i40, only us and one or two other trucks. Ran our generator with no issues disturbing anyone

name: Love’s Travel & Truck Stop
description: 5 clean, private, unlimited time, hot showers with code! $14 fee. Overnight parking allowed. Air and water pumps. Staff was friendly and showers are deep cleaned immediately after each person.

name: Bobs rock parking
description: Parking area by the river with flat spots and room for several

name: Oliver Reservoire Recreation Area
description: Free camping with access to water spigot. It seems they have dumpstation, but I did not find it

name: Stinker truck stop
description: 5$ for shower. Comes with soap and towel. Hot water too. No time limit. Great!

name: National Forest
description: Nice spot in the National Forest. There is a fire ring. When I camped here there was an RV in the main spot but me with an Odyssey and my buddy with a Sprinter were able to park over night on a secondary pull out. Quiet, between trees, excellent sleeping conditions. A very short drive up the road there is a bridge over the creek for water and near that bridge there were 3 other big spots with RVs in them.

name: Badlands NP/Buffalo Gap Grassland Boondocking
description: Popular Boondocking near the Badlands. plenty of room. Expansive views. No Shade.

name: 5746 Rd Dispersed Camping
description: Stayed here 2 nights with no issue. There wasn't too much traffic going down the road. There are a lot of other dispersed spots in the area, but this is the only one on this road as far as we know. Basically no Verizon service here. Small firepit on site

name: Grand Park Community Rec Center
description: Bought a shower for $8 - very nice rec center, bathrooms were clean, great water pressure, and the hot shower felt nice.

name: Quantum: the future of laundry
description: Exceptionally clean laundromat. They have a coffee shop on site, pastries, many working tables, and free wifi. The loads are a bit pricey ($5) but it’s perfect if you need to use internet while waiting for your laundry. The restrooms are also very clean.

name: Public water spigot
description: Threaded public water spigot in the middle of Winona Town Park. The spigot is over 25 ft from the closest parking spot so make sure your hose can reach (I counted 20 steps from the spigot to my van so… maybe 60 ft?) There is a gap in the parking barrier so a van could probably back into the park to get closer, just make sure you don’t tear up the grass. There are also covered picnic tables and a couple grills but no trash cans on the premises.

name: Mr. Fuel water spigots
description: A few threaded water spigots by the fuel pumps

name: Harbormaster showers
description: Harbormaster building has restrooms with showers in the back. Ask the harbormaster for the door code to get into the bathrooms. I didn’t use the showers but they are clean and I assume it wouldn’t be a big deal to use them. As always, be polite, be respectful.

name: Walmart Parking Lot
description: Typical Walmart parking lot. I asked security and was told I could stay anywhere on the lot for up to 24h. A few other rigs parked either in Walmart or Lowe’s. Pretty noisy since it’s right by the highway. Store is open 6am to 11pm.

name: New Canyon Dispersed Camping
description: Dispersed camping in the Caribou National Forest. The entrance sign is on Google maps. About 2.5 miles from Devil's Creek Reservoir or a ten minute drive. The road in is pretty smooth and there are about a half dozen decent spots within the first few miles. Next to a small creek.

name: Dog Park
description: Nice fairly clean, no bugs.  Friendly people

name: Denali View South Viewpoint
description: Official view point in Denali State Park. The brochure said they allowed overnight parking and we did not see any signs disproving that. It has a pay station but that is all closed off and the water connection is covered up. So looks like it is free.

name: Sinclair Gas Station
description: Red water spigot between the big red barn restaurant and the large gravel truck parking lot. Was flowing clean water summer 2022. The truck lot seems good for an overnight stay.

name: Breen Oil Co
description: they can fill portable propane tank as well as built in RV propane tanks

name: Baylor canyon road secluded
description: Across the street from the loop. Drive down the dirt road as far as you want. There is a fire pit to designate the spot I stayed at. No one drove past me all night. Good Verizon and T-Mobile

name: Cedar Mill Coin Wash Laundromat
description:
Clean laundromat, machines look new. 
$3 small load
$6 large load
$2 dry

change machine, soap, softer, bleach, available for purchase.

name: Movie theater parking lot
description: Big parking lot at a movie theater, my partner and I have stayed here multiple times with no issues. We have also seen other van lifers/ car dwellers here as well, but please keep it clean of trash! Near multiple restaurants, a 7/11, and a target. Would only suggest parking one night, but overall a nice place to park!

name: Costco Parking Lot
description: This Costco Parking lot is a good spot to park your conversion van overnight. I slept well last night and no one bothers me. It’s close to gas station, wholesale, and lowes. You can get anything you want in this area.

name: Mountain Home FS 7300 Rd
description: Decent sized parking area with a Porta potty. Nice and quiet at night but the lot will fill with hikers in the morning so be respectful of how you park. Plenty of tree cover.

name: Shower by the beach van damne
description: Exterior shower, Cold as ice, usually used by surfers to wash off the salt but you can use it for a quick wash as the beach is not too crowded :) recommend wearing your bathing suit though lol. there’s restrooms too.

name: Gravel Road off of 101
description: Quite gravel road with some pull off’s. I was the only one here. Only 2 cars drove past me the whole time. The road is kinda narrow to turn around, so I wouldn’t come back here in anything bigger than a van. I’m pulling a teardrop and found a spot wide enough to do a 3point turn. The road is in good condition though. No potholes. Any car could drive down here. The road seems to go pretty far, but I took the first spot I found, so I don’t know how far back it goes. 2bars LTE TMobile and Verizon. Although, I couldn’t even check email with Verizon. Streamed a show with TMobile.

name: Large Pullout in NF before Bridge
description: Should fit big rigs. The road leading here is steep and has loose gravel, 4wd recommended but no need for high clearance. River nearby. Apart from that super quiet and dark.

name: The lunar landscape
description:
This is the quietest place I’ve ever camped. I never heard a single sound. Watch the weather I would not wanna be here in the rain the soil turns the very slick and sticky mud. The road is a bit washboard.
I always had good cell service three bars with Verizon
You could put up a tent here but it is very windy

name: Pull in near river
description: Sites down by the river were taken, this is a pull in about 100yds before the turn down to the river. Straight, level, fit our 9' tall camper fine, and about 100ft long. Not too wide though. Fire ring at the back and lots of mossy areas beyond that. Very quite and comfy. Walking down to the river is a must.

name: Shore Aquatic Center
description: This place is awesome! $6.25 for entrance to the pool+shower, and u must enter during free (no classes) swim hours- by us it was 6-8 pm. The center had various pools, a lazy river, a poolside climbing wall+diving board, sauna, and hot tub. The showers were clean and hot, there are private family bathrooms+showers which we used. Great place!

name: pull off
description: pull off on side of road one night stay. loud cause next to the road but a pretty big spot

name: WiFi in the pavilion
description: Fast WiFi, electrical outlet works great. You might need to bring your own chair if you want to plug in as the tables are not close to the outlet

name: Shelter Island parking lot
description: A large parking lot with spaces designated for longer vehicles. Lever spaces in a well lit lot. I stayed several nights with no issue.

name: Kentucky Horsepark Campgrounds
description: A large RV campground with primitive sites as well as sites with water and electric.

name: Itasca State Park
description: Nice State Park with a couple campgrounds to choose from. Everything from walk in tent sites to large sites with electric. Picnic tables and fire rings at each site. Drinking water scattered around the campgrounds. Dump station available. We did not check out the bathrooms. Lots of hiking, biking and kayaking opportunities.

name: Mt Emma
description: Back a few miles on a narrow forest gravel road. Emma Lake trailhead right nearby and beautiful views of the basin. There are a couple of spots here and along the road in. I stayed in the trees as it was less windy vs out on the scenic view. Very peaceful, little to no traffic.  Wildflowers abound! In addition great Verizon and AT&T LTE.  One of my favorites in the Eastern Sierras. Yours to enjoy protect and keep clean.

name: Ellis St,  Bellingham
description: Quiet street parking across from Bellingham Food Bank. 8hr Parking on most of this street. Small fun town on Bellingham Bay. WA.

name: Walmart
description:
Walmart close to National park. 
Stayed for one night, no problems.

name: Family Coin
description:
Washing 3,25$ 
Dryer - 12min - 1$

Wifi, Toilets, Sitting Area

name: Street Parking
description:
Street Parking for small Campervans. 
Nice, safe area. Friendly Neighborhood, some poople talked to us and welcomed us. 
A lot of people walking around with their dogs. Quiet at night. 
Just 5min walk to Brooklyn Bridge Park (where you can find toilets) and stunning Skyline view.

name: Stewart Park
description:
Little parking area next to a park. We stayed one night, arrived at 8pm and left before 8am.  Except the noise of the train, it was quiet.
Good for a night before or after LA.

Benji & Audrey🇨🇭travelling with our Truck Camper @on.vagabonde

name: Near the soccer field and senior center
description: Quiet place at night, with trees and morning shade. We slept here one night with 24" rig. Space for 5 Rv min  or more in the shade.

name: Hill Air Force Base Fam Camp
description:
Hill AFB Family Camp is a site that you will need to have DOD base access to use. The facility has a lot of spaces with full hookups, and does also have a few dry camping options. If you are in a tent they also have a couple of those spots. 
There is a dump station and potable water if you are passing through. 
The camp host is awesome! 
.

https://75fss.com/famcamp/
.
Current rate as of 7 July 2022: 
$25 per day for full hookups
$17 per day for dry camping

name: Forest road
description: There is a pit toilet and check-in spot for $12. At least  two level spots along this road. Not a lot of pull out room but nice and quiet for a van or tent camping.

name: Rock Canyon Campground
description: Around 15 spots in the forest along the road. Access road is tough. Poor cellular coverage.

name: Shingle Creek
description:
Dead end track, along a creek.
Little water flow.
No cell coverage.
Not flat. Best for 4WD.

name: 437 2nd top of the road spot
description: There are two campsites at the top one on the left first, and then one on the right y the very top near the 437 C sign (I think it’s C but it’s a letter) honestly weren’t impressed with the views - the next person that uses the left spot will need a saw to cut a few small limbs to drive down to the fire ring/flat ground

name: Speedway
description: Water spigots in the Diesel Island lanes.  Also good gas prices,  especially diesel.

name: BWAC Brooklyn Waterfront Artists Coalition
description: Parking in front of the artists’ coalition building, no restricted parking. Overlooking Statue of Liberty, next to a grocery store with a cafe and patio overlooking the bay. Quiet spot, had the whole place to myself.

name: End of the (2 wheel drive) road
description: A large flat turnaround big enough for almost anything. From here on high clearance and 4x4 recommended. I would certainly walk the route before continuing as there are few places to turn around and evidence of washout and large fallen trees that may block your way. I walked about a quarter mile past this point and the road just got worse. Up to this point the road is fine for all vehicles. This would be a good spot as would the many pull offs on the way up. No cell service here

name: Big Pull Off
description: Pretty large pull off circle with existing fire ring. Two bars cell service.

name: Planet Fitness Eagle River
description: Planet Fitness parking lot - no “ No overnight parking “ signs . The gym is open 24/7 . Quiet and safe night . At 04:30am they came to empty the trash bins so park far from them ! Wifi available inside the gym but not in the parking lot. Water, showers and wifi available inside the gym for members only.

name: Solair Recreation League
description: This is membership-owned nudist resort. Most of the resort is clothing optional. swimming pool and hot tub is nude. Very friendly, family place. Quite a few activities on the weekend often with a band and dancing Saturday night. pickle ball, beach on a pond with a lot of sand. A restaurant is open on the weekends.  Most of the camping sites are taken with seasonal campers. midweek should be pretty easy to get a camp site. sites vary in size, have electricity and water. The toilets are composting, showers are public.

name: Forest
description: Nice spot, private and also a little bit open - you don’t feel enclosed . Very quiet of course . No internet at all

name: Roadside
description: Perfect camping spot by the lake, and a bit secluded from the road

name: Pull Out on NF Road
description:
Easy access on loose gravel. Space for 2 cars or one bigger rig.
Super quiet, flat. Only very few cars passed us by until in the morning a lot of cars came. It turned out that there is a group of people that cleans up the forest twice a month because so many people dump their waste here. They where super nice, didn't bother us at all. We helped them a little bit. Please keep this place clean!

name: Potable Water at Public Boat Ramp
description:
Bring your own hose
Super easy to get to
And Free!

name: Shenandoah River State Park
description: Very nice campground immediately adjacent to the Shenandoah River. Sites have water and electric hookups. Very quiet and peaceful. We’ve stayed in this CG on three occasions. Great recreation on the river.

name: Oakhurst Library
description: Library wifi reaches the parking lot. Some shade in the morning to use wifi before the library opens.

name: Public Boat ramp
description: Small site good for vans and cars. There were a few people when I got here but they all pulled their boats in and left. Rainy day today so no one here. Good for a night. Weak ATT signal.

name: behind abandoned church.
description: I parked behind the church, by the trash dumpsters, hidden from the street. class C RV. No problem all night. Not the best view or nicest campground, but it was very convenient and free.

name: Swallows Park
description: Great day use park on the river. Lots of amenities here, but mainly potable water at this spigot on this rock feature. It doesn't have threads, so we had to hold our canister rather than use our hose.

name: Noble creek RV Park
description:
You can dump and get some fresh water for 10$. You have to ask someone who works there to open the locker of the dump station. There are some timetable but we were lucky to find someone who open us the locker.
Timetable :
Monday -Thursday 8am - 2:30pm
Friday 8am - 12pm

Benji & Audrey🇨🇭travelling with our Truck Camper @on.vagabonde

name: Spring
description: Natural spring outside the town of Davis. Can not confirm if water is potable, but country springs usually are.

name: Elsie Lake National Forest Campground
description: Rough 12 mile dirt road to get here- but oh so worth it ! Beautiful remote lake with established campsites. Fire rings only- pit toilet.  No one here when we were here.  Lake is just gorgeous - perfect for kayaking or SUP. Stocked with trout.  Pack out trash please- help to keep it this beautiful :)

name: Mr. Ed’s Espresso, Juice, and Underground Pub
description: Mr. Ed’s has good wifi and an outside outlet under a covered porch area. They didn’t mind us hanging out there for half the day to get work done. Good coffee and the breakfast burrito was a generous portion size and reasonable price!

name: Pit River Campground
description: BLM campground about a mile in from the main road. It’s $8 a night but with an America the Beautiful pass or senior pass etc., you pay half. Other free iOverlander spots had no camping signs. 7 sites, restrooms, no service. Right by the river.

name: Carbon River near the end of road
description: Basic spot by the River, no facilities except porta poties at the end of the road

name: Oregon Mountain Road Dispersed Camping
description:
Dispersed camping with cell service and a river! Excellent Verizon service (no AT&T). 

There are many small pullouts along this mountain road with little to no traffic. This is the first larger pullout we found, big enough for a couple smaller rigs or one large-ish rig (there’s also a fire pit). Right beside the creek but a bit of a climb down from this spot. A little farther up the road (~100 m) there is a very large paved pullout (big enough for any rig) with a path down to the creek. 

The left side of the road is at the base of the mountain, so watch for fallen rocks and trees. Do NOT park on the left side of the road. For a short time the road parallels hwy 101, but there’s a hill and trees blocking, so there’s minimal road noise. The road is paved in good condition (at least for the first couple miles). There were some tree branches on the road but easy to drive around. Expect the possibility of freshly fallen trees after heavy rains. We stopped at the first good site we found and walked up about a mile or so. There are likely more pullouts further up the road. 

This is a great spot for a night or two, with close proximity to the Redwoods and the Oregon border. Though it’s next to a road, it is beautiful, quiet and peaceful. We we’re here in the summer after a few days of rainfall so there were mosquitoes. It’s not the worst we’ve experienced, but bring some means of deterrent or you’ll wish you had.

name: Karma Farming
description: Very basic and not cheap. Staff not helpful. Bathrooms are terrible, no mens shower available. Bathroom dirty and wet and small and poorly lit. Grounds are cool. Picked cherries. Stay if needed but won’t be back.

name: Holly Road Camping Area
description:
Free Camping in Ocotillo Wells SVRA. Lots of space, some pavilions and fire pits, multiple vault toilets. No established road where we are just paths through the sand. We have 2WD and we’re okay but be careful!

Usable Verizon service, 5G with booster.

name: arrowhead park
description: very nice campground with electricity at each site. access to water and dump station as well but not on the site. very easy access from 80. All sites are close to the river and a lot of shade! nice spot for a one stop.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Large rear RV and Bus parking designated in the rear. No highway noise. Parking area is level’ish..

name: Tunnel View Parking Lot 5G!
description: Super fast T-Mobile 5G! Update your maps, surf the web, call your mom...this is one of the rare places in the valley that actually has fast and reliable cell and data.

name: Lake Sakakawea State Park
description: 20/30/50 amp sites, hot showers, flush toilets, dump station, dog friendly, $30 a night

name: Cenex Gas Station
description: There is an RV dump station and a fresh water spigot at the rear of this station.

name: Ford Lake free camping on lake
description: Free camping on lake. About 10 pullouts with picnic tables. No fire pits. Some people driving by, friendly. Pit toilets about 1 mile from here. Tried to fish didn’t catch anything. Stayed just for a night. 1 bar LTE ATT.

name: West Beach Bath House - Indiana Dunes National Park
description: There is a large bathhouse right off of the beach that has bathrooms and showers. The showers are not private. There’s a table with a tall pole thing sticking up in the middle and 4 showerheads that come off of that one pole. When you press the button to turn the water on, it turns off after about 20 seconds. Water was kinda cold but there is a temperature adjustment knob. There were about 18 showerheads. Only one bench in the shower area and nowhere to hang your stuff in the direct shower area but theres a big room with a lot of benches behind the wall next to the showers. The park closes at 9pm and there were rangers out in their cars probably to make sure everyone left.

name: Essential One
description: Supposedly the only place in town that fills LP tanks.

name: Mile 39.6 River Access
description: At Mike 39.6, you will find river access. There is a $5 parking fee. There are 2 access roads both leading to separate large, relatively flat, rocky river bars. The road to the right is mostly river rock with some overgrown branches. The road to the left is part gravel and sections with large ruts. Outhouses at each site, established rock fire pits. Some road noise. Gorgeous spot next to the Chena River.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Large parking area. I didn’t stay here but drove by and saw a handful of semis and a motorhome parked in the back. Bathrooms nice inside. Wendy’s and baskin robins connected.

name: Forest clearing
description:
Clearing in Shasta-Trinity National Forest, not far from McCloud River Falls

Quiet, safe. 2bars LTE t-mobile. No other services.

name: Cracker Barrel near White Hall, WV
description:
2/5/22 would recommend in a pinch.  

not much to say. showed up here at 2am after leaving a Walmart pumping dance music.   there was already a pickup truck / Camper parked there, and clear signs for rv / car camping in the back.  was dark,  quite,  no problems

name: Loves Travel Stop
description:
Loves Travel Stop
Diesel 
Gas
Parking
Full RV Hookups
RV dump

name: Westchester Lagoon Disc Golf Parking lot
description: Just for one night, not so quiet, clean toilet, picnic tables.

name: Steamboat Coin Laundry
description: Nice little laundromat. Big washers are $6.75/load with the smaller ones ranging from $2.75-5.00. Coin operated

name: Morgan Summit sno-park
description: large flat paved area near lassen NP. Had a small van but able to fit large RVs. Occasional road noise but fairly quiet through the night. Snow shelter with some pit toilets (not maintained but with toilet paper). 2 bar with mint but no Internet. there was a forest road off it with potentially more camp spots but we didn't explore.
