name: McDonald’s
description: We have Verizon and phone says service and LTE but everything loads very slow around the area. This is the only place that has free WiFi in town.

name: Mokelumne River
description: Mokelumne River Campground is at the bottom of the canyon along with plenty of free camping along Ellis Rd which runs along the river. The drive down is long and steep but well paved.

name: Rest Area
description: Multiple water spigots. No camping allowed.

name: Grassy meadow
description: Small flat area with low ground cover, large fire ring suitable for tents and big rigs. no cell service.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store and Restaurant
description: One of the quieter Cracker Barrels. Several trucks here. Long spots for bigger RVs. 5G on T-Mobile.

name: Eagle Community School public WiFi
description: Internet available for public use. Signs on the window with the password.

name: BLM with 2bars Verizon no 4x4 needed
description: Fairly level spot. This stretch of 90 is bordered by BLM (check Campendium for other spots if you don’t use the BLM.gov arcgis map). I took the first pullout that is maybe only 15yards off somewhat busy route 90. totally hidden from road. No 4 wheel drive needed for sure, but could be needed further in. Trees, pleasant partial mountain view. Verizon 2bars getting 21Mb download (fast). Spacious enough for minivan or class B but not larger.

name: 33 Milehouse Cafe
description: Burgers, pies and sweet treats. Nice place to stop before crossing the border.

name: Scenic Overlook - BLM camping?
description: Fantastic overlook about 1/4 mi off hwy 135 on washboard Rd. Great place to stop for lunch in an RV where you can escape the wind while enjoying the view of the valley with the Tetons off in the distance. My map says this is BLM land and there were no signs saying anything about camping, so if no one came by to say you can't ... this would be a great overnight camping 'room with a view'

name: Falls Campground and Overlook
description: Pulled in for a quick stop. Shoshone National Forest cg close to highway. Stream/river nearby and great views of rock cliffs.

name: Paradise Alaska RV Park
description: A nice, clean RV park with beautiful mountain views. The owner was so nice to me while I saw there. Wifi, $5 showers, $5 laundry (wash and dry), as well as books and movies. There are dry sites and sites with full hookup.

name: Mile 32.1 Denali Hwy
description: Pull off to the north about 30 yards off road and above the road.  Room for 2 to 4.   Maybe wet in spring since there were lots of ruts but early July it was bone dry.   View of valleys and mountains for miles.  During the afternoon 10 to 12 cars per hour.  There is also a really nice site right at the 32 mile marker if you have a high clearance vehicle.  Also on north side of road.  It is high  we above the road so you can see much farther.

name: Pathfinder Campground, Fremont Lake SRA
description: Campground in state Recreation Area. Checked in here after dark. We got site 94 which is nice— good spacing from other campers. Only pit toilets in this far end though. The shower and flush toilet is on the far west end of the campground. The facilities are not well- marked.  Get a map at the headquarters building near the entrance. You must pay the day entry fee online and print out permit or pick up a pay envelope at    the park headquarters building or group day lodge.

name: Loves Truck Stop
description:
they offer shower services for 14 $.
Private shower  room, with no time limit

name: Up To The Rim
description: Beautiful established (numbered) campsites off of 300 Rim Rd. One family per numbered campsite. Nice and cool with sites that have shade or sun. Tall pines abound. Blue spruce and aspens!

name: Kulshan Campground
description: Free or $22 per night. Free spots labor day to memorial day. Around 2 bars for verizon. Website link has a lot of info

name: Phillips 66 Hub Plaza
description: Decent sized dirt lot next to the 66 gas station. Spent the night alongside the truckers. Good for a quick nights sleep.

name: Love Travel Stop
description: Free water spigot next to Air. They have grey and black water dump as well for a $10 fee. Small dog park too

name: Love’s Travel Stop
description: Water spigot near air also another spigot in between pump 1&2. Tire shop. Waste Water dump.

name: The Commons
description: I use this place frequently for their wifi and to charge my laptop. Wifi is completely free and there’s plenty of space to work there.

name: Jordan Game Land
description:
Large open gravel parking with room for travel trailers. This location is labeled on goggle maps as “Parking area for Jordan Lake”
No signs and no trash receptacles. Location visited by hikers but overall no disturbances. Ground is level and away from main road.

name: Crackle Barrel
description: Typical cracker barrel. Decent amount of road noise though.

name: Parking next to Rosewood park
description:
Very quite area. Next to Rosewood park.
Arrived around 6pm left at 8am. No problem at all.
No parking on Monday from 8am till noon.
1 hour parking between 7pm-6pm

Benji & Audrey🇨🇭travelling with our Truck Camper

name: Mount Rainier Viewpoint
description: We slept here for one night, there was also another van when we arrived. Beautiful views of Mount Rainier. A lot of space to park. No "no overnight" signs.

name: Beaver Dam Dive Shop and Resort
description: Scuba dive shop, convenience store (pop/beer/ice/ice cream/pizza/wings/grocery), RV Park and Motel (motel, hostels and bunk rooms available).   Nice view of the lake, renovated during winter 2021/2022.

name: Green Mountain Campground
description: BLM/NF Campground at the Green Mt lookout tower (over 10 miles of washboard roads to get to campground). Only 4 small sites, vans, popups and tents will work, no big rigs. The sites have tables and fire pits, no water but it has a single room pit toilet (that was very clean).  We camped on a Sunday night in late June 2022 and had the place to ourselves. The sunset was awesome, with a 360 view of the surrounding area. We had very good LTE service from Verizon.

name: Edward's Rest Area
description: Beautiful Riverwalk next to the rest area. Potable water fill. Free. Available April through November.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Good place for a shower. some homeless in parking lot. Big parking lot. Many other campervans.

name: Potholes Recreation Site
description: Free campsite, 14 days, toilets.  A lot like Moab without the Colorado River.  sweet swimming spots with natural water slide like formations in the creek bed. Secluded little pools inside a cavern a little further

name: All Season Campground
description: Multiple campsites with full hookups.  Open area with gravel base.

name: Quartz Creek
description: Forest Service on two loops and a day use/boat launch area.  Dump station & water too!

name: Usal forest camp
description:
Single spot with one fire ring inside forest. You can’t fully drive here. You’ll have to walk part of the way along a logging road. 

No cell. Just trees.

name: Mountain Home Reservoir south side
description: Many camping spots on south side of the lake.  Most with fire rings.  Road coming in has a lot of washboards we came in fine in our 24ft rv, just go slow.  Quite a bit of trash around. 2 bars Straight Talk, enough to use as a hotspot to watch movies.  Pit toilet was pretty dirty with trash on the ground.  Really pretty area, too bad people have to trash it.

name: City of Summer Wastewater Treatment Plant
description: Sani Dump on the parking lot of the Wastewater Treatment Plant. Available year round 24/365. Flushwater, but no potable Water available.

name: Cherokee County Rest Area
description:
Was pretty calm.
well maintained.
Picnic Tables and Bathroom

name: large spot in the woods
description: large flat spot, 2 campfire rings, room for a couple vehicles. down a long dirt road. decent Verizon service

name: Campsite off of Forest rd 613
description: Nice open meadow, existing fire ring. You can see the road it’s about a mile and a half away.

name: Lake Fairlee
description: Great free swimming spot at a pull out in a quiet lake

name: water hydrant at fair grounds
description: red water hydrant near animal stalls at fair grounds

name: KC Campgrounds
description: Sweet little RV park with showers and a playground and nice grassy areas in the middle of cornfields.   $39/ night for hookup. $32 for dry camping.   RV Sanitation station and potable water.

name: Scotchman Store
description: Working water spigot on the outside rear corner. Easy Van access when parked next to dumpster. Hopefully this helps you all find water.

name: Fire Watch Tower
description:
This unmanned fire watch tower is visible from US 84 on top of a high cliff. The road up is pretty good if it is dry. When it is wet it can be treacherous. It can get very slippery. I had no trouble making it up in my 2wd F150 though I did have to cross some serious mud holes. I would keep a close eye on the weather to avoid getting trapped in up here. There are three small flat spots at the tower that might accommodate cars, vans or trucks. Just a few hundred feet down the road is a flat area that would fit more.

Keep kids and animals (as well as adults) away from the far side of the fence as it is a shear drop to the rock slide below. 

Amazing Verizon signal from Pagosa.

name: Large open site on way to Mt Townsend trail
description: Large gravel site in National Forest with views on the way to Mt Townsend trailhead. We stayed for 2 nights during the week and no others came. Did not see too many other pull offs good for sleeping/camping beyond this point on the main forest service road headed to the trail head.

name: Water Birch Campsite
description:
Cute little campground on the side of the road. 18$ if you do not have a fishing license. We didn't stay here, just stopped for washroom, but wished we did.  
fire rings, picnic tables and one outhouse at the end.

name: Airport Gas & Oil
description: Cheapest gas in town, by far. 5c discount for cash. right now 8/7/22 it's $4.65 per gal for unleaded. In Fairbanks, it's around $5.55+. They also have #1 diesel/heating oil for diesel heaters.

name: Crosbyton City RV Park
description:
This is a free RV site provided by the city of Crosbyton. It has electric (30/15 amp) and water hookups. I didn't see a sign but from other sites it states "They accept donations for 1 or 2 night's stays and only charge $10/night for 3 or more nights. They don't take reservations and there is no on-site manager. The sites are first come, first served, but we were the only ones there."

The sites are large enough to accommodate large trailers. There's at least 7 lots available and, as of July 9, 2022, the sites are in great condition and seem well maintained.

name: Weis Gas Station
description: Red water spigot at the back of the gas station.

name: Half Moon Bay State Park
description: Pay showers in the camp ground. 25¢ per minute, 50¢ to start. Controllable temperature: cold to hot. Nice bathrooms in same building. Signs posted that say registered campers only but no one is watching. I parked on the road outside of the state park for free then walked in, about 1/2 mile. $2 will get you a nice 8-minute shower. There isn't many places on the coast from Santa Cruz to San Francisco to shower so this is a nice treat. Good luck.

name: Elk camp
description: The views from this high elevation pasture are fantastic!  Very remote.  Cool rock formation and some trees to hide behind if the wind is up.  Access is 16.3 miles along unpaved Alkali Road from Hyattville.  The road from this camp northwest to Shell is high clearance 4X4 only!  There are plenty of superior camp sites within a mile or so of this location.  Elk hunters use this camp in the season.

name: Elk camp
description: The views from this high elevation pasture are fantastic!  Very remote.  Cool rock formation and some trees to hide behind if the wind is up.  Access is 16.3 miles along unpaved Alkali Road from Hyattville.  The road from this camp northwest to Shell is high clearance 4X4 only!  There are plenty of superior camp sites within a mile or so of this location.  Elk hunters use this camp in the season.

name: Wayside
description: A rough track a short distance off the main drag.  Track is deeply rutted and would be impossible in wet weather.  Not much to remember from this site other than the sign.  See attached.  As I went flying by, the sign nearly gave me a broken neck as I snapped my head aside to read it.

name: Park & Ride / Service Plaza
description: This is the second time I stayed overnight in this place in my stealth SUV. There was two small RVs and a Van parked here overnight too. There are restrooms, gas station, Burger King and Dunkin.

name: Flint Hills Fuel Mart truck stop/gas
description: I stopped here to buy ice  and use the bathroom and each bathroom has a shower in it. It cost $10 for a shower. There were also a few semi trucks that look like they been parked here for the night so this could be a possibility for an overnight stay. The lot was kind of small though.

name: Coffee Cup Travel Plaza/TA Express--Hot Springs
description:
Truck stop which overs free overnight stays and hot showers. They provide a room with a hot shower, a toilet and a basin inkl. fresh towels and a hairdryer.
Showers are a little outdated but clean. 
$15

name: Street Parking
description: Street parking next to hotel and small dog trail. Quiet and safe neighborhood. Wasn't bothered at all. You can walk down to downtown. Great space if you have a dog, there's a trail next to it. Great for overnight only. This is next to high class homes. I don't recommend this space for RV's more than 25ft.

name: National Forest By River
description: This is the best spot on this forest road, in my opinion. I attempted to get to the one listed further up, but the road past the trailhead became too difficult for my liking, given the drop off and lack of areas to turn around. There are a few small pull offs after this with fire rings as well, room enough for a van, truck camper or tent (those were not super level, though). While I was here, there was essentially no Verizon service. Very pretty and clean, though. Still some snow in July!

name: Tractor Supply Company
description: Large, level parking lot. Easy to pick a shaded or full sun spot. We stayed on a Saturday night with no issues or neighbours.

name: Street parking for vehicles <8ft high
description: We spent here one night in our van. In this residential area it is allowed to overnight for vehicles <8 ft high, <8ft large and <20 ft long. For commercial vehicles the limit is 7ft. We spent a good night, slower traffic in the evening and in the morning, really quiet at night. If you park near the bike sharing platform, you are not in the front of house. it's a good option for visiting Venice beach, where parking is forbidden for vehicles over 7ft. We suggest the stealth mode.

name: Park City Mountain Free Parking Lot
description: Huge parking lot. No restrictive signs that I noticed. All parking spots are on a hill, so it's not level. The most level spot is towards the Northwest corner. When we stayed there were portaloos there, possibly due to the construction taking place. Nice view of the ski slopes in summer.

name: Bogus Basin Lookout
description: The paved road in is slow and long. There are pull offs others mention as camp but I was not willing to stay. It is just pulling to the side of the busy road. Along the way you'll see a couple dirt forest roads. Better off to check them out. Not as busy and some seclusion. The spot I'm in has a steep approach, not sure if 2WD or low clearance make it. Use your judgment. The views from here are fantastic! There are a few other spots further up the road. Verizon 5G. Someone unloaded their unwanted building materials here, sad. Yours to enjoy protect and keep clean

name: Love's Water Refil
description: Blue threaded spigot by Air Pump closest to highway, in Lowe's Parking lot. Free!

name: Ney Springs Creek
description: No amenities. No restrooms. A small parking lot that allows you to stay maximum of 7 days. Could fit about 7-8 vehicles. I had 1 bar of Verizon and LTE, barely anything loads. Right next to a small creek.

name: Roadside
description: There are places on the sides, all along the road.  quiet at night.  good mobile T network.  beautiful view of the valley and the ocean when there is no fog. it's the best place in the area.

name: National Forest Campsite
description: Established primitive campsite with fire pit

name: Snowy Range Laundry
description: Nice clean laundromat, $2 wash, $0.75 dry per load (25 minutes). nothing fancy, but they had a billiards table ($1/game).

name: Fountain by the beach
description: 3 spigots, decent pressure, ok to fill up 5 gallons without problems not for big rigs and you need to park a bit further away because there is no parking nearby. We just parked on the street Santa Cruz.

name: Courtney Campbell Causeway
description: Roadside Car/Bus/RV Camping on Tampa Bay. No facilities, just parking. Overnight allowed.

name: Tolovana Beach State Rec site
description: This is the parking lot for Tolovana Beach Park.  A policeman told us it's legal to car camp overnight. Not fancy, but it's legal  Even has public restrooms!

name: hospital stealth camp
description: street parking right by the hospital. no signs and plenty of other street parked cars to blend in with. parking also available on J street side.

name: Poshuinge Trail
description: Small paved parking lot with tree shade. Built by the US Forest Service as a trail parking lot for a short steep trail up a Native American Pueblo Archeological site. No services and a weak Verizon signal. Scenic and peaceful.

name: free wifi
description: decent wifi at the campsite store. If you park out the front you can get it in your van. No park entry fee if you have an annual national park pass

name: Sunoco Gas Station
description: They refill propane tanks here. I wouldn't come here if you need to refill onboard propane. I don't think they can. It's $25 for a 20lb tank. Pretty high price!

name: Yancy County Public Library
description:
Public library. Open until 6pm. 
Drinking fountains (outside), restrooms (inside and outside for the attached play area), WiFi, seating with power outlets (including rocking chairs with outdoor power outlets in front). Great for getting some work done. I came here to access the WiFi and was pleasantly surprised by the seating and power options.

name: Panguitch park
description: Very large gravel parking, close to baseball ground.

name: Above Jack Pass with a view
description: From Jack Pass going up NF-6574 small camp spot at a switch back onto NF-6570. Nice view, wild strawberry’s

name: First Creek Wild Camping
description: Beautiful forest campsite 15 feet from First Creek just outside of Sisters, Oregon. Two-bar cell phone service, a fire ring, level camping, First Creek babbling thirty feet away, and shade from big trees all around. Easy access for a smaller truck, Jeep, or SUV. Would be difficult for a larger class B RV or above because of brush getting here.

name: Walmart Super Center
description: Parked one overnight with close to 10+ other RVs. Could likely stay multiple nights if needed.

name: Zen Monkey RV Retreat
description: Zen Monkey RV Retreat is a family-owned RV campground resort located on Northeastern Oklahoma's beautiful Grand Lake O' The Cherokees. Zen Monkey offers full hook-ups (water, sewer, 30 & 50-amp service), free Wi-Fi internet, laundry room, and bathhouses. Spend your days fishing, playing volleyball or horseshoes, and your evenings sitting by the fire. A covered pavilion with picnic tables is available is also available for reunions and large gatherings. You'll be close to Monkey Island, where you can find world-class golfing, dining, boat rentals, kid activities, and spas, along with so many more adventures to be had in the area. Whether you're creating lifelong family memories or looking for a location for your next family reunion, Zen Monkey RV Retreat is truly your best vacation destination! Book today.

name: Behind Exxon
description: Large gravel parking lot behind the Exxon gas station. Used for semi trucks. Right on the roadway so noise is a factor.

name: Moose lake
description: Large parking area and public water access. Pit toilet up the road. Lots of mosquito and snakes but very quiet.

name: Spot off of off of power line road
description: Turned off Rt443 just after Little Shcuylkill River. Just a path heading up towards power lines. When you get to the top there are private property signs on the right. Nothing on the left. As you come around the bend there is flat space to the left. I was going to turn around then saw tracks heading down into the woods. Explored and found a good flat spot with a pond down below. Trail continues through the woods. More exploring tomorrow.

name: Prospect Library
description: Library with free wifi. You can connect without a password from the parking lot.

name: Quiet pulloff with room for a few rv’s
description: Nice quiet space on road to lake the Portage Lake boat tour.

name: North Bend State park
description:
Really nice, big, well spaced park. Grassy, treed, river, access to lake and long gravel rail trail. Sites on river best, site 10 the best I'd say for privacy.  Bathrooms and showers ok. Rangers leave you alone. Also playground, fishing and restaurant on site.
Very dog friendly, tons of kids biking around. $30- 38.
Totally recommend!

name: Nip and Tuck Road
description:
Improved Dirt Road.  Easy to find.  
Views. Views.  
10 day limit.

name: Monocacy battlefield/ City Park
description: Kayak Launch Point Park. You can park on the street to overnight.  pit toilet.  picnic area.  Park next to the tree at the entrance for morning shade.

name: Target parking lot
description: Quiet, clean, safe, well lit, lots of trees for shade. Asked for permission at Targets customer service, they said yes, 1 night is ok. Very quiet, no problems. Bathrooms available during business hours, a Starbucks right inside. Didn’t try the WiFi.

name: Thornburg Draw Trailhead
description:
Thornburg Draw trailhead BLM outside of Maybell CO. I checked 3 BLM maps and all confirm that this spot is legit. Turn at brown sign that says Thornburg Draw TH. Big sky, long views, grassy desert, a little windy. Quiet. A nearby highway has little traffic. We saw pronghorn and prairie dogs. Use caution as this is snake country but we saw none. Probably packrats, too. Maybe the snakes will eat the packrats! Also, killer fire ants off the road. Trust me on this one. I can show you the bites.

Pronghorns on the hill. 92 hot degrees but the breeze and van shade are helping to accept the heat. Stunning, beautiful sunset, almost full moon, and a starry, starry night!

name: U-haul
description:
Great service right on HWY 97 in Bend across from full shopping center.
Nice people

name: Bruhel Point Road Pulloff
description: Gravel pulloff just north of Bruhel Point Road. Area was pretty level. Nice views of the ocean. No signs prohibiting parking. Road traffic was pretty light after dark so was relatively quiet. Verizon signal was weak to moderate. No amenities. Stayed for one night with no issues.

name: Inlet Av Beach Access
description:
access to the beach, free from 8pm to 8am every day.
can pass, very quiet, no disturbance!

accès à la plage, gratuit de 8pm à 8am tous les jours.
peut de passage, très calme, aucun dérangement !

name: Creek and mountain view
description: this is a parking lot for the motorcycle trail.  it's quiet and scenic. we did not encounter any bikes, but there are signs of use. a nice place 20 miles from Jackson.  the road is gravel, a bit bumpy, but nothing unusual.

name: Klondike road campsite
description: one of the few spots on Klondike south with good cell coverage. two great sheltered spots  to get out of the wind. only drawback is you do get highway noise.

name: Parachute Rec Center
description: $5 showers.  They have a family room or gendered showers.

name: West Elk Creek Dispersed Camping
description: Lot of trails and pull off along dirt road.  14 day limit

name: The Bunk House
description:
Simple accomodations for solo travelers.

Would be perfect for a solo motorcycle rider, or a pair of riders.

Rooms are set up like a college dorm. You have your own private room with a small bed, desk, cable TV, sink, mini-fridge, microwave, and a closet. You share a toilet and shower with the room next door. Clean and modern. WiFi is available, though my room must have been too far from the router as I could barely connect. I got a good Verizon signal here. 

There's a recreation room with coffee machine, counter space, hot plate, large TV, pool table. There's also laundry facilities, but they were marked "Out of Order" when I was here. 

Probably the least expensive option around. I paid $65. 

The facility caters mostly to workers, but they'll rent to the public if they have space available. Best way to book a room is to call +1 907 895 5422. They took my credit card information over the phone.

name: Neah Bay Public Showers
description: Free public restrooms and showers provided by the reservation, nothing special but completely free

name: Maramec Springs Park
description: Great campground with both inexpensive electric sites and primitive campsites.

name: Hills Park
description: Small campground. $10 tents, $15 campers. Plenty of room for large campers. 4-5 pull through, 6-8 back-in and at least 10 tent. Water and electric included.

name: Christmas Meadows Road
description:
One of many dispersed campsites along Christmas Meadows Road. 14 day stay limit, and please pack out your trash! I had quite a bit of cleaning up to do…
This spot is fairly small, but others would easily fit big rigs. 
No cell service. The dirt road is a bit washboarded, but doable for any vehicle. Lots of great hiking trails in the area, so it’s fairly busy on the weekend.

name: Smugglers Den Campground
description: Rv camping, tent camping, group camping and cabins

name: Francis Drake street parking
description: Street parking on side of road. Road not busy at night. Slept fine. Residential cars parked here. Be respectful to the residents that live here. Ok for a night, but otherwise not a beautiful place to park.

name: Bushnell Campground at Lake Lucile Park
description: 35+ campsites with a mix of electric ($20) and dry ($10) campsites. No reservations accepted, all First come First Serve.

name: Cheapest gas on the Interstate 5 route - 76
description: Very good rates especially when coming north from Cali. Current 4,87 vs an average of 5,50. Worth planning for.

name: North Cascades visitor center by the dump
description: Fresh water refill by the dump station. When driving in pass the cabin and make a u turn on going back. the dump plus water is on the right. all FREE, thanks NPS!

name: Logging road
description: Spot at the end of a logging/forest road. It's 4.5 miles from the turn onto Burn Creek Rd. Nice views. Space for 1 or 2 vehicles. Good service on Google Fi.

name: Rest area
description: Free dump station at the end of the rest area! Very clean and again, it’s free!

name: Oak Embers Campground
description: Campground with RV, tent camping, a pool, and a general store.

name: Pipestone Family Campground
description: Quiet campground with pool, playground, showers and store (ice is $2:00 for a 5# bag). Mostly RVs, but there are shaded tent camping sites with fire pits for $18 a night. Situated right across the street from the entrance to Pipestone NM. The people here are friendly, as well.

name: Jacinto Courthouse
description: This is an old historic site, with an old courthouse, pavilion, and picnic benches, not a campground. Super quiet. Great place to spend the night. And they have electricity! All FREE. We have a 24 foot rig which fit with no problems. Bigger rig could fit too. In order to use the electricity, there is no actual 30 amp plug in, but there is a 110 house outlet built into the floor of the pavilion. If you have a converter and park close to the pavilion. The breaker might be off, but the panel is right on the pavilion. Great place to spend the night.

name: Pinconning Bay Park Campground
description: Established campground right on Saginaw Bay.  Campsites are not on the water,  but many have a lakeview..  Hot showers,  power , water and dump station.   Boat Launch and playground.  $33 all in with camping and day use fee.  Decent cell service.

name: Behind Costco - Simi Trucks Galore
description: Good for a rest in a pinch. Some loading noise at night, but not bad. Well lit, no people around, no knock. Ran the generator all night, no worries, refrigerator trucks did the same.

name: Blanco River Rd
description: Large circle site with smaller but more level back in site almost hidden from the road. Quite a ways above the river, but probably has access via a steep hike. Lots of meadows for tents. plenty of room for cars. Several trails would make for short but pleasant bike rides. The old road seems to be just below this site. Quiet and protected. No cell service.

name: Mud Creek Campground
description: Small campground with seven sites, picnic tables, fire rings, and a toilet. Water is also available.

name: Marks auto repair
description: Went there for an oil change. I brought the oil and the filter. The people were super nice and fair prices!

name: antelope creek blm rd
description: blm road off highway, there is a campground right before this spot called antelope creek just follow the signs , you need clearance to get to it so i pulled to this spot instead, dirt road nicely maintained in summer no winter maintenance , only saw about 3 cars the entire time i was here the stay limit is 14 days, i stayed two nights. there is no shade so be prepared. there are a couple pull off on the road and there are cows everywhere. a whole herd came right up to my car so keep an eye on pets. mosquitos are deadly at night, to be expected and there is some beautiful views of hills. good spot to stay the night or even the whole two weeks. i only went up the road as far as the cattle grate and saw some antelope but i don’t know how good the road is farther. i’m in a sonata so i’m not gonna risk it. i had two bars of t mobile and good service for streaming and calls. happy camping.

name: Tidal pools
description: Water spigot at corner of gravel parking lot. Also bathrooms nearby and you can see starfish at low tide. No dogs allowed in preserve.

name: Water refill station
description: Filtered water refill station. Can probably fill up bottles and 1 gallon jugs. Located a the park behind the bathrooms.

name: 📚 Pagosa Springs Public Library
description: Small public library with wifi in parking lot .

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Regular ole cracker barrel! specific spots towards the back for cars, campers and the sort. full at&t service

name: Nice spot off Big Meadows forest road
description: Pretty spot off the main road. Overall quiet as there’s not a lot of traffic. Easy to be levelled with blocks. Fire ring (beware of fire restrictions). Walking distance to the day use area bathroom and dumpsters.

name: Little place in the forest
description: Another pullout almost level, big enough for a van 23’, mine is 19 feet. Nice place to turn back without any problem. The night will be veeeerrry calm…one bar AT&T, just enough for texting

name: Knob Lakes overview
description: Wild camping spot up the road towards the AT&T towers at the top. Easy pull for truck with 30’ 5th wheel.  Wide pull off that we were able to back trailer into.

name: Robe Lake pull off
description: Small parking area off the road by Robe Lake. Beautiful little creek feeding the lake. Right next to road but road ends at boat launch/ parking lot.

name: Cyclone Laundry & Internet Cafe
description:
We felt very welcomed when we walked in. They have plenty of washers (20lbs, 40lbs, 60lbs) and dryers. They also offer drop-off laundry service. A good amount of seating for everybody. Because it is an Internet Cafe, they have free wifi and computers.
This place was great for our traveling family. A large lot for our 26' Class C RV too!

name: Gooseberry Falls St Park showers
description: Showers here and at Split Rock Lighthouse park. No showers at Tettegouche but you can buy a $7 day pass and go to all the parks in the same day and shower at either gooseberry or split rock. However if you just have time for one, this one has a bigger visitor’s center and just as much trail access and the falls are a short walk from the main parking area.

name: The Pocket Recreation Area
description:
Open: April - October 31

Cost: $15 / night

Small established campground in the National Forest and adjacent to the John's Moutain WMA.

There are several sites, water spigots throughout the campground, and flush toilets.

A nice creek runs along the edge of the campground. The creek is very crowded with day use visitors during the summer.

name: Flaming Gorge Ridge
description:
Great, free site close to water. We have 2wd  so we did not camp on the beach which looked like soft sand and gravel with the potential for getting stuck. It was a short walk to the lower beach. No one here except about a dozen closed-up 5th wheels that look like they have been here a long time.  There is a 16 day limit but it looks like people are just leaving trailers here without being here. Some do not even have license plates. I am sure this place gets busy on weekends.

Beautiful evening light,  star filled sky. Quiet and peaceful until the crowds come in.

name: Helendale Rd
description: A long dirt road that goes on for a few miles. Once you drive about a quarter mile in from the from the 58 hwy you are on BLM land. We just pulled over off the side of the road and parked our 16 ft camper. It’s a little hard to turn around but doable. We didn’t see any other campers but there were lots of trucks driving along the dirt road. Trucks stop passing around 6:30pm and it was very quiet and peaceful. You can hear the highway, but it’s faint. There is some sort of industrial building in the distance where trucks were coming from and it smelled like sewage the entire night.

name: Ray's Corner Store
description: Propane refill available out back.  Also a nice store and public park next door.

name: Site 7 Grassy Lake Road
description: Established campsite nice meadow.  Secluded.

name: Mobil
description:
Propane filling station.                               
                                                               B

name: Highway 1 Brewing
description:
Big parking lot of Highway 1 Brewing and Alliance Gas station. Stayed here with others. No signs, and we weren’t bothered.
WiFi available from the restaurant

name: Government Rd
description:
Parking on the side of a road. The road is wide enough and on some spots you can drive on the grass beside the road. 
Really quiet. No other cars came by. Beautiful view and Elks came by

name: Walmart
description: Lots of campers and trailers here. There is a “no overnight parking” sign with a picture of a semi truck on it. We stayed here with no issues.

name: Indiana I-69 Rest Stop
description: Rest stop with rest rooms, vending machines. Dog walk area not so great. Slept here overnight with no issues. Rest area on both sides of highway, we stayed at the one headed north.

name: Walmart parking lot
description: It’s not the worst place, but it is a Walmart parking lot. Better than nothing.

name: Rio Blanco
description: Head off the highway following the signs for the NF group campground which is 2.5 miles down. All along this river are dispersed sites in tall ponderosa trees. A gorgeous little valley. Very safe. No cell reception. Quiet. Lovely place about 35 minutes from Pagosa.

name: Mammoth Creek
description: About 3/4 mile down FS240 from Utah 143. Lots of turnout locations. Some fire rings. Verizon cell signal pretty good. Flies and bees are really bad. Lots of OHV/ATV activity. Be forewarned:  FS240 becomes unpassable about 3 miles off UT143. Don’t let maps fool you.

name: Snow removal equipment/trailhead parking lot
description: This is a pretty big parking lot where snow removal equipment is stored. There are no signs saying you can’t park or sleep here. It’s flat and quiet on a Tuesday night. Adjacent to several trailheads. Big cell towers nearby and 3 bars of ATT

name: East Badlands Grassland
description:
Open the big cattle gate where the other people stopped. Close it again! Continue up along the first big patch of badlands and find a pullout. Careful of the low prickly pear cactus, and all the mosquitos in town! Peaceful and quiet. 
https://www.fs.usda.gov/Internet/FSE_DOCUMENTS/fseprd701419.pdf
This federal map shows all the Buffalo Gap roads where you may camp. This was the farthest one east, which at sunset was what we had to do. But I wonder if the bugs are better at the ones farther west.

name: Tennessee river canyon road
description: This is small beach. Arrived around 3 pm, there was people swimming and hanging out at the beach. After 6 pm it was totally empty. Slept in our car, not tent. Around 4 am local people came for fishing. View was amazing.

name: Seneca state forest or seven mile
description: Shady spots amongst trees and rhododendrons. Very well spaced sites, 8 and 10 being the most private. Pit toilet at sites and cheap coin laundry and showers at headquarters down road. (showers are free, despite having coin slots!) Nearby Snowshoe fun for mountain biking and Cass is cute!

name: Trailhead
description: Huge and well maintained. You’ll be slighting unlevel no matter where you park in the gravel lot but it’s not by much. Pit toilets, bike repair rack, picnic tables. No signs saying no camping or no overnight parking and we weren’t bothered. Stayed here two nights. No crazy forest road to drive in. Just a short 30 second entrance but away from the road so it’s dead quiet and feels extremely safe.

name: Rest area/ Minnesota info center
description: Great place to make lunch, go the bathroom, take your pets out, etc. I only stayed for an hour to eat some food but saw no signs about time limits so I am assuming it is okay to stay overnight here.

name: Bird Track Spring
description: It’s an OK campground I accidentally found while got lost looking for Morgan Lake campground. It’s overgrown but okay to crash over night and $10/night

name: Sacwest RV park and Campground
description: Best RV park in Sacramento.  Pool, fire pit, petting zoo, full kids playground, great dog park, clubhouse and kids train on weekends. $975 a month for full hook up

name: Mound Dump Station
description: A nice place to dump tanks just across from the post office. It is on the right/east side of the street. So for me I had to drive in from the north because my tanks are in the drivers side. Sadly no water available for hook up but it works if you just need to dump tanks

name: Aspen Grove
description:
Big enough for 20 big rigs. Huge prairie with flat ground surrounded by trees and mountains. Foragers paradise. Easy dirt road getting in. 45 min from town. Free range cows that might visit your campsite. Moisture is held on top layers of soil for days. If you get a heavy rain, it may be days before you can leave. 
Beautiful drive up the mountain!! One of my favorite camp spots for sure!!

name: 801 Bancroft Ave Parking
description: Large lot with 10+ pull through spots for RVs including longer trailers. Right beside city hall and McEuen Park. Stopped over for the day to let the dog play at the dog park and work remotely. Great spot in a cute town.

name: Dog Park
description: Small dog park with agility course connected to McEuen Park. Plenty of parking including large RV and trailer parking in lot off of Bancroft Ave.

name: The Market
description: Several restaurants and stores. Free wi-fi reachable from the parking lot.

name: North fork laundromat
description: Simple laundromat runs by old couple. They also have propane and they do oil change.

name: Riverside
description: by the river, mountain view, just before you cross the river on west side of highway 4

name: Water at Arches Visitor Center
description:
Free potable water here near the sign
ATTENTION : You have to actually be in the park.

name: Grey River Covered Bridge
description: Beautiful spot next to the bridge. Slightly exposed; however, only three cars passed by all evening and all night. Walk a few steps down to the river bank for a fire pit. Across the bridge you’ll find an immaculate port-a-john. Great place for a clean river bath. Best site we’ve found so far!

name: Parking lot camping
description: Stayed here overnight and wasn’t bothered. Free 8pm-10am, has signs for no parking 2-6am November-April. I stayed here in July. Good Verizon and ATT service.

name: Turkey Springs Rd
description: Several large sites with fire rings. mostly level. Some quite a ways off this little traveled road. Some right near the road. Very quiet. Three bars of Verizon service in many spots.

name: Owens River Road
description: Owens River Road is a suggested dispersed area per the Inyo NF website. It seems to be extremely popular. All spots are down side roads, I could see many campers from the paved Owens River road and this was the first open spot I found, about 1.6 miles from the highway. It was easy to reach in my FWD van & it's a large spot. Might not be good for large rigs due to a tight turn getting to this spot. Completely surrounded by trees. Good TMobile & Verizon service.

name: Erie U Storage
description: Propane fill up available at front of business in parking lot

name: Town park
description: There’s a water spigot next to the covered picnic tables at the Randolph town park. Easy for filling jugs, but probably not ideal for filling a large water tank.

name: Silverthorne Rec Center
description: $5 showers. Hot, clean stalls, soap provided. locker room situation bring a lock. No hair dryer. Unsure if they rent towels

name: Sipper‘s Corner
description: Public parking lot at City Lake, part paved, part dirt. No signs, no fee, no amenities, no traffic, no noise, very quiet, only the unavoidable frog choir at night. Had a good nights sleep.

name: Mirror Lake Public Beach
description: Shower in the bathroom of the public beach house. No frills, not even a curtain, but guaranteed to get you cleaner! I used the one in the men’s room, guessing there’s one in the women’s too.

name: Kadoka city pool
description: Nice little public pool just beside a chidren playground. 1$/person to swim, several sessions per day. Showers and toilets.

name: Level spot off forest road near 100 giants
description: A quiet spot a little bit off the road. The other spots in this area are right on the side of the road but this one is a few hundred feet into the forest. There are flat areas for two vans / vehicles and a flat spot for tents, but larger vehicles won't fit. There is a fire ring as well. The forest road continues but there is a rough patch so we didn't explore to see if there were more possible sites further down. No service on AT&T

name: Gobblers Knob Viewpoint
description: Beautiful Vewpoint of the Brooks Range. Restrooms and huge parking area.

name: Arctic Circle
description: The Arctic Circle sign and information boards.

name: Finger Mountain Wayside
description: Panoramic Views. 1/2 mile interpretive trail. Parking and restrooms.

name: Intersection of 610 & 216 campsite
description: Large campsite, could easily fit 3-5 30’ travel trailers.  Easily fit class A, however few branches at the entrance could rub some high rigs.  We are in easily with our 30’ travel trailer at 11’6”.  I would recommend coming up 611 to 610 to get here with any sizable rig.  Those roads are wide and easy.  I drove out 216 with just the truck and it is narrower with branches and steeper.  We tucked into the corner of the campsite for afternoon shade.  Still getting morning-midday solar.  Picture only shows a portion of the site.

name: FS 103.1
description: Small pullout in grassy area near a old trail access point.  Perfect for a car or van.

name: Ellis Lazy Days Resort and Campground
description: electric hook up , water, showers , toilet and sink and lake access for swimming ans boating. Close to big springs.

name: Roadside pullout
description: Good sized gravel lot along the highway. If all you need is a quick nap this is a great spot. No signs posted at all and I have napped here before and never been bothered. Good AT&T signal.

name: Snowpark wit a view.
description: Huge snow parking area. No signs and fabulous view s to the west. Great AT&T and Verizon.

name: Kingman AZ
description: Park in Kingman with grass, tables and a couple of locomotives kids can go inside.

name: Showers at Alta Lake State Park
description: Hot showers located in the day use change room / washroom facility near the lake. Cost is $0.50 for 3 mins. Each additional $0.25 adds 1.5 mins. Accepts quarters only. Both showers on the women’s side had very low water pressure, but the facilities were clean and spacious. Can’t speak to the men’s side.

name: Pilot Travel Center
description: Asked if we could park our RV overnight. Were told that we would have to pay, but that the lot was full anyway. I wasn’t aware that RVs had to pay to park overnight at Pilot / Flying J locations. Maybe just at some locations, but something to be aware of none the less.

name: Pilot Travel Center
description: Asked if we could park our RV overnight. Were told that RVs normally have to park near the back of the lot, but there were no spaces available.

name: Ferry to Vancouver Island from Tsawassen
description: Ferries to Nanaimo, Gulf Islands and Victoria.  If you do not have a reservation you should line up in the 'possible wait' lines.

name: Broadway city street parking
description: 2 rows of parking spaces along Broadway and the street above it, I'll include a snapshot on maps in pictures. No signs specifying their use, shady in the afternoon spent the afternoon only.

name: Fryeburg Fairgrounds
description: Across from fairgrounds is the camping area and office.  Wide open sites, water and electric only.  They do have a dumping station.  Great cell service, Verizon LTE. $35 s night.  Great spot for a reset.

name: Pull out next to " av of the Giants"
description: Next to the route, after sunset the frequency of the vehicles is low. Next to the river, no signs. Verizon two bars

name: Jackman Park Campground
description: Small campground with 5-6 small sites in the trees. Picnic tables, fire rings, toilet, and water. Not suitable for RVs.

name: alder creek plateau
description: high above alder creek off good gravel road. quiet except for birds, creek and occasional jets. cell coverage 2 bar ATT.

name: Spague River Rd / 140 intersection pull off
description:
Large pull off on Spague River Rd at the intersection of 140. About 100' long can easily fit multiple vehicles. No signs about overnight parking.

Very quiet and dark at night, gets a little busy in the morning around 730 but nothing excessive.

Felt safe and secluded off the highway. 

TMobile and ATT full service available.

name: Natalie state forest campground
description: 15 site primitive campground, not far from Newberry. dirt road in is in good shape, large sites, good privacy. $20, need a MI recreation pass. 2 bars Verizon.

name: Overlook
description: Nice views. Road is in pretty bad shape so 4low would be your friend. Not recommended for 2wd vehicles but a good driver in dry weather could get in and out carefully.  Allow at least an hour from pavement. There’s a few campsites on the way here, but this site only holds 1-2 vehicles and maybe a tent or two.

name: Keep it Clean
description:
A small back in parking spot for 2 suvs or 1 truck/trailer. Medium clearance required because of some rocks in the spot. Possible tent spot. Campervan worked perfect. No noise. Very spotty service (U.S. cellular) Very clean. Do not leave any trace you were here. Tight fit with rig but if you are good at backing up you can make it (use a spotter)
 Near Lake of the Woods.

name: Pull off on Way to Nature Center
description: A paved, official pull off 3.5 miles before the Eagle River Nature Center right along the river. There are blue "P" parking signs to guide you there! Residential traffic dies at night so was quiet. Camping at the nature center is not permitted. But the staff person said people regularly camp in this and other pullouts on this road.

name: Castle Dale Information kiosk
description: Stand pipe on road side of kiosk. Good, clean, fresh.

name: Cracker Barrel
description:
A quiet place to stay for a night.
no facilities during the night.

name: Grapevine River Access - Trinity BLM
description: Camping max 14 days. Spotty cell service to none at all. Some shade, a table and a fire pit. Small area. No restrooms, no amenities. Right next to the river.

name: Alpine Lake Hidden Gem
description: Dispersed campground suitable for 2-3 medium sized rigs. Approximately 250ft from a quiet road and mostly hidden by trees. There's a small dirt road turn off leading to the place. Spots are relatively flat and shaded. No reception on Google Fi.

name: parking for rv
description: they are water available just near the grass....you need your ose

name: Large gravel pullout in the Alpental valley
description: Large and level pullout, may only be used in summer as it probably is an area for snow storage from ploughing in winter. No buildings in sight and very quiet in the night, I have only heard the river and not the I90.

name: Davis lake campground
description: Quiet lake with small boat ramp and about 5 established camp sites with fire rings. Not super flat ground but each site as lake access. Dry camping only. One pit toilet. Absolutely beautiful fun to ride around with kayaks on the lake - caught a ton of cutthroat trout on the fly rod. Hike around the lake is about .7 miles

name: Water Station/Dump Station
description: Same turn in as the showers. Will be onnyour immediate right. Double lane turn in. Great flow. Separate hoses for clean water & one for dump station

name: Pack river dispersed campsite
description: Beautiful spot RIGHT next to the Pack River.  Fire ring. Nice shade and sandy area by river to chill on.  There are a few more along this road- but this is the nicest one by far.  Stayed 4 days- had a few atvs and cars come back to see if spot was open- but no other interactions w people.  Loved it !!!  No cell service- but up the road we got a bar of T mobile on our bikes.

name: Gunter Hill Campground - US Army Corps of Engineers
description: Gunter Hill Campground offers a peaceful scene of trees and nature on the backwaters of the Alabama River. The fishing is excellent, providing challenges for the master angler as well as the occasional cane pole fisherman. Boating, hunting and hiking are popular activities.  There are 142 sites w/ electric hookups, sites 1-75 are newly renovated.

name: Free BF site near Emigration CG
description:
Beautiful level spot in the forest where birds are singing, tall pines are shading, the woods smell great, with total quiet on a Forest road off of the main road. A rock fire pit is here. There is another more open gravel spot up the road about 500 ft at the trailhead, also with a stone ring but it might have visitors. This site is  private and perfect but there are many free forest roads and pullouts off of the main road fir you larger rig people. One  can fill up with water at the nearby campground or drive to the bathrooms. Very few bugs last night! Great multi- use trails nearby.

We saw 2 moose!

name: West Coast RV Recycling & Sales LLC
description: Incredible place, like a an RV Salvage where you find all the parts you need for an RV or homemade van. We just found a furnace door we have lost on the road and isn't made anymore, shelves for the fridge, special trim etc. Number 3606690346. Not a garage.

name: Lakeside near HWY
description: Small parking Lot with space for maybe 5 vehicles.. There is access to the lake for taking a swim!

name: Great Sand Dunes Parking Showers
description: Outdoor showers located at the Great Sand Dunes Parking Lot. No privacy but great to get a quick shower with water in your swim wear.

name: Walmart Gardendale
description: Large parking lot, well lit, clean, safe, pulled in in the back at the garden center, some trees there to provide shade. No through traffic, no noise, no signs. WiFi works well inside Walmart, no connection at our spot. Several restaurants, a bakery, a Starbucks nearby.

name: Safeway - Drinking Water Refill
description: Glacier water refill inside the store. Pay at cashier and refill station is in the back end. ¢40 a gallon.

name: On 12 country road, near east of Boulder City, Utah.
description:
À very large rest area, so large that the road is quite silent. 
There is pit toilets. 
Wifi come and go, uncertain. 
Very quiet because the so beautiful 12 country side road is less used, even his beauty is like Zion park with fabulous rocks.

name: Factory Butte Special Recreation Area , Utah
description:
A place on the moon !

Grey hard sand. Very large space to park. 

Very quiet pace to sleep. Very close the one, with same characteristics, named before on this site the so wonderful and high friendly IOverlander.

name: NF road
description: Dirt road that hooks off from the main road through the National Forest. We pulled off on the first large patch of grass on the right. No one bothered us. Beware of ticks of course, my partner picked off 7 staying for one day. Lots of mosquitos but it’s summer so what are you going to do lol. Good T-Mobile and Verizon.

name: Jomeokee Campground
description:
Tents
Hammocks
Car Campers
 Van Campers 
Truck Campers (In the bed of a truck)
Recreational Vehicles up to 28 ft.(20 amp only)
•

Bathrooms
HOT showers
Water spigots(Bring 50ft of hose)
15/20 amp electricity (bring 50ft heavy duty cord) 
Picnic shelter to reserve. 
Fire rings
Open fields and space to explore
Propane filling station

name: Idita-Wash Laundry and Showers
description:
Laundromat with showers. 
Idita-Wash
1150 S Colony Way Unit 9, Palmer, AK 99645

name: City of Wasilla Bulk Water Station
description: Self service water fill station. Credit card only. $0.03 per gallon, $5.00 minimum charge (good for 167 gallons). $19.95 pre-authorization charge returned in 24-48 hrs. 3” hookup and standard 3/4” (garden hose) hookup. Open 24 hrs.

name: Elk Creek Campground
description:
This campground has a really nice and accommodating staff, they allow people to use the showers on Donation (that goes towards NGO) until 4pm.

We did NOT stay in the campground after they showed us around coz thought it wasn’t worth to pay for us, and after that we still used the showers on donation and they told us that, if we didn’t find a spot, we could come after closure, park, and figure it out in the morning.

Great attitude and vibes!

Nice clean warm showers on donation.
Not a lot of pressure is the only downside I can find.

name: Ruby Mountain CG
description: Between Salida and Buena Vista are a few campgrounds run by CO. $28 night. On the river, easy access, lots of room between people but no privacy. We’d needed to find a place for the night rather than wing it. Very happy for this place.

name: Speedway drinking water
description: Outside drinking water faucet. Labeled clearly at the edge of the lot next to the propane and dump station.

name: Speedway Propane
description: Propane fill at Speedway Gas station. At the edge of the lot near the RV dump station and water fill.

name: "Best Mobile Mechanic"
description:
"Brakes, Tune-Ups, RY & Motorhome, Check Engine, Light Diagnostics." 
Justin (the mechanic and owner) was helping my neighbor at the rv park and I asked him to borrow some WD40 for a squeak. He helped my out and was very nice about it. As the title says, the business is mobile.

name: Roadside pulloff with 4G Cell coverage
description:
Right on the road near teailhead. 
Look..I hit this spot because other areas with Glacier view were clouded in with no cell service. I have 4g Verizon here. Other than that, it has road noise and right beside a trailhead which I may hike.

name: secluded dispersed camping spot
description: Nice spot away from the other spot listed down the road. Shaded with fire ring. 1 bar Verizon. Difficult to get our van level but we managed (check photos)

name: River spot
description: Little road next to the bank. Big opening once you go down the little hill. Then an access point to the River. Some trash on the ground but not too bad.

name: Fisherman's Wharf Restaurant
description: Park back behind the parking area (to the left of the restaurant) and near Johnson Bay. We ate at the restaurant and asked to park for the night. I was told the restaurant owned the lot. Staying a night was not a problem.

name: La Playita de Dorado
description: La Playita de Dorado is a public beach with protected waters. It is located between Dorado Beach (due west) and the Embassy Suites Beach (due east). it is a popular hangout for local surfers, paddleboarders and kite surfers.

name: Hopeville Pond State Park
description:
Beautiful, quiet, well taken care of state park. Have a few sites with water and power, loads of dry camping sites. Dump near the entry office.

For details, times and season info checkout https://portal.ct.gov/DEEP/State-Parks/Parks/Hopeville-Pond-State-Park

name: Lewis Wharf Parking
description:
30$ for 24 hours. 
20$ early bird parking. 

Close to Freedom Trail, Downtown, Restaurants. 

There are public toilets in Joi Salon next to Starbucks. Open in early morning and late evening (maybe whole night?)

Parking lot gets full in afternoon, best arrive in the morning. 

Quiet night. Nice sunset at water. 

Stayed for one night, no problems.

name: Wolf Creek Campground
description: Quiet little campground surrounded by cornfields and woods. Reservation online only. No water but there are a couple of gray water dump stations and two outhouses. Fire pit and picnic table at each site. Was the only one here on a Wednesday. Would definitely come back again if I'm ever in the area.

name: Fayetteville River Access Point
description: Small pull off area next to New River, across from boat access area and bathrooms. Stayed overnight with 25ft bus and van no problem. No issues overnight, cooked breakfast outside the next morning and some rangers said hello. Train nearby was loud but otherwise nothing significantly disturbing. Great view of bridge. Saw no “no overnight parking” signs, only no camping.

name: Common Cents
description: Common Cents station with new dump station located on the Flying J side of the building. On a hill and didn’t drain completely but was clean and good enough. Large lanes for fuel will accommodate larger rigs with tow vehicle.

name: Cross Ford Park acces 272
description: A quiet super cool place can accommodate large vehicles 30 camping place to have internet go to the bridge it's free but you have to register at this number 6418497309 we can stay 7 consecutive days

name: Lemon Creek Trailhead
description: Gravel lot next to trailhead at the end of Commercial Blvd, behind Home Depot. Big enough for several rigs. Someone living there full-time when I visited. Trash bin at trailhead and bathrooms at Home Depot.

name: Slana River Side
description: This area is large enough for bigger rigs. It right next to a small pond off the Slana river. There are no amenities but 3 bars on Verizon. Be prepared for a lot of mosquitoes. Easy drive for any rig.

name: Free campground
description: Quiet, lots of spots all spread out, 14 day limit. No cell service anywhere around here.

name: Nenana City Public Library
description: Fast WiFi. Can get it no problem sitting outside in your rig.

name: Flying J
description: Place is clean and not much vehicles here at night. No security guards roaming around. There are signs for towing enforced but it does not mention about overnighters. There are a few pandhandlers in the area. It’s a Truck stop therefore it has all the amnemeties like showers, laundry, etc. It’s highly recommended as a place for overnight.

name: FS4818-101
description: This location is just off the dirt road that leads to Kachess Ridge Trailhead.    During the weekend days it gets a little busy as people are driving to the trailhead.  However, very quiet at nights except for two out 14 nights when other campers were making some noise.  On the south side of I-90 is Lake Easton State Park.  There you can shower and get potable water.  When you enter the park turn right and drive to the day use area.  Water is along side the path to the amphitheater.  Shower is in the restroom.  I wouldn't call this area big rig friendly because of the narrow road.  I was able to pull my 15 foot trailer back here no problem.

name: Shoulder
description:
Good shoulder up Forrest road.
Flat. Great view.
Got my 20 foot RV up with no problem besides a couple of low hanging oak branches I had to navigate. 
T-Mobile service ok ... better with data booster.

name: pull-out overlooking the Manti-La Sal National Forest
description:
on the North creek line (between Monticello and Newspaper Rock)
Very large pullout and not to close to the road. Very quiet. 
Isolated and good paved road. 
Place for tents in little bush. 
No services.  
Fresh air at this 14h July.

name: Red dirt wash and dry
description:
Laundromat.
4 washing machines, 2.25 $.
4 dryers, 1.5$
Change.
Toilets.

name: Plateau travel center propane
description: Cheapest propane and gas within an hour! I’m sure you could sleep here if you wanted to as well it’s a huge travel truck stop

name: Granite Gap II
description: Nice secluded spot on BLM land just off 80. Go thru the green gate off of 80 with a chain wrapped around it. It is up a narrow sandy road. May could fit to vans or small RV trailer. 2 bars Verizon. This is the first gate on the left past the other Granite Gap site. Fire ring. Great views. Maybe other sites in the area.

name: Cliff Dwellers Lodge and Restaurant
description:
Great Lodge with excellent restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Also a full bar with package liquor. 
There is a gas station that also sells diesel.
They have a flyshop and outdoor store and also have a fly fishing guide service and haul people with rental kayaks to Kayak Horseshoe Bend.

name: Indian head casino
description: Large lot for parking some road noise. Not really any shade or privacy. They do give you $10 slot credit as well as some small gifts when you sign up for a free players card. You do not need to check in with security.

name: Dispersed FS camping
description: Dispersed camping on Forest Service land. Fire ring. Space for 1-2 vans. About 30 yards off a quiet gravel road, hidden from view of the road.

name: The Market
description: Several restaurants and a brewery here. The Market has several healthy, fresh options. Suitable for vegetarians.

name: Devil's canyon overlook
description: Nice little overlook stop with bathrooms and a parking area for semis/rv's and smaller vehicle parking also. Was needing a place to pee and stretch legs but the little loop was far enough from interstate that we decided to spend the nite in our 30' skoolie. 2 semis, a van, and a sprinter were here.

name: Gravel lot Glacier Toe in View
description: Large, mostly level construction staging area. A couple of informal fire rings. Within sound and sight range of the Richardson Hwy but quiet at night. Some mosquitoes and gnats. yes for Verizon but no for AT&T There is  a spot just across the highway that is BETTER but we didn't look at it until the next morning. We had erroneously thought the 3 Glacier View pin was in the wrong location.

name: Darien visitors center
description: Water spigot beside entrance door.  Filtered drinking water is available inside.  There are also clean new bathrooms.

name: Murdoch's Ranch Supply
description: Propane refills available here, ask at the counter inside and they'll send someone out to help.

name: Trailhead Parking
description: Large gravel parking lot. No 'overnight parking prohibited' sign. Google Fi full bars. Verizon lite 4 bars

name: Great spot off a quiet forest road
description:
Great spot for a van or teardrop or tents - no larger. Nice fire pit and benches. Creek nearby (though hard to access), minimal road sound, some train sound. Lots of mosquitos in June!

No generators. Respect the peace and quiet  of the forest please

name: Corporate park cul-de-sac
description: Just like Cindy Ln just south, the cul-de-sac here on Rose Ln was quiet and well lit overnight. No no parking signs. Good place for a night just off of pch. 5G 3/5 bars verizon.

name: Kin-Win Trailhead
description: Big gravel lot that can accommodate any vehicle size. Access to nice trails on the Matanuska greenbelt. I think this is the only trailhead to the greenbelt that doesn't charge a day-use parking fee. Probably because it's owned by the university and not the city. No pit-toilet though. Nevertheless, great for day parking!

name: Fort Myers RV Resort
description: Check in at the office, $20, someone will bring you out to the dump.

name: Loves Truck Stop
description: Showers, parking, restaurant has good food.

name: Secluded spot in the shade
description: Any car can make it back here on the short dirt road off the snow-park. Good phone Service and very very quite! Fairly flat. Enjoy

name: Bald Mountain Road
description: Bald Mountain Road is a recommended dispersed camping area on the Inyo NF website. This area was far less crowded than Owens river road. This specific spot is very large, easy to get to for any vehicle, great distant mountain views across a meadow and full Verizon & TMobile service. The only negative was the family of chipmunks that were relentless about getting under my van's hood. They were nonstop from around sunrise to dusk & they are the reason I left. This is probably a great spot if you have a dog or cat who can keep them away! :)

name: Sequin Spur B
description:
Two dead end roads that are great for dispersed camping. On the gps (garmin) you can see the two roads on the east side of highway 13. They are called 
“sequin spur a” and “sequin spur b”. 
We checked out both and stayed at “b”. There was already a small made up fire pit there. Room enough for almost all size rigs. Large enough room for a group even. We stayed here July 4th weekend with some family. 

Only about 3.5 miles from a gas station and dollar general. Very close to Picture Rocks National Lakeshore. 

Service wasn’t the best for visible (verizon towers) but had a little service with t-mobile. Best way to use the service was through a cell booster.

name: Mojave road spot
description: Nice spot 1/2 way up the pass. Enough space for 4 or 5.

name: Glacier Water
description: Place to fill your water jug. Outside of Safeway.

name: Small Campsite
description: Small, fairly level site with stone fire ring on west side of the road. Amazing views to the east. Entry path from road to the site is rough and off camber, needed to use 4wd. Once past that it is nice and level.

name: Launderland
description: Very clean and big laundromat with large number of good washers and dryers. Loads from small to big are: $3.50 - $7.75 for a big load. Dryer is 0.25 for 7 minutes. Good location though if you are exploring the coast near Half Moon Bay. Has wifi. Grocery store nearby.

name: CCC campground forest service
description:
forest service campground. about 1 mile off the highway on a well maintained gravel road. nice campground with great views! about 1 mile south of the entrance to Theodore Roosevelt nps North unit.  $10 a night. no services, no water dump or trash service. there's about 50 sites in 3 loops. when I was here on a Sunday in July, there were only about 5 campers here. you can hear a little bit of traffic noise from the highway, but it's really not noticable. very quiet and peaceful! hiking/biking trails directly out of the campground into the grasslands wilderness area.
very fast Verizon cell service! there's no cell service in the campground in the national park, so I stayed here instead to work during the week.

name: Astoria East Coin Laundromat
description: Very clean laundromat with 2-load, 3-load, 5-load, 6-load and 8-load washing machines. You can pay with quarters (change machine available in the laundromat), credit or debit card, or   The Laundry Boss app. I just used quarters because it seemed like the easiest option. A 3-load warm water wash was $4.75. Cost varies depending on size of machine and water temperature selected. Cheapest option is $3.50 for a 2-load cold water wash. There are two sizes of dryers, which I would call large and XL. Cost of the smaller (large) dryers is $0.25 for 8 minutes.

name: Lakeview Commons Concessions WIFI
description: Public WIFI provided by the concession stand. Lots of tables, some shaded in the late afternoon. This spot is above the beach and provides an amazing view. Restrooms are available during the day here and at the parking lot to the south.

name: Tahoe City Commons Beach Parking
description: A parking lot with roughly 40 spaces next to the beach. Not big enough for RVs, but vans should fit just fine. Bathrooms and play equipment for kids is available here as well as kayak rentals. You can also access the North Lake Tahoe Multi-Use Trail System. No dogs allowed at the park, but on the trail is ok.

name: Water spigot
description: Blue handle water spigot in the backside parking on the look. Vans and small rigs only. Not sure if potable but confirmed it has water

name: St. George city park and Cheat river boat launch
description: nice city park along the Cheat river.  lots of kayaking/ canoeing/ white water rafting.  there's a water spigot in the park just off the road with a hose.  very quiet.  there's a rafting company on the other side of the river.  show em some love and go on an adventure.

name: Fourmile Butte, Deschuttes National Forest
description:
Gorgeous views of the Three Sisters and Mount Washington. Road is rutted and rough, but I did it at a slow crawl in 2WD with Jeep and trailer. If it were muddy it would be much more difficult. 

We parked on the south rim and had the most incredible views. 

Absolutely recommend this spot!

name: Homestead Valley Rd
description: Great place for a quick overnight just outside of Seattle. Long pullout section on the way to Ollalie State Park. There were at least 6 others when we stopped for the night, but everyone had plenty of room to space out and there was still room for more. Signs state 8 hours only.

name: Helena NF dispersed
description: This side road is mostly grown over by grass but you can see the obvious road, there is about 4 or 5 established fire rings as you go down that are nicely spaced out, some spots are more accessible then others as the road becomes more puddles and ruts as you go down. Easily manageable with any truck or lift. Road stops at a cattle fence that looks like once had signs but is just old board now. We didn’t go past and stoped for camp here cause it was level. Great views at the top site as well. No reception for AT&T or Verizon.

name: Auntie Em’s Laundry Room
description: Cute little laundromat with machines of all sizes. Washers cleaned everything we had better than any laundromat we’ve been to in 4 months. The dryers actually worked and we’re super efficient drying all our things in 30-40 minutes, where most have been an hour plus. Decent prices and clean!

name: Ross Lake
description: Ross Lake DNR campground, 10 sites primitive but peaceful. very pretty, very weak one bar Verizon

name: Quiet larger pullout
description: Pullout just off the road with decent privacy. A small berm blocks most of the road so you went get dust blown on you from cars going by. Large enough to fit a couple of rigs.  Fairly level with room to turn around. There's also a fire pit. 1 bar Verizon LTE.

name: Dispersed camping big rig friendly
description: Just a few sites off the road. Quiet at night. Very pretty views. 1 bar on ATT and Verizon.

name: Bear Dixon 5000
description: maybe the bears will visit you too. Creek. quiet. no cell service. good spot off the highway.

name: Forest road
description: Forest road turn off on NF-13. Its across the street from the landing strip field. On google maps the forest road is 644. You’ll definitely brush up against some branches driving in but it is very remote, quiet, and we didn’t see anyone for two days. Lots of ticks and mosquitos. The first good spot with solar is at the end of the road. You can also enter from Chamberlain rd and there’s a huge open field once you drive through the forest a little bit.

name: Matanuska Glacier State Recreation Site Campground
description: Small dry camping site next to Glacier viewpoint area. $20 for camping, $7 for day use. 12 campsites total, 3 dedicated tent sites. Some privacy, pit toilets (clean), a manual water pump (non-potable, boil advisory, see picture). small and medium RVs okay. watch for overhead obstructions. It's a short stroll to the glacier overlook. Highway nearby but quiets down at night. AT&T had good signal, Verizon had none at all, even with a cell booster.  This is not at all associated with the private tours conducted by a private party nearby.

name: SF Forest camping
description: Large site for multiple vehicles. Popular road with large RV’s going by.

name: Freedom Park ball fields
description: Large gravel lot at the end of Airport Way (small airport 400 yards away). Area is next to National Guard vehicle storage area. No services, but 4 bars for internet connection.  cars on highway but traffic dies down about 11 pm. Good site in a pinch.

name: Spruce Pond
description: Parking area beside a quiet pond with walk in tent sites. We set up our hammocks in a site by the pond and slept in the van. Super quiet, aside from bullfrogs and birds. The pond is a fishing spot for locals. One clean pit toilet on site. Free.

name: Large Roadside pullout
description: Large pullout should fit any number of large rigs next to the gravel road. Small fire ring. good views. This seems to be the last cell service before heading to the campground. Stayed 3 nights. A few other cars pulled in for a few minutes then left.

name: Sinclair Gas Station
description: Showers available. Fairly new and clean gas station, market with showers.

name: Allied Propane
description:
5000 Seaport Ave, Richmond, CA 94804
This is my go-to place to fill up the finicky VW Westfalia's 3.2L Propane Tank. Other locations seem to leave me smelling like propane. It's likely due to the technician servicing, or maybe this place has the right adapters. Either way, I'm a big fan.

name: Dispersed Camping On FS Road
description: Dispersed camping spot on Richmond Ridge Road. Mostly level with a fire ring. Good road the whole way up. Passed a couple other spots on the way up but this one was the biggest/nicest one we saw. Saw a black bear on the way in so make sure you're prepared for that! 1 bar AT&T, no bars Verizon. Great place if you want to get away from all the people camping by the lakes down below.

name: Honey Creek State Park
description: Well-groomed park mostly catering to RVs and boaters. We parked in the tent area ($10) and slept in our van. No one else was around and we had an expansive view of the lake and a trail down to the beach all to ourselves. Showers and flush toilets available within a short walk from tenting site.

name: Matanuska River Park
description: water & dump open to public. cost $5.00 located by office. turn right to go around to pull in dump station. if office locked drop money in pay box across from dump.

name: Camden State Park
description:
State Park with electric and tent sites, dump and fresh water.  Trails, picnic area, and swimming hole too. Campground toilets are nice with showers (which seem free; I didn’t use).

$35/electric
$24/tent
Plus $7/vehicle day use fee (or $35/MN state park annual pass)

A lovely overnight. We were in site 82, in the upper campground, which seems to be all tent sites. Shaded, private, level. Occasionally 1 bar VZN LTE. T-Mobile 2bars. Lower campground seems to be more open, with larger sites for electric hookups. Dump and freshwater is next to entrance. (There are also water spigots scattered throughout the campgrounds.) 

A train line runs through the park with regular (hourly?) trains, which don’t bother me at all but could be a noise issue for some. Otherwise a really lovely night.

name: Angel Lake RV park
description: RV park with all 3 services 40$/night. Friendly service. showers ,laudromat, restrooms and wifi

name: Crosby Farm regional Park
description: This park has a water fountain outside and established restroom. I was able to fill up water bottles and transfer them into my water system. Only the bottom fountain works currently.

name: chena lake
description: there is dumping and non-potable water for those who camp but free or $5 depending on whether the guy is at the barrier or not...:)

name: 30 minutes free wifi
description: 30 minutes free wifi per day at the toilet building. No password needed. It was the only wifi in whole Skagway wich was fast enough to download something (Netflix etc.)

name: Street behind Buc-ees
description: A short, but wide road directly behind Bucees. Security will wake you up if you sleep in the bucees parking lot, but it’s apparently ok to sleep on the road behind the station. There was a class a, a bus, and a big rig back there too. No issues.

name: Devil’s Punch Bowl parking lot
description: Multiple campers parked along first street on the south side of the road. About 50 m from the beachfront. Toilets at the state park parking lot. Very quiet. Restaurant and coffee shop right across the street. Not good for daytime use. Will get very busy in the high season.

name: Indian Crossing Campground
description:
A very nice BLM campground on the river.  first come, first serve.  $10/ night (or $5 with interagency pass.) It takes about an hour to drive down the road.  4x4 not necessary.  Group campsites as well.  There's a campsite host.

It is a popular take-out spot for rafts and drift boats.  On a Friday night in mid-July, there were only 3 or 4 other campers.  The riverbank has thick vegetation, but the campsites are not shaded.  The reason to come down here to camp is to wade fish in the river.

name: South Steens Campground
description: There are 36 campsites amongst the juniper trees. Picnic tables, fire rings, vault toilets, and potable water. Much less buggy than Page Springs Campground.

name: Cooper’s Landing
description: Beautiful little bar and campsite right on the banks of the Missouri River. Has spots for cars and trailers and overlanders but probably not enough space for big rigs (maybe call ahead for that). Has live music on the weekends. Overall really nice spot. No restaurant but have food trucks that come on the weekends. I’ve never stayed over night but come here often and see campers here all the time. You can also google the place for more info.

name: service road electricity towers
description: Completely silent, lots of wild life. off from the main road. No signs. safe

name: The 4RunnerShow Camp
