description: Large Site suitable for Multiple Vehicles.  Fire pit already here.  Access to all the trails.

name: Rainbow Lake Campground
description: 3 campsites, 2 on the lake and one across access road. Fire pit and picnic table at each site.   Beautiful secluded lake. Camped for 5 nights, had lake to ourselves for 2 of them.  Clean out toilets on site.   Free.  Pack out your garbage.

name: Laundromat
description: $3.25/load. Not the cleanest. Only 2 dryers out of 6 are in working order.

name: caves
description:
Cute campground 10$ / night near oregon's cave.
dry toilette and garbage. water at the front gate. no dump station

name: Berry's Ferry/Boat Ramp
description: Historical site of where The Trail of Tears crossed the Ohio River. Any size rig will fit. Well maintained grounds. I have a Toyota Tacoma with sleeping accommodations in the bed. Backed up to an open view of the river at the far south end. At that location found a small but steep trail down to the water. Was quite secluded & perfect for taking a bath, even with other campers there. Would definitely stay here again. Cellular: AT&T 1.4 Mbps

name: Free air in front of Lowe's
description: nice air compressor in front of Lowe's, free

name: Galveston parking
description: A huge parking lot for campers, trailers and etc. It’s next to wall green. Parking lot is $10.00 for 24 hrs. for vehicles and $ 20.00 for vehicles wh trailers. This place is more like wild camping and there is a fee to park. Pay as vehicle enters. There is internet but no bathrooms, showers, no hookups and no water, etc. I used the bathroom in wall green n bought ice. Only noise is the vehicles going by main road otherwise feel the breeze from the ocean. I recommend for an overnighter. There were a few trailers here kind like an over flow from the Sand Piper RV.

name: Dirt Turnabout
description: dirt turnabout/pull off, off Four Mile River rd. one on each side of the road.

name: Cracker Barrell
description: Great spot for overnight parking.  As usual located right at interstate entrance/exit so can be a little noisy.  Nice staff

name: Valley Park Hermosa Beach
description: Parking spaces for the park right on a busy street. No Parking on  Mondays 8AM to Noon. No vehicles over 22 feet. Stayed one night in a van. Cell reception Verizon 2 bars. Adequate but slow for streaming.

name: Thoms Creek Campground
description: This is a great little free NPS Campground.  There were 6-7 spots, all with new tables and fire ring grills.  The two pit toilets also looked brand new.  I rolled in there on a Saturday afternoon and was the only one.  There are no signs that I saw on the highway, making it easy to miss.  Most of the camp spots are right on the little creek and there is lots of shade.  The spot I marked is where you turn in.  The only downer was some jackass broke a vodka bottle in the creek.  I couldn't get to it to clean it up.

name: Hersberger Rd
description: There are a few spots just over a small bridge right off the highway.  They are on the Rogue River which drowns out the road noise.  The first one is the best.  It had a stone fireplace from a long gone house.  Lots of shade and no litter scene.

name: NF55-PullOff
description:
This is just a couple turns past the N55 Logging spot. It's just small gravel/grassy pull off that is relatively level. It is in the open with a great view of a small canyon area. You would be right on the road, but I don't suspect there is a ton of traffic this far up.  It is paved most of the way up though to this spot. 

This spot is suitable for 1 larger truck camper at the most. Even getting 2 vehicles in here would be tight.  However, one person could stay here and one could stay in the NF55 Logging listed and you would be able to see each other and be in walking distance. 

Be aware you could possibly hit some smallish overhanging tree branches on the way up if you are 12'+. Past this spot, the trees get a lot more overwhelming. I did make it to the NF55-Ext to turn around with a 10' truck camper, but I definitely was hitting some smaller branches. 

I would not recommend any trailers as turning around would be impossible until you got to the NF55-Ext turnoff. 

There is no cell here and Starlink would have obstructions because you have tall ledges and trees to your north.

name: Kittatinny canoe and campground
description:
Limited cell signal, no septic at sites, has a dump station, many of the spots are big rig friendly with pull through’s  near the office otherwise the office side of the campground are Jammed pack tent sites. We did not venture to the other side of the park to see the spaces for ourselves. It does advertise cable tv that doesn’t work, the office lady said (it’s just there for show only some work)???
The beach and tent areas are horrible, mostly locals that completely block the beach making it difficult to  access with each of them listening to all different music at blaring levels visible drug use even with kids running around, there is park security walking around just doing nothing. The bathroom on the office side of the park was filthy and only has one shower. Personal canoes and kayaks are not welcome at there boat launch, we were directed to a public beach to use for our kayaks even when camping there. Also they will not transport them. If I have anything positive to say, I had a nice site (118) and it’s convenient as a stop over place when traveling. We paid around 75 per night…

name: Cleone California
description: Very friendly local folks have had this campgrounds in the family for many years. Coin shower and laundry, quiet and close to ocean

name: Wishing Springs Trail
description:
We stopped to enjoy the creek and ending up loving it so much we stayed over 24 hours. The creek by blue hole was very busy on Sunday but we parked in a gravel lot down the way and it was quieter at our section. No amenities but it was a great place to stay and enjoy the natural creek and spring. 
There is a water fill-up a few miles up the road at the Arkansas Welcome Station

name: Yazoo National Wildlife Refuge Admin Bldg And Visitor Contact Station
description: We stopped at the Yazoo National Wildlife Refuge for one night. It’s nice, quiet and secluded. We only stayed one night and got in late and left around 8 am the next day. Didn’t see any other cars. The building is only open Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 10-4 so there’s no facilities of any kind.

name: Marathon Campground
description:
Municipal Campground owned by the city of Seward.  Gravel, flat, waterfront camping.
Basically a parking lot that runs the length of the city. Views are amazing as the "campgrounds" are right on the water. The rest of the town and its amenities are right across the street. That's the good news. The bad news is it's $40/night to dry camp, the bathrooms are terrible, and there are only 2 showers for probably over 100 sites, which I would not recommend using anyway.

name: Valvoline instant oil change
description: For a quick oil change when you are doing a big road trip. Not sure for RV size, though. I have a van 16ft long, 8ft high.

name: Badlands Boondocks Camp spot
description: Great views with beautiful sunset Just beging us and vastness in front of us.  We even saw a couple of sheep on the cliff

name: Cenex
description: Large Cenex gas station that also has propane fill, sewer dump (free) and potable water.

name: Wells Dam Rest Area
description: On the lawn on the auto side there is a water spigot. It could be locked, but wasn't when I was there. Sprays the water in a horizontal arc so you need something to divert into your container (short hose) or just use your skill to manage it.

name: Moto Hammock Spot on Forest Road
description: Pull-off suitable only for moto hammock camping, although you might fit a small tent instead. Was wonderfully cool this July night.

name: Route 291 just north of Route 311 at Rabbit Ears
description: Short drive off highway 40 with incredible view of Rabbit Ears Peak in Medicine Bow-Routt National Forests. 291 is a little rough, although passable. Very quiet spot with fire pit and spectacular wildflower bed in peak season. Hikers pass by occasionally from dawn to dusk.

name: More sites
description:
About 4-7 more sites in this area. My pin has the best scenery. 

Recent rain: Some bigger water holes to go through on, but even with 7” deep water the bottom was hard enough to make it through with 2wd no issue.

Very poor to no cell service.

name: BLM Snake River Public Access
description: Public access site to the Snake River on BLM land just before the commercial RV park. Overnight permitted for up to 14 days consecutively, with a pit toilet on site. There are 4-5 picnic tables around the edges to pull up next to as "sites," and one actual pull-in spot that could work as a tent site.

name: New Town Marina Campground
description: campground at the marina on lake sakakawea. $20 for a site with electric hookup. pit toilets. store with bait and ice. some picnic tables, shade structures, and fire fings. dump station and potable water here also. looks like a lot of the campers are here for the long haul, probably for the whole summer. a lot of boats around too.

name: Horn Rapids Park
description: This is a County Park with 22 campsites, a river put-in, picnic area and bike trail. It's $30 per night for RVs and $20 per night for tents. Dump station is available and so are showers. On a July Sunday night we were the only ones here. Very pleasant place.

name: Duck Creek Campground
description: Duck Creek Rec Area is managed by the COE, and offers 12-15 free sites with fire rings and tables, boat ramp, 3 pit toilets and a fish cleaning station. no other amenities. pack-in pack-out. trash, dump station and fresh water are located about 6 miles down the road near Down Stream campground.

name: pullout across from mile marker 8
description: nice dirt pullout, not many mosquitoes. has cell service (Google Fi), wild raspberries. went up to upper level in my 2wd pickup - slightly shielded from road noise by a berm

name: Boat launch, large parking
description:
Paved large parking lot next to a bridge with spaces long enough for boat trailer parking, slight slope, we slept well without leveling. ATT LTE 1-2 bars, 3 boost.
4 other rigs were, minimal traffics noise at night.

name: Chimney Rock Travel Center
description: Truck stop - parking for semis and passenger vehicles to spend the night. Not too loud despite being next to a highway. Good place to spend the night if necessary. Verizon LTE

name: Rest Area Southbound
description: Right off the freeway, as much traffic noise as you would expect but clean, nice bathrooms, vending machines, picnic tables, water. No “no camping” signs.

name: Powderhorn Park
description: Under the shelter next to the bathrooms there is a water fountain which has a spout for filling jerry can type containers. Filled my 6 gallon container easily. You have to hold down the button to fill so may be less convenient than other spots but it’s easily accessible and free in a nice park.

name: Roadside pullout off Colorado 7
description: A few different pullouts off the state highway. This one is big enough for a few cars. It’s right next to the road but if you’re as tired as I was that might not matter. Traffic dies down a lot overnight. No signs saying you can’t park or camp, and based on how many cars were at these pullouts I have to assume it’s okay. Also a convenient location between Estes park and the Longs Peak Trailhead, if you’re gunning for an early start on that.

name: water at speedway by air station
description: water spigot for threaded hose. next to air fill up. a little slow to fill.

name: Tractor Supply
description:
Propane refill during store hours. Refill station is to the left of the store looking at entrance. Just go inside and tell the cashier you need propane, then meet the employee with your tank on the side.

No tanks allowed inside store.

name: End of the road
description: This spot is at the end of a road in the national Forest. You must pass the spot marked “mountain hideaway” on iOverlander to access the road, You’ll then pass a few small pull offs getting here that have beautiful overlooks of the flathead lake but are no more then a pull off RIGHT on the road. This spot although has no immediate lake views is larger and could fit two small vehicles or tent even with privacy. You can walk a short distance for a nice view too. Nothing large should attempt this as there is only small opportunities for turn arounds. Great spot for the night and close to the flathead valley. Decent reception for both AT&T and Verizon

name: Cemetary
description:
The road goes alongside the railroad tracks and ends at an old Cemetery that people are obviously coming by and taking care of and just beyond the cemetery there's another big wide open space that's a little bit more away from the railroad tracks, and away from the cemetery. there's also a spot just after you cross over the railroad tracks right on the side of the road. T

his is a small spot but more open and breezy. The road is quiet, nobody drove on it this entire time we were there but the train went through three times. and the mosquitoes are a bit fierce. We were kind of lucky that it was rainy while we're here and I think the mosquitoes could have been a lot worse. I had two to three bars of service with us cellular.

name: Trail parking lot
description: Parking lot next to Forest park and the departure of a trail. Sign saying the park closes from 10pm to 5pm but no “no overnight parking” sign. We stayed here and no one bothered us. Bit far from the city center (1h walk) but for the night it is quiet. 3bars 4G AT&T

name: Dolney's RV Center
description: located on Rt 23 in Pinconning, MI. Friendly staff. Filled tank size class B. No issues to report

name: Eldora city park
description: The cool place very quiet river access and restrooms

name: Recycling Center
description: Recycling center with bins for cardboard, glass, paper, plastic, aluminum, tin cans…maybe more that I didn’t see. Open 8-4:45p everyday aside from some holidays.

name: Bud’s corner laundromat
description: Super clean laundry with bathroom, candy and pepsi dispenser machine, money change machine, $4 washer and dryer $1.50

name: Walmart
description: Great Walmart car park in a quiet area of town, I asked at reception and was told I could park in the far left section of parking when looking out of the door.

name: Snyders Car Park
description: Car park for boat launching, plenty of room to park all day but signs say no parking at night.  Overnight parking at the ferry terminal 1 mile away.

name: Badger Ferry car park
description: We had to wait a couple of nights for the ferry so we used the car park.  Sign says you can overnight here!  Very quiet all night but the action for the ferry gets going at around 7am

name: Showers at Beverly Beach State Park
description: You can walk to these showers from the day use parking lot. Showers are free and there are no signs prohibiting non-campers from walking into the campground or using the showers.

name: Off road
description: Some spot in the off road just 400-500ft after taking a small dirty road. Just for class B vans, not for bigger. Super nice and quiet, plenty bugs (july)

name: Broomfield Town Center
description: small shopping center mall anchored by King Soopers. I asked the manager about overnight parking in my campervan. He said to park away from the entrances. there are working outlets. its quiet.

name: Pull through Rest Area and small trailhead.
description:
Pull in rest area next to road. Large asphalt parking area. Easy pull through parking for RV's. 

Three picnic tables. Pit toilets. Very short trailhead to river overlook, photo opportunity. Mosquito heavy so bring spray.

No rules posted about parking.

No Verizon cell phone coverage.

name: Paint Creek
description: nice cleared out area to set up camp for a night driving while driving i-64.  Some fishing and swimming available in the creek.  it's probably busy with locals on weekends.

name: shower 14$
description:
shower 14$
pilot complex
everything seems to be clean and quality

name: Life Fitness Center
description: $8 day pass. The gym is pretty good with lots of equipment. Showers and bathrooms are clean.

name: Dominguez-Escalante NCA
description: Beautiful place, 15 minutes off Hwy 50 near Olathe. No services but 3 bars internet. If you like solitude and vista's, this place is for you.

name: Nash Rd, Seward
description:
gravel pull off
mm 4 on Nash Rd
overlooking Resurrection Bay and Seward Port.
fire rings

name: FS road, forrest opening
description: So glad we found this looking for the other spots in this area. Nice clearing in forest. Road in was tight and gravel. Toyota 4Runner 2WD made it here just fine in the rain but be cautious. Bigger rigs may have a problem getting in so scout the area before you drive up, no turn around spots until clearing. Target practice galore up here with a ton of shotgun shells and targets, didn’t bother us but pack it in pack it out. Cutest banana slugs all over. Established fire ring. No shade surrounded by forest.

name: Bridger-Teton National Forest Gravel Spot
description:
Follow the road up to Cottonwood Lake, take a left when you get to the national Forest Sign. Large gravel area to pull into. 2 bars LTE w/ Verizon. Spot backs up to private property so be sure you make it all the way to the NF sign before you take a turn off. 
Secluded, some shade and plenty of space!

name: Wilderness Adventure at Eagle Landing
description: Camping, bathroom, shower,  boondocking, rooms for rent, lodging, swim, hike, MTB, tube, Canoe, kayak, check ahead for restaurant hours,

name: pullout
description: pullout on the side of the road, just outside the park. forest roads were slammed with people for the weekend, so just parked here the night before Rainier. no no signs.

name: Big Y Laundromat
description:
Coin Laundromat, also drop off and dry cleaning. Very friendly staff. Bill changer and soap dispenser in store.
Double-loader for 4$. A quarter gets you 7 mins dryer!

name: The Laundry Basket
description: Small reasonably priced laundromat, parking in lot is limited but plenty of street parking

name: Forest service road 302, Kaibab national forest
description: Great spot , we fit a 25ft c class towing a trailer into our camping spot.

name: Deer Haven—BLM
description: Site is approximately .6 miles off main road. Road to site is graded. Very little noise from main road.

name: New Mexico welcome center
description: New Mexico Welcome Center, 24-hour parking maximum, has bathrooms, a spigot for water (marked non-potable) and shaded/covered picnic tables.  Just across the TX/NM border off I10

name: BP Fuel station
description: There is a spigot with hose next to a diesel pump NR 19

name: Coin operated shower at RV park
description:
We asked at the small shop if we could use the shower. We didn't stay at there campsites. They let us, shower is coin operated and they didn't charge more.

6 quarters for 5min. In a blow house on the campground.

name: Eugene Overnight street parking rules
description:
A local Eugene businessman told me this:

Street parking rules - one can park, respectfully and quietly on any residential street in Eugene. An official may stop and check you out but he has to give you 72 hours to move and has at least 24 hours to obtain a move ticket for your windshield, not a fine, so you have plenty of time to stay.  The man says if a local complains, let him.  He said that parking in front of sleeping facilities like motels, and apartment complexes, is discouraged. 

Where is camping allowed? Parking lots people may sleep overnight in a vehicle, camper, trailer, tent, or Conestoga hut in a parking lot of a religious organization, business, or public entity as long as there is an occupied structure on site.

Rest stops- You are permitted to sleep overnight in your vehicle while at an Oregon Rest Area. You just cannot stay beyond 12 hours. It's worth noting that you must be inside your vehicle while sleeping overnight. This is because sleeping outside, either on the ground or on a bench could be construed as camping. 

Please research and be sure. You are welcome.

name: Meade Run (site #5)
description: Space for several vehicles and a short trail 70 yards down to the creek where there is a very lovely camping area with several tent sites and tables constructed around a cooking and fire pit adjacent to the creek. Even a toilet seat on a box 40 yards from the campsite. Nice and quiet. No cell signal.

name: Rout NF
description: Wild campsite off of FS 500 in Big Red Lake Park. Just at the edge of the timber overlooking the park, the site has a rock fire ring with evidence of a fire some time ago. It’s a fairly level spot big enough for a couple of rigs. No amenities at all. Pack it in, pack it out.

name: Fore River Sanctuary trailhead
description: A small parking lot, maximum 4 cars at the trail head to Jewel Falls. No signs for no overnight parking. Great if you have a dog to go for a morning walk. Super quiet. Love the spot, keep it nice and clean.

name: Dump station
description:
Donation based dump station and potable water right down the road from the showers.

Suggested donation $10.

name: Free water
description: Threaded spigot for potable water right next to dump station. Down the road from the showers.  Fills quickly.

name: Cabela’s parking
description: Before making the decision to sleep in this place sachet that you are in one of the 10 most dangerous neighborhoods in the United States during the day it's ok but at nightfall it's at your own risk and after finding things not normal have decided to leave and not sleep there.

name: Pull off/turn around
description:
We got kicked out of the Pinkham Notch/Mt Washington lot (we tried!).
The gentleman mentioned this pulloff. 
No signs stating anything. Very little to no service on this stretch. This is a rather quiet stretch of road at night (esp in winter) and we pulled in close to the island of trees, as not to be visible from the north bound travel lane.

name: Nenana River
description: Secluded and beautiful, overlooking the Nenana River and approximately 60 feet below the Denali highway. Fire ring. Level and large enough to turn around a truck. (Do not attempt to take your vehicle all the way down to the river.) It's a small rocky overgrown trail to get down here with two very tight switchbacks. (Consider going in reverse between the switchbacks.) Expect to get fresh scratches on your paint.

name: Slana Visitor Center
description: There is no free potable water to fill with here. There is a water fountain by the bathrooms only. There also is no wifi here. Today they told me that the road us washed out by creeks and we cannot go past mile 30. They do not know when it will be open again since they are expecting more rain all week. Check at the visitor center before you go.

name: Little Bear Wild Camping
description:
Beautiful camping location on national forest land with gorgeous views of the valley. Multiple spots at this location, which is relatively flat. Road is accessible to 2WD sedans, though the turnout into the camping area has some deep ruts.

Excellent AT&T and good Verizon service if you have a booster. 1 bar without.

name: Little Bear Wild Camping
description: Just off the road. Space for 1, maybe 2 vehicles. Week cell signal (great with a booster).

name: Shadow Mountain #11
description: Most amazing view of the Teton range. There are spots at the bottom of the hill and all along Shadow Mointain Rd. Although when I entered from the north I saw very little spots for 3 miles. Most of them are on the first 5 miles from the southern end. Fire ring available. I have decent Verizon signal. This is one of the larger spots. Road is good, a little rougher the further up but have seen 2 wheel drives passing by. Will need 4x4 for some of the side roads.  Vault toilets at the bottom of the road. This site is next to the main road but there isnt much trafffic. Flies and mosquitos are bad this time of year.

name: Lunar Laundry
description: Laundromat in cute area. Next to some restaurants. There is a change machine, soap dispensers, beverage vending machine, bathrooms, a bunch of seating/ tables. Very clean. Open 6am-10pm. Last load is at 8:45pm (machines turn off so there is no wiggle room there). 3$ to wash(25 mins), ~1.50 to dry (30 mins). FREE WIFI. No complaints.

name: Tesoro - Back of shop
description: Free potable water. Also has free car wash if you get gas.

name: Wawa Station
description: Auto propane available for 65$ first one. Payment by credit card.

name: Canyon Ranch Dr.
description: Spot where truckers park overnight you can go further down the road for a little more quite. Pretty nice cause right across the street is a loves truck stop with showers, toilets, propane, and some food.

name: Point Detour Campground
description: A remote tent campground with about 12 small sites that are set up above Lake Superior. Many have trails to climb down to the remote shore for a swim. One pit toilet, no water. Nice walk to the point with a stairs leading down to an excellent, remote swim spot. Camping is $25-- must pay at the casino in Red Wall (about 15 miles away). Perk is that free showers are available at the casino for campers. This is a quiet campground off some remote (but well taken care of) dirt roads. 2 bars of Sprint. Only downside was a lot of biting flies by the water when we were there mid-July.

name: Tacoma House
description: This is my house! You are welcome to park on the right side of the driveway. One vehicle only please! Maximum of 2 nights. Thanks!

name: Zurich Park
description: Great little town park, back on a farm road mostly away from road and train noise. 7-10 electric spots (30 amp only) and water available nearby (not at sites). Some picnic tables and bathrooms.  Big rig friendly. Big playground for the kids. Shade and grass! $10 per night to use electric.

name: BP Gas station
description:
$8.50 dump station or $7 with fuel purchase. 
$0.75 vacuum right next to it as well.

name: O’Brian Creek Roadside
description: Pullout on side of road overlooking Copper River.   Several fire rings.  I was here during salmon fishing season and joined 3 other rigs here. Room for about that many more.  No amenities.  2 bars of cell service.

name: Forest Rd campsite with Grand Teton view
description:
This is a level spot with a fire ring along the forest road. You can see the top of the Grand Tetons from here. 

Not much traffic driving by. The road is a bit steep but you should be able to get up here with a 2wd. There are other spots on this road too.

name: Sutro
description: Residential parking near the Sutro Tower. This is a steep and tight neighborhood of roads - I wouldn’t drive anything larger than a van up here. I got a level spot away from the houses and stayed really discreet. No one bothered me. There was minimal traffic, and I was here on a Saturday night, so weekdays are probably even quieter. No water or toilets at all. Very slow cell service on Verizon. Near trails through the woods up to the Sutro Tower for a fantastic view of the city. Nice quiet spot for one night.

name: Burl shop
description: Incredible place, houses are fun, check out the roof and cabin in the tree... gallery is way worth the visit!

name: Deer Lake Boat Launch
description:
45.409903,-92.551658
Deer Lake Boat access St Croix Falls, WI 54024
Nice medium sized fully paved boat landing. Porta Johns onsite. No hrs posted, no real prohibitions posted, close to St Croix Falls, nearby state HWY 8 access. Steep paved driveway down to lake. May be a bit busier on weekends during the day. Most parking spaces will have a bit of a slope down towards the water. There are portable toilets onsite.
AT&T phone service is decently usable but better with a WeBoost type phone booster

name: Coon Lake Park
description:
Coon Lake Park in Frederic, WI
There's a nice little swimming area with a fountain. Restroom building with flushing toilets and power receptacles. The water is accessible on Lake side of the restroom building, just a faucet on wall. likely only available during summer non freezing seasons.

There's multiple shelter buildings at park with power receptacles and power on a pole at corner of parking nearest shelters

AT&T phone service is pretty good and has 5G

name: Parry Spring
description:
Parry Spring
43.002789,-88.447186
 Parry Rd, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

NATURAL spring that is well established and protected. There's a bit of space to pull off on shoulder to access spring which is right next to shoulder. 

Near an Ice Age National Trailhead

name: Lind Spring
description:
Lind, WI Natural Spring 
44.2873394,-89.0472249
N1315 County Rd K, Waupaca, WI 54981
At Lind, WI Old Town hall at corner of Cty A and Cty EE

 
Directions:
Spring is located on Right Side of County Road A South just before inersection of County Road EE West, where Old Lind Town Hall sits, and is near Ditch of County Road EE, to the North.

Hope you understand Directions Very Easy to see from CTY Rd A North or County Road A South and County Road EE West , Spring is on the Right when heading South where the Old Lind Center Hall sits, Spring can’t be missed someone put an old fashion Pump and welded the handle open so it can’t be shut off.

Continuous flow.
Open to the public.
Open 24/7.

name: AirplaneHome
description:
WOW! I’m sure your tiny home on wheels is cool, and so is this one, but there’s one huge difference… yours isn’t an airplane. Yeah, you read that right. Come visit Bruce and his airplane home! He is SO inviting, and told me to post this and let you all know you’re welcome to visit and stay here for free, IF YOU READ THE WEBSITE FIRST FOR HIS VISITOR REQUIREMENTS. You must visit AirplaneHome.com and read through it first, and be respectful of his wishes and home. Some notes:

-Steep and narrow-ish driveway but anything smaller than 20ft should have no issue getting up here. You CANNOT park on the road, you must come up the driveway- walk it first if need be. He said biggest rig was a 30 something ft skoolie, but they did have a couple dings from the trees as they tried to maneuver through his property to park somewhere. I’d recommend keeping it under 20ft. My 2WD very low clearance rig made it just fine.
-You may visit during the day or also park overnight on his property, as well as use his hookups and his plane lavatory/bathroom as needed. Permission not required. (I still emailed him to let him know) I had between 2-3 bars 5GE with AT&T.
-You can fly your drone (just not above the tree line in respect to his neighbors) and take any photos/videos you want. You can also climb on the right wing, the top/fuselage, and check out the inside. Very strict on keeping feet clean and no shoes inside or on the stairs.
-He loves to share about his process and philosophies, and is always open to talking. If you speak Japanese he will absolutely love you. 
-Most of the ground is not flat, but I recommend keeping your stay to 1 or 2 nights, and not overextending our welcome here. 
-Dogs are fine and welcome to be off leash AND explore on the wing of the plane if you trust your pup to be safe. There are walnut trees out here, which are highly toxic to dogs via chewing sticks or the nuts, so be diligent. He hasn’t had any issues but I’m paranoid about that stuff. The majority of trees are not walnut but still, just a note

*The inside of the plane is not built out, but it is gutted with a partial build and amazing nonetheless. He LOVES dogs, and will gladly play with your pup and talk your ear off if you’re up for conversation.

name: Little Girls Point Spring Lake Superior
description:
Little Girls Point Spring 
46.580856,-90.277362
Lake Rd, Ironwood, MI 49938 at Lake Superior

Metal pipe draining to a concrete bed. There is parking off the road.

In 2021 there was a yellow sign saying NonPotable…with no indications why

name: Sundown Saloon & Campground
description:
45.714516,-92.394823
Sundown Saloon And Campground, 3508 WI-35, Frederic, WI 54837

Primarily a permanent site Campground but will allow overnight if there's space. 

The Saloon is CASH ONLY and a nice modern bar with some really good large burgers. I believe they're 1/2 lb ea, don't get the double unless you want extra. I think buns are a type of Sourdough. Burgers are sold á la carte and range about $9-$13(double), sodas are fountain and free refills, play some corn hole if you want.
Nice place in the middle of nowheresville WI

name: Abbyland Truck Stop
description: Truck stop that allows overnight parking, free water and paid dump station (timed). Open 24 hrs. Has restaurant

name: Fairly large spot
description: This site is big enough for several tents, or 2 vans. Somewhat covered by trees. No immediate water access, but some close by (streams). Have 1 to 2 bars AT&T service, none on T-Mobile, non-boosted.

name: Brevort (Brevoort) Lake Campground, St. Ignace, MI
description:
Established campsite, dumpsite, bathrooms,water. No power
Beautiful lake views

name: Grand Coulee Dam Water spigot
description: Water spigot in the Visitor Center Picnic area near the Women's restroom entrance.

name: Last Dollar Road (T60 Rd)
description: A small pull out on Last Dollar Road, quiet, easy access, private from the surrounding homes.

name: dirt lot near bridge behind guard rail
description: lots of daytime highway noise and trash but it's a spot for the night. 1 bar Verizon. no signs posted. plenty of room and flat. I parked a small class c here.

name: Fast Eddy's Restaurant
description:
Beside huge sign or restaurant and Young's Motel. Class A parked overnight. 
Allowed. Open hours 6 am-10 pm.

name: Upper WhiteFish Lake Road
description:
Parking area is the size of basketball court, 6-7 vans can fit. Wild camping. Great location 100 feet off gravel forestry road. Mostly flat 15-20 min from whitefish city.. 

I own a 4x4 sprinter van so not sure if I would take a Class A or fifth wheel to this location..

Remember bears are in their home land, be advised.

name: Armour Lions Club Park
description: Beautiful clean. Shade trees, covered picnic tables. 30 amp some pull throughs. Leave some cash in the donation box and be sure to support local business. It’s a community park and a great offering to weary travellers. 40 min off Interstate Hwy 90. Population 700

name: Small Pullout Tucked in Trees
description: Small spot, a bigger vehicle would not fit. Tucked well in the trees, right off the road. Backs up to the stream. No service, not much room to run but nice spot for a night.

name: Off road Knowles creek rd
description: Nice spot enough big for 3-4 vans. Is a quiet open space without bugs (the only one we found on this area after 30 min checking several places)

name: June Bug Campground
description: USGS campground on a beautiful stream. Half the sites back up to the stream popular with rainbow trout fisherman. First come first serve campground. $22/night.  Firewood available. Pit toilets. Soon to have city water, but service was not turned on yet  when I was here. Accepts Senior pass for half price but not other interagency passes. Some Verizon signal, but not for me for some reason.

name: Red River Public Library
description: Small library with outdoor lighted seating and open wifi. Outdoor power outlet too. Coexisting with the museum. Adjacent to a small dog park.

name: Pullout NF30
description:
Lots and lots of pullouts along NF30. I liked this particular spot because it was quiet (took a quick naked outdoor shower in the morning) and had solid 1-2 bars on verizon. A little creek nearby can be heard. Mostly shady so not great for solar. Also, pullouts are not very wide. Fit my promaster just so but not ideal for big rigs. 
Bonus: loads of thimbleberry bushes around. Only a couple were ripe (and delicious!) when I was here mid July. Maybe you'll be lucky.

name: Pacific Ocean overlook
description:
One of many 101 pullouts in the area. Less foggy, better view of ocean, and more level than most of the others. 

Like other spots along highway, be prepared for road noise.

name: million dollar views
description: rocky road getting up but less than a mile from main road, campsite is at switchback, fire ring, million dollar views. no service, 10k elevation, flat. probably not for trailers. done easily in jeep grand Cherokee with roof top tent.

name: wild flats
description: flat, enough spade for a few rigs, shade, yet enough sun for solar panels

name: Shell Parking Lot
description: I used their ATM and purchased some snacks for our trip tomorrow up the Top of the World highway. I asked if we could stay in the lot behind and she said yes. Added photo. Plenty of room for bigger rigs and area for pets to walk around away from the road.

name: Escanaba Municipal Beach
description: Free and open to public from noon to seven every day.

name: Cabelas Dump / Parking
description:
You can stay at the Cabelas. Looks like a regular spot for some two dozen truckers. Nice spot if you’re passing through Indiana. And let’s be honest — everyone who comes this way is just passing through this godforsaken shithole state.

Anyways, Cabelas also has a dump site.

name: City of Palmer OLD Fire Station
description: small building with city water source to fill tank.

name: Dunham Canyon
description: Epic views of the mesas near Bryce Canyon. Rough road would definitely recommend higher clearance AWD or 4x4. Road could easily be washed out so check weather. Fire circle built into edge of cliff. What a find!

name: Kingsburg
description: Really cute old Swedish town. There is a public area near the fire station with bathrooms. Parking around town looks to be all open street parking. I don’t see any “no overnight “ signs.

name: Perks Pier Parking
description: Stayed for 1 night (was open in July the 15th) with an overnight fee.

name: Black Lake Parking Area Roadside
description: Small parking lot facing the lake, restrooms as well as a potable water spigot right by the gazebo. Outlets at the gazebo if you need a charge

name: Laundromat in Joyce - open 7am to 8pm
description: Various sized machines. Quarters only. Plenty of parking for big rigs. Next to gas station, general store and post office. Reasonable prices with top load washers starting at $2.00/load.

name: Another Cramer Creek Road Pulloff
description: Pulloff a little further up the road than the other listing, not super wide but parked here in a truck with no issue. Great lake view, good Verizon signal. A few cars going by on the gravel road during daylight hours.

name: Quiet spot along FS road
description: Tucked in spot away from the busier pullouts. Very private as it’s behind some trees and in a sort of cul-de-sac Sometimes gets one bar of ATT, but usually none.

name: Pelican Point FAS
description: 4 campsites with fire pits and picnic tables. $18 self registration fee. This place is used as a boat launch and is frequented by local fishermen. Very quiet at night, yet close to I-15.

name: Mt Rainier overlook
description: Not the best spot, granted the two spots at the top and the bottom are level, but we made it work in our rig for a night. I work remote so service was a must and had two bars LTE VERIZON. Sometimes would jump to three. ATT works too. You will need to level your rig as it’s on a pull off, existing fire ring as well.

name: Walmart
description: Not bad for a night or two just park in the lot closest to steak and shake. There were several big rig trucks minus their trailers there when I was. No issues but a bit noisy from main road.

name: Cleve Creek Campground
description: Amazing free BLM campground! There are 11 sites, all numbered. All sites have picnic tables & fire pits. Several sites are along the creek & have plenty of shade. The other sites offer expansive views and picnic tables are covered.  Most sites are large and there are several group sites. Two very clean pit toilets. The dirt road is about 2.5 miles and pretty washboarded, but manageable for any vehicle. I was here over July 4th weekend and only a few sites were occupied. It is extremely quiet & great night sky viewing. No verizon, but I was getting 1-2 bars on TMobile at the top sites.

name: WI Rest Stop
description: Basic rest stop with bathrooms, water, picnic tables. etc. Plenty of room for large rigs.

name: Thedford City Park
description: Small city park where camping is allowed.  Water and electric available.  No toilets and trains are loud

name: FS Rd 400 small campsite
description: Small campsite up a curvy steep hill across the street from a gun club private small fire pit wild camping no services I have five bars of Verizon signal

name: Washboard laundry
description: Busy in the afternoon. There is a change machine but it runs out of quarters.

name: recycling at harbour parking
description: cardboard, glass, newspaper and aluminium can recycling. also motor oil collection next to the toilet block (which has potable water spigot)

name: Bed Bath Beyond parking lot
description: There’s no No overnight sign on the parking lights in front of Bed Bath Beyond. But there is signs in the Safeway section. Quiet and no issue. I tried to sleep on the Front St in town, it was quiet until 4am, after that so noisy with many cars passing. (Toilet at Safeway)

name: Ice Age Trail Parking Area
description:
2950-2980 140th St, Frederic, WI 54837
Nice little half circle parking area for the Ice Age Trail.
140th street is nicely paved, 150th is gravel, 135th and 130th is dirt/gravel, 270th South of Straight Lake is gravel but turns to paved but slightly rough further west
Lots of the Ice Age Trails have a Trailhead with no hours or prohibiting signage.
Ok for small to medium rigs and is a pull through

name: Avalanche Campground
description: 13 sites.  Donation-based campground ($10/night suggested donation) along Avalanche Creek. Hiking trail nearby.

name: Mineral creek
description:
Beautiful spot. Solid road getting in. But I’m amazed no-one has mentioned the bugs. Maybe it’s just the spot I’m in. Chose a roadside fire ring to get away from the crowds. It was lovely after the sun went down but lots of flies and mosquitoes. Mostly flies. The campsites along here are stunning but busy in the summer it seems. Plenty of tent sites or if you're willing to walk down from your camper or van. Hopefully just not as buggy as this one site. 
Still chose to stay and do the ice lake hike up the road tomorrow. Just beware. 
Great location and 2 solid bars of LTE Verizon.

name: Scenic Picnic Area
description: Great scenic picnic area next to Littleton NH. Quiet at night, great sunrise in the morning. Toilets available. No "overnight parking" forbidden sign.

name: Spearfish City Campground
description: This is a very lovely city camp ground.  $32 a night without hookups.  There is a stream that runs through the camp ground and it is very close to the downtown of spearfish where there are lots of restaurants.

name: Trinity View Resort
description:
Trinity View Resort. Full hookups both 30 and 50 amp. Tent camping and cabin rentals available. Swimming pool, club house, mini golf, disc golf, showers and laundry facilities. 
$65/night for 50amp service 

It’s an older resort but it was immaculately kept. Plenty of trees for shade and you aren’t packed in like sardines. New owners just bought it and they are so nice.

name: Cherry Springs State Park
description: Very low light pollution here so the stars are amazing. Definite recommend. Open parking lot, level with little bumps, freeeeee, hole in the ground restrooms, no “no” signs - just no tents. Full bars of 5G on Mint/ T-Mobile. Stayed here last night during the eclipse with a full parking lot and wasn’t bothered at all when everyone was leaving. I was the only one to stay so hopefully this is legal. :’) keep it clean, this place was a gem! Happy camping! :-)

name: Castle Tower
description: This is a free established campground. Only facility is a chemical toilet. Nice view of the Castle Rock. This is technically for climbers, but all others use it too. Not that far from the road, but not almost no traffic even during the day. Super nice! Access is not super level, so not really for RV, all others should be fine.

name: Cottonwood Campground
description: Free camping off hwy 287, one abandoned car here. A few picnic tables and fire rings. A ton of mosquitoes.

name: Horse Camp Lot
description: Parking lot before horse camp. Pretty level, lots of fire rings, pit toilets. Quiet. No cellular service.

name: Cabela's
description: Lexington, Ky. Called ahead to make sure it was ok to park. The woman was friendly and said absolutely ok. Arrived just after dark, a few other RV's already in the lot.

name: only for bike travelers
description:
this place is ONLY for people traveling by bike, as there's a fence w a big hole. look at the pictures.

as you walk in in the back of the open area , on the left , there's a path.you can follow it (maybe walking?) and you get to the ocean. I stayed at the beginning of the path. there are some bugs (January 2022) at sunset (545-645pm) but it's fine.

name: baypoint market
description:
Probably only for bicycle travellers or walkers, not RV or motorhomes 

I'm bike travelling. The very friendly man who runs this great sandwich shop and corner store said he has let lots of people camp here. I'm sure you could try?!!

name: BLM Rd 26-2-7
description: came in at 10 pm tired & looking for literally anywhere & found this road. it's a well maintained gravel road that looks like it's mostly used for logging. the whole area is dead so I wouldn't park under any of the trees. we just followed the main gravel road until we came to a closed gate and camped off to the side of the road in front of that. best for cars/trucks/camper vans. when the sun came up & we traveled back down we noticed a few off shoot roads that looked like they may lead to some other places to camp but we didn't get a chance to check it out. very quiet until around 530-6 when we started hearing some logging trucks in the distance but no one came by through the night. decent 5g tmobile service at the gate where we slept. please pack out all of your trash. this area was very clean for the most part, keep it that way!!

name: Brandon park
description: Public park with many tables, restrooms and trash next to a little creek and a waterpark

name: Back of the Museum Bar
description: Had some drinks at the museum and asked if i can sleep in my car, they said it was ok at the back. be careful to not be on the paved site, I was kick out of there at 9 by a security guard :)

name: High above Snake River
description: Single spot on a ridge overlooking Snake River, amazing views and excellent Verizon signal. The trail to the spot is rutted, but I straddled it with no issues. Wouldn't want to attempt it in wet weather, very silty soil.

name: Lincoln Library
description: Fast wifi available 24/7 from the parking lot at the Lincoln branch of the Lewis and Clark Library. No password needed.

name: Raton Aquatic Center
description: New aquatic center. open mornings, afternoons and evenings. day passes $4.

name: Arthur Johnson Memorial Public Library
description: Public library with 25x7 open wifi. Seems pretty fast. Library open from 10 to 6.

name: Public restrooms
description: Public men and women restroom s leased and maintained by the Town of Twisp.  Open 7:00 am to 3:30 pm. Baby change tables.  Fairly clean.

name: cheaper propane
description: great fast service. fair prices. great propane.

name: Forest Lake Roadside
description: We pulled in front of a business and parked for the night. No one bothered us. there is definitely some road noise, but it was a good place to get some sleep. There's also a fishing dock along this side of the lake.

name: Speedway
description: Free potable water in rear.  Also have a dump station in the rear.  Not sure of cost for the dump station.

name: Best Western Oceanside Parking Lot
description:
Stayed in the parking lot of a best western here in Oceanside last night after searching for a place near cannon beach. There were several other rigs in the lot and no one bothered me, didn’t realize til morning it is only steps away from the ocean which is nice. I’m also just hanging out here during the day doing work in my van and no one seems to be bothered.

A little loud with a stop sign right near my chosen parking spot, and car alarms going off and stuff, but that is normal for touristy areas. Would be a bit quieter parking farther from the street.

name: Historic Museum
description: Very nice Museum about Fallon, Route US 50 and the older historic time

name: Ainsworth park
description: Small park with super clean restrooms and a bike self service fix-it station with a pump and basic tools right outside the restroom. Also water fountain and bottle refill. Several loop trails in this area too.

name: Cenex Gas Station
description: Coin Op Laundromat behind Cenex gas station. $1.00 for washing machines. $0.50 to start the dryers. There are also two showers here but I’m unsure of the cost.

name: Cenex Gas Station
description: Two showers in the Laundromat behind the Cenex Gas Station. I’m not sure of the cost or run time but they are here.

name: Bond Beach Park
description: Public beach parking lot. Wasn't too crowded during the day. GATES CLOSE AT 10:00PM SO YOU WILL BE LOCKED IN UNTIL THEY OPEN AGAIN AT 9:00AM. If you're ok with that it is a wonderful, free, legal, quiet spot to sleep for a night.

name: Old Milwaukee Grade Trestle
description:
A pullout on the Old Milwaukee Grade just short of an old railroad trestle and tunnel. Gates close vehicle access on each side of trestle. We camped on the turnaround at the gates. Room for a couple of vans. Slightly sloped but acceptable. Pleasant walk over trestle and thru tunnel for an evening stroll. Easy and good road for 2WD Sprinter.

Great place to camp the night before riding the Route of the Hiawatha. Appears to be the continuation of that former rail line.

name: Gateway Recreation Center
description:
The community recreation center in Ketchikan has hot shower facilities. You can pay for a daily pass, which is $3.00. With that you can use the facilities ( pool, sauna, gym, games, etc.), as well as shower. The fee includes a towel too! 

Clean showers, friendly staff, and awesome recreation facilities.

name: Cow Bell Campground
description: owned and operated by the county of Musselshell in Montana and located adjacent to the fairground in Roundup. About 35 sites under Big Cottonwood trees.

name: Marina Potable Water Spigot
description:
Potable water spigot at the marina
There are two hoses, but I would bring your own
Close to parking spaces but there are a lot of business’ around.  I would come early or late so you aren’t blocking their customers.

name: willow point
description: beautiful southern views of lake mojave, right on the water

name: Private Overlook
description: wide open views, on a bluff high above many other  campsites. several short junipers around to provide shade. The spot is just after a steeper grade change on theleft side. May need higher clearance to make it over the grade change.

name: anttenae overlook
description: spot under the White Mountain antenna towers, with a beautiful view over Bishop,CA. you can see a significant portion of the Sierra Nevada Range including Mt Tom, Mt Humphreys, the Palisades, Temple crag, and many more. It was a bit smokey when we were here but the views were still nice.

name: Red Cliff Campground
description: Free water in national forest campground. No dumping station.

name: Portal Creek
description: Not the nicest camp spot I've stayed at, but flat and has room for multiple vehicles. Road has some rougher sections but should be accessible to most vehicles (4WD recommended). No cell signal but good view of the sky for Starlink.

name: NF55 Turnout with clearing
description: A turnout with a clearing. Largest turnout until this point that wasn't just paved. was able to back in my 24ft rig and be completely off road. could fit 2 large rigs with a bit of room for a fire.

name: City park
description: This is a city park with water connections in several places.  There is also open electrical outlets

name: Teal Lake Carpool Lot
description: DO NOT STAY HERE! possible trafficking, sketchy area. This is a michigan carpool lot, we found it from their website. They are usually pretty good spots to stay overnight, but when we pulled into this one a drunk woman walked up to our window immediately and started asking us to come into her house for tiki drinks, because her husband makes the best tiki drinks. we continued to decline, and she hung around asking us where we were from and such. we locked our doors turned the van on and left, and saw her (rather big) husband watching from the porch, and he continued to watch us as we pulled out, even after she was inside. Maybe she was drunk, but it seemed like much more. I would not recommend this lot to anyone traveling, especially if young or alone, there is another one 10 minutes west. It was a sketchy area, there is no direct address for these carpool lots to locate you, and she was there within seconds of us pulling up, we didn’t even have time to go into the back of our van before she arrived. Be careful, we did not feel safe even after she left.

name: Drummond Island Township Campground
description: Found a nice spot right on the water. Non-electric for $16 a night. It's first come first serve. Nice quiet spot. Has pit toilets and several water spigots. Some sports did have electricity. Good AT&T phone service.

name: Kootenai Rest Area
description: Water available on north wall of the restrooms. Push button. Height is fine for gallon jug, maybe something else close to that height.

name: Tie Fork trailhead, on road 31, close to Huntington State Park.
description: Little open space for a quiet overnight camping. For 5 or less RVs maximum.

name: mohawk coin laundry
description: nice laundromat, very clean. machines take debit/credit cards or coins. free wifi and friendly employee

name: Little Creek Station
description: Small Chevron gas station on the side of the road with a big parking lot. Really quiet. No trucks or noise in the night. We asked the cashier if we could stay the night and he told us there is no problem. Nice view to the mountains. Good place to spend the night. Small grocery store at the station. Also dump station but we didn't ask the price.

name: Harpers Ferry KOA
description: Well established. Pool, playground, showers, great store. Staff are very friendly. Did t like the assigned spot when we arrived, moved us no problem. Lots of RV sites, and lots of campsites with fire pits. Great place whether you need hookups or not.

name: Russell Pond Campground
description: NPS Campground. RV and tent. 25-34$ per night depending on how and when you book. Hot showers 2.50$ for five minutes, relatively clean public restrooms. Host is on site to help with locating a spot. Stayed one night. Lots of space between camp sights. Picnic tables and firepits are at every sight.

name: Straight Lake Parking Area
description:
Straight Lake Public Lot, 280th Ave, Luck, WI 54853.
Corner of 130th St/280th St, all gravel for a couple miles in each direction. Straight Lake State Park is to the South and Straight Lake Wildlife Area is basically surrounding the lot to the East and North Another small lot for Ice Age trail to the west a few hundred feet. THAT lot IS signed as a Trailhead and Fee Area. There's power lines overhead and room for most small to medium sized rigs. The lot is clearly an established lightly used slightly overgrown parking area with large boulders surrounding it. About ½ of it is mostly blocked from view of the road, rather secluded. This technically should be the Straight Lake WI State Park. There's only the one sign, a reasonable person would conclude parking here is ok, but vehicles not allowed beyond the area.

Lots of the Ice Age Trails have a Trailhead with no hrs or prohibiting signage

AT&T service is ok,  not great but usable, service is better closer to Luck and Frederic, gets worse to East and Northeast. A WeBoost gets you much better signal

Directions: from Hwy 48 Turn North on 140th then Right on 280th and it runs right to it. 

The Coon Lake Park in Frederic about 5 mi Northwest on Hwy 35 is a nice place to spend the day 6am to 10pm, there's a swimming area with small fountain, water on Lake side of flushing toilets. There's 120v and 4 prong 240v power on a pole at corner of parking lot near shelters. The shelters also have power.

In Frederic, there's a Dollar General, Holiday gas station with Subway and a hardware store. If you want a really good huge burger, head about 8.4mi North on hwy 35 to Lewis, WI the Sundown Saloon and Campground. About ½ lb burgers and delicious. They are CASH ONLY but do have an ATM in there.

name: I-70 Westbound Rest Area
description: Typical rest stop. Not too big but still plenty of space for vehicles. Lots of trucks but that’s to be expected on this interstate. Bathrooms, snack food area, grass space. All good

name: Rest Area with nice view
description:
Rest Area with around 10 parking lots. Next to street, but quiet at night. 
A few cars stopped for rest or photographs.

Tables, BBQ Place, Pit Toilet. Good AT&T. 

Nice Mountain View. There is a hiking trail as well. 

Stayed one night.

name: Encounter Cove
description: Great place to RV and very inexpensive. Very Christian and family place. Staff is extremely friendly. Short distance to water and fun.

name: Mountain Lake gift shop
description: Free parking close to gift shop. Place where the movie 'Dirty Dancing' was done.

name: Park&Ride
description: This is not geared towards camper/rvs. Basic park & ride. backed right up to I-95 toll booth. cars come and go all night & it's a bit noisy but it's a safe, well lit place if you're in a pinch. I stayed one night & slept fine. Cabela's has a huge lot right behind this one, which is better suited for larger rigs but they have 'no overnight parking' signs so I didn't risk it.

name: Motyka Lake
description: U-shaped pullout along Hwy 63. No signs regarding parking. On a busier road. Probably best for a quick one night stay. Nice spot right next to the lake.

name: Auggie-Morrell Rd NF
description: drove around looking for more than just a pull off on the forrest roads. stumbled upon a few areas with informal fire pits and finally settled on this little nook. no one drove by while I was here, 8:30pm - 10am. Tad bit buggy but expected.  Small pull in perfect for my highlander. Sprinter can fit but nothing more, maybe a small skoolie  1-2bars Verizon, about 2-3 bars ATT

name: Denali Hostel & Cabins
description: Really cool place with a great vibe! Cheapest private room we could find in the area at $140/night, this includes free showers as well as coffee in the common area. The hostel dorm room has individual beds for $65 as well. Definitely check out the pizza place across the street for some good pizza and local beer.

name: Shasta
description: Fire ring  with great views of Shasta right off road. Good shade in late afternoon

name: Arkansas River Rim Campground
description: $5 showers. No time limit! There is also coin operated washer and dryer. Owner is nice and very proud of his campground!

name: Tatlanika RV and Campground
description:
Nice place and a reasonable price. They let us park and sleep in our rooftop tent in the tenting area since we didn't need hook ups; it was $15/night. We ended up coming back for a second night since there is pretty decent tree protection from the wind.
Showers are available for $4 in tokens.

name: Creekside Meadow in National Forest
description: Dispersed camping along a creek in a meadow in Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest.  Large site with easy backing for RVs, Vans, etc.  You have to enter the site from 46 not 46A as that access road is no longer in service.  There is a pit toilet at the site but I did not open it to investigate the current condition.  The mosquitoes do not play around.  Be prepared or be eaten alive.  Site is around 9,500 ft and gets cold at night, even in July.

name: Camp spot with fire ring
description: Great and level place next to the dirt road. We decided to let our car (2dw) on the side of the road (there was plenty space) and just put up our tent on the quite big space next to the fire ring. Could fit several cars (if you are willing to drive on it). Very quiet and level, no cell service.

name: rest stop
description:
specially for trucks.
approximately 5 miles before the spot, it was indicated how many spots were available on site

name: Bulk Potable Water Salesmen
description: .01 cents per gallon, potable water. Easy to find & convenient.

name: Skykomish campground
description: 29 space campground along river with baseball field and play ground in middle. Dry camping. Does have a pavilion that has fridges stove water.

name: Bear valley souvenirs/Sinclair gas station
description: Impeccable showers at the gas station. Five dollars as long as you want.

name: Red Barn Campground
description: Great small town campground. Very friendly with lots of fun activities. The restaurant looked good but we didn’t eat. There is a river that I heard was stocked.

name: Moose Creek Wild Camping
description:
Rocky, tight spot at the end of a dirt road off the main gravel road. Steep, rocky road. 4WD with somewhat high clearance required.

This spot was good for me because I needed a good view of the sky for Starlink. Otherwise there are prettier, larger spots a little further up the main road.

name: Side street next to businesses
description: Obvious camping spot with probably 10 or so permanent residents running generators, but didn’t look horrible for single night. I didn’t stay here, but Kirkland is very safe. Hardly any road traffic.

name: YMCA
description: Free WiFi you can access the WiFi in the parking lot.  No overnighting the parking lot.

name: Northern lights casino
description: Overnight parking is possible in one of 3 vast parking lots, can be noisy as casino is open 24h

name: FS 103 small field boondock
description: Flat, decently shady pull off about 80ft from FS 103. Nice views south. Easy, quality gravel road to get there - any car could do it. Fit our Promaster easily. Could fit 5-6 more vehicles. Nobody spoke to us, but FS 103 is super busy. We saw 40 or more other campers drive by, almost all in huge fifth wheel trailers. Then lots of ATVs and Quads roaming around. Obviously further up the road must be big fig friendly. It calmed down at night. More amusing than annoying, but be aware it's a bust corridor.

name: Huge pullout
description: Huge pullout next to the highway, stayed here overnight when we had a mechanical issue with our trailer. No issues just road noise from the highway but overnight it lessened.

name: Sinclair gas station
description: Hose on the right side of the building. Cashiers’ said it’s good to use though they don’t know if it’s potable. (Assumed it is)

name: A Quiet Spot
description: Small campsite tucked off of the main forest road. Large enough for 2, possibly 3 vehicles (trucks / vans). Someone towing a trailer may be able to turn around but it would be tough. Decent view of the mountain peak to the North. Small creek runs on east side of site. Established fire ring. No Verizon cell service.

name: Gateway Park
description: Parking lot in a park with a football field, tennis courts, baseball field, indoor bathrooms, playground, and more!

name: rite aid parkinglot, VERY safe, clean, quiet, friendly
description: I asked the manager if I could spend the night. no problem. super clean store. safe neighborhood,  park "anywhere". I am just a car, so very unobtrusive.  got milk, water and cereal in the store. right of I 81, very convenient. But very quiet. Store opens at 7. I'll be gone by then.

name: BLM Land with Dispersed Camping sites
description: Many spots on BLM land. Fire pits, pull thru grounds, and wooded. Road is a bit rough but 2WD was good enough to make it up here dry.

name: Rest Stop with spigot
description: Free potable water via a spigot at this rest stop off I-90 W

name: Lucky Peak State Park Discovery Unit
description:
water spigot in field below parking. Assuming it’s potable as it’s in a picnic area and has a drinking fountain attached. $7 per day Idaho State Park entry fee. 
As an aside, There are also picnic tables in the shade here, a great area to paddleboard, and dogs are allowed to swim off leash as well (Only in the discovery unit of the state park). Great place to spend a hot afternoon.

name: Street parking: Oakwood st. + nearby side streets (Mission District)
description:
Street parking in Mission District of SF. I slept on this street and it was relatively quiet and chill. Area is flat. 

You can find parking on various small side streets in this vicinity, many of which are flat/level. (On the bigger streets too, but they’ll be more noisy).

Parking restrictions: in general, streets around here are 2 hr parking from 8am—9pm (sometimes only till 6 or 8pm, maybe) on weekdays, and no limit on weekends. There is also street cleaning which varies street to street, so make sure to look out for signs. Streets that directly border Dolores park have overnight restrictions based on height/length of vehicle. 

Availability of spaces: If coming on a weekend or at night, you can have luck finding a parking spot around here. During the day on a weekday it will be tough.

Safety: can’t guarantee this is the safest neighborhood for your car, but it is at least relatively safe. The Mission is quite gentrified, to say the least, and there are expensive cars parked all over. Nevertheless, there are signs at nearby Dolores Park instructing you not to leave valuables in the car.

Bathrooms: Dolores Park has 2 sets of bathrooms, one on either end (near 18th st and 20th st, respectively).

If you find yourself a parking spot in this neighborhood: get a burrito at Taqueria Cancun or El Farrolito (might be some of the best you’ll east in CA/the USA), have ice cream at Bi-Rite, buy pastries and bread from Tartine (the line moves quick), eat Burmese noodles at Yamo. These are all $15 or less excursions - if you want to spend some money on a special meal, do a little internet research, as you’re in a neighborhood where it will be worth it to do so. Also, mill about Dog Eared Books (used and new). And hang out in Dolores Park in the early eve, where you can feel a little bit of the kookoo wacko energy that once defined SF and is perhaps still holding on by at a thread.

name: Street parking, downtown Point Reyes
description:
Overnight parking/sleeping in vehicle is allowed in Pt Reyes unless specified by signs on particular streets/areas. I confirmed this with the police in town, and then slept in this spot directly across from the police station : )

Nothing special, but town is quiet at night and there is access to lots of beautiful nature right nearby. Plus Brickmaiden Bakery in town is quite legit (open Thurs–Sunday, usually), and the bookstore here is quite good too, especially for nature-related material (fiction and nonfic).

Public bathrooms: in town, on Mesa Road. They are marked on Google maps.

name: Thompson canyon road
description:
Small pullout along Thompson canyon road. Access road is a bit washed. High clearance is preferable.
Temperature is a bit lower at night compared to Thompson spring. Lots of shade. Fire pit. Small creek. No telephone signal.

name: Polar mesa road
description: Spot along the polar mesa road. Shade with huge pines. No trafic. 2 bar LTE AT&T

name: North beaver mesa
description:
Really stunning view from North beaver mesa on Beaver creek,South beaver mesa and several 3700+ m  peaks. You can set you table and chairs right on the edge of the cliff. The spot is totally secluded, and can accommodate a couple of small vehicles. High ground clearance recommended. Lots of shade.
No service. Dangerous for kids.

name: Great view of the valley
description: Small place with a beautiful view of the valley, you can see the glacier. There are two firepits.

name: Walmart Parking
description:
regular Walmart parking
I got there at midnight
planning to leave early in the morning

name: boondock outside Carson City nv
description: National forest rd about .7 miles past the king canyon waterfalls trail head take the road to the left through the gate. There is a site right there.  We went down the road a bit further. The road has some big humps and lots of rocks and loose soil. We drove our 2wd Sprinter Vans here. Huge trees. gorgeous views. everything is very sloped. We were able to find big rocks to level out enough to not roll out of bed. verizon with a booster 4g and 3 bars.

name: Ramp boat/Beach Douglas
description: Quiet And beautiful place! Amazing sunset! Parking is ok. Written “no camping” but house owner around  told us ok for one night no more

name: Highland Park
description: Giant park with trash and bathrooms. There was also plenty of space for our pup to run. There were not a ton of people at the park and there is free parking all around the edge of the park. Decent Verizon signal.

name: Langlois
description: Huge gravel turnout on a very quiet road.  reasonably level with five bars of AT&T. Room for several large vans

name: Cracker Barrel
description: I’m surprised this Cracker Barrel was not already listed. Convenient location just off the highway minutes from Virginia Tech. RV parking is in the back with four pull-thru and a large number of regular spaces.  You know the drill. The night we stayed there were 7+ other campers.

name: ONE City Plaze - Lobby
description: I use the lobby for charging my laptop and using the free wifi. It’s attached to a coffee shop for drinks and food. I’ve never had an issue with not being able to use the lobby other then one time when they let me know when they closed which wasn’t an issue.

name: Clean Machine II
description:
A good size coin-op/credit card laundromat. It has a good variety of washer sizes. 30 or so regular sized dryers. They even have a few XL size washers and dryers. They do offer drop-off wash and fold service. 
Walmart parking lot is right next door and so you could park and walk over if your rig is too big.

name: Moreno Day Use
description: On the lake. No overnight but great place to spend a few hours. Pit toilet. ATT 4 bars.

name: Rivermouth campground
description: Great sites by the river. Had to make reservations ahead of time

name: Egg Haven - with plenty of free parking
description: Historic downtown Breakfast joint with ample free 2 hour parking behind the building or paid parking visibly across the street. Large menu of omelettes and seriously good coffee.  Very busy by 10am.

name: Akeley Cenex
description: I asked inside and they told me yeah go for it. You can find the water spigot and hose next to the left side entrance. I have a small van with 20 gal, not sure about the space for big RV

name: Beer Bottle Crossing
description: Primitive camping area with a strong stream right next to it.

name: Port Orchard waterfront parking
description: Parking lot behind brewery. Free parking on the weekends (the lot next to it is paid parking and has a farmers market on Saturdays). next to a library with free wifi. stayed for one night no issues. Noise from the bar quieted down around 11:30. Nice spot next to the water. Public restrooms open from 7 to 4

name: Berts lookout
description:
Small road off highway first pullout on the right 
Protected from wind decent view low road noise 2 more sites further down

name: Paid Recycling
description: Put your cans, plastic bottles, or glass into machines and get money back. .10 for a large plastic bottle, not sure about the others. You get a receipt you can take into Ray’s market to redeem.

name: Midis Auto service Experts
description:
Received excellent service from Leo the owner and Albert the mechanic here. Excellent for class B or low class C
---
Reçu u  excellent servi de Leo le propriétaire et de Albert le méca ici en. Excellent por classé B ou petit classeC

name: Needville city park
description:
Parking near the park next to the baseball field.
---
Stationnement près du parc à côté du terrain de base-ball.

name: Tia Wuanita's fish camp
description:
Restaurant and golf parking lot. Excellent restaurant
---
Stationnement du restaurant et du golf

name: CoEnergy Propane LLC
description: Propane refilling station. Convenient, 1 mile from Interstate 5. Cheapest propane I have found around here. Was $2.50 per gallon on 23Jul2022. Check out operating hours on Google Maps

name: Old Ferry Landing
description: small boat launch with parking lot. no signs preventing overnight parking. very quiet, no traffic.

name: Mammoth Lakes Laundromat
description: Very clean & there are a lot of machines. It is in a shopping center & the parking lot can get busy on weekends. Three different size washers, the smallest is $3.25/load. The dryers are large & have a minimum of $2.00/30 minutes. Machines take credit cards or quarters.

name: a small, good thing
description:
Pit Stop in Central Pennsylvania.

Wy wife and I own a small bakery in central Pennsylvania. We spent most of the pandemic traveling, and we have a pretty good skills set with van builds and other stuff.

Stop in if you need a place to grab water, get advice, do small repairs, or just take a break for a few hours and have a cool conversation.

I know how rough it is out east to find good campsites or to simply be left alone in the world. If I can help you find a good place to be for a little while I will do everything I can. No promises, but I'll try.

Please email or do the social-media thing if you have a problem that is bigger than normal, or if you need something out of the ordinary. I'll do what I can.

No overnights. Show up here with a bad attitude and you will have a bad time. And a short time. 

@Asmallgoodthingpa

name: Provin Power
description: John Deer Lawn Mower Dealer. Also sells Propane. Will fill a cylinder or if you have an internal tank in your RV, they will fill that as well.

name: Bull Mountain Campground
description:
There are many pullouts and informal campsites along this USFS road. This is in or near an OHV area, but there seem to be lots of campers involved in different activities. On this Saturday night, every location south/east of here along the road was occupied.  This particular spot has a pit toilet and room for 4-6 campers.

This area burned in the last few years so it is mostly dead trees and undergrowth.

The road is in reasonably good shape and FWD is not needed.

There is ATT and T-Mobile cell service, although not strong.

name: Rest stop
description:
ordinary rest stop
overnight allowed
different spots for trucks/RVs
bathroom
vending machine

name: Canoe River campground
description:
Very very American campsite. Big rigs, fire pits, outside televisions and even a wrestling match (see pictures).
There is a pool, an arcade and bad wifi. We where in a weekend so maybe better on working days. But at least it’s another option on the east coast. We paid 42 dollar for a tent site without hookupsy

name: PT Free Public Restrooms
description: Open 8AM-8PM every day. Clean! Amazing amenity to have in town. Keep it nice :)

name: Nice site just off Spring Creek Rd.
description: Space for 2-3 trucks. Exit is 248. Nice shady site jus off Spring Creek Rd

name: Water front park
description: water spicket over by the gazebo. make sure to turn off tight so it doesn't leak.

name: Salisbury Town Wharf
description: Town parking area for 15 or so vehicles, overlooks the Merrimack river and has a dock for accessing the river. All rock parking lot, has a nice statue and a flag pole. Flag pole may ding consistently in the wind. Depending on tides you are either there with just a few cars that are using off street parking or you are there with a bunch of fishermen who come and go from the their vehicles and the dock.

name: Costco Parking Lot
description:
There are signs for a towing company but nothing saying you cannot park overnight at Costco. I Moved over here after getting the dreaded knock at Bellis Fair at 3am (very nice securitywoman, but still got kicked out behind target)

I got to Costco at 3:40am and at 3:45 all the lights turned on and workers started showing up for their day. Reflectix is needed on windows. It was A little noisy with the road behind, but good for a night when you need cheap gas and groceries in the morning

name: Weber County North Fork Campground
description: Large campground with many sites for tents or small RV's. $25/night per site. Quiet and pretty.

name: Susanville BLM Campground
description: This is BLM campground off Hwy 139, outside Susanville CA.  It is 15 min from the  town of Susanville. Has 8 sites and some have rock fire rings.  It is free.  Close to road so some traffic nose.

name: Umpqua River Lighthouse Station Whale Watching Overlook
description: Long gravel overlook in front of the lighthouse. I didn’t see any no parking signs. One bar Verizon. Beautiful view. ATV activity below on dunes regularly but quiet at night. Beautiful sunset. Park on North side away from interpretative sign for less traffic. Great site. No one bothered me.

name: jbear tour
description: Bearviewing tour in Homer Alaska. Perfekt with Chris. saw 15 Bears.

name: Estuary Parking
description: Gravel pull off at water access spot for Harper Park. There are spots to park on both sides of the road, the estuary side is smaller, probably only room for one rig. The water side was large enough for our 22 ft skoolie and 3 other cars, one with a small boat trailer. Beautiful place to enjoy the sunset. Fairly level, we were comfortable sleeping without putting any blocks under. No restrooms nearby. Dog friendly, big field and hiking trail across the road. Occasional foot traffic (people walking dogs and biking) in the a.m. Could be busy during the day with people visiting the park and putting kayaks in the water but was very quiet in the evening. Also right near a Kitsap Transit bus stop. Definitely would recommend.

name: Rocklin Laundry
description: Good clean laundromat with different size machines. Smallest load is $3.75, largest $7.75. Gets a little busy during the weekend. You can park in the back.

name: Forest land above Idaho springs
description: There’s a bunch of spots up on this road on the way to this pin. The pin is where I ended up parking because all the spots below were full when I drove up at 10pm on a Thursday. Ended up being a really nice place to spend the morning. Verizon LTE is decent. Road is bumpy and steep, anything with a little clearance should be fine though.

name: Country diner parking
description: Big lot next to the country diner for RV and trailer parking. Diner is open till 10am. Shared lot with apartments so be courteous

name: Artesian spring
description: Free artisan spring water & free water with spigot at dump.

name: The pointe market
description: Gas, propane, clean bathrooms, small market.

name: Libary good Wifi
