description: Unfortunately only during opening hours and only inside.  You get a guest code (you need one for each device) and can simply log in.  Unfortunately there is no VPN, so some downloads do not work.

name: Johnston Canyon P1 potable water
description: There is a spigot near the entrance to Johnston Canyon at P1 parking, on the building for the bathrooms (closest to entrance). Sign says potable. I think it would be too far to run a hose but is good for filling jugs. This spot gets insanely busy, so I recommend going off-peak hours to get a good parking spot and not be in people's way- I went around 7pm.

name: Miette Hot Spring Showers
description:
To enter the hot springs is $7.75. Once inside they have public showers that you must use before going into the hot springs (soap on the wall). You can also soak in the hot and cold pools, but be aware they look just like regular swimming pools and get CROWDED. There's also a water fountain inside so bring your bottle :-) 
Overall the price was worth it for me, especially after hiking sulphur skyline!

name: Public parking lot north of library
description:
Quiet area sat night (library closed sun and mon). No signs. I was the only van (extended sprinter) but there were other cars overnight and during the day. No one bothered me. Walking distance to waterfront. 

Library has Wi-Fi but too slow to be useful from parking lot. I assume bathrooms are available when open (tues-sat).

name: Covert Township Park dump station
description: This dump station, and adjacent freshwater fill, are located right outside the township park. I assume they're an amenity provided for campers, but there is no signage restricting public use, and it's located before you even get to the office and park entrance.

name: forest rd 160 near kinzua dam
description: state campsite in allegany forest along forest rd 160. numerous sites with fire pit. clean and comfortable.

name: Church parking lot over looking river
description:
Moderator Note: Churches are private property in the US. Please call and ask If overnight camping is allowed.

Very large church parking lot with no parking restrictions. This town is very easy to overnight park in.

name: Dead end street
description: Spent two nights here. End of a dead end street. Lots of space and very quiet.

name: Planet fitness parking lot
description: Free overnight parking. Showers and wifi available inside gym with membership

name: Industrial street quiet
description: Super quiet industrial street. A couple Vans and RVs parked in some streets around. It's a couple intersections and a lot of spots available. No signsat all saying "no overnight parking" or street cleaning. I arrived here at midnight from Saturday to Sunday and left 8:30am. No issues. I recommend this place if you are in Costa Mesa or cities closest.

name: Rio Grand BLM near Truth or Consequence
description: Many, many potential sites along the Rio Grand. First sites are nicer and well established, some with trees and fire rings. Further down is more private but more cows and some garbage. River is very nice and many fishing.

name: Private Caballo cottonwood cove
description:
Very private and secluded covered cove on the lake. BLM land on backside of lake. Must access on dirt roads need 4 wheel drive. Not recommended for trailers or RV.
Very Beautiful!

name: Gila Forest Private View Point
description: Pull off Hwy 15 and wander about 50-100 yards to a view point away from Hwy and surrounded by trees. There are a lot of campgrounds nearby but this is private and free. No cell service.

name: Bluewater Lake Wild Camp
description: Take 612 from Thoreau to the backside of Bluewater lake. The dirt road is a slip in the fence. If you have gone to the State Park entrance you have gone too far. (Note the State Park entrance I’m referring to is the one on 612.). There are many dirt paths and tree spots.

name: Outside of Chaco Canyon Park
description: If campground is full or closed( our case d/t Coronavirus). Go to the south entrance side and head forward Crownpoint Road # 57. Follow the dirt road right beside the wire fence to the end. (Inside the fence is Navajo Leased Farm Land.)Stay outside the fenced land on the park side. The spot is flat and you can turn around. Only attempt if the weather is dry and 4 wheel drive. No big or heavy rigs should try this. It is a place to stay for the night in a pinch.

name: BLM Bluff Site San Juan River Overview
description: One of the best spot we’ve ever had. On a rock bluff overlooking San Juan River. Only 4X4 dirt road very rutted. Hwy 173 to Cottonwood camp ground then next dirt road to left. Follow up to the right to the bluff at the end. Yes campground was closed. Single bar of cell service.

name: Dispersed Camp Sites on Rio Chama
description: 8 sites or so on the Rio Chama. Small motorhomes are making it in. A turn a round at the end. Very flat. Most spots on a back 10 feet above river. Fire rings. No cell.

name: Sand Canyon Trail
description: Unbelievably beautiful trail in Canyon of the Ancients. Multiple ruins along this trail besides canyon view points and stunning rock formations and caves.

name: Top of hill overlooking Red Fleet lake.
description: See “has it all “ description. BLM LAND with ATVing, mountain biking, fishing, and all water sports. There are even fossil tracks. No amenities. Big rigs can get in.

name: Flaming Gorge BLM Lakefront Beach
description: Follow GPS on dirt roads to get to the lakefront location. Several sites available once you get out here. 4 W with high clearance a good idea depending how far you want to go. Beautiful beaches all around. Good cell coverage. No amenities but fire rings.

name: Cle Elum Waterfront River Camp
description: Dry camp right on the river bank. Lots of free camping spots with rock fire rings here. River used for rafting/tubing, can float to Cle Elum Lake. Several large motorhomes have found a spot if patient enough to navigate ruff rock road in.

name: Bonaparte Lake NFCG site 3
description: Great site on a beautiful lake, perfect for small trailers, motorhomes or tents. Lake is warm enough for swimming and has good trout fishing. Forested setting provides shade during hot summer days. Resort store and cafe is ez walking distance. Great family camping. FF pm

name: Natural Bridge Campground spot 6
description: Spacious campground. #6 has the best Rogue River swimming, sunbathing area. A clean solid rock beach and nice pool with plenty of light. The campsite is large and no other sites in sight so private. Pit toilets and fire ring. $15.00 per night

name: 3 Forks Camp grounds
description: reasonable rates for RV and Tent camping. Also provide laundromat and showers to non guest for a small fee. great BBQ and Gas station and biker bar all across the street. Surrounded by Black Hills National Forest. And not far from Mount Rushmore.

name: crystal lake
description: drive up to Mt Hough along a dusty dirt road through some burn areas. Enough room for 2-3 cars in this spot. A couple hundred feet from the lake. Nice spot if you want seclusion.

name: Glen‘s Automotive Service
description: Great workshop if you‘re having trouble with your car. The staff is very experienced and pragmatic. They got us back on the road even though we have a foreign vehicle without any parts available in North America.

name: park n ride
description: no rest room but quite. park n ride. troy Michigan.

name: Barnes Park Campground
description: Excellent county campground!  Beautiful beaches right on Grand Traverse Bay - Lake Michigan.  Wooded campsites, hiking trails, paved biking trails. 2 mins from Torch Lake.

name: Memorial beach Park
description: nice and quiet parking near lake. park has some cars till around 11. after it is really quiet and you are hidden in complete darkness. I have parked there multiple times before

name: Established campsite in NF
description: Easily accessible pull off area just inside the NF. 2 bars VZW. Some cars pass by but otherwise very quiet.

name: Hunt Falls Plateau
description:
A quiet plateau near Hunt Falls with easy access for cars, vans, and small trailerers like pop-ups. 5 well established sites, one is a field with lots of room, created as an Idaho fire management camp if there is a wildfire in the area, else fair game for camping up to 14 days.

Comfortable camp with no mosquitoes in July even when all other camps are swarming.

Short 1/4 mile walk to Hunt Falls and easy access to Priest Lake area. Might have an occasional car or hiker come by enroute to the falls during the day, quiet at night. 

1 bar of Verizon service.

name: James River Bay Campground
description:
A beautiful little primitive campground overlooking rolling hills and Jamestown Reservoir. Fire pits and picnic tables are spread around the area along with one trash can. If you go right at the top of the hill where the sign is you'll see a large mowed field with a patch of well groomed trees in the middle. Nice and level place big enough for quite a few campers to spread out. Absolutely beautiful sunsets can be seen over the hill across the reservoir. $10 per night with honor system drop box. 

If you go left at the sign and down the hill you'll find the lower section which has a pit toilet and boat launch. 1 or 2 people could camp there if desired.There were 2 tents at the boat launch when we arrived

There is a campground down the road called Lakeside Campground. They will let you dump your tanks and fill up for water for free if you show them your camping tag from this site.

name: Water Spigot outside of West Glacier Camp Store/Gas Station
description: water fountain and water spigot perfect for refilling larger 1 gallon-10 gallon jugs. not for RV’s. located on the lawn near the parking lot- just to the side of the West Glacier Camp Store. close to the street.

name: Denali Park wifi
description: reasonable speed free & open wifi from both the cafe and from the visitor centre

name: Large open area between road and river
description: Nothing special but a large, open flat area, easy to access and park-up. Very little road noise. A bit visible from the road, but there is a huge mound that is large enough for all but the largest rigs to shelter behind. As with everywhere around here, mossies are pretty bad in summer. No facilities. Free.

name: WiFi in Deadhorse Camp Hotel. NOT FREE
description: If you need data connection you can buy WiFi here. $5 for 1 hr or $10 for the day. It was a very fast connection when we got it, but it only works inside the building. Ask at the lady at the reception office for the hotel/Arctic Ocean trip, for details.

name: Mossy Woods in Maine
description:
There's a nice gravel pullout on the highway right here and then you can easily walk into the woods away from the highway to set up tent or hammocks and wild camp. Easy to find flat mossy spots between the trees about 100 yards from the highway and the underbrush is non-existent so it's easy to walk in. You can hear traffic but it's not bad. Perfect for a one night stay on the road. 

1 bar cell signal available on Verizon.

name: Mariaville Falls
description:
2 parking lots. A river and falls. Ten spots. We spent the
night with our 24 footer without any problem.
--------------------
2 parkings. Une rivière et des chutes . Une dizaine de places. Nous y avons passer la
nuit avec notre 24 pieds sans problème.

name: nice spot on Bear Creek
description: very nice spot right along the creek. big fire ring. easy access off Forest road.

name: Creek Sleepover
description:
Small spot just off the road to mesa falls.
Spent one night no issues. Many other dispersed campers around the vicinity. Quiet and chill evening. Creek side spot.

name: Mt Roosevelt Rd (2.5)
description: We stopped in Deadwood for dinner and drinks and then found this place in the dark. Gravel road, any 2WD can get to the spot. We’re sitting 2.5 miles away from the library in Deadwood as I write this at the spot. See photos!

name: Kemmerer, Wyoming
description:
Little spot,uneven, for few RVs. 
At the top of Emerald street, that finish in an idle dead end in gravel. Nice view, quiet, a kind of nowhere.

name: Lake Koocanusa Overlook
description: There are a couple of parking spots with a great of the Lake at the end of a gravel road as well as a couple of other places along the way from highway 37.

name: So. of Priest Lake
description: Forest Service access road on the east side of the highway with places to park. Also larger places to park off a short road about 100 yards north on the other side of the highway.

name: McKay’s Bend
description:
This is a very nice BLM administered campground with about 15 hard-surfaced, full hookup sites with tables, grass, and shade and about 15 tent sites on grass. There are no reservations - first come only.
Prices are:
  Full Hookups - $18
  Tent site - $10
1/2 above price with Senior/Interagency pass.

name: Roosevelt NF Large Camp Area
description: Just up hill from the other spot is a nicer area with fire rings and roughly 3 or 4 spots. Low clearance could be an issue to get here but if done carefully could likely make it. I towed a geo pro 12srk up with a lifted 4runner with no issues. No ATT or Verizon

name: Speedway Potable Water
description: Free potable water located next to the building towards the back. Quick fill just need to bring your own hose

name: North Fork Frying Pan Road
description: Large spot that would hold a Class A. This location had several fire rings. One of the 3 campsites was closer to the creek/river but high clearance vehicle would be needed due to large rocks and a shorter vehicle would maneuver easily between the trees. Easy access from the road and site was fairly level and had great solar. Many sites are also along this road. Temperatures were fantastic in late July due to elevation. 42 degrees on our last morning.

name: Near Dug Out Dicks
description: Pull out at the opposite end of dig out dicks just off the dirt road. We turned right after crossing the bridge and went down the dirt until we got the dead end sign. The pull out is right before the dead end sign. We're traveling with 4 motorhomes and we easily fit in the pull out. Ground is a little uneven but not terrible. Has a fire pit made of rock. We planned on staying at Dug Out but there were campers already there. There's a little shade from trees, very little road noise, and a you can hear the river.

name: Point Hudson Marina & RV park
description:
Splurged on a site by the ocean here with full hookups and to take an obnoxiously long shower. 

Smaller park with great views. Didn’t use the coin laundry and coin shower area but they’re available. 

Big spaces for some really big rigs. Couple restaurants on this side and a very short and nice walk to town. 

Not cheap. Ended up being $60 for a Sunday night.

name: Asheville Bear Creek RV Park
description: RV park with full hook ups, pool, wifi, and close proximity to downtown Asheville. The wifi is weak in parts of the park and AT&T cell reception is weak.

name: Haines Place Park and Ride
description:
Large lot with free 24 hour parking. Signs say overnight camping. I came during the day to work and have a place large enough. Hand full of RVs scattered about and boat trailers.

Middle island has trees if you need to escape the sun. Located beside the grocery store and McDonalds

name: Before but "Across" from Lodgepole CG
description: This spot is on the right before the bridge & Lodgepole Campground. Thicker gravel to get down a little hill, spot isn't totally flat. Buttttt once you park, there are tons of spots to tent camp and if you walk a little bit in there's a beach for a swimming spot.

name: Dolores Town Hall
description: Water in park on east side of town hall building

name: Powley Road Campsite 18
description: FREE Campsite with fire pit and pit toilet, just 10 mins from the 10 (unpaved road). There's a nice and quiet lake just five mins away (walking), and the parking is 20m away from the campsite.

name: Little Buffalo State Park
description: Small campground with electricity at some sites.

name: Plate Welcome to Alaska
description:
The famous entry board to Alaska. It seems to be a new place. Surreal this moment of arrival.
-----------------------
A famosa placa de entrada ao Alaska. Parece ser um lugar novo. Surreal esse momento da chegada.

name: Source Motors
description: In addition to gas, they also fill propane.  Only place in Haines Junction.  Coordinates may not be perfect. See Source Motors Gas station nearby.

name: Maverick Campground Cimmaron Canyon SP
description: Nice campground on the cimmaron river with a stocked fishing lake. Potable water available around the campground. Bathrooms.

name: Ellensburg KOA Journey
description: RV park amenities including 20/30 power and 20/30/50 power at sites, water at sites, sewer at some sites.  A mix of pull-thru and back-in sites.  Seasonal pool, bike rentals, playground, self-contained cabin rental.  Restrooms and showers tidy and cared for, although not luxurious.  Some sites back into a view of the Yakima River.  River sites do not have sewer hookup.  Cell service is acceptable due to the proximity to Ellensburg and the truck stops on the other side of the exit.  Very nice staff.

name: Across the reservoir from hotsprings
description: Large spot directly across the reservoir from the hotsprings just below the road. Beautiful view through the trees with enough space for 2 or 3 rigs. Few construction trucks making noise passing by but otherwise quiet. Established campgrounds with vault toilets up the road.

name: Lake Carlsbad Beach Park
description: Free cold showers by the beach park - the lake is also a nice place to cool down in the summer. There's 2 showers by the beach swimming area that weren't on when I was here, and 1 other by the splash park on the other side of the parking lot that was on. Sign there says open between Memorial Day and end of September.

name: Alcova, Wyoming.
description: good and cheap camping $12/day.  Close to a nice reservoir.  picnic Tables

name: Pops 66, Arcadia
description: Saw a brightly lit huge soda bottle and a large parking lot - very tired, just pulled in and went to sleep. No „no overnight parking“ signs, minimal noise from Route 66, no one bothered us, had a good night’s sleep. Bathrooms available when the shop is open; saw electricity sockets on the lamp posts but didn’t use them.

name: USFS Brush Lake Campground - free!
description: There are 6 sites at this USFS campground- all with a fire ring, table and amazing wooden shelter.  The sites are free! There is also a pit toilet at the day use parking lot and one down by the boat dock.  On beautiful  Brush Lake.  Fishing ( bass!), swimming (great rope swing g across the lake), hiking and biking trails. The sites are just a short walk to the lake. Beautiful, clean sites.  Loved it here!  Spent 3 days- sites were full but far apart so dont even notice neighbors :)

name: Lightning Creek Road - dispersed sites
description:
We saw about 10 different sites off of this road back in the woods.  Very far apart.  Need to drive about 6-7 miles from town before you hit the forest service road. Road is in great shape. The sites we passed were all taken- but looked nice right next to the creek.  We eventually found one that was open about 10 miles up the road.  Worth the drive :). And….. FREE!  
** we moved Sunday and found this awesome spot RIGHT in the water.  Huckleberries around too!  Love it!!

name: Eagle Village
description: Very nice place to stay overnight close to a boot ramp. It is absolutely calm. About 2 km upriver the Yukon. beautiful view on the River. Gravelled place, good for small RV or van.  No service. Very few Moskitos.

name: Three Bears
description: Free potable water. $15 dump station. Propane fill.

name: Little Susitna CG
description: $10 dump and flush. Video surveillance. No fresh water without paying for camping

name: Winter Park, Co
description: On street parking, no overnight parking from Nov 1st to May 1st. Good cell service, stayed 4 nights for Winter Park Jazz Festival. No issues.0

name: Mesa Trail Alpaca
description: Such I lovely farm with 50 Alpacas! Find it on Harvest Hosts! For free but kind to buy a souvenir to the shop of the farm! Good visit with owners!

name: Speedwash laundry
description:
Laundromat with good quality free wifi. 
Small load for $2, large one $5.25
Dryer 25 cents per 7 min.
Soap, bleach and softeners available for $1 each. Change machine. Super clean, industrial neighborhood.

name: NF campsite
description: Fire ring. Space for a few rigs. Flat. 2 bar VZW. Very quiet but don’t be surprised if you see cattle.

name: Mountain Bluebird RV Park, LLC
description: Full hook-up RV Park 20/30/50 AMP; water & sewer. Great place for hunting, fishing, bird watching, hiking, kayaking, 4 wheeling & star gazing. Great scenery for photography, wild life, a walking trail behind park and peace and quiet . Good phone signal & wifi provided.

name: Frenchman Coulee
description:
The site is mainly used by climbers, as it is a nice climbing area, but all are welcome.
there's bathroom on site.
It has a rocky ground, so take pads to have under your sleep bag.

name: Wilton Town Forest Campsites hikers or bikers only.
description:
A couple dispersed campsites with tables and fire rings in Wilton Town Forest. Location is accurate - follow the path from the northwest entrance to the forest for maybe 5 minutes on foot. Also listed on Google Maps.

No water, no power, not for cars or vans. Would be good for hikers or bikers only.

name: 12 hour RV parking
description: We stayed one night. Quiet and convenient. Trash and bathroom is helpful. Right in the middle of town next to a park/field. Police station nearby too. Good for a quick overnight.

name: White river national forest
description: Dispersed camping with a gorgeous view near the vail rest area

name: Little Beaver Campground
description: NPS Established Campground on Little Beaver Lake.  Very quiet and peaceful. No Cell service! Fishing and a boat ramp. Electric motors only.

name: Junipers’s Restaurant
description: Great stop for dinner!  This restaurant with a separate bar and beer garden, is at the Wildflower Inn.  Really good food, everything on the menu is, or can be, gluten free.  Spectacular views.  Lots of craft beer, specialty cocktails, and wine to choose from in their bar , the SpokeEasy.  If you have a big rig, call ahead and they’ll tell direct you where to park.

name: Murphy Express Gas Station
description: Free water source between gas pumps 6 and 16. Can attach hose to fill camper/RV tanks. Clean bathrooms too (stalls, not private).

name: Wayside park sanitary dump & water
description:
Free dumping and water. Clean and convenient.
Water for cleaning and separate tap for filling water tanks! Easy access in and out with big rigs

name: Hague/Silver Bay
description:
Lake George, Bolton Landing, Hague are so busy! So hard to find a place to overnight that is not just a wide spot in the road. 

Found this little keyhole shaped camp spot in the Silver Bay Hague area north of Lake George on Route 9N, near the Clay Meadow trail head. see image for GPS. Round-ish camp area surrounded by trees. Hwy access point is a perhaps 20 ft wide. Drive too fast and you'll miss it. Wild camping in the Adirondack Park. NO FACILITIES

name: Peat Ponds Wildlife Area
description: Small parking lot with room for 4-5 cars or small vans overlooking wetlands area. Fire ring. No other facilities.  Could have mosquitoes but wind kept them away. Some minor road noise and distant train. Owned by Alaska Land Trust.

name: Moose river
description:
Small and quiet campground.

Wooden area.
 48 RV and Tent sites along with 3 Year-Round Cabins. The Campground is under new ownership

name: Niobrara County Fairgrounds, Lusk, Wyoming
description: a very large parking, empty when no events occurs, very quiet, closed to a baseball field, both in asphalt for RVs and grass for tents.

name: grand teton view
description: best view ever dry camping not crowded under 30 ft

name: Tangle Lakes Campground
description: tangle lakes campground - BLM $12/night. not too cramped, raised tent sites, a few pull through sites for big rigs. in tangle lakes with tons of fishing access around for arctic grayling. when we were there the were practically jumping on our flies. be warned - TONS of gnats and flies that drive you insane (thus our insane net setup) but it was worth it for the fun fishing for us. also blueberries growing on small hiking trail around lake. lodge nearby a mile or two towards cantwell.

name: Rio Grande NF
description:
Follow 149 N out of Creede for about 6 miles. Turn left on Middle Creek Rd. Follow to FS523. After about 3 miles or so on FS523 there is an unmarked dirt track which goes off to the left. Follow for about .75 miles on this rough dirt track and you’ll come to a ford across a small creek. Cross the creek into   
a huge open area. Lots of spots, many with fire rings, very private area along the tree line next to the creek. Our site cannot be seen from the road until one crosses the creek. You’ll hear them coming. Fantastic views and a night sky sparkling with more stars than you’ve ever seen. No amenities. Pack it in, pack it out.

name: Eagle Valley Campground
description: very nice county owned campground established by the Fraternal Order of the Eagle.   Dump station only $1. WIFI available.  dry camping and hook ups available. showers are hot with good pressure.

name: Port Freeport - Amports Inc.
description:
This is where you go to pick up (or ship I assume) your vehicle if you ship it via RORO to Freeport, Texas. Call ahead of time (979-482-5000) to make sure that your vehicle is cleared and ready to be picked up. I had to pay the shipping company another fee and clear customs before they would let me pick it up. Bring your bill of lading or arrival notice with you, that's all they needed. They check online to make sure it has passed customs and the shipping company has released it. It took a few days for them to unload the vehicles and reconcile them in their system so make sure you confirm with them ahead of time that it is ready to be picked up. 

To get into the port you need a flourescent security vest so bring one with you or buy one when you get there for $10.

name: Lewis and Clark National Forest
description: Open field a few miles down the gravel road.  Creek down the hill. Could fit big rigs here, made it easily as the road is well maintained. More people than I thought. But still a ton of spots off the gravel road you can chose from. Watch the weather - it started to hail a bit.

name: US Customs & Border Protection Office
description:
In order to import my vehicle (shipped to Freeport) I had to come to this office and get clearance for it. Please note, you cannot complete this process at the Customs and Border Control Office in Freeport, you have to do it in Houston. They basically do a return of your vehicle if you drove it out of the county and shipped it back like I did. They needed the arrival notice, bill or lading, my passport and the title. They are on the 9th floor, small office. I went in the afternoon and was in and out in an hour. 

Phone number - (281) 985-6700
Email - CEE-Automotive@cbp.dhs.gov, HOU-BRANCH2@cbp.dhs.gov

name: Milner Recreation Campgrounds
description: Pulled into one of the sites along the Snake River with no table or facilities of any kind but some old campsites were here. As other people have said, there's a lot of trash around which really sucks. but the setting on the Snake River is beautiful. My site is just several hundred yards from the main road where there is a public restroom.

name: Desabrais laundry & dry cleaning
description: Laundry & dry cleaning, the restroom offers a free shower as well!

name: Nortic Trailhead
description: Highway 20 pull off for the Nortic Trailhead. Giant parking area good for big rigs and trailers. Pit toilets on site.

name: Burnt Cabins Grist Mill & Campground
description: A quaint RV Park tucked out of the way in Burnt Cabins, Pennsylvania. Took me about 30 minutes to get to from I-84 with roads getting smaller every few miles and lots of turns along the way yet the campground is located right next to the Pennsylvania Turnpike. Turnpike traffic isn’t too loud and kind of tranquil. The campground is surrounded by trees and next to a tiny river, the area itself also has something for history buffs. Bathrooms gave me some Silent Hills vibes at night but the showers worked great. Spots have either power/water hookups or power/water/sewage, there’s also a dump site and dumpster on the campgrounds. A couple of the attached photos contains more information on the campgrounds taken from the Passport America app. The campgrounds is big rig friendly, just realized I clicked the wrong entry.

name: Pine Lake Ice Age Parking area
description:
Pine Lake Ice Age Trail lot. 70th st near 267th 
Hwy 48 is pretty rough…be prepared 
Small lot and  no prohibitions/hrs posted 
AT&T service pretty bad in the area, better to west near Luck and Frederic, gets worse to East and Northeast. Multiple towers nearby likely other service is better. With a WeBoost you might get 2-3Mb DL in the lot otherwise about .5Mb if you get a signal at all. There are multiple cell towers around so I'm assuming other services are better 

Lots of the Ice Age Trail heads have a public parking area

If you happen to get Stuck, Search\join Facebook group 4x4 Rescue Wisconsin(or any state) Only for emergency/stuck broke down out of gas situations. Have GPS coordinates prepared

name: Eau Claire Public Hunting Lot #1
description:
Eau Claire Public Hunting Lot #1, Riverview Rd Fall River, WI 54742.
0.3 mi of dirt/sand rd/trail off Riverview Rd. Trail/Rd. North of the lot is gated off to vehicles. Approx 0.75 mi Northwest or Northeast to the River.
Directions: Off Hwy 12 Take Oak Knoll Rd North then at T with Pine Rd take Left or West then take first R or North onto Riverview Rd. At end of pavement, continue straight or North to sand/dirt rd to lot. 

The place is fairly secluded but locals use it to hike and dog walk. The lot is rather small and there is not a lot of room to turn around. It's only 0.3 mi off the pavement so walk it first if you're not sure. End of paved road area there are  'No Parking' signs on both sides. The dirt road is a bit narrow with a couple dips. One spot is soft loose sand near paved road end. With a little running start, any vehicle should get through no problem.  It's short. Otherwise, path is hard-packed sand.
The lot is small and I wouldn't suggest anything larger than a long van etc. And for a trailer more than maybe 14ft is gonna be tight to turn around 
AT&T phone internet is a little slow but usable here. Other service may work better.
There seems to be lots of Public land near the river.

name: Dutchman Lake Dam
description:
Dutchman Lake Dam 
37.489487,-88.913805

There's a large circle at the bottom of the driveway as well as 2-3 sites across driveway that are small.
The road in is all gravel and about 1.5mi long
 
This is Shawnee National Forest, there is a Falls I didn't see and a steep boat ramp for the lake. There's a few people that seem to drive down to bottom of dam turn around then drive out…kinda odd but no big deal.

There's a Natural Spring from the rocks kinda Southeast from the bottom of the circle driveway. The ditches sort of lead to it. Easiest access is from uphill on the driveway then east to rock wall and follow downhill. It's NOT easy to reach but is kinda cool. There is a big grate over it. Probably need a PVC pipe stuck in there to reach it. Approximately here 37.488942,-88.914119

The Dutchman Falls should be about 37.488916,-88.914212

NO more vehicle access across dam but can hike over it.

name: Corral Creek Ranger Station
description: Large, flat pull out next to Ranger Station on NFS road in the Bridger-Teton Forest. The road follows Greys River off of the Lander Cut-off in the Wyoming Range. This camp spot is below Wyoming Peak. It has great access to the river and good fishing for fine-spotted Snake River cutthroat trout. Very little traffic, one car drove by last evening. Beautiful starry night sky.

name: Union Pass #2
description: Further along the road, we found a single place 200 yards off the road at the top of a slight rise. The access road is a jeep trail-type road, two well-worn ruts, but not too deep, clean and passable. Room for one (van, camper, tent, car, etc.)

name: Mckkays
description: Water fill near the deli. Pay at the cashier.

name: FS 2248
description: Nice pull through site not very far from the road. Road noise is noticeable but not bad at all. Plenty of pines whispering away.

name: the better option
description:
Drive a mile further when you are on the first marked spot here!

Its a lot more quiet and has firepits and the best... No train!

name: creek run site2
description: nice place off the forest road and pretty secluded.  we camped here for 2 nights and 3 days and saw 3 cars and a sxs so very little traffic. You need to get a permit to camp here but it's free to apply online.  Had 2 bars of Verizon 4g.

name: Lone Pine library
description: Potable water spigot in front of Lone Pine library east entrance. ask permission inside to use.

name: BLM Camping
description: This is the first campsite we came to on this road. The road is a little rough and will require high clearance and possibly 4x4. It is quiet with no vehicles passing while we were here.

name: Pine Mountain Creekside
description: Level spot off USFS 613. Small fire ring and near reliable water source. Out of sight of main forest service road. More sites available higher up the mountain but this is a nice secluded and shaded spot.

name: USFS 613
description: Large, flattish, shaded site along USFS 613 located in the third switchback. This site is 2.7 miles from the main road (Fairwood Road) and could accommodate 3 small rigs comfortably. The road getting here is rough but doable with 2WD.

name: The Scales
description: This is an amazing, large open mountaintop field at 4637 feet. The Appalachian Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, and several other trails cross here. It can be a busy place on summer weekends, especially in early to mid August when wild blueberries are ripe. Expect to see wild ponies grazing the hillsides. There is a bear box available and pit toilets. Fresh piped spring on the road up to the Scales on the left at mile 3.6.

name: Three Eagle Trail Head Parking
description:
Small parking lot off the road. To pull in at night and leave in the morning just fine. 
We were here with 30ft RV, tight to turn around but worked.

name: Exxon VAC/Air Machine
description: Water available next to vacuum. No lock and easily able to pull up next to the spigot.

name: Target parking lot
description: I’ve crashed in my car/suv camping set up here a few times. There was an older large RV parked by the Capitol one bank for several nights while I was in town. I left and came back a month later and the people were still parked there. I would see them go fly their signs for money. Safe place to park with no issues over night.

name: Blowing Springs Campground
description: USFS campground, pay on site, $12/night.  Open March 17 - December 6. Vault toilets and drinking water on site.

name: Roan Mountain State Park
description: Very nice campground.  There are spots for RVs and tents.  All have water, some have electricity (I did not see any sewer).  The staff was awesome and there are hikes to do, a river runs through the campground.  Overall very nice. $20 for a tent spot with water only.   Not sure how much for electricity.

name: Uncle Nicolas’s Inn- camping at Copper Center
description: $25 for sites on the river- great for smaller rigs. RV sites are not as great. Beautiful river location with showers. Also has a great burger stand and the bar has a huge large-scale LGB trainset with a complete reproduction of the Kennicott mines. Images on the bar walls are like a museum.  Def worth a visit.

name: Devils‘ Rope Museum
description: Small parking lot in front of the museum. Pulled in at night, there was no one there to ask, no "no overnight parking“ signs, so we stayed. Nice Lady at the museum said next morning, it was ok and we were not the first to stay here. Bathroom inside the museum, when it is open. Some traffic noise from the Interstate, other than that quiet, had a good night’s sleep. And the museum is fascinating, by the way!

name: Street parking, old town Florence
description:
Quiet street parking just on the edge of the Old Town center of Florence, which has various restaurants/shops.

This is a commercial street, not residential, but there isn’t much on this stretch and it’s quiet. Very few cars and people passed by after dark or in the morning.

Public bathrooms: a few blocks away in Old Town center, and when I was here there were two porta-potties in the parking lot across the street too.

3 bars of AT&T

Confirmed with police that it is legal to sleep in your car and park overnight in Florence unless otherwise indicated by signage

The other iOverlander location marked nearby is on a residential street, which I did not feel as comfortable with. You’d stick out on residential streets around here with single-family homes/driveways and not too many cars. I usually try to avoid residential streets unless they have apartment buildings and are densely populated with parked cars, out of respect for locals who might feel uneasy having people parked outside their homes overnight.

name: Flagler Recreation Area
description: Approximately 5 sites with shelter and picnic table surrounding a reservoir (currently dry).

name: Recycling containers behind Walmart
description: Large recycling containers behind the store.

name: arapahoe NF
description: rough road near CDT. recommend high clearance

name: Park & Grove Pullout
description: Street-side pull off at the intersection of Park Ave and Grove Ln. Small dirt lot that can fit 3-4 vehicles. Parked here from 9pm to 10am in our 24ft motorhome (not stealth) and were not bothered. No “no parking” signs. Fairly quiet during the night and felt safe since it is near a residential area.

name: Bartlett City park/alley
description: Circled through town just to check it out.  Found this place to dump the sewage.  Across from city park. It's on a side street/alley. It's free and unlocked.

name: Taylor RV Park
description: City owned and operated RV park with 6 spots. $15 for full hook up, electric $7.50 or sewer dump only.  No reservations needed.  Paybox at location.

name: Lake Sylvia State Park
description: Paid showers near the lake/playground. Showers use tokens, not quarters. Tokens can be purchased over by the camping office. 1 token = 3 minutes and you can get 2 tokens for $1.

name: Ruffin Rd
description: A stealth site for overnight. Good for vans and small trailers

name: Alaska  RV Center
description: Had electrical issue, served us immediately. Reasonable rates.

name: Home Depot
description: Crashed here a few different times with no issues. There is a Taco Bell and gas station in the same shopping area. Gas station is 24/7 and the Taco Bell is open until 3 or 4 am. If you’re a light sleeper you may want to stay away from that side. There were a few different vans parked in the lot along with a big rig. If you have a large RV, there is a road on the back side of HD where I’ve seen others camped for a day or two.  It’s a long road that dead ends. So, there should be zero traffic back there unless it’s a rig coming/going. Cheers.

name: Gravel Pit
description: Large gravel pit next to Denali highway. No traffic noise at night. There are several fire rings and a porta-potty. If you go down the road on the right side you cannot be seen from the road. Good Verizon cell service.

name: Roadside
description: End of the road in a residential place. Enough place for 2 or 3 RVs. No big rigs. we asked local people and they said it should be ok. we stayed there until 10am and no one bothered us.  Follow a small path to the beach to see a beautiful sunset.

name: River Birch Campground
description: Nice campground with long pads for any rig. Lots of sites right on the Mississippi River. Tons of dragonflies!

name: Harstad County Park
description: County campground on the Eau Claire River with 27 first-come first-serve campsites. Potable water from hand pump. Pit toilets and no electric available. Canoe/Kayak launch. New playground area. Spacious campsites with foliage between most (some arranged for small group camping.)

name: Planet Fitness Parking Lot
description: Usually 1 or 2 other vans parked here. there is a highway near by so there's sometimes a little noise. I've parked here for weeks at a time with no issues. There's also an excellent coffee shop nearly called WhereUBean with great wifi and they don't mind people working there all day as long as you buy a coffee.

name: Como Lake Rd
description: Turn left off the main road onto a small dirt road and follow it till you see the large fire pit. The road is good to travel even during rain.  Great spot. Cell service and several channels of TV. Some bugs later in the evening and the cows showed up in the morning

name: Off Hwy26/287
description: This is some lovely free camping in Wyoming less than a half mile off the road down an easy dirt road. Plenty of space. We had a family reunion here with over 100 people and multiple RVs and trailers. Easily accommodated. Beautiful stream running behind the camping area.  There were no facilities, however within less than a quarter of a mile there is a pit toilet. For water, I can refill my RV van from the creek running next to the campground. This is Wyoming so nights are cool and days are hot and very sunny. Highly recommend this campground. And free.

name: End of road
description: all the spots lower down were taken, so decided to make a right onto a smaller road.  Low branches, but I made it with my Promaster, although a few branches needed to be cleaned off.  Spot is decent sized, very private, has a fire ring.  Lots of shotgun shells around.  obstructed view of Mt Rainier.  Starlink works with occasional obstructions.  no cell service.

name: Palo Duro Canyon Sagebrush Campground
description: Established campground, reservation online or payment at the State Park entrance. All sites with electricity, water, picnic table, fire place. Showers & toilets ok. Very quiet. In walking distance to the Amphitheater for TEXAS - the outdoor musical.

name: Noxon
description: Established campground with no amenities. Several beautiful spots right on the lake, with fire rings but nothing else.  Nearby gas station has a toilet available.  No mosquitoes or biting flies, but lots of other wildlife including bald eagles.  Low road and train noise compared to most of the valley.  Camp host stopped by and said there was a two week limit. Good for class B, small class C, and I saw an airstream, but there are limited spots to turn around so trailers may be iffy. T-Mobile but Verizon was roaming.  Highly recommend this peaceful spot.

name: Fox Hill Motocross track lot
description: Parking lot across road from Fox Hill campground. Campground currently closed. Empty lot at head of motocross track. Great views. Some random cars heading up the forest road.

name: Brevard County Rest Area
description:
This rest area has plenty of parking for all types.
Clean bathrooms and a variety of vending machines.
A safe place for an overnight stop.

name: Forest Service Road 187
description: Near Pine Top AZ. An area big enough for a few RV’s, including bigger rigs, currently it’s a bit muddy because of the rain, but it is set in amongst tall pines which provide shade.  No services, T-mobile can’t seem to decide whether I get 1 bar or all of the bars…

name: Dump station
description: Very fast water pressure and cold water. Quick and easy. Free. Potable.

name: Atlantic City Campground
description: $6. Nice quiet place with water and pit toilets. About 2 miles from Atlantic City and South Pass City.

name: Hostel California shower
description: There are showers here for $5 including a towel. Nothing fancy but it’s pretty clean.

name: Street parking
description: Street parking with afternoon shade when facing SW. Wide residential street with no signed parking restrictions. cross street: Claremont and 31st Street.

name: Lakeside Rest Stop
description: Quiet rest stop on Lake Pepin. Good amenities. 10 hour stay  limit.

name: Pilot Peak
description: Historical marker on BLM. Quiet and scenic. Good reception. Pretty spot for the night. Epic sunrise. Easy on/off freeway. Cheers!

name: Dog Park Water Spigot
description: Spigot located in a dog park. would be good to fill up small containers of water. No indication if potable, but I would assume it's fine city water.

name: Huntington City Beach Seasonal RV Park
description: Super hard to get potable water in this area. There is a water faucet next to the dump station of the seasonal (closed for summer) RV park...that is running during the off-season. Area close to the intersection of PCH and Huntington. Not the fastest fill but, for $15 to park here for the day, it's a deal.

name: Brandywine Creek Campground
description:
Located in Lyndell, PA, Brandywine Creek Campground is a wooded, tranquil campground situated on the banks of the trout-stocked East Brandywine Creek, with several acres of manicured lawns and a large fishing pond. This Pennsylvania campground is close to Historic Philadelphia at only 32 miles away (with nearby regional rail service readily available), as well as also being the closest to Valley Forge National Park, at only 21 miles away. 

Brandywine Creek Campground has more to offer than just a place to park your RV, trailer or tent. Enjoying a dip in their inground pool, fishing,  or playground activities. The pet-friendly campground is open seasonally from April 1st to November 1st. All of their RV sites have full hook-ups. Ice and firewood can be purchased on site for your convenience. The campground borders Marsh Creek State Park, connecting you to the Park’s miles of hiking and biking trails, as well as boat rentals and great fishing.

The Campground’s onsite amenities include: 50/30 amp electric service, sewer, water, Large level pads to park on, bath house with private rooms, laundry facilities, inground pool, playground, fishing pond and free WiFi.

name: Pull out
description: Fairly flat pull out with fire pit and room for multiple cars or tents. Massive view of Mt Baker. Enough room for a bigger rig to back in but I doubt you’d take anything big up this road. Road getting up here has major pot holes, high clearance recommended.

name: Rest Area
description: Parking, bathrooms, vending machines, large rig parking, typical rest stop.

name: Riverside
description:
A large gravelpit next to the road with no facilities.
Can take >10 vehicules.
Leaving the highway to enter the place is a bit steep (not for long RVs).
2 sites directly by the river, where the "water noise" is louder than the "highway noise", both very nice spots.

name: Seville Mobile Home Park
description: Well established campground. A mobile home park that has several RV spaces, Laundry, Restrooms and WiFi. it's a bit dated but a good option if visiting Miami and Fort Lauderdale area. In the evening you can enjoy the breeze coming from the ocean, not many mosquitoes and at night this is a really quiet place.

name: Planet Fitness
description: 24 hour gym half the week - great for showers and friendly staff. Absolutely NO PARKING overnight.

name: North Forest Service Rad 201
description: Established spot at beginning of Blue Bell Flat trail.  This short road has a handful of places off Hwy 39, a few which are RV accessible, but no amenities.

name: Cottonwood Canyon Campground
description: Small campsite. Amazing views. Free. Large sites - good for RVs. Tables and fire pits. Toilets, but no water. 5 miles up a gravel road, but good condition. Next to trailhead into spectacular canyon. We are so grateful such places are provided for free - amazing.

name: The Marble Hub WiFi
description: Please buy something from this business if you want to use the wifi. Can use after hours.

name: Walmart 3550 Cummings Highway
description: Several overnighters spotted here, Work trucks, semis, campers, and cars all sharing this space respectively and responsibly. Many shops, hotels, and gas stations nearby for convenience, as well as highway access nearby.

name: Canaveral National Seashore Entry
description:
$20 per vehicle 
$10 for walkers and bicyclists 
$40 annual pass
Seashore closes at 8pm

name: Nena Trailhead
description: Park and walk along the lake. Some information on site. Not scenic, but looks like a long path.

name: Everglades Holiday Park
description: Public park with paid airboat tours, small animal show, and a store and small restaurant on site. Boat rentals offered. A place for fishing, boat docking, parking, and free water refill at the water fountain. High end place in the swamp.

name: I-95 Reststop Mile Marker 133
description: There is a North bound and a South bound location. The parking is spread out in an O shape around a nice green park. This location seems to be busy, but isn't too noisy for a reststop and is far enough from the highway for a good nights rest. There is day and night security and grounds keepers. There are pavilions, bathrooms, vending machines, and trash bins.

name: Avalon State Park
description:
Bathroom, after swim shower, and shaded picnic area.

$2 per vehicle pay at station. Don't risk sleeping along the shore it is monitored 24/7 undercover by various methods and will get you caught.

The parking lot small. Walking the beach to pepper beach park or farther and back is worth it.

State park is nearby

Park closes at 7pm

name: Santa Lucea Public Beach Access
description: Parking lot that has interesting history of native Americans and quick access to the ocean. Has a shower for after swimming, but no bathrooms or lifeguards.

name: Wendy's extra parking
description: A spacious over night spot for a fast food joint if you want to be in Miami. It's in a lower end area. its located next to the highway so there is much noise

name: Bridgeside roadside spot
description: There is a gravel turnaround spot next to the busy bridge that over looks the water. The spot is very noticeable from the road. Great view of the stars here, but heavy bugs.

name: LMCU parking
description: The beach parking is paid and can get full on the weekends. If you don't mind a 30 min walk to the beach then this is a good place to park since this branch is closed on the Saturdays and Sundays.

name: Bowditch Beach Park
description: A nice beach somewhat hidden at the end of the road away from the Time Square area. The location has wilderness on one half and developed rest area on the other half. Some white sand and shallow waters. Bathrooms, Showers, and picnic area near parking. I don't bother paying for parking. Be aware there can be heavy traffic along the 865 on the island during the day that is slow!

name: Punta Gorda Military Heritage Museum
description:
A wide variety of peices on the inside from different time periods. Also there is a cool flight simulator. 

Nearby is an art gallery, the historic train depot with black history, nice parks, wildlife sanctuary, and Fisherman's village.

name: Times Cir road parking
description: located behind the wawa gas station some vechiels park overnight along this road. At night there's not much traffic, but there is morning traffic noise.

name: Near Planet Fitness Parking lot
description: The planet fitness is open 24/5 and the day pass is free to try the first time so it's worth trying. But connect is a series of buildings that wraps around the corner and some of them are empty making it a good spot to park over night. This area of town is a little run down, but it is next to highway access. There were a few big rigs parked in the back and in the front.

name: Grocery Parking lot
description: There is an extended parking lot next to the building after the power lines that is empty and well lit, but it is next to a busy road. Also on the opposite end of the strip mall is a 24/7 gym and plenty of nearby restaurants.

name: Linville Falls and hiking trails
description: The falls are nice to see, but the area also offers several different trails from easy to climbing rocks hard. Plus there are many different dispersed camping sites for free. The gravel road gets worse the farther you drive down it.

name: Buzzards Roost Camp
description:
This used to be part of a trail, but was closed off as you can see 2 big holes were dug by a tractor leaving 2 separate neighboring semi-trailer sized parking spots along the gravel road which is why the map is incorrect here. This is the deepest spot into the woods along FS 288 / Harmon den rd which is a low traffic road. The spots are fully visible to the road, but It's a good spot if you want to be left alone. Possibly a good backpacking spot to park.

Note that this is on a 1 lane road that doesnt always have passing areas for on-coming traffic and has many blind hairpin turns. The gravel road is steep, along a big cliff, and has some hidden potholes in areas, but drove up it in a low clearance vehicle with only a few bumps. Driving between 10-20mph takes about 35 minutes to drive to this spot from the damn entrance.

Barely can hear the highway in the forest at night, but treefrogs are quite active here starting around 9pm. Seen a small black bear, but it quickly ran away when it saw me. Keep food and trash packed away.

name: river spot
description: flat area next to a river and fish ladder.

name: Andrew Johnson Historic Sites
description: This is a small cute quant traditional village that is nice to walk around to see all the different historic buildings. At the Andrew Johnson National Historic Site, you can trace the 17th President of the United States’ journey from tailor to the White House. Also visit Andrew Johnson Homestead, Dickson-Williams Mansion, City Garage Car Museum, Greeneville Greene County History Museum, Old Greene County Jail, State of Franklin Capitol Building. Check hours of opperations, many places will be closed on Sundays.

name: Forest Service Rd 328A
description: Dispersed camping.. I used a lifted 4x4 to get to this location.  Backs up to Barkley Lake/Energy Lake. People have camped here before (existing fire pit) There are 4 other forest service roads (potentially with campsites) connected to this road.

name: Catnip Reservoir BLM campground
description:
What a great discovery for us after seeing wild antelopes in the Sheldon National Wildlife Refuge! This reservoir looked and felt like an oasis after a whole day of seeing nothing but dry landscape. We had this whole campsite to ourselves, so it was extra peaceful. There's a pit toilet but the exterior underside of the roof has been overrun by swallow nests. Multiple fire rings are available, and even a bbq counter/structure! Incredible open sky; it would have been great for stargazing but we arrived during the Thunder Moon so the stars were diminished by epic moonlight.

Road conditions were ok, bumpy in some spots. 4WD and high clearance recommended. There's no cell service and you're miles away from help so don't get stuck!

name: Love's Travel Center
description:
This seems like a newer Love's Travel Center. The main road is under construction. Getting in wasn't too difficult. 
They have 4 RV parking spots up front.

name: Catnip Reservoir Free Campground
description:
What a great discovery for us after seeing wild antelopes in the Sheldon National Wildlife Refuge! This reservoir looked and felt like an oasis after a whole day of seeing nothing but dry landscape. We had this whole campsite to ourselves, so it was extra peaceful. There's a pit toilet but the exterior underside of the roof has been overrun by swallow nests. Multiple fire rings are available, and even a bbq counter/structure! Incredible open sky; it would have been great for stargazing but we arrived during the Thunder Moon so the stars were diminished by epic moonlight.

Road conditions were ok, bumpy in some spots. 4WD and high clearance recommended. There's no cell service and you're miles away from help so don't get stuck!

The biggest downside to this spot are the bugs! They were out in numbers and clung on to our clothes.

name: Maverik gad station in Greybull
description: Free water supply at pump 3-4. Bring your hose

name: Golden Gate Petro
description:
There’s a $10 RV dump on the backside of the gas station. You need to go in first and pay. 

No freshwater.

name: Maple Lake
description: This is a dispersed campground in the State Forest.  It is a lovely meadow right on the lake shore just a few minutes drive beyond the Maple Lake established campground. This is open all year, just a beautiful quiet spot. No amenities and not suitable for large rigs. We are in a camper van and it’s perfect.

name: Beaver Eddy Campground
description: First come, first serve. Fee site. Vault toilets.

name: FR9T
description: Nice secluded spots off forest road 9T with fire rings. Short walk to the canyon rim that offers a good view of the Rio Grande.  Good cell signal from some carrier that I can't register on. No Verizon/Visible service.

name: Ryan Rd
description: Decent-sized spot directly across from the very popular Ryan Rd Dispersed Camping (which fills up very quickly and can be hard to turn around). This road is much easier (a Class A is here tonight) than Ryan. wider and level dirt. Very short road to drive down. easy enough to turn around if it’s full. enough room for at least 4 decent sized setups. pretty much any rig/car could stay here. about 4mins from West Glacier town where there’s water, little bit better cell, restaurants, gas and Glacier NP West Entrance. cell service is all over the place. ranging from 1-3bars LTE Verizon to 1-2 Bars 5G/LTE on TMobile. Sometimes I can browse, stream. other times it’s impossible to send a text message.

name: Little White River Reservoir
description: This is about one half mile beyond the site marked in this app. There are nice shady trees, two picnic tables, a fire pit, and pit toilets.

name: Double Falls Campground
description: Nice spot down by a creek, a bit steep coming down the last bit. Vans and maybe smaller campers could fit here. About 5 spots that I can see. A short little walk to one of the falls. No-one here so far, very nice with picnic tables, fire pits and pit toilets.

name: Gravel Area
description: This large gravel area is just off the road. There is a rail line. quiet at night, noisy during day. lots of space big rigs, friendly. no facilities.

name: Heritage square parking
description:
Moderator Note: Next visitor - please check potability. Otherwise, this place must be removed.
....

Behind Sissy's thrift store in Heritage Square parking lot there is a spigot that is turned on and has threads if you need to hook up a hose. 

Not sure if it's potable or not.  there are no signs about the quality of the water. 

Used it to fill up a gallon for grey water.

name: Forest road pull off
description: Medium pulloff along a beautiful forest road. 1 bar of Google Fi. This was the only spot I found along the road with cell service. Two cars in the night, very peaceful. One of the most beautiful forests we’ve stayed in. The sounds of the forest at night are incredible.

name: Fish Creek
description: Nice spot in the forest, downstream from the bridge on the north side. Three places for smaller RV's. You can hear the road, but quiet during night time.

name: Gravel Pull Off
description: Take the BLM road and make the first left. There are several fairly wide pull offs, under power lines, suitable for a medium sized rig. Highway noise is minimal and full reception on Google Fi.

name: Interpretive Site
description: Bathrooms and potable water spigots along with some cute information about wildlife protection in Flathead territory. Also no “No” signs, but I didn’t try staying overnight.

name: NF Road
description: This is a beautiful and very unused paved road on the north side of the lake. There are a LOT of pull off’s and this side is so unused that there are small trees growing in some of the pull off’s.  NO AT&T SERVICE!

name: Fred Meyer parking lot
description: Some nicely shaded spots and plenty of open parking. I didn't see any signs restricting overnight parking.  I arrived well after midnight and left in the afternoon with no disruption.  I stocked up in the store in return for the hospitality.  store guest wifi available when close enough to the access point.

name: Scenic River Retreat
description: Pullover. View of fish pond, grassy picnic area, with restrooms. Local History preserved by Munson Family.

name: KOA Mount Shasta
description:
Camping with full hook ups for $42 nightly.
Laundry services. $10 for just electricity. $15 for just dump. Not sure how much water is separately. We just stopped in for electricity for a few hours. Great people, great location.

name: Blue Lake Trail Head
description: Trailhead with pit toilet. People tent camp at the lake, so parking overnight is allowed. The lake is about a mile hike downhill from the trailhead. Traffic during the day, but very quiet at night, and very dark. Had good 5G with T-Mobile.

name: Area off North Fork Road
description: Large camping area off North Fork Road! About 20 minutes to West Entrance of Glacier. Lots of big rigs (expect some generator noise) and road isn’t bad at all. 16 day stay limit but seems there are some ‘residents’ but not bothersome at all. No real sites so even if it’s fairly full you can probably just make a new one

name: Waterfall Park
description:
Small quiet park on the end of a roundabout just past the Bass Pro shop.. only one parking lot light. Quiet at night. 

Walking path, charcoal grills, picnic tables, river view..

No “no overnight parking” signs.. no gates..

A Skoolie could fit depending on how busy the lot is, 75% chance. 

Reservation for Pavillion shows the schedule.
Remember to leave it better than you found it!

name: Arriba Rest Area
description:
Rest stop for Truck drivers, and passenger vehicles.
Well lit.. well traveled.

name: Mack State Wildlife Area
description:
Wildlife refuge.. open 24 hours according to Google maps.

There are two parking areas available for the wildlife area located off Herman Road.

Stopped to sleep for the night.. dark with little road noise. Stars were beautiful.. fireflies/lightning bugs twinkling.. 

No parking on the road. No signs saying no overnight. 🤷🏻‍♂️

name: Free parking around the Thompson Hotel
description:
Tons of free parking around the Thompson Hotel. Apparently, the city is going to put meters here someday but it's been over a year. Lots of overnight parking and I've seen some parked in the grass. 

The picture is from the Thompson Hotel looking E SE over the parking area.

name: Martin County Rest Area Southbound
description:
This is a large rest area. Plenty of parking for all types of rigs and vehicles.
They have a variety of vending machines. Our favorite is the ice cream vending machine.
In the open area near the bathrooms, they have electric plug-ins.

name: Whetstone Creek Conservation Area
description:
Simple Lot with clearly marked free camping. Very quiet down a gravel road. No one else here when I was here.

1 bar of Verizon and 2 bars on AT&T.

name: Owl’s Nest on Arroyo-Portland Rd
description: Pull off small area with fire ring. Good for tent or small camper. Close to atv trail head. Quiet at night.

name: Primitive campsite near Robin Island.
description: Two large campsites with gravel parking spot and fire rings across from river. We stayed on C-8 campsite but there is many other dispersed spots along river between Irvin Run and Millstone Creek. Access to river.

name: rest area
description: good rest area. a lot of space, clean and street lights. gives a safe feeling

name: On Skagit River
description: Right off the 530 by Howard Miller Steelhead Park. No “no” signs. Locals use as boat ramp which didn’t bother us. 2-3 cozy spots. 2 small, but long vans would be okay. 2 or 3 bars AT&T.

name: Bowman Haley Dam- North Shore campground
description: Established campground next to lake. Electric sites $20, primitive sites $5. Picnic tables, grills, bathrooms and showers!!!! Easy road in. Register at the marina, or after hours drop the registration envelope with cash or check through the slot. Great sunset, a teeny bit buggy, since it’s right along the reservoir. We were the only ones in primitive camping, and there were plenty of electric sites open when we arrived at 8pm.

name: Lake Shannon Recreation Area
description: This park next to Lake Shannon is newly built. Features a boat ramp, bathrooms, picnic area, grills, and beach area to swim in the lake. We spent the afternoon paddle boarding and hanging out. The road to the area is not maintained but wasn’t bad coming up in our sprinter van. Mostly loose gravel. Maps will take you to a closed off road but just turn right and follow signs for “public boat ramp.” The park unfortunately has signs for no overnight parking but it’s a great spot to spend the day.

name: End of the Road Park
description:
Free day time parking with flush toilet bathrooms. 
It does say no overnight parking so won't be able to stealth camp here.

name: Stanford track picnic grounds
description:
Between the track and pool are picnic tables. There’s water, bar b que grills and possible electricity. There’s electric plug boxes but I did not check to see if they are live. 

Can park in the nearest parking lot, 100 feet away, and refill your portable water containers.

name: Estes Valley park
description: We try to sleep at Estes Park Visitor Center parking lot with an 25feet motorhome. At 1:30 am a police officer told us, and 3 other cars, we had to leave, and guide us all to this place at the lake, where we had no trouble. We left at 11 am.

name: Free parking
description: Free parking spot by the Beach!! with restroom and showers, grate and safe  place, we spend four nights here without issues with our 25 feet Motorhome. Very crowded during the day.

name: Idleglen trail head
description: Large flat camp site with restrooms and Verizon. Trail is closed. This area was burned in 2020.

name: Coyote Moon Ranch
description:
Premier Camp & Cabins at Laurel Lake, Kentucky


Create memories and enjoy the natural surroundings of Corbin KY at this premier Camping and Cabin lake resort in the heart of Daniel Boone Natural Forest.

6 Premiere Camper spots with electric and water, simply pull in your camper trailer and set up for the weekend, week or season. Enjoy the outdoors or simply kick back and chill by the camp at Coyote Moon Ranch. 


6 Spacious Fully Furnished Cabins with kitchen, fridge, family room, screened patio and full baths await you to create the perfect lake getaway.  Uniquely apportioned and brand new, these cabins were hand crafted on site by local tradesmen to fit Coyote Moon Ranch specifications.


Spacious Barndo-minium with queen beds, queen bunks, fully outfitted kitchen, 2 full bathrooms, living area with TV and private balconies and entrances add to your getaway. Bring your entire extended family in this one of a kind barn condo!


Enjoy the pristine surroundings, splash in Laurel Lake, fish in the pond or spend your day exploring the trails.

name: Cardston Pool
description: Local recreation center with a pool and showers. $6 for using the pool+shower or $3 if you only want to use the shower. Accepts US and Canadian currency. Showers are communal, not private, and you'll be sharing the space with a lot of families in the summer.

name: Side of FSR
description: Decent spot on side of the road. A bit of a downward slope.   Nice view of the mountains.  Perfect starlink connection.  I went a bit further up the road before settling on this spot- didn't find anything I liked that I could access in my 2wd promaster.  Occasional vehicles but almost nothing after dark.

name: Kaniksu Ranch (Nudist Resort)
description:
NUDIST RESORT - CALL BEFORE ATTEMPTING TO ARRIVE!
This is an absolutely wonderful location and people to match the atmosphere! 

They have showers, 2 small ponds (with cute turtles, a swimming pool, a hot tub, a sauna, clean bathrooms, an RV sanitation dump, miles of trails for hiking and biking, it's a great location for a stay!
.
Pets MUST stay on leash.

name: Pilot Travel Center
description: pilot travel center with hot showers, safe place to sleep overnight as well :)

name: Picnic area off US-277 north of Weinert, TX
description: Picnic area, gravel, some trees for shade. Noisy due to proximity to the highway,  but ok for a night. No amenities

name: Rio Parking
description: Rio's parking is huge. Has no signs. Slept here with a Class C, nobody came to bother. No shade...

name: Circus Circus self parking
description: Self parking of the circus circus. Lot's of free spaces. Even late. Don't know if it is allowed. Stayed here for one night and had no problem. You also have an RV park here. If you sleep at this cheap hotel they make you park your RV on the side, between building and RV park with a paper on the dashboard. You can pay to go only to the swimming pool also.

name: Small Beautiful Aspen Grove Site
description: Nice site for our 4x4 Sprinter. Beautiful sunset views and great shade. Not big enough for a trailer or big rig. One mile from a NFS vault toilet along the highway.

name: Aspen Meadow Views for Days
description: Beautiful site in a copse of fir trees overlooking a long open valley. $6 recreation fee covers 3 nights of camping in this forest. Pay at the USFS kiosk near the pavement. This site is large enough for trailers, but the road in is a bit rough. Perfect spot for our 4x4 Sprinter van.

name: E Cabrillo Blvd
description: Unlimited daytime street parking except for 2am-6am daily. Perfect for leaving your car or van to go explore the city. Wide vehicles may not fit in the space.

name: Speedway
description: Spigot on the building in a locked box. Just went inside and asked and they said I could hook up. Filled up 100 in our 40ft skoolie for free.

name: Dizzy Daisy Winery
description: We really enjoyed our wine tasting and snacks a lot. The little gift shop area has some very witty things. The owner Harold and his friendly staff were so welcoming. We sat on the winery patio long after closing and chatted with other from another part of state. The winery used to be a working farm in the past and my husband especially appreciated Harold's vast knowledge of local agriculture. We loved our visit. We were especially impressed with how hard Harold and his wife work in this small business and were happy to support.  We bought several bottles of wine and enjoyed a bottle of wine while we were there! Lovely evening. Excellant flat boondocking spot. Call ahead, like we did and they accepted us just hours before. 989-269-2366.

name: secluded spot along road nearby Grand Teton
description: pull out along gravel road. Just outside the borders of Grand Teton. The road turns into a gravel dirt road which is very drivable with any vehicle. There are already several pull outs on the road. This one is a small, narrow dirt road which leads to a place to set up a tent (or several, I think like 3 would fit). could also park a van here, just know the road is small (only 40 meters long). pretty quiet, not many cars coming by. not very level, but good enough.

name: goose bay marina
description: free potable water near one of the pit toilets. look for the green posts. dump station at the campground is $10. showers also here for $1 for 3 minutes. can get quarters at the camp store

name: Sam Michael's Park
description: County park with good shaded parking,disc golf course, dog park, live music every Thursday's during summer, play ground. Showers. Free showers, although I gave them a couple bucks, super friendly.

name: Wilderness Park Trailhead Parking Area
description: We parked in the gravel area of parking lot. There were no signs anywhere stating the hours of the park or that overnight parking was prohibited. We hung out there the better part of the day since it’s a park and just hung around to see if anyone came by. No problems. A business in the city uses the parking area to store trucks so workers do come and make noise in the morning but no one bothered us at all. There was a portapotty but it was locked the entire time we were there so no services.

name: FSR208 Pull Off - Ridge
description: Pull off on FSR208.  Very low traffic. Only 1 truck today on a Friday.  High point in the road so views were decent.

name: Howling Dog Saloon
description:
Howling Dog Saloon. 
Owner is a BMW Motorhead and offers free tent Camping for Bikers. Just 5$ for the Bathroom (Shower and Toilet). Outside is a Pit Toilet. 

Cabins are also available for 60$/Night. Little bit outdated but absolutely clean inside. 

Wifi inside the Bar available. Also Beer and Snacks.

Owner is a nice man and tries to help with any Motorbike Problems. Just give the Saloon (on Google Maps) a Call.

name: Free showers next to the beach
description: Free public beach shower - cold water - shower situated on the outside (without intimacy)

name: Glacier dispenser at Safeway
description: Glacier water dispenser at Safeway. Located outside the building near main entrance, next to ice machine

name: Pampa Recreation Park
description: A park next to the rodeo stadium. Small lake and paved walking path. Great spot. If you use the camping tent area it’s free. Hookups are $15-20 with electric and water. There is a pavilion with bathrooms and showers. The showers have code locks so we couldn’t use them. Overall very nice stop over. We spent 3 nights here due to a mechanical issue.

name: Highmore  half grass-gravel place
description: Large place for RVs and tents. On side of baseball field.

name: Willow Public Library WiFi
description: Good WiFi available at the library. Sign on the door has the password.

name: Burke Canyon pull off
description: 60 ft long pull out just a half mile from I90 in E Wallace. By creek, and off road, no amenities, no no camping signs.  No shade til 3pm

name: cannon beach day time RV parking
description: daytime RV and other vehicle parking. no time limit. no overnighting. bathrooms and everything in town close by.

name: Jackson Road near Timberloft Pizzeria
description: Paved pullout/parking area right after you turn on Jackson Road off highway 41. Good for one night. Enough room for 5-6 vehicles. There are no “no parking” or “private property” signs posted. We arrived around 9pm and stayed until 5am without any trouble. The only reason we left so early was to enter Yosemite before 6am, after which a reservation was required to enter the park.

name: Laundromat
description: Normal laundromat, change machine, wifi, no ATM.

name: County Road 1 Roadside Colona
description: Short distance off Hwy550…County Road 1 at Colona. Large pull out roadside of county road 1. Just stopped to sleep.. quiet only a few cars drove by after 10pm. Traffic picked up quite a bit after 630am. great comfortable easy place to get some sleep.

name: Behind the skykomish mini train depot
description: Multiple spigots for water fill up. You can also ride the mini train if they are open.

name: City parking lot
description:
This is in between two lots/buildings.
The city has a lot for 24 hour parking 
Nice restaurants near by

name: NF campsite
description: Medium size spot just off the road. big enough for up to 30ft. A little overgrown but quite flat. rock fire ring. No TMobile, but Starlink works.

name: Shamrock RV Park
description:
This RV park is at 260 E. Parr Blvd, just north of downtown Reno, between 395 and North Virginia.  We've stayed here when we needed a full hookup, or, as today, when its 100° @ 8 pm.

It's well kept, with about 1/2 the spots taken by full-timers.  

In the past, they have not answered the phone after hours, but if you show up, they list the open spots on a board at registration and you're welcome to take any open spot and then pay in the morning.

name: Yahoo Falls
description:
It's a steep pathed drive and a step hike at times, but the views are totally worth it. You can walk to the top and the bottom of the falls and even take a shocking shower underneath the powerful water. There was hardly anyone out here compared to nearby tourist falls, which is a nice way to enjoy the peaceful nature trail.

I highly recommend taking a photo of the trails map near the bathroom as there are few signs on the trail and it's not always intuitive. The arch trail is a dead end.

Some parts are muddy and dangerous, so don't let your kids run around here.

name: Foster's Fireside Restaurant & Cheese Shop
description: Parking lot of Restaurant  available for overnight parking.  Homemade chocolate chip cookies, great bar & sit down dining room and a dog park!

name: Pilot Travel Center Madera
description:
There are 11 private shower rooms. Cost is $15/shower. No time limit. Towels provided. Very clean facilities. (Someone cleans the shower rooms between each use). 

I read online that 2 or more people in a family unit can use a shower at Pilot /Flying J while only paying once. We did this with our family of 3, so it was effectively $5 per person. We didn’t explicitly ask if all 3 of us could use the shower, but the shower attendant lady clearly saw that all 3 of us were going to be using the same shower and it didn’t faze her. In consideration of other people that may have been waiting, we did try to take reasonably short showers since there were 3 of us. We ended up being in an out in 30 minutes :)

name: Forest service road 300
description: This road is a well maintained 50 mile long road with many offshoots. Very capable for RV and trailers. Surprisingly quiet area even though it can handle hundreds of campsites. The north end near Sedalia is a pay campsite with lots of OHV areas.  9/10ths of the road is national forest dispersed camping all the way down to woodland park.

name: Maplefields
description: Truck stop with nice clean showers. The attendant on duty didn't charge us.

name: Onteora Lake Campsite
description: Campsite off trail next to the lake. Stone fire pit and picnic table. Labeled as DEC site.

name: Lake Sumner cliffs
description: Nice place on the cliff at the lake. Go down the road to the right of the pay box. Pas the picnic area and follow the road to the right to the end. It is the last and 3rd primitive site on the road. There are many sites at lake Sumner if this spot is taken. I had a couple bar of version. The spot on east side of the lake are reservations cross the dam and use the pay box at the welcome station. Shower are available in the restrooms access from the welcome station. Not sure if they are warm or just cold. Was not able to run them long enough to get warm water as it os a push button valve only on for a few seconds a push. An employee happened by as i was pulling in and was very helpful in finding me a spot. Big rigs will fit at other spots.

name: roadside pull off
