description: this is a paved pull off that semis often use, however there are some gravel pull-outs farther down the road. good cell signal.

name: Miners Claim
description: Pretty spot in the forest. Lots of wild flowers. Site has two fire rings. Pretty smooth dirt road to get here. Pulling a teardrop trailer with off road suspension.

name: Arapaho bay campgrounds forest camp
description: 3 forest campgrounds in Arapaho Forest. Restrooms and water. Verizon

name: Osterman Rd
description: Good street for park. A lot of car parked on the street facing apartments complex. Signs of street cleaning Monday Thursday and Friday. I recommend arrive early to get a spot, but I came midnight and still have couple spaces available.

name: Dubinky Well Road view
description: Beautiful quiet BLM. Room to roam. Nearest campers were a quiet ways away maybe couple football fields length. Spot right off main blm road but no traffic. One car came past. It is on slight hill and not level.  There is a camp ring. Wouldn’t recommend camper trailers or larger fb.  Was Good in my Campervan.

name: Glacier machine cvs
description: Glacier machine in front of cvs to fill 5 gallon jugs. 0.40c per gallon

name: Provo Recreational Center
description: 5 bucks for shower. Didn’t bother to ask the day use fee. Nice place.

name: Jordan Creek Designated Dispersed
description: A series of designated dispersed campsites along Jordan Creek. They are near the Jordan Creek OHV campground and staging area. Site #2 is off Archer Rd, above the creek and well away from the OHV. We stayed from Thursday to Sunday and it was pretty quiet. You can hear the occasional vehicle on the main entrance road but there is plenty of greenery to keep you out of their sight.  We get maybe two vehicles a day drive past. Tillamook is 24 minutes away so accessible to gas and groceries as well as various parks in the area. The parking pad is big enough for a good size truck and trailer, but the roads are very narrow. Easy access for a van, truck camper or small trailer.

name: Zumbro Bottoms
description:
nice place, flat, fits big rigs and you can turn. by the river. river acces with cano possible. no fire ring. there is also a campground nearby for 22 dollar with toilet and fire rings.

the ranger came and said we could not stay 1mile from a campground and asked us to stay there.

name: Gold Springs Park Campground
description: Beautiful campground in Alberta, just north of the border with Montana at Coutts, AB. On the Milk River with an oxbow lake. Campsites are located near the lake or the River. Extremely well kept, friendly staff, family oriented. Boat rentals, stoked lake with rainbow trout. 30$ CA./night, cabins rental.

name: Parking Lot 2
description:
Previously overnight parking was only allowed in Lot 1, but now it is only allowed in Lot 2.
Asked a guy who was working at the adjacent lodge and he told me that overnight parking with sleeping in the vehicle is ok but needs to be low-profile...means no chairs, no awnings etc. and only for one night.

name: Blackfoot river Park
description: Sign says 10 days camping limit realy quiet parking lot in the middle of nowhere

name: Sulphur Springs Pond
description: Meant to use the dispersed camping at Lake Mauzy but it was roped off. Right next to it was another pull off with a sign for this pond. Looks like a fishing spot. Single gravel track down to a loose gravel parking area. Not level, though there are two grassier spots that could be used. Good for cars, vans, etc… don’t think it would be large enough to turn an RV around easily. Spent one night and never saw a soul. Cleaned up some trash. No facilities of any kind. One bar of Verizon.

name: Three Rivers Hideaway
description: From the road this place looks mostly like its just a trailer park, and that will throw anyone off that is camping from their vehicle. Down below the office just passed the last row of RV campers are plenty of open flat spots and direct river access in their tent camping area. Water, showers and a bathroom  plus direct river access with a swimming hole, dump station, wifi, ice and drinks for sale in the office.  Camping was $15, which is not free, of course, but since there is basically nowhere to camp directly off 198, this place will do the job. It's about 5 miles from the entrance to Sequoia Park, and has views from the campground for days. Check in is easy, can drive up, no issues, if it's after hours, you pick your spot and pay on the way out, reservations to come in with your overlander rig are not needed (on most days)

name: Moser Jumpoff
description: Nice spot not far off the main road. Room for 2-3 vehicles and easy road in. No cell signal.

name: Harrah’s Casino
description: Lot specifically for motor homes (we are in a camper van). No signs stating no overnight parking. No hook ups but just outside of Natahala National Forest. Nice view.

name: Pierson park road
description: If the other spots at the beginning of the dirt road are all busy, you can climb further up. It is rather steep and a good ground clearance is preferable. The spot is in a little clearing. Fire pit. Almost flat around the fire pit. No cellphone service.

name: Certified Auto Repair
description: The best mechanic I've ever had work on my van. Super helpful and nice staff, worked same day and fair prices. right across from a NAPA shop which is also very well staffed and accessible

name: very slow Wifi
description: When you buy something at the gift shop, you can ask for the wifi voucher. But very slow

name: Aldrich Boat Ramp
description: Boat ramp with ample parking. No "No Camping" signs.

name: New London, Minnesota, at Spicer High school parking
description: A large parking, close to the tennis court and football field. With picnic tables, playground for kids,

name: Pymatuning State Park
description: Wooded Campground on a lake with over 300 spots,  electric,  tent sites,  boat ramp, showers,  dump station.   Weak cell signal.   Camp store in site, firewood nearby.  Walk-ins not allowed,  must reserve through https://www.reserveamerica.com/explore/pymatuning-state-park/PA/880226/campsites?pageNumber=2&availStartDate=2022-07-29&arrivalDate=2022-07-29&lengthOfStay=1&lookingFor=2001. $34.50/night

name: Side Road from Hole in the Rock
description: Follow 3 miles the small side road. You will pass another camp which is very exposed to wind. After a while you reach a small valley where is no wind and you cant be seen from the hole in the rock road. Very quiet. A mountain close by to climb.

name: Tok River State Recreation Site
description: State of Alaska campground.  Nice location next to river. some road noise but decreases at night. RV and tent sites, potable water and bathrooms.  $18 per night.  have two bars Verizon. There are skeeters but not too hungry, lol.  I like this place.

name: Recycling Center
description: Public recycling for glass, plastic, cardboard, aluminum, paper. Open 24 hours as it is just two large blue dumpster like containers in an open parking lot without any gates.

name: Nash Fork Campground
description: Forest Service campground. 25ish sites with picnic tables and fire pits. Vault toilets. Spotty service with Verizon. Really pretty wooded area - wildflowers were in full bloom when we checked in, in late July. $10/night, $5 senior. Beautiful spot.

name: Walmart
description: Parking lot with a lot of trees for shade, clean, safe, no „no overnight“ signs, quiet.

name: Dyea Bridge to flats
description: 11'2" height restriction to get to the flats. any camping beyond this point needs to be able to do that.

name: Skagway Ferry Alaska Marine Highway
description: The ferry dock to Haines etc. If you have a ferry in the middle of the night you can come and check in during the day and already line up at night / sleep in your lane. No fee, just courtesy of the ferry

name: US customs towards Skagway
description: The US border facilities are 27km from the Candian ones (actual border halfway) - open 8am to midnight ALASKAN TIME. If you have come overland from Canada and this is your first crossing into the US you will have to go in and do all the fingerprinting etc. If not, you will be able to take the drive through facility. Friendly, no vehicle check.

name: Cleaning world II
description: Great coin operated laundromat,also does dry cleaning. May not look like much bit the machines are solid (3$ double, bigger ones availablr) and the dryers VERY hot! in and outin 1 hour. recommended!

name: South Jetty Day Use Area
description: Ocean access, public restrooms, about a mile of parking on both sides of road that is on top of Newport’s South Jetty.  All the boat traffic into Newport’s busy fishing harbor pass by.  T bars of Verizon service.  Lots of folks taking advantage of this free park on a Saturday, several with horse trailers, out for a ride.

name: Eastside Community Center
description: Community recreation centre with a full array of services. Day pass gives access to the showers and Wi-Fi. There's a pool and a fitness centre with a variety of equipment.  I came for the shower, stayed for the fast Wi-Fi.

name: HNF campsite
description:
Two smaller/midsize vehicles could fit. Fire pit and very little cell service with Verizon.
The GPS this app recorded doesn't take you right to the campsite like it should but it does get you close.

name: Walmart
description: Some young people seemed to meet with their cars in the area closest to the sign but left by 11:30. We felt safe and it was a good night. McDonald's is nearby.

name: Midtown RV Park
description: 60$ for a parking lot ... Most of the ppl here are living here. Old but clean bathrooms.

name: Blue Pool Campground
description: Basic campground along a creek with great swimming spots. Very clean pit toilets and water from a hand pump. Most places below big old trees and extra tent sites available. 19$ per night in 07/2022 self pay

name: McIntosh Reserve
description: First come first serve campsites for $12 a night right on the river. There are clean bathrooms and a shower. Also has potable water spigots available. Very quiet during the off season but can fill up quick on nicer weekends. Only about 1 bar of LTE for Verizon at certain campsites.

name: Two Glacier viewpoint
description:
Spot for up to two medium RVs, but ideally one unless you know each other.
Great views of two glaciers to the north across the valley. Slightly set back from the road behind a berm, which lessens traffic noise.

name: Best Buy/Lowes/Staples/Others
description: Shopping area with several businesses. I’ve spent multiple nights in this lot, primarily part next to the Best Buy/Geeksquad vans at night until 8am’ish. Have never had any problem. I’m in a car and don’t go outside of my vehicle or do anything to bring attention. Have never seen an RV or big rig parked over night, though. Only cars and vans.  Also, planet fitness is around the corner. Less than a 2 mile drive. HUGE open field/drainage ditch for pets to run around in. There is also a man made pond with fountains and a path to walk around it. This sits right off the highway. So, typical noise.

name: Dale City Car-Only Safety Rest Area South
description: Excellent rest stop location for overnight parking. It has a dedicated area for campers. Vans can easily parked on the car only side

name: Cape lookout water spigot
description: Near the bathrooms towards the ocean there are two picnic tables and a water spigot. Was able to walk my 7 gallon jug to it and walk back to the parking lot.

name: 24hr parking
description: I was passing through Cleveland and got some drinks, wasn’t intending to stay overnight but needed to. This is a 24hr parking lot, not covered. I parked by the fence and stayed overnight, no issues.

name: Along Gamble gulch road
description: Dispersed camping near Gamble gulch road. Several spot in almost flat area. Fire pits. Good cellphone signal.

name: Blue Mountain rde
description: Also a nice place. Unfortunately, it had a lot of the big black bugs. But they were every also on the road. Probably because of the weather condition as it looked like raining in a few hours. Recommend high clearance.

name: Bretz RV & Marine
description: propane refill. $2.99/gallon without membership or $.99/gallon with membership. it’s free to get a membership. if you’re paying 3x as much when you can get it for less… for free…. you’re dumb. also- not sure if GPS here is correct. for some reason it wasn’t updating. type in Bretz RV & Marine on your GPS Map if these GPS coordinates don’t work.

name: Little belt mountains
description: Free dispersed camping, very nice spots spread out along the creek! Road is gravel and washboard in places, but not bad at all.

name: Leslie E. Roberts Beach & Recreation Area
description: Little beach with free parking, wood tables and restrooms. we slept without tent on the beach, but definitively a good spot for tents in the grass or sand. Not a very touristic place, just a few local people here until sunset.

name: Black Butte Drive
description: Quiet side street near Grocery Outlet, Chevron, and several fast food restaurants. It's across the street from a Pilot Travel Center. Many other big rigs we're parked along this street as well since Pilot's lot was full. Lots of street lights. Did not let out slide.

name: Private Beach!
description: Epic spot right next to the water. It's a quiet area in general, but this spot is super secluded, which we love! The map pinned us in the water, but we're no submarine. Very bumpy roads, lots of slippery gravel, but doable. We drove down a steep gravel "road" in our Ford F150 in 4x4 with our 25 ft travel trailer. I wouldn't recommend this specific spot if you have an extra large rig, because the turn around space is limited to the beach and the road is a little sketchy.  Located about a mile past the pit toilets. We heard and saw wild donkeys. Great exploring! We drove to a local RV park to do laundry and left the trailer parked with no problem. I can't stress how awesome this spot is!

name: Hidden Lake Safari Ranch and RV Park
description: Nice, quaint RV park with back in sites only. Full hook-ups available. The park has a bounty of wildlife and farm animals that wonder around the property. I let my dog out to pee and was greeted by a herd of sheep at my door.

name: Walmart/Kohls/Whataburger
description: It has security, so I don’t bother. There is a Whataburger which sits in a Kohl’s car park. I parked my car near the Whataburger, but not so close as to be bothered by their 24/7 traffic. I’ve seen vans/SUV’s and cars. No RVs (yet), however I have seen a few car haulers/cargo vans parked overnight. Also, Whataburger interior is 24/7 …so….if number 2 calls, you’re good to run.

name: Barbara S. and Walter F. Brown memorial park
description: Looks to be a newer campground. Basically an open flat circle in the trees with 19 sites. I stayed here when everything else in the area was full, and it was fine for a night. Spots are all fairly flat with nice fire rings and picnic tables. Access to the river along a maintained path.

name: Log jam pullout
description: Little forest road pull out. Fire ring over the log.

name: 24 hour parking
description: As noted,  24.hour parking allowed.  Turn right as you get off the ferry and it's literally right there.  Both sides of the street are 24 hour parking.

name: Portage Valley Parking
description: Great spot right next the highway (yes, it’s noisy), but amazing views and no trouble for 5 days. Big open, paved parking lot. Located about 10 miles past Girdwood.

name: Rest Area i-90
description: Very Clean Rest Area for trucks and Cars. We are spending the night here, but very noisy because it’s rigt beside the highway. If you can, park in the Truck Area , where it is less noisy.

name: Riverside Park
description:
Free parking on a quiet street at all times except Tuesday and Friday from 9:30 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.
Arrive at 10 a.m. these 2 days for places available.
---
Stationnement gratuit sur rue tranquille en tout temps sauf mardi et vendredi de 9h30 à 11h00.
Arrivez à 10h ces 2 jours pour places disponibles.

name: Lake Forest Golf (facing street)
description: I arrived here midnight, and find some car and vans parked in both sides. This street is facing a golf park. Don't have any restrictions to park overnight, except vehicles over 6" longer and street cleaning Wednesday. Stay 1 night without problems.

name: Bill Sliper Lions Park
description:
Small community park honoring armed services. We stayed overnight and no one bothered us. There is a port-a-potty, and two cars pulled in so a passenger could use it.
After 10pm, it was very quiet with little traffic noise.

name: Beach Dr in West Seattle
description:
Curb parking on Beach Dr. right by the bay. The space isn’t very wide, but plenty wide enough for a campervan. No parking restrictions that I saw anywhere. There are several spots on the East side of the road where a tall wall/hedge/trees blocks view of the houses, so feels private enough. Cars passing on the road till 11 or 12 pm, but quiets down after. 

Came to this spot during a heat wave and had a great night with the cool breeze off the water. Sunset is nice too. Good reception as with pretty much everywhere i’ve been in Seattle. Keep quiet and be respectful so that we can all continue benefiting from spots like this! Thanks

name: Ugly but quiet
description: Large clearing, does the job if everywhere else nearby is full.

name: Burnt Lake Dispersed Camping
description: Road out was possible with a 2WD sedan but a little sketchy at parts, sites are very spread out and go along the river or lakeside, lots of trees and greenery, level spots and tucked away. Definitely recommend checking it out, although would also suggest giving extra time to make it down the road if not in a high clearance or 4WD vehicle. We tent camped, not sure if an RV could make it out. Lots of grazing cows and mountain views along the way!! Had pretty good service at the lakeside sites

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Typical CB parking, clean bathrooms, no “no overnight parking” signs. Pretty quiet overall with a bit of road noise.

name: Blue Hill Town Park
description: Blue Hill Town Park. This park is at the end of Water St in Blue Hill, ME. Very pretty setting on the water. Playground for kids, pet friendly, picnic tables and benches. Porta potty.  Room for 10-12 cars. We stayed 2 nights in our van with no problems. People cleared out by dark and we had the place to ourselves. Very quiet.

name: Upper Tongue Creek
description: NFS campground 1 mile down a good gravel road. Lots of dispersed sites in this area also. 12 sites, water pump, vault toilets. Smaller RVs ok, but only a couple of sites large enough for big rig. Good shade, 2 creeks run through it. Lots of 4 wheelers around, so it can be a little noisy. Hosts are very nice. $19.50 per night, is on recreation.gov, but accepts drive ups.

name: Free WiFi
description: Free super fast WiFi at the cafe. We sat outside and downloaded Netflix, checked email, etc. No password needed. FootlessOpen network

name: Outdoor shower by day use parking
description: Outdoor shower with excellent water press and adjustable head. Shampoo, conditioner and soap provided. Easy to walk from day use parking near the water. Free and no time limit.

name: Jackson island camp
description: free campsites. there’s fire rings, porta potties and trash cans. lots of shaded spots by the water. max stay is 14 days. :)

name: Ramco Petroleum
description: Gas station with Propane refil. Friendly staff.

name: lebec rest area - north bound
description:
free Dump and water near the exist.
I think the South bound rest area also have the dump station

name: Lonely highway pull off
description: Large dirt parking area used as overflow parking for campers/rvs for a casino. Lots of other overnighters. Great place to rest after a long day traveling the lonely highway. Grass park area across road for walking dogs

name: Lava Flow Campground
description: FREE Campground with maybe ten or twelve spacious sites and two large pit toilets. No water, no trashcans, no dumpstation. Picnic tables and barbecue on every site. Campground is offered free of charge by National Forrest. No max. stay. Nicely located under trees. We only stopped for a lunch break, had it been later in the day, we would have spent the night! No cell service AT&T (even with mifi and external antenna)

name: Aurora Bay
description: Public canoe, kayak launching spot on lake Michigan. Small gravel lot big enough for 3-4 vehicles (only 2 level spots) right on the water. Arrived for sunset had one other car watching that left when it set. Quiet all night long, first car in around 8 am. The shoreline is extremely rocky but beautiful views. No Verizon service

name: the nook near the swim hole
description: This is a cute little site just off hwy 199, there is a car pullout just off the hwy, on the west side there is a high clearance road (not big rig friendly - could fit a smaller sized van or truck w campertop) it’ll take you down off the highway, there’s enough room for 4-5 car/vans. there’s also a trail down at the bottom that leads to a larger tent camp site w fire ring. you can hear the hwy traffic but in between the cars all you get is the creek sound. not incredibly private (but private from the main road). no ‘no camping’ signs just no camp fires. cute little spot!

name: Mono Lake Committee Information Center
description: free wifi ,  picnic tables with shade structure, bear resistant trash and recycling container, ac power outlets at tables

name: Walmart Parking Lot
description: Nice level spot, There is parking lot noise, but what do you expect from a walmart parking lot. There is no shade at the level part of the lot. There are no signs that say No parking over night. There are signs that you can't sell a vehicle. So I think I will keep mine.

name: Penny Lake Trailhead 2
description: A gravel loop making up an unmarked trailhead. The trail from here connects up with the trailhead to the south. There is space here for several cars on the far side of the loop. Quiet with some brush blocking sight from the road. Please keep this place clean!

name: SugarLoaf Lake
description: Established Forest service campground on a wee lake. 4 sites well enough spread out and a boat launch for fishing. Nobody else was here when we stayed. Pack in pack out style with pit toilets. You pass a large lake with MANY camping spots as you make your way here but somebody was camping with loud music playing over that lake so we choice this quite spot Instead. 10$ a night cheaper with America pass. No reception for AT&T or Verizon in the area.

name: Methow River
description: Second pulloff road once you enter the national Forest. Many opportunities to camp and accessible to all kinds of rigs. This spot is next to a river (more of a creek this time of year) and offers enough shade. Spots are spread out and we only saw two other rigs spread around. Workable reception for Verizon but would greatly benefit from a signal booster. Fire risk in the area and no fires allowed

name: South Picnic Loop
description: Stay here one day, picnic tables, grills Bathroom, water( I did check and the water is on, not not sure if they turn it off at certain times) very quiet nice place to get off the road they do have some trails .  They do not have any "no overnight". the gate in the front it does ask to have your car removed at 7:45 so I did not try to stay overnight.

name: koa
description: water spigots at many of the rv pull throughs

name: I-79 northbound rest area
description: I-79 northbound rest area, south of Pittsburgh, close to the interstate, noisy

name: laundry near Riley Campground for public use
description: 2$ each wash and each 45 min Drying, only coins, exchange in the reception near by, also shower room, the washing maschines are not clean, some out of order (2working , 3 broken) takes 25 min each wash, free wifi, 4 dryer (also not clean)

name: Challenging pullout
description: i got my sprinter here with a couple scrapes. would be fine for a truck with better group clearance or a shorter wheelbase. nearly level spot, but inches from the forest road.  stay left at the fork in the road. Two bars of Verizon 4g and a little mountaintop view

name: Street By Bartram's Garden
description: Quiet dead-end street by neglected industrial area. Very close to Bartram's Garden and a segment of the Schuylkill River Trail. Plenty of parking.

name: Parking Lot near Manayunk
description: Out of the way parking lot by the river. Some noise from freeway traffic. Convenient location near downtown Manayunk with restraunts in walking distance.

name: BnB Swiss
description: Gravel lot with hookups. This place has cabins for rent or you can cram in like a sardine in the gravel lot with full hookups. Lots of permanent residents here. It’s clean and quiet except for the road noise. Close to Walmart, no amenities available. Barely fit with a 45’ 5th wheel but there wasn’t room for the truck so it had to be parked elsewhere

name: NF 700 junction Creekside camping
description: Large site with a cute creek and fire pit. Right off the road across from the 700 junction. Road is a little washed out so high clearance is probably required but made it easily in a Subaru Outback. Had 2 bars 5G Tmobile

name: Martin County Rest Area (Northbound)
description: Nice big lot to park for the evening. We felt parking next to the curb to the right had the flattest spots. Security was around and it was nice.

name: Little meadow
description: Meadow opposite side of the campground, one fire pit, enough room for few rigs

name: Bramble Wildlife Management Area
description: Just a small parking lot, but definitely a good overnight.

name: Pilot Grove Campground
description: A small, county campground in Montgomery County. There is electricity and a solid restroom and shower.

name: David City Campground
description: Nice little city park, with camping. $15.00 for electric. Quiet and very well maintained.

name: Walmart (water refil $29c gallon)
description: Walmart water refill $29 cents each gallon. Close 11pm

name: Southern Park
description: Great parking lot next to a local park. While the park is closed at dusk, we stayed in the parking lot next to the road for two nights. Beautiful sunsets on the river and a great forest across the road to hang your hammock.

name: Lake-side Camping near Devil’s Tower
description: A great dirt road pull over spot (off the main paved road), right by a small lake. Perfect for overnight camping and a decent view of the national monument. No road sound at all.

name: Love’s Showers
description: $15 for a private, no time limit shower. Shower rooms are very clean. Towels are provided. More than one person can use the shower (for example, if you are travelling as a couple or a family).

name: Love’s Truck Stop
description: Truck stop with RV parking spaces. Stayed for one night. Was somewhat noisy (typical of a truck stop) but otherwise good for a night. They also have showers that you can pay to use. A shower costs $15, but they are private, no time limit, and more than one person in a family can use the shower.

name: Powder Creek Campground
description: Powder Creek Ranch offers generous camp sites nestled in the Tillamook forest. Access to Powder Creek, a picnic table and campfire ring.

name: Nature Trail Parking Lot
description:
Got a great spot for all ya overlanders. Here we've got a parking lot at a trail head. Nice trail for sure, starting right here in town. No signs prohibiting overnight here, in fact it seems to be encouraged as there were about a dozen other cars parked here overnight. Yet we were the only humans present and sleeping here, so I assume this is where people overnight park when they catch the ferry for some camping.

Public bathrooms down the street near the water, you can find them with a Google search.

Lots of friendly folk around here.

name: The Bluffs at Cedar Creek
description:
5 sites with full hookup. 1-4 are directly along the creek, 5 is the largest, and although not on the creek, the most private. Accessible with any type of vehicle. This campsite is on the owner’s property, and he is incredibly nice. No showers, porta potties that are cleaned weekly. 

On the expensive side considering available amenities, but these sites are not jam packed. 70 on weekends (Fri-Sun), 63 week days. 
T-Mobile and Verizon were touch and go. At best 2 bars. 

Pets are welcome but the do allow off leash. The owner has dogs, and they are very well behaved (farm working dogs) and do have free range of space. We usually see them in the morning, and kept our reactive dog inside the van during those visits. 

Creek has a swimming hole and multiple points of entry for setting up chairs. Gorgeous, dark skies for star gazing. Gazebo, multiple picnic benches, fire pits, etc.

name: Lawrence Family Fitness Center - YMCA
description: Lawrence Family Fitness Center YMCA. Clean showers - $5.00 each.  Hours vary each day so check before heading over.  Sat & Sun only open until 1 pm.

name: not wifi but great cell signal!
description: not wifi but really good service for Google fi and Verizon at this turnout. was able to work a full day here and take meetings etc. thought I would share for other digital nomads out there!

name: Large Gravel Pullout beside River
description: A very large level area beside the beautiful McKenzie River at the “1,000 Feet” marker.  Apparently there was a forest fire through the area in the past decade or so.  Although large enough for a dozen or more coaches, we were the only ones here last night (a Sunday evening).  It is what it is, an open place to park overnight, with no signs and no amenities other than the flowing river on one side, and expected highway traffic noises on the other.  Some trash, but not bad.  As Mom always said, “leave it a little cleaner than you found it!”  One bar Verizon service, slow but useable hotspot!

name: Road 316 (Madden Peak)
description: Just under a mile up from the 160 Highway, the National Forest begins, with a sign saying you can camp anywhere along Rd 316 as long as it's within 300 feet of the road. No services, but 2 bars for internet. Beautiful sunsets. Spots all along the road.

name: By the river - parking lot
description:
Currently a closed business fenced off next to this lot. Has signage that they charge during the witching month of October.

Just across the bridge is the historic district of Salem. 10 min walk to the sights.

Next to a fairly busy street but not too loud. Gas station across the street.

name: Lower glidden lake campsites
description: Beautiful lake with 5 dispersed campsites on it. Beach area for swimming. Rough ride in but we did fine with  our fwd Promaster. No toilets. Unfortunately the mosquitos were just horrendous- so we left first thing in the am ( as did other campers). Just horrible !!!

name: North Fork Siuslaw Camp
description: Dispersed campground with 7 sites. All but 1 have table and fire ring with grill. Gross but present pit toilet. 2 sites appear to be off the creek. I didn’t get 1 of those but mine had a path that led to creek. Definitely some long term people but no drama, quiet, and felt safe…stayed 3 nights. Easy access right off paved road. No cel

name: pullout on little river road
description: large pullout on a semipaved road.  all the side roads were gated off, so settled for this.  we had a quiet night, no issues.  occasional traffic in the morning, but because the road is sort of paved and therefore quiet, I only noticed after I woke up.  Heard some hunting in the morning.  Some ATT service, Verizon was spotty.

name: Free Dump site
description: Easy access dump station not far from Middleton.  Water is available for washing down, but would not trust for drinking.

name: Rotary Park
description: Beautiful spot right along Rock Creek. There is plenty of shade, picnic tables, and access to the creek. There are also clean kybos and grills.

name: Walmart Geneseo
description:
A quiet well lit Walmart with lots of good out of the way spots to tuck yourself away for the night. 

No signage indicating overnights or RV’s were unwelcome.  Nobody bothered us all night.   Grabbed some groceries in the AM at the Walmart itself.

name: Lower Elwha Food & Fuel
description: Gas Station with great prices, fuel,  propane, big roomy diesel pumps AND FREE WATER (use your own hose). We asked the attendant inside & he said we could help ourselves to the water spigot. No dump seen

name: Wildberries Grocery Store
description: Free strong wifi. There is a greenhouse patio area on the side that is really sweet. Great food inside to nibble on.

name: Craig Lake pull out
description: A pull through wedged between a small pond and the scenic highway. Lava fields across the highway to the north.

name: Mount Sherman trailhead
description: Mount Sherman trailhead. Not a big area, or very flat, but lots of rocks for leveling. Last mile of the road is rutted and rocky

name: Telephone Mesa
description: Roadside, but off road several hundred feet. The highway is restricted to 40' long vehicles, and some of the tightest switchbacks I've ever cared to drive.  One LTE bar.

name: Water spigot
description: Water spigot by the bathroom in Penrose Point State Park. Not good for RVs but perfect for refilling bottles and jugs.

name: Magic Mile Laundry, Car Wash & Pet Wash
description: Magic Mile has 4 businesses in one location. Laundry Mat, Car Wash, Pet Wash, and Casino!... 520 10th St SE, Watertown, SD 57201.

name: HARKINS THEATRES FLAGSTAFF 16
description: Huge parking lot between the theatres and the strip mall. Stayed there 2 nights with other Class Cs, Class As, room for big rigs but the center of the parking lot is not too leveled.  You can hear a constant rumbling from the Purina plant and some trains passing by but it's not a significant problem. Spent 2 nights there. Very convenient when the Forests around are flooded during monsoon season.

name: Elkhorn Campground
description: Good road in 8 miles off Rt. 72 about 10 miles north of Loa. Forest Service campground fee $12 nice pit toilet. Picnic tables/water at 8 sites plus a large group site. Approximately 10,000 feet elevation. No one else there when we were on a Sunday evening.

name: Chatanika River Access at the Cripple Creek Campground
description: Take the River Access Rd instead of entering the campground. Follow the road, medium clearance vehicle might be required.  It will lead to a gorgeous pristine riverbed with enough space for a few smaller campers.  Please leave this cleaner than you found it, it’s beautiful, road noise when a vehicle passes which is infrequent

name: Bashas
description: Water! There is a dispensary outside. 25 cents a gallon

name: Clark’s Country Market
description: Small grocery store but they will have anything you need. Prices are a little high but reasonable for being a small place. They also have a water fill up outside, just ask to use it.

name: BP Gas Station 24/7
description:
Moderator Note: Place added by owner.

BP Gas Station 24/7
 10 Viking Dr, Reedsburg WI 53959
608 524 5544

RV’s and vacationers are welcome! We offer a RV dump station (closed during winter months), vacuum stations, propane tanks, and other items to make things on the road more bearable 

Our pumps include off road diesel. ATV-UTV maps available for Juneau, Jackson, Monroe, Sauk, Richland & Wood Counties. Camping in your plans? We carry firewood, ice, propane tanks / refills, bug spray 
Next to a Taco Bell and large parking lot

name: Kwik Trip Truck Stop #775
description:
Kwik Trip Truck Stop #775
611 Gateway Ave, Mauston WI 53948 
608 847 2333

Look for red pillars by air pump
Free Dump and Verified by contacting the store
Has the Dump station, water, bathrooms etc

name: Dutch Mill Park & Ride
description: Next to a gas station and Arbys, nearby Menards, Kwik Trip, Subway, grocery store. Easy On/Off

name: parking mid-beach
description: Public parking near the mid beach. It is 20$ for 24 hours. We spent the night here in our camper and everything was fine.

name: publix parking
description: Slept here 1 night. No signs of no overnight parkings and everything was fine.

name: Kwik Trip Truck Stop #796
description:
Kwik Trip Truck Stop #796
310 E MCCOY BLVD  Tomah, WI 54660
608-372-5776 

Free Dump Station/water
ATM, BULK DEF, CAT SCALES, CONVENIENCE STORE, DELI, FEDEX BOX, LAUNDRY, MONEY ORDERS, PAVED LOT, PROPANE BOTTLES, PUBLIC FAX / COPIER, RECEIVE PREPAID PERMITS, RESTAURANT, RV GASOLINE, RV PARKING, SHOWERS, TRAILER DROP, TRIP PACK LOCATIONS, WIFI

name: Cherry Springs State Park
description: Dump station & potable water spigot outside of the state park entrance

name: Chinty Lake
description:
Chinty Lake Sarona, WI
Public Rest Area
From Hwy 53 Turn East on Cty B go about 4.5mi and turn R or South at the dirt entrance. If you reach The Roost or Cty M you've gone too far.

This is a small roadside rest stop with a long abandoned pit toilet only, about 5 miles East of Hwy 53 on Cty Rd. B. It is well hidden just on the south side of county road B about a half mile west of Rolling Thunder RV Park. If you pass the park you've gone too far. There is room for one RV under 40', no hookups, small trail down to waters edge for some fishing or swimming on a small pond.

name: Gravel pull off at intersection
description: There is a gravel pull off big enough for one vehicle at the intersection of Icicle Road and Forest Service Rd 7601.  Obviously tons of car noise since literally on side of a busy road leading to a popular trailhead but also by rushing water so that helps drown some of the noise out.  We ran out of daylight coming down from Colchuck Lake trailhead so this was a quick/easy random pull out for the night.  No trees overhead so great spot for astro photography!  No amenities or cell signal.

name: Swan Creek Park-Free Camp
description:
Swan Creek Park
Schwartz Rd Exeland, Wisconsin 
45.666906, -91.23627 

1-5 Free sites 
This small town park is closed after Labor Day due to severe winters in Northern Wisconsin. There's a loop with 5 electric hookups in the center. There are volleyball and baseball fields, pavilions and Windfall Lake is only a mile to the East with free swimming and a boat Ramp. All trash must be carried out as this is bear country. 
Some train and traffic noise during the day, but not enough to ruin the peace of this park 
There are bathrooms and water but shut off for cold weather.

NO  reservations, the park has 5 electric hookups and are 1ST COME 1ST SERVE,  there is a MAXIMUM STAY OF 3 NIGHTS, Please leave donations in town at the Exeland Depot gas station
Contacts:
Village of Exeland as of 8/2022
President - Susan Kopras P.O. Box 153 Exeland WI 54835. 715-943-2200. Email - Vexeland@bevcomm.net 
Village Hall. 11042W State Hwy 48 . 715-943-2026 
 

BBQ Grill
Drinking Water
Electricity
Pets Welcome
Picnic Tables
Restrooms
Playground
RV Parking
Tent Camping
Boating
Swimming

AT&T and Verizon reported as poor here. Likely want a WeBoost phone booster

Directions are from Hwy 48, Turn South on N Schwartz Rd, take immediate R onto Swan Creek Park Rd stay to the R

name: Bruce Village Park-Free
description:
Bruce Village Park
750 West  Arthur Ave Bruce, Wisconsin 
715-868-2185
45.45464, -91.278628 

Camping is under the large pines. Just off of Hwy 8 so there will be road noise.
Tent Camping or Trailer but someone did stay in a 40' RV on Freecampsites.net
Sign at the entrance says no motorized recreational vehicles. I assume that applies only to motor homes...Unclear
Need to contact township for free permit and verify no other events scheduled. 
Bruce Village Hall 715-868-2185
Biking
ADA accessible
Drinking Water
Pets Welcome
Picnic Tables
Restrooms
Playground
Trash Cans
Village park with ball fields, playground, picnic pavilion, horseshoe pits, and more. Some spots are numbered some seem to have lost their signs

name: PicnicPoint
description:
Picnic Point Campground
Medford, WI
45.30559332932154, -90.43583866441976

877-444-6777
www.Recreation.gov
Chequamegon-Nicolet National Forest campground

Appears to be Tent Only, it's umm expensive at $75-$83/night as of 8/2022
Says may close summer of 2022 for repairs

name: Horn Lake & Lincoln Cty Forest-Free
description:
Horn Lake & Lincoln Cty Forest- Free
Horn Lake Rd Birch, WI
45.302340, -89.634850

The Horn Lake campsite and the entire Lincoln county forest is free to camp for 14 days with no permit.
NOTE: The north side of Horn Lake is private property.
CAMPING ON COUNTY FOREST LAND
Overnight camping, including tents, trailers, cars and trucks may be permitted in the County Forest without charge for a period of no more than 14 days. Any camper who violates the rules of good conduct, including cutting or defacing timber, carelessness with fire, violation of game and fishing laws of the State, or improper disposal of garbage and litter shall be subject to ejection from the County Forest and subject to the penalties provided by County and State laws. When camping on the County Forest, blocking roads, parking areas, or lake access is not permitted.

Camping is not allowed at the following lakes: High Lake Fox Lake Morraine Lake Henson Lake Kordick Lake Forestry, Land and Parks Department Lincoln County Service Center 801 N. Sales Street, Suite 106 Merrill, WI 54452 Phone: 715-539-1034

name: Synergy Cenex Gas Station
description:
Synergy Cenex West- Rice Lake
45.5103460619651, -91.76424853054175
2022 Cenex Drive,
Rice Lake, WI 54868
715-736-0800 

Also contains a Subway
Hrs 5am-10pm --Dump Station, Live Bait, Fishing Tackle, Hotstuff Pizza, Coffee, Cappuccino, LP Tank Exchange, DMV Tab Renewals, Truck Parking

name: Kwik Trip Truck Stop #796
description:
Kwik Trip Truck Stop #796
44.019023, -90.502427
310 E MCCOY BLVD  Tomah, WI 54660
608-372-5776 

Free DUMP STATION, ATM, BULK DEF, CAT SCALES, CONVENIENCE STORE, DELI, , FEDEX BOX, LAUNDRY, MONEY ORDERS, PAVED LOT, PROPANE BOTTLES, PUBLIC FAX / COPIER, RECEIVE PREPAID PERMITS, RESTAURANT, RV GASOLINE, RV PARKING, SHOWERS, TRAILER DROP, TRIP PACK LOCATIONS, WIFI

name: Springville
description: Vacant lot next to Burger King across from Country Fair gas station

name: cenex
description: Potable water at Centex. free from blue handle spigot.

name: Keep Going Up
description: This spot has room for 2/3 smaller rigs. One spot is perfect: level with great sunrise views. The other(s) you might need levelers. We have a 25 foot rv with low ground clearance and made it no problem. T-Mobile works fine.

name: Cooter Camp
description: Wide spot turn on dirt road about a 1/4 mile down from Castle Creek road room for 2 truck/ vans with cab/ RTT with great views

name: Speedway
description: Water spigot beside vac and air, in front of gas pumps.

name: KOA Salida / Mt Shavano
description: Pleasant KOA site with nice view of the mountains. Hot showers, laundry and an indoor community room with WiFi. $47 for a tent pitch with electric. Lovely friendly staff who lent us a power drill to do some repairs.

name: JJK campground
description:
Little campground, if it's full you will be more like on a parking lot. Near the river and with view on the marathon mountain.
One clean pit toilet, pit fire. No shower, no dump station, but potable water available.
dry site : 20$, electricity site: 30$.

name: Mohican State Park
description: Lovely park. Stayed at a pull through during heavy rain. In the morning the birds were enjoying the huge tall trees that shelter the campground.

name: Lazy J - Arkansas River
description: Easy to miss this turn off. 3-4 small sites right above the Arkansas River. Requires fire container and portable toilet. Definitely road noise but, it's free!

name: McElroy Park Water
description: Portable water available from spigot on drinking fountain at group picnic area, on northeast corner.

name: Walmart parking
description: Regular Walmart parking with overnight option. Quite a few campers here

name: Riverside Park RV
description:
Great spot, easy access on Easy TX!
USD 39 /day full hook up.
Spots with tree shades at the entrance of the Riverside Park

name: Rest stop
description: They have a water Spigot on the right side where cars enter not the left side for RVs

name: Pipestem Lake Turnaround
description: Follow the road over the dam until the pavement ends in a turnaround. Enough room for larger rig. No, "No Overnight" signs. Suitable for overnight parking, not camping. Decent Verizon signal.

name: Rocky Spot off FSR 9301
description: This area had tons of spots to camp ranging from walk-in, to drive-in, to pull-offs, and even an established campground. River nearby. Area seems prone to flooding and rushing water, likely in early spring and summer from snow melt. Had decent cell service and was generally pleasant.

name: Cities Creek campsite 4
description: large level site by the creek. Could fit any size rig. mixed pavement and gravel rd to reach the spot. very close to other sites and near a campground.

name: Big Water Marina and Campground
description: Campground and marina with over 45 tent and RV friendly campsites, 6 tiny cabins, 150+ wet slips, watercraft rentals and an inflatable waterpark. 30 and 50 amp hookup, 11 full hookup sites, dump station on the property, free wifi, water and power hookups.

name: Kentucky Welcome Center
description: Large rest area, separate truck and vehicle parking. Clean restrooms nice overnight spot.

name: International food/snacks store
description: Interesting store with lots of different food snacks from all over. Cash only. They also sell wifi time and calling cards here, see photos.

name: Olivia's Overlook
description: small gravel lot off rt 7 with a beautiful overlook of the mountains and lake, has a few trails up the mountain as well, Verizon has full service here.

name: Drake city park
description: City parking With dump and water. Place for 6rv

name: Girdwood Parking 72 hours zone
description: Nice spots. Authorized  by the town. 72 hours. See pictures. Chemical toilet.Near restaurants and orner facilties ex. Laundromat & Showers.

name: Furnace Creek Visitor Center
description: Free potable water and filtered water next to the restrooms at Furnace Creek Visitor Center

name: Becket river ish
description: followed the road up to the end. open area. looks like locals might target practice here? super quiet. t mobile 2 bars.

name: Bump Sullivan Wildlife refuge
description: 6-7 spots with fire rings right next to the reservoir.  Pit toilet at the parking area coming in and another where the camping spots are.  14 day camping limit.  Nice sandy beaches.  We picked up quite a bit of trash.  Expect locals on the weekends swimming.  Pretty quiet during the week.  2-3 bars Straighttalk cell service.  Enough to stream movies.  Other then the trash a really nice place.

name: Mineral springs Nooks
description: There’s a good amount of diapered camping on the off shoots but this one is big, on the creek, and has a fire ring. You can fit about 3 cars and a good amount of tents.

name: Point Paradise State Park
description: Nice campground with roomy sites bedded within the tree cover. Some sites have services, others without.  Variable prices so can range with season demand.  Good place to stop, free showers included and clean restrooms.

name: Overflow parking lot for Russian River Campground
description: A flat, paved parking lot. $4 for 12 hours and $8 for 24 hours. If the Russian River Campground is full, this is better than the side of the highway. Large pull through sites. No toilets, no fire rings, just a paved parking lot.

name: BLM Camp spot near PCT
description:
Pretty large, most flat BLM space next to a little creek and perfect for any type of traveler. Has a really nice and safe fire pit but PLEASE follow local fire regulations. There’s also a little trail that leads you directly to the pct. you can see hikers on their way from the spot. Safe, quiet, peaceful. We stayed here for the full 14 days without being bothered or anything. 

I want to note that when we first got here this place was kind of trashed. It looked like a big family stayed here for a long and left a lot of trash, hurt a lot of the trees, etc. All I was to say is please respect this land when you stay here and clean up after yourselves.

name: Lighting Creek Rd
description: Multiple places to pull off and camp. We saw many where people had rvs or were in tents. It is recommended to check to make sure your rig can get where you want. We saw one site occupied by multiple vehicles and tents. The site we stayed at gave us direct access to the river. We had ample space to spread out our restroom, eating, and sleeping areas. There was a fire ring set up and at one site there was a sign reminding you to make sure the fire was out before leaving. We had our senior dog with us and saw several other dogs at different sites. We didn't see anyone from our site and thought we heard people but the noise from the water made it difficult to know for sure. We slept in our van as it was our first time in the area. Stayed 2 nights, 3 days.

name: Maple fields
description: This maple fields Sunoco has a 3 lane truck fuel island with a DEF pump.

name: Interstate state park north campground
description: Beautiful sight, nice campground. Is close to highway with lots of highway noise.

name: Springfield Waste Treatment plant
description: $1, + sign-up.  Excellent public RV waste station.  Go to administrative building and follow signs to RV dump station.

name: JFK Park
description: Hand pump with spigot connection next to picnic shelter near parking lot at JFK Park in East Helena

name: Off 385 forrest service roads
description:
Off of 385 there are forrest service roads (I’m pretty sure) and lots of spots that can serve as great camping spots. We can hear some road noice as the winds is out of the NE.. I’m sure at night it will be quiet..
Beautiful and cool in august!

name: Planet fitness
description: This is one of the cleanest safest 24hr fitnesses east of Cleveland. Unfortunately at the time they had not got water but I’d been out running so that’s fine. Parked overnight by a truck no issues

name: Portland International Raceway Park and ride.
description:
A tiny park and ride lot next to Portland International Raceway. Quiet during the day, can get noisy on race nights. Nice field with walking paths right next to the lot and an off leash dog area. No restrooms, but there's a dumpster at one end of the lot for garbage. Area was clean. 

Sign in the lot says stays are limited to no more than 24 hours.

name: Washington Pass Observation Site
description:
There are water spigots by the picnic tables on the SW side. I did not check to see if there were any on the north side.

The "regular" restrooms were closed but the spigots still had water. They had pretty high pressure, so you could use a hose to your rig if it was long enough.

name: Eastbound Rest Stop on I-84
description: North of Idaho/Utah state line. Clean Interstate rest stop, noisy from trucks nearby, 30 or so level deep parking spots for cars and RV.  Certainly okay for overnight stay.  Vending machines and flush toilets!  3 bars Verizon service.

name: oasis laundry
description: laundromat washers are a bit pricey but they accept credit/debit cards and dryers are only .50 for 18 minutes. Great wifi! staff was available for questions and friendly. Clean and lots of space.

name: SeaTac Community Center
description: Shower was around $3, and they only take card. Showers took a second to get hot but then were hot and pretty clean. The SeaTac botanical garden next door is a nice place for a picnic too. Cheers!

name: Beach #10
description: From what I was told, there’s is no overnight camping at the state park even though you see tons of RVs, but this is a great place to spend the day until dusk. Concessions weren’t open so bring plenty to eat & drink. Bathrooms kind of dirty but they work fine.

name: Peavine Campground
description: Forest Service established campground. Just near the road, 4 spaces with fire rings, tables and barbecues available for tent camping. Pit toilet, trash containers on site. $10 day use, $15 for the night, $10 additional vehicle.

name: Apple Tree Campround
description: National Forest established campground. Pit toilets, fire rings, barbecues, tables for tent camping.

name: View of Ranier
description: Beautiful high mountain spot on side of dead end road. Good for solar an incredible view of the south side of Mt. Ranier. Right on the edge so probably not great for littles.

name: Mt. Hood by Lost Lake
description: Dispersed site, hard to see entrance but a roomy spot for campers or tents. I would not recommend a trailer.

name: North Beach General Store Campground
description:
a landromat just behind the gaz station. 
2$ per laundry

name: Off FS Rd near Whitefish
description: Nice pull out about 20 yard off the road. Fire ring and a parking area to get one or two vehicles in.  Cars passing during the day turn up a lot of dust but, there was only one car which drove by at night.

name: St. Augustine Beach Showers
description: Two outdoor, cold-water showers next to the splash pad and bathrooms. Several "rinse off" shower heads closer to the beach.

name: Love’s Truck Stop
description: $10 to dump grey and black water tanks! Spot is near the air compressor and dog run.

name: Wastewater Treatment Plant
description: Free outdoor shower. Next to wastewater treatment plant

name: Street Parking
description: Quiet neighborhood street close to shopping district.  Slept in my car for one night arriving late and leaving around 6AM.

name: River walk
description:
Quiet place with access to a small green area along the river walk. Ideal for children.
.....
Spot tranquille avec accès à un petit espace vert le long de River Walk! Idéal
Pour les enfants.!

name: flat pull off on forest road
description: nothing special but quiet.  no services or cell coverage

name: BLM Sacred White Shell Mountain
description: Great spot, there's about 10-20 additional areas to park off the dirt road, with established fire rings. Fantastic view of the San Luis Valley.

name: Salmon Shores RV Park
description: Very large sprawling RV park on the southwest shore of Black Lake in Olympia Washington.

name: Red Lodge Mountain Ski Hill
description: Large open parking lot open for camping. Plenty of room for many vehicles.

name: Target Parking Lot
description: Target shopping center large parking lot. Per security you can stay 24hours even though there are ‘No Overnight Parking’ signs posted. I have stayed here numerous times passing through. Great location off highway with nearby dumps and potable water (at Valero down the street). Shopping center has Starbucks, movie theater and much more. T-mobile service is spotty. All of Rohnert Park seems to be a dead zone for it.

name: Stark Rd North Lot Hwy 67
description:
Stark Rd North Lot 
Stark Rd Eagle, WI 53119
42.911565,-88.474311

Nice small lot, is visible from Northbound on Hwy though,  Blocked by trees/bushes from Southbound. No hours or fee signs, only nature trail info signboard. Access to Ice Age Trail. 
Tight space to turn around with a trailer. Gate at edge of lot no vehicles down Rd
Excellent AT&T 5g phone signal. Very close tower
Larger Open lot for Solar ¼ Mi South on HWY 67, likely requires State Park Sticker though

name: Stark Rd South Lot Hwy 59
description:
Stark Rd South Lot
Stark Rd Eagle, WI 53119
42.883359,-88.504563


Nice secluded 2 Lots with access to Ice Age Trail. All gravel on Stark rd about .5 mi from Hwy 59
Good open lot for Solar with sun Rising from open field to East and setting over trees to West and 2nd lot. No water access. 

There is another Stark Rd lot approx 4mi North of here on West side of Hwy 67 marked on Google Maps as IAT Lot or something. Not as secluded but clos, smaller and less obvious, looks like a gravel driveway. Also no signs/hrs other than nature trail info.

Lots of Parking Lots for the Ice Age Trail have no signs and easy access.

No prohibiting signs or hours, doesn't appear to be State Park or Fee area. Just North of here is a trail to Paradise Spring with old Springhouse, on Cty N, marked on Google Maps

40' rig about absolute max length to turn around. Truck and short trailer just fits between driveway section and North back of lot without really blocking drive.

AT&T 5g phone service is amazing with a tower visible and 200Mb down and 30Mb up

name: 24/7 Gas Station
description: This has station is just south off of I-70. I noticed a huge open lot behind the station and asked the attendant of I could park my van there for the night. He said I could and that long haul trucks park here as well, sometimes. There are restaurants and fast food joints within walking distance. It'll do for overnight. That's all I needed it for. Free is good.

name: Platte River Rest Area Eastbound
description: This is a nice rest area. It sits back off the highway and has lots of woods. It has bathrooms, walking paths, big area for dogs.

name: Blair Flats Campground
description: This is a free primitive Forest Service campground with just three sites and a vault toilet. No picnic tables or water. A secure food locker is available. It is frequently used for day use by floaters, fishermen, etc. No Verizon signal. Access road is 0.4 miles long so although highway noise is present it is pretty minimal. Not suitable for RVs. Lots of mosquitoes during our stay.

name: Fall Lake Campground - free
description: Free potable water in the forest service campground office parking lot. You may need to go in the reverse way if you don't have a long enough hose.

name: Mesa Verde Campground Dump Station
description: You must pay $30 NP entrance fee (or show America the Beautiful pass or similar) but no additional fee to dump. Follow signs to campground then continue past registration toward campsites and it is on the right just before Prater Ridge TH. Potable water, too.

name: Antique Corral
description: Incredible huge place. Has cowboy and indian stuff, not expensive. If you are looking for a souvenir this might be the place!

name: Davis Food and Drug
description: There's a potable water refill station inside Davis supermarket at ally # 9

name: Seal pull off
description: Small lil pull off on a tiny beach when the waters low. A group of 20 seals or so are lounging on the sand in the middle of the water (low tide). Not staying here tonight but I would if I didn’t have plans! Low traffic, no signs of any kind. A few pull offs around here if you don’t get this spot. (Prob not big enough for an RV/trailer. 2 bars 5g Verizon

name: State wildlife park
description: Large area flat restrooms on the river. Lots of room a bit tight getting in between the gate poles.

name: Trout Creek Road dispersed sites
description: There are a number of nice dispersed sites on Trout Creek Road outside of Superior, MT.  Road up was a little washboard, but not too bad.  Past the campground look towards the creek and you will find some nice big and secluded sites.  Very shaded, fire rings.  Right next to the water!  We loved it- as the dogs could run free and swim within our line of sight.  No cell service.

name: Trout Creek USFS Campground d
description: Nice campground within Lolo National Forest. 12 campsites with tables, fire rings, bathrooms and trash cans. Few steps from Trout Creek- which is beautiful !! $10/ nite- 1/2 off with senior pass.

name: Welcome Center West Virginia off of 81 south bound
description: Rest center/welcome center for West Virginia

name: Medano Creek trail 0.3
description: Great campsite, very flat,next to creek, fire pit, no other amenities, free, amazing views, near to the Sand Ramp Trail.

name: Daroga State Park
description: Nice views of the river, found a shady site with power (for A/C!) and water. Ranger told us they had nearly 50% cancel this weekend. It was 109F when we stopped here to escape the brutal heat.

name: Vitus in Tok
description: Propane for good price, 3,50 a gallon, also cheapest gas in town.

name: Chicken RV park and fuel
description: Last place to get US fuel prices, more expensive then Tok, but cheaper than Dawson city, also diesel.

name: Dead end road
description: Dead end paved road that seems rarely used. I stayed in a pull off to the left maybe 1/4 mi from main road. FR ends shortly after and potentially a couple other spots. River at the end of the road is somewhat accessible but was a bit steep and I didn’t go down to it. This spot was most level and had a nice mix of sun and shade. Very quiet. No cel

name: Washing Well
description: Clean laundromat with many machines of different sizes. $4.00 for smallest load.

name: Point Lena picnic Area - Near Host site
description: Free water at the host site. Today there was no host so we parked in this spot and filled up our jugs.

name: Yellow lakestate forest
description: Little spot for 1 or 2 small or medium rv/car. camping in tent can be possible. Next to the river, perfect spot for fishing.

name: Wanakena public campground
description: Free - Nice place with fire pit. Pefect for all kind of tents. No river and lake but there is a forest and toilets.

name: suwannee cove
description: peaceful rite on the river,hot showers . great place

name: Wilson creek trailhead
description:
Parking at the trailhead.
Firepit. 1/4 mile away from the main track. Super quiet. No cellular coverage.

name: Two camp road
description: On FS381, spot with several fire pits and room for 3 rigs. Flat. Spotty cell signal.

name: Conchas Lake State Park
description: State park with almost no working facilities. Lake is too low to launch power boats. Water system is off. Little Verizon signal from the front gate only. Another cell tower nearby but I don't know who's. Small metal shelters at each campsite. dumpsters and porta potties

name: Tim Lottis
description: Nice spot with a great view,  it’s a bit tight for 2 rigs, and bit difficult to get down into since it’s kinda steeps with some fairly deep holes

name: Planet Fitness
description: Parking lot open 24/7, gym open and staffed 24/7

name: Maverik
description: Water spigot between pumps 7 & 8. Good fast flow.

name: TA Travel Center
description: Green hose & spigot on the wall outside the travel center building.

name: Baggs RV Dump
description: Free RV dump with water and vault toilets. Donations accepted.

name: Twin Elm Ranch
description: Good ranch with pool, horses, campfire, hayrides…for 50$ night. Good plan

name: Plateau Roadside
description: Pull-off on the side of the road with a fire ring. There’s other spots up the hill but we didn’t try it with our camper trailer. The road in is bumpy but not bad! We made it fine with a 15ft pull-behind, 2wd and relatively low clearance. Great ATT service

name: Paradise Spring
description:
Paradise Spring
Cty N Eagle, WI 
42.887362,-88.492882

Actual spring house at 42.886793,-88.489800
One CAN access the spring for water…not easily but hop over wall and down to water level right at the pool. It's crystal clear. The Spring house is probably 1000ft from the parking lot. Follow sidewalk East the veer Right about 500ft down trail, follow sidewalk. Its at the south end of the spring pond. It's a bit of a hike to haul a big jug etc unless you got wheels. Then it's easy as it's all paved.
This is State Park fee area so a pass is technically required. There is a drop box, no electronic machine. No pets, hrs are 6am-11pm

Also pit toilet building is available likely only during summer/warm season. The small hexagon building down path but near lot. A Reservable shelter is there too if desired 

Natural Spring, from before 1900's
The rebuilt Gotten Cabin from 1850's is across the street.
If you're into that old historical stuff check out Old World WI nearby

name: Walmart
description: Beautiful Wal-Mart with no signs indicating overnight parking is disallowed.

name: Ely Chamber of Commerce
description: $5 RV dump with flush hose. During business hours they can take cash or card. You pay inside during business hours and there's a slot to drop cash in when the office is closed.

name: Gill’s Neck Road underpass
description: Gravel parking under highway 9 overpass to Cape Henlopen. Access via Gill’s Neck road directly from Lewes. This is a popular fishing spot. Fisherman come and go at all hours. The bridge is quite solid and muffles the traffic well, plus it provides much needed shade. There’s room for two to three vehicles under the bridge plus more parking in the adjacent gravel lot. We enjoyed a quiet night here. We didn’t fish this time but have scored Striped Bass here on a previous trip.

name: North Aztlan community center
description: showers, gym/cardio, a good place to cool down. $5 for day pass (to shower and/or use gym)

name: Trippe Lake Park
description:
Trippe Lake Park
407 S Wisconsin St, Whitewater, WI 53190
42.828870,-88.725151

Small park with flushing restrooms a shelter. Hrs 6am-12am
Power is on back corner of wall, lift panel to access 120 or 240v receptacles.
Water is a drinking fountain and spigot on sidewalk side of restrooms, easy access. Likely shutoff in cold seasons. There's a free flowing well about 5 mi South on Clover Valley Rd GPS- 
42.784466,-88.714701 

At&t phone is awesome here with 5G and 130Mb down, 8Mb up with 40ms ping

name: SW 37th Ave Street Parking
description: Quiet side-street parking. Gabriel Park on one side and residential area on the other. It was very quiet from when we arrived (9pm) until about 10am the next morning when kids started to arrive at the park. Street is fairly level and there are no parking restrictions posted.

name: Short, dead end road
description: Short dead end road with no signage of any kind. It's narrow without a turn around. We pulled in with our 20' RPOD and just backed out. Had to take our time, but it wasn't bad. Good amount of highway noise during the day, but very quiet at night. Great Verizon signal. Stayed here a couple nights with no issues.

name: Flowing Well
description:
Whitewater Spring
8267-8201 Clover Valley Rd, Whitewater, WI 53190

Free Natural high volume Spring from 1895 easy access from road 24/7/365
Few covered benches
AT&T phone service is ok here with about 13Mb down and 3Mb up.

name: Escalante Canyon Road off HWY 550
description: The road goes down through the canyon and across the Gunnison River. The road off the highway is a good gravel road, and I chose to pull off at a marked campsite near the highway—it was relatively flat and I had 2-3 bars VZN LTE. I also had some concerns about flash flooding in the canyon as it’s monsoon season. For me it was a perfect overnight—convenient, quiet, breezy. Some traffic on Escalante Canyon Road around 7am, presumably people going down to the boat launch.

name: Spring Water Spout
description: This is a natural spring water pipe. Locals & others stop often to fill water tanks & gallons! When we were staying nearby we would frequently stop to fill our water reserves & water bottles. It is free although I’m not sure how long government will let that go unattended to.

name: Springfield Suites off Progress Ave
description: Stayed in the corner of the hotel parking lot. Got in late and left early, keeping a low profile. Hotel is located in a business park so there's no foot/thru traffic, but located right next to US 81 so road noise is noticeable. Gas station and fast food located between exit and hotel for easy access for fill ups and bathroom.

name: Loves
description: Typical loves truck stop. Showers are $15. If you don’t want to go in to pay you can do everything within their app on your phone. Pay, get your shower # and code for entrance into the shower. Everything is clean and pleasant. Crashed in the parking lot, no issues.

name: Glacier Laundry
description: Next to Glacier Family Foods grocery and 76 gas station with diesel.  reasonable prices.  no wifi but good cell signal.

name: Scenic View paved pulloff
description: This is a designated "Scenic View", paved and level. There are no services, but enough room for a few rigs is needed, including big rigs. There are a lot of pullouts on this route, but we wanted the security of a paved spot due to expected rain.

name: Lake Sonoma parking
description:
A parking spot / outlook that has room for a few cars or vans. Does not fit RVs and does not allow trailers. No “no overnight parking” or “no camping” signs. Had a garbage bins and down the bridge there are some port-a potties. 
Close to a road that is fairly quiet but seems to have loud traffic between 5am-7am. 
Spend two nights here.
Clean. Please keep it that way. 
Verizon was poor, AT&T and Starlink worked well.

name: Exxon
description: Water spigot next to free air. Bring own hose.

name: Atchinson State Fishing Lake
description: This is a small but pretty lake. As the name says, it is mostly set up for fishing but camping is permitted. There is a pit toilet, picnic tables, and fire rings. There were some people fishing when we arrived in the late afternoon on a Wednesday. One couple had a picnic dinner here, but we were the only overnight campers. There are about 5 or 6 sites that could accommodate tents up to 35’ rigs.

name: Grand View Showers & Laundry
description:
$3.00 for 8 minute shower.  Hot as long as the washing machines aren't filling, then lukewarm at best.  Reasonably clean, no bench or chair to use when dressing.  

Laundry in the same building: 3 washers and 4 dryers, all old, but working.  Two of the washers are $3 each, one is $3.50, all are the same size.  Dryers are $2 per load.  Get quarters at the store/reception/ restaurant building.  Staff seems friendly.

name: Lemolo Forebay
description: Camped here one night. Nice spot next to Lemolo pond area with canal rushing by. Had 2-3 bars with Verizon. Pretty fast internet. Decent amount of bugs(flies) but mosquitoes weren’t bad. Found wild boysenberry’s near the water. Large area to park multiple vehicles on level ground. Road was not bad and mostly gravel, a few ruts here and there. Also another area further down the canal to park. One fire ring. Some shade. Some trash and TP around.

name: North Bound Rest Stop
description: Good for a travelling night's stay.  Quiet on a weekday overnight.

name: Water Spigot
description: Threaded potable water spigot located in the back loop of the camp ground. We filled up twice and nobody cared.

name: Shoulder parking with signal
description: Large pull out area with sprint signal. We stayed 1 night in RV and was not bothered.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Called ahead and they said it was fine. They don’t have any pull through spots if you’re pulling a trailer but vans & small RVs are fine. Park behind the restaurant & buy something if you can.

name: Loves
description: Crashed here for a day/night. No issues. Several car/vans parked. Clean showers. $15 for shower. It sits off the highway so you have your typical noise.

name: Meadow above Taylor Reservoir
description: Dispersed sites above Mirror Lake surrounded by mountain views.  very exposed with limited shade. Cold at night and warm during the day. Can be windy.  I would only do this as a one night location. If you're looking for a longer stay, there are much better/bigger sites along the road between here and Cottonwood Pass. Those sites will accommodate large rigs and toy haulers. This site is ideal for 1 or 2 vehicles.  I've marked the site as 'not big rig friendly' but you could probably get a small camper or toy hauler off the FS road if you couldn't find a better site along the way. This site is completely dry.

name: Success Pond Road Campsite
description:
Success Pond Road runs N/E out of Berlin,NH.  A gravel public roadway in good condition suitable for SUV, vans and trucks.  Rough enough in sections where road sedans would not be suitable.  Generally very light traffic to include ATV’s.  

There are many short pull offs on this roadway along it’s length.  This posted site has a 80’ or so pull off well cleared to about 12’ wide.  Has a firm level surface and at the end has a wider section, perhaps 20’ wide.  We backed in with our truck camper and enjoyed a quiet night.

name: Dispersed Camp Site
description:
Take the dirt road past Cosmic Campground and there are quite a few spots off the road. 

Any vehicle could get you to the first few spots but the further in you go the bumpier it gets.

5G with TMobile

Established fire ring and flat spot for tent at most sites

name: Netul landing parking lots
description:
3 separate parking areas for trailhead, interpretative signs, and kayak launch that is part of Lewis and Clark national historic site managed by national park service. 

Ranger at main visitor center specifically said they leave gate at this area open 24/7. Parallels fort Clatsop road but guessing not much traffic at night. Will update if wrong.

Vault toilets, parking lots all pretty level.

name: Beautiful, Isolated Forest Spot
description: Super Location. In the Fremont- Winema National Forest it is generally located   East and North  of Great Meadow Snow Park which is on  SR 140. Located  3.5 miles East of the snow park on 140  is a turn off on the north side for NF-3651, a dirt forest road.  Follow that .6 miles. Shortly after the start 3651 veers left and prox at .5  miles from start  there is a smaller NF road marked 060 (sign is small and barely visibile). Turn left and  follow that back a short ways (prox .1 mile) and on your right will be a little road/opening that leads to this wonderful location. It may be N-F 3651-061. Surround by trees that form a circle with a stone campfire ring, the spot is open to the sky for great night viewing while surrounded by the trees. This is not a designated NF spot, but legal to camp here it appears. I spent two nights here with no problems and no-one in the area at all. Very slight light highway noise. Verizon signal very good. Big enough for a couple of truck campers, or van campers.

name: Yachats river road pull outs
description:
Multiple pullouts along this very quiet road. No signs. A few vehicles stopped by while I was there incl someone who I think went fishing for a few hours in the morning. Others were only there briefly. 

Reasonably level.

name: Cape perpetua parking off 101
description: Level. Pretty quiet at night (few vehicles all going slow). No signs. Nice ocean/horizon view.

name: Cape perpetua overlook parking
description:
Ymmv. Two parking areas, a sign says day use at the first one so I chanced it by parking in the second area by restroom/picnic tables. No rangers came by the night I stayed there.

Great short trail to overlook for incredible ocean views, particularly at sunset.

name: Small Campsite
description: Small campsite w/fire ring (room for one or two vehicles of the same party, maybe a tent or two) just before going up the hill. There's only 3 sites in this area that I could see due to FS placing markers to stop people from driving all over the grasslands. LNT!

name: Tuna Harbor Park
description: Parking lot next to the piers. Parking is metered from 10 am to 8 pm, aside from that, there are no restrictions and no "no overnight parking" signs.

name: Wheeler Pond Road Campsite
description: I found this established campsite with a fire pit just off Wheeler Pond Road near the pond.  Overnighted here with no other traffic during the afternoon or night.  Roadway is suitable for trucks, vans, AWD and other moderate ground clearance vehicles.  No towed vehicles.  Pull out spot is about 30’ off road and has a clearing size of about 30x50’. Fairly level and firm ground.

name: Eden Laundromat
description: Super Clean laundromat,  multiple size washing  machines 2x 3x 4x . At least 30 dryers. I'd  come again.

name: Arkwright Campground
description: Wooded Campground with mostly full time residents,  but 3 overnight slots.   $35 cash/ night for electric and water,  $30/dry.  Showers and dump station.   Road going in off 83 is unmarked but google will get you there.   Kitty corner across road from white house with red barn.   2942 NY-83, Fredonia, NY 14063. Full bars cell service.

name: Pinion Pine Paradise
description: Gorgeous spot at the end of trail #71F. High clearance 4x4 will get you here easily. Could be difficult in wet conditions. The spot is off the grid BLM area, sandy ridge with amazing 360 degree views. 3 bars of AT&T service. Wild life includes rabbits, deer, elk and we saw tracks of what matched 5" long Grey Wolf. In the picture below note that I wear a XXL glove and a size 16 ring. Very quiet, every once in a while car noise from hwy 9 (about 3 miles away)

name: White Bird Fishing Access
description: White Bird is a state fishing access site located along the Stillwater River in south central Montana. Camping is permitted at the site; facilities are limited to toilets and there is a 7 day stay limit

name: FS Road Pull-off
description: Nice and easy spot to crash for an evening. Some noise from the main road, but overall a quiet night. If it’s late and you don’t feel like driving around looking for a spot this is a good stop.

name: Cottonwood pass oh parking lot
description: Ovh parking gravel lot on top of Cottonwood Pass. Flat with good view. Road in is good for any car. Just fellow the signs to Cottonwood Pass. Maybe 6 miles. Good views along the way.

name: Street parking close to Wallance Park
description: Calm street in nice neighbourhood, close to restaurants and park. Serveral other campers in this and nearby streets when we were here, both in stealth vans and smaller RV's. Please be respectful to the people living here. Parking sign says maximum 4 hour parking between 9AM and 7PM.

name: Pullout in the forest
description: Nice pullout in the Deschutes National Forest, 10 minute drive to Newberry Volcanic National Monument. Just a few meters off the main forest road. We drove a bit further down the secondary road but it gets super narrow so we turned around. This is the only spot we’ve found so far but we’ll keep exploring the area. Really quiet (only one car drove by). No mosquitoes!! AT&T cell reception. Bonus, it’s flat!

name: Grizzly Broadband Free Wifi
description: Free city wifi network. No password, really good speed.

name: Vons
description: Free wifi in Vons. Seems pretty fast and can reach to some parts of the parking lot. Also have restrooms inside at the back

name: SuperMatt Laundry
description:
It is a small laundromat but it worked for our needs. XL-$3, M/L- $2, S-$1.
Upon walking in, the attendant was vacuuming the entrance area. Then proceeded to wipe the machines off after each use. 
The only complaint I have is the lack of seating and folding tables.

name: 24hr (max) free parking lot
description:
Parking lot behind downtown that has sign you Are allowed to park for 24hrs but that's the max. Sign says they will monitor / tow for longer than that. Lot was pretty full when I got here around 2pm, but I did find a spot.  Not really built for campers/RVs ... Trucks, Vans, cars fit fine. It's just a parking lot, so no camping/etc. 

I have 4-5bars of Verizon 4gLTE. There are businesses, restaurants, hotels, and bars within walking distance (1-2 blocks), so restrooms 24hr because of the hotel, food, gift shopping are around. No facilities on site. Not very loud, general traffic.
