It's a block away from the free Wild West show that happens every night @6pm (unless raining) in front of the Irma hotel.

name: CONOCO
description: This dumping place is free on the parking

name: Park N Ride Newville
description:
Newville Park n Ride
WI-59, Edgerton, WI 53534
42.834723,-89.026361

Close to Interstate so it's noisy but if ya just need an easy stop. There's also gas station and restaurants in close proximity.

name: Hummingbird Camp Markagunt OHV
description: 200 yards off OHV 3/ 069 easy level access with loop at end for turnaround 2 bars LTE with Verizon. Great views

name: Nice little pull out
description: Nice spot near the Truckee river > looks nicer than the two spots further along the road. If you’re rig is not too big you can easily pull in & out. No signs, seems a legitimate place to stay for a night

name: Perch Point Wild Camping Area
description: Discover required! Beautiful view of the pothole lake. There is plenty of spot to park by the lake - 2m walking distance. There is also bathroom available with no shower.

name: Pine Log WMA
description: This is a great place for dispersed camping vanlifers overlanding four-wheel drive.... but RVs are definitely no no. The maintenance is lacking here at pine log so it's a little rutty, I'm in a full size ProMaster 3500 and it was a little sketchy on the way out but I still made it if they would fix the ruts everything would be great. About a mile and a half in I found a high spot and got some LTE service all night long It was all good very quiet very level if you watch where you're going you'll know what you're getting.

name: Seward Park
description: Slept very well in this park. The road is a little busy in the summer but the water is great. There is a public restroom but it was broken when we were there.

name: Hominy Creek River Park
description: The site has many available FLAT spots. Very peaceful and quiet. porta potty and playground are here too. Just pull off to any of the available spots before reaching the gate of The French Broad Outfitters.

name: Sweet Berry Orchard
description: 1.3 miles east off exit 28 I85. Two large campsites in the pines. Sites are shaded with electricity and water. Good cell service. Exit 28 has fuel groceries and restaurants.

name: Peavine Trail Head BLM
description: The end of Yorkshire Rd turns to dirt and drives right into BLM land. Lots of roads/trails to take once on the dirt. Roads are rough and some need 4wd. Plenty of room. Camping upto 14 days allowed, just not within 1/2 mile of trailhead. We stayed on a Sunday night and saw one other sprinter. Some distant road noise. Depending on where you park, there are views of Reno. Some garbage here and there.

name: Brad Floyd
description:
Booking is thru hipcamp.com. 
private lake with 6 graveled camp sites for  car/overland rig, small campers and then another 8 primitive tent camping sites.  ⛺️

name: Cypress Hills
description: Cell service is reachable, WIFI is amazing, electricity voltage is a maximum of 50 amps and a minimum of 20, our RV concrete pads are ~40 foot long by ~26 wide, there is no tent sites and they are not allowed in the park, firepits at most campsites with grilling racks, community firepit, pickleball court, ~1100 sq ft multipurpose room, commercial laundry room, bathrooms with showers, enclosed sitting viewing room, and local trails nearby. Floras Lake is also nearby with a multitude of different activities like wind surfing, fishing, and beach access. There is a farmers market along with a you-pick strawberries and blueberries activity.

name: Road pull off by river
description: Nice turn off of main road. Great for a night or two. Can tuck yourself away not be seen by road. Can hear some car noise but quiets at night and the river drowns it out as well. Big enough for car, RV, or camper. Fire ring was already here

name: BLM 4x4 trailhead
description: Basecamp type place for overlanders. About a mile off the highway is a big flat spot for lots of vehicles. Paved but rough road most of the way. 2wd low clearance friendly until the very end, finding a spot might be a little tricky for big rigs (our is 23’). 4x4 would have a great time out here.

name: Water spigot outside of Kelly Moore
description: Unlocked spigot outside of Kelly Moore. Please get permission from the store manager before filling your water.

name: Pioneer Cabin
description:
Pioneer Cabin Lot
Across from N9624 Young Rd Palmyra, WI 
42.839849,-88.620588

Across Rd from an old Pioneer Cabin. If you're into that old historical stuff check out Old World WI a few mi East

This is the Young Prairie State Natural Area. There's no signs except for cabin across rd posted 6a-11p

AT&T phone internet is ok at 15 Mb down, 2Mb up. Usable but better 3-4mi North in Palmyra at the Village Park 8th st at like 200Dn/90Up.  Or for more seclusion the Aurelia Spring Park also good speeds.

Depending on vehicles in lot, should accommodate a good sized rig. But there's a fairly steep drop from pavement downhill into lot which will be an issue for a longer rig/trailer especially something low clearance.

It's pretty open so solar should be decent
If you happen to get Stuck, Search\Join Facebook group 4x4 Rescue Wisconsin(or any state) Only for emergency/stuck broke down out of gas situations. Have GPS coordinates prepared.

name: Hythe Husky - First best Alberta rate
description: After crossing into Alberta, this is the first (or last from the other way) gas station with lowest rates. 40ct difference with Dawson creek, same rates as Grande Prairie. There is another station right after the province border with only 20ct benefit, so continue here if you can.

name: Safeway supermarket water dispenser
description: Glacier brand water dispenser.  For containers only, 40 cents per gallon

name: Perry Creek Boat Landing
description:
Perry Creek Landing
Perry Creek Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615
44.266943, -90.861822

This is a boat landing parking lot. It’s not real big especially for a trailer to turn around in. There’s a Recreation area on the upper level above it which has picnic tables, charcoal grills etc. Perry Creek is a little bit North and feeds into the river. There’s little trail with a cable bridge etc. On Google maps visitors mention a 2nd bridge that washed out. 
The large parking lot for the Rec Area is signed with hours of 6am-11p. 

This is signed facing the river Perry Creek BOAT Landing which should be 24/7 use/access

name: False Outer Point
description: This is our third night here. This area, even though raining, has been popular during the day. Since the road ends not too far past here, the nights are mostly quiet. There is a waterfall on the hill behind and a beach in front. First day we came here it was sunny and more locals were here, now that it's been raining its mostly just tourists looking and leaving. It's a big area, but since it's on a slope it wont be super level. Good spot for truck campers, or vans. There is also a marmot that comes out when it's not raining, he's cute. I have had no issues staying here and have seen others stay here as well. I also have full T-Mobile service.

name: BLM Route 2760 Near Granby,CO
description: Nice views, flat, quiet and just off Hwy 125.

name: Pioneer Cabin
description:
Pioneer Cabin Lot
Across from N9624 Young Rd Palmyra, WI 
42.839849,-88.620588

Across Rd from an old Pioneer Cabin. If you're into that old historical stuff check out Old World WI a few mi East

This is the Young Prairie State Natural Area. There's no signs except for cabin across rd posted 6a-11p

AT&T phone internet is ok at 15 Mb down, 2Mb up. Usable but better 3-4mi North in Palmyra at the Village Park 8th st at like 200Dn/90Up.  Or for more seclusion the Aurelia Spring Park also good speeds.

Depending on vehicles in lot, should accommodate a good sized rig. But there's a fairly steep drop from pavement downhill into lot which will be an issue for a longer rig/trailer especially something low clearance.

It's pretty open so solar should be decent
If you happen to get Stuck, Search\Join Facebook group 4x4 Rescue Wisconsin(or any state) Only for emergency/stuck broke down out of gas situations. Have GPS coordinates prepared.

name: Library Parking Lot - Diamond Park
description: There are no "no overnight parking" signs here and there is a van and RV already here tonight. The parking area is very spacious and well lit. There is nice grass for those with dogs. You can hear some town traffic but not bad. I have 4 bars of T-mobile service here. I checked for wifi parked outside the library, however, I did not see any. Maybe they turn it off or you need to be inside. This location is about a 10 minute drive to the west glacier trailhead and 8 minutes to Nugget Falls trailhead. Perfect location if you want to visit the glacier the next day.

name: Perpendicular street parking Fort Ave
description:
Before leaving for road trip, I written to Salem city hall to ask for overnight parking. They replied that the only place it was allowed was on the perpendicular street parking on Fort Ave. This is close to Winter Island. We were not bothered by anyone but we slept with all windows opened because of heat and there were many vehicles passing by during all night, so a bit noisy. So it was not the best spot for quietness. But at least, it was legal. 
Since parking is perpendicular to street, i would say maximum lenght is 22 feet

name: West Virginia Welcome Center
description: 24hr restrooms! clean and a good place to spend the night. many semis and a few big rigs also stayed. seems safe. a bit bright if you don't have a way to cover your windows.

name: Flathead Lake Trailhead #77 Lot
description: Stayed one night in the parking lot. No issues. Trail leads you to some nice views of flathead lake.  Don’t abuse the spot. More of an in/out type of deal.

name: Planet fitness
description: Your GPS will lead you the opposite side the gym is on, drive around the mall and you’ll find it. Really nice clean showers, very private and small crowd. Probably the only Planet fitness you’ll find close to the Finger lakes that’s decent.

name: Walmart in Bradford (outside Algheny National)
description: Quiet spot to catch some rest with service before heading into the Forrest.

name: Desert Vista RV Park
description: Small nice little park with showers, laundry and very clean. Nice people and close to town. Talk with Lois and tell her Gary sent you

name: Black River drive In
description: this is not a site.you can come anytime but if you want to have a nice evening watching a movie at a Drive-In, the owners will let you stay after the movie and sleep over on site. Cost per person for movie 8$. We have a 27' RV and we backed up at the very end of the site with no problem.

name: Independence Dam State Parc
description: Nice and quite campground with toilet, nice river view.  We stopped for one night and worked from there til mid after noon, decent 4g signal.

name: Road 90 - Trail head T105
description: Fantastic view from 2500m altitude - 4x4 access - Isolated spot 100 yards front the dirt road - Small place, 1 or 2 vehicle group - No RV or Trailer access

name: Santa Fa National forest - Jimez District
description: Camping spot right between the trail and the mountain ridge, nice view, ca be windy.  4x4 access only.

name: Arcadia Lake
description: Camping spot in the sand dune.  4X4 required to access through sandy trail

name: Little haven in the trees
description:
Pull out on the forest road (on the left when going up) more than a pull out it is a little clary surrounded by trees, so beautiful. Could also fit a few tents 

Would recommend a 4x4 as the entrance is a bit bumpy after a forest road. 

We had no service at all 

It is a clean space, please keep it that way :)

name: Huge pull out off 101 with cliff views
description:
Nice big pull out could fit multiple big RVs 

Pretty sunset view and a bit hidden from the highway so not too noisy

name: Free parking central San Francisco
description:
Not for overnight but great for the day in San Francisco, no signs that you need to pay and cops went passed a few times and no tickets. 

Maybe not for big RVs but fin with our truck camper

name: Martin Top
description:
4X4  REQUIRED THE ROAD IS PRETTY BAD 

Super nice spot with few flat areas, do not try with a big set up, very steep dirt road. But the view is worth it, fires prohibited at the moment 

There is another a bit further a the junction called alder creek camp, no amenities and services but what a view, and free! 

Please keep it clean and keep out of the private properties you will see along the way. 

Works for tents as well

name: Rocky view
description:
Beautiful sunset view over the lake and rocky landscape. The pinpoint is on the little dirt track to the spot I camped, few small options, just forgot to pin before I left. 

Dirt road, high clearance maybe but no 4x4 needed. Great views, not windy when I was there but there are signs in the area about high winds. 3-4 bars LTE Verizon great stop about 2 hours from Yosemite village

name: Ludington Municipal dump station
description: Non-potable water only. Sign says dump open year round but water shuts off the last Monday of October.

name: Bradford Laundry & Dry Cleaning
description: Nothing special. Small Laundry and dry cleaning spot.

name: Cenex
description: Gas, diesel, propane, and convenience store.

name: Big pull off
description: Big pull off with no signage. We camped next to the river and we’re not bugged by anyone. Great spot for a night.

name: Montgomery Hill Park
description: Calling all hikers and bikers.  Spend a day parked here and hiking and biking all these trails.  Hella shade.  Closes at 8:30pm.

name: Stove Prairie Campground
description: One of several USFS Campgrounds along the Cache La Poudre River in Bellvue, CO. $25 per night with $8 reservation fee if booked in advance. Pit toilets available. Only back in sites (no pull through) and walk-to tent sites. Picnic tables and fire rings at all sites.

name: Bellevue Public Boat Ramp
description: Large asphalt parking lot along Mississippi, wide boat ramp with dock, vault toilets. Near RR tracks but only one train at night, no horns. There is the hum of occasional barge traffic. Good for overnight parking one night. No signs prohibiting.

name: Circle K-Irving Oil
description: A water spigot is available on the right side of the building. We asked and received permission to get water.

name: Blue Bell SP Campground,
description: State Park Campground in Custer State Park, campsites in the pines!

name: Lower Camp
description:
Keep going down the hill past the campsite by the road. Totally secluded. The road is dirt with lots of mud holes but nothing our 4wd Sprinter couldn’t handle At the end of the road there’s the campsite. Relatively level with a beautiful view NE of Marcelina mountain.
It’s a perfect view for Starlink. Cool site nestled in the Aspens right off trout creek.

name: Mt Carmel Rest Area
description:
We stayed one night. It's actually a tiny memorial chapel built to honor Acadian Americans, but is offered as a normal rest area with picnic benches, too. It's a little different, but interesting. 
We stayed with no problem. Read the interesting history posted on the chapel while there.

name: Haystack Rest Area
description: This is a nice rest area between Ashland and Presque Isle. It's quiet with a large parking area with close spaces next to the few picnic tables. It's next to a highway which has traffic, but the noise didn't affect my sleep.

name: Whetstone Rest Area
description: This is a rest area on Hwy 11 north of Brownville. There are several covered picnic tables. It is quiet. The light traffic noise wasn't a problem. No one bothered us. Our campervan fit well. Brownville is a mile away and has a convenience store if needed.

name: Mt Washington State Forest Ranger Station Parking
description: Ranger station, trail head and primitive camping parking lot.  Very quiet even on the weekend we saw only few hiker / camper.  Porta potty toilet available, working but weak LTE signal, drinking water at the ranger station.

name: Pilot Travel Center
description: Big parking lot, has a subway, showers, open 24/7. Lots of trucks a few RVs and campers. They have cheap clean showers. spent the night in peace. Conveniently off I90.

name: Lazy Tom Bog Reservoir
description:
This is a dirt/gravel circular area next to Lazy Tom Bog, a popular moose sighting spot north of Moosehead Lake and Kokadjo. There was plenty of room for our camper van. We felt safe, but there was a lot of traffic in and out, especially at sunset, looking for moose. It was quiet and no one came after dark, though. 
The road is gravel, but it's only 1-2 miles down to the circle.

name: Staunton Public Parking
description: In town parking.  Stayed 2 nights,  no problem.  Super close to everything in town.

name: Lot D Parking
description: This is a parking Lot opposite of a GG Bridge view Point. Sign says: paid parking every Day (8am-6pm), but in fact weekends are free of charge. Even on a busy weekend there is plenty of space. All other days it is 7$ for the whole day.

name: Primrose campground & boat launch
description: 8 sites primitive campground close to Kenai lake

name: Hartig wildlife reserve park
description: Beautiful free camping area. No hookups anywhere. Pack in and pack out. Very dispersed. Barely see anyone else. If you go to the end of the gravel road there’s an awesome overlook of the river! Highly recommend this place. A lot of hiking trails too. Take a look at all the campsites before choosing which one you want to stay. They get better the further you go back! Verizon cell service is great the further back you go.

name: Willow Bay Campground
description:
Really nice campground right at the lake. 
Under new management since June 22.
Very friendly and helpful team. Sites with or without hookups (big rig friendly sites as well). Facility a bit older, but very clean.
Lake with watersports very vivid on the weekends. If you have a boat you can launch it directly here ;)
We loved it here!

33 Dollar for dry camping.

name: Kleinke County Park Campground
description: Nice campground overall right on Lake Michigan with clean showers and restroom.  Electricity if you need it.  Large individual camp sites but a little difficult to know where your site is compared to others.  All sites must be reserved but they take same day reservations. Tried to reserve a site but they had problems with computers. So we had have supervisor call us and register, a real pain and they charge $10 for a reservation fee plus a county park pass which was $5 for a day.   The biggest down side was highway noise with lists of traffic. We stayed at Fox park in the same county 4 days earlier and the reservation site was not working.  Called and they took care of it.

name: Beard Homestead
description:
Lovely place at Josie and Eric House! For free but have to buy some eggs or vegatebles to maintain this kind of possibilities! Look on Harvest Hosts app to book it! 

Hook up possible, water and pool for kids!

name: Just outside of Gypsy Hill Park
description: Super cool park.  You can park inside the park during the day and have awesome views, and when the park closes, move here. No shade till late afternoon.  Technically a public easement.

name: Oriska Rest Area
description: Convenient place to rest just off the interstate. Truck and traffic noise all night as expected. Nice picnic area. Very safe feeling

name: Down access road to atnt private property.
description: Wide turn-off to access road with two spots before the private property gates. Pot holes but if you take it slow you can bring whatever you want down it. First spot was taken so we had to grab the second, not super level but good for a night and far enough from the highway that all you can hear is the creek right next to you

name: Fuji Park
description: sweet dog park with shade and restrooms, lots of parking space

name: Fort Abraham Lincoln state park north campground
description: Great place , beautiful views, amenities galore.

name: Walmart super center
description: Walmart parking lot, slept there two nights in a row with out an issue. You can hear the highway running along the side of the Walmart. other than that, no issues. happy to have found it.

name: Walmart supercenter
description: Walmart parking lot, slept here 4 nights in a row. security guards are nice and said we could stay as long as we don't cause any problems.

name: boat launch
description:
awesome little boat launch, got here around 10pm there was one semi truck parked. quiet and beautiful. sun rose behind us so I'm assuming it be great spot for sunsets.

small amount of high way noise, totally manageable.

woke up to some fishermen.

name: random overnight parking lot
description: this is a parking lot for people to park in overnight. I've slept here one other night a few weeks ago. pretty quiet but right on a main road but along the river. there is a nice hike along the river too.

name: supposed to be the boat launch but is a baseball field
description:
I was supposed to be driving to the boat launch to sleep but the directions brought me to a little league field. 

it was quiet and super dark. I don't think you are allowed to park here over night but no one bothered us. we pulled along the wall running along the road to not disturb anyone if they came in the morning. 

if you stay here please keep it clean.

name: lake Durant on the water
description: beautiful spot next to the lake with fire pit. can get in with 2 wheel drive car. not big enough for big rigs

name: I-4 Westbound Rest Area
description: As of August 7th, 2022, it was under some sort of construction. Majority of the spots  were filled with big rigs. A few campers were able to park. It is noisy due to being right next to the interstate.

name: near a lake
description:
several camping spots along this side road. the road was mostly quiet but. the further. away you get the better.
has Verizon and googlefi reception.

there were also several more spots along this highway nearby

name: Glacier View
description: Pull out south of Seward south of fish processing facility.  Right on water.  Stayed further down last night but forgot to check in.  Beautiful views.  Pretty level.  Stayed in built out minivan.  Minimal traffic especially after dark.  Dead end community .  Plenty of room for larger vehicles.  Not a lot of privacy but view makes up for it and moderate traffic.   4 bars LTE Verizon.   Better than in town.  Right before recent mudslide.

name: Kaycee City Park
description: City of Kaycee Wyoming has 5 unpowered sites, 2 pull thru and 3 back in. Allows free stays of a maximum of 5 nights.  Playground, 2 covered picnic shelters and porta-a-pottie. Walking distance to shops and restaurant.

name: The Purple Pig
description: Restaurant with free wifi, good food and lovely patio. Wifi works on patio as well.

name: Great Sand Dunes NP Parking
description:
Showers outside (not private, can not use soap as there is no drain). Gender separate changing rooms. 
Free for park visitors. These are really basic showers but great if you are anyways at the dunes. 

There is also a filtered water dispenser and trash cans.

name: Green Wash Laundromat
description: Self-service laundry with cash or card. No coins. Clean, fast.

name: TA Truck Stop
description: large truck stop with nice amenities inside! a bit noisy, but what truck stop isn't?

name: Spot w fire pit off of forest road
description: This is a road that goes off of the fire road. Rock fire pit. Very private and out of the way. Flat, good for multiple tents. Can turn around at end of road. Grassy road in center but passable. Made it here with a motorcycle. Pets would be fine as your in the forest.

name: Pike national forest dispersed camping
description: Great disperses camping. Established fire rings. 4x4 recommended. OHV traffic

name: Tia Juanita’s Fish Camp
description: A must stop in Winnie Texas, amazing food, we had Shrimp Quesadilla and Seafood Enchiladas. Best we’ve had in a long time

name: Newport performing art center
description: 16 hour parking sign,  lots of other RVs parked.  Big parking lot that has restroom that closes at dusk.  Very close to the beach too

name: Redwood Fields
description: This is street parking outside of a park.  The park says it closes at dusk and has a gate but I don’t think they close it,  right outside of the gate is a few parking spots,  about 6. The spots are close to the neighborhood but not in front of anyones house.  It was very quiet all night until about 7am when a few cars drove in.  Overall a great spot!  There was a porta potty in the park,  but wasn’t well maintained.  Decent cell service.

name: Safeway
description:
Safeway’s got two Glacier water dispensers in-store, at the end of aisle 1. 

49 cents/gal at the time of post. Happy hydratin’!

name: Sunoco
description: Open Monday to Saturday. It’s the only place in the area that fill thanks.

name: Packer Lake
description: Many spots down the road along the lake.  One pit toilet.  Good Straight Talk cell service, was able to stream YouTube.  A lot of trash.  Probably busy on the weekend, got here on a Sunday afternoon and there were quite a few locals swimming.  No one else camped overnight, was quiet in the morning.  Narrow gravel road when coming into lake after you leave the bigger gravel road.  Was fine in our 24’ class C.  Wouldn’t try much bigger.

name: Magic Bubbles 24hr Laundromat
description:
It has a nice variety of washer sizes. Maybe too many XXL size ones, in my opinion. It was nice to get a little discount due to doing laundry earlier in the day.
My only suggestion would be to have an attendant their to wipe down the machines after each use. Some of these people use so much laundry soap, it coats the dispensers and makes a yucky mess.

name: Mollie b campgrounds
description: Water and dump $10 use cc to pay. Lots of campgrounds around area.

name: bear Creek campground
description:
nice site near red rocks which is why it's full on weekends but lots of spots from Sunday through Thursday clean toilets friendly staff 1$ in quarters gets you five minute shower... nice little beach no trees so wide open
35$with no water and power... dump station and water as well

name: Burgess RV Dump station
description: 4 lanes for dump and each lane also has a spigot. You need your own hose. A little donation is asked for.

name: Lake Wilson Reserviour Campground
description: Nice place to stay, busy/loud on weekends, but pretty quiet during the weekdays.  You have to call to book a site. there are 8 or 9 established single RV campgrounds for 10$ per night and two group sites.  During the week they have sprinklers that they lay out across parts of the campground, but doesn't seem to be a big deal to the RV sites.  Basically an open grass field.  Nice access to the lake for boats, kayaks, SUPs etc.  Additionally there are several two-tracks going around the lake with differnet pull offs you can park at for free for up to 14 days, these seem to be very busy and hard to come by.

name: Talladega National Forest
description: This small, easily passable dirt road off the main road has at least 3 spots. This spot has a fire ring. Not exactly level, but not too bad. This is a popular dirt bike area and we saw some bikes on an adjacent road one afternoon, but only one drove by on our road in the 3 days we stayed. There is a tiny stream just a short hike down to the end of the road. Great place for dogs to explore. Two bars Verizon signal at this spot, no signal by the creek.

name: Lone Pine Campground at Doddridge County Park
description:
Beautiful county park with camping close to Rt 50. 
I stumbled across it while looking for a place for picnic lunch. I stopped at camping office and asked if the have showers for travelers. Not sure if it was policy or they just wanted to help out someone who smelled like they need a shower. But, they pointed to a new large restroom and shower building and no charge.
WOW.
Some seriously nice people here. I still needed to make some more miles or I would have camped.
The campground had lots of large level sites. Only grass between sites but well spaced. See photo of camping rates.

name: Planet Fitness
description:
I came here for workout and shower, and decided to stay for the night in my car.
I saw other vans and 1 Motorhome parked.
I spend the night with no issues.
* No security guards knocking.
* No signs prohibiting overnight parking

name: Viewpoint
description: Just only a quiet place before you enter Delta Junktion

name: Love’s Travel Stop
description: Four $15 unlimited hot showers! Allows overnight parking, dump station, and there’s a subway attached. Gorgeous view in the overnight area.

name: Sinclair
description: Propane and water - one stop!! Great spot.

name: Dispersed camping FR 1028
description: Beautiful Ponderosa Pine woods, tons of free camping Cool cave (Skylight Cave) open time the public nearby.  Motor Vehicle Use map displayed at the intersection helps you to locate the FRs.

name: FSR 434 pull-off
description: Just off FSR 434.  Quiet, green - no chance for neighbors.  Coeur D’Alene NF.  No Verizon but follow FSR 268 to Fernan and in 15 minutes you’ll find 3 bars LTE.

name: Tractor Supply Co
description: Great place to get your propane filled. Store has easy access and a big parking lot.

name: Tractor Supply
description: Good place to get propane for your rig.  And since I need 40 characters I have to keep typing.

name: Palmer Junction TVA
description: Easy access, 16-29 campsites on Tennessee Valley Authority property around Norris Lake.  Fire rings, multiple bear proof trash receptacles plus decent Verizon connection (2bars LTE) and lakefront sites make this a wonderful free campground.

name: Jackson Creek Park
description: ACE informal free campground.  Good road in, good Verizon signal, beautiful lake views and access.  Many of the 20 or so sites are quite unlevel... we saw 3 really good ones.  Trash cans, picnic tables and pit toilets among the amenities.

name: Camp Sula
description: Beautiful little campground with cabins, RV sites, tent sites and Airbnb cabin.  Stream runs through it.  Has things like mini golf, kids fishing pond.

name: Russell Sage WMA
description: One of several parking areas off the main highway.  The one we slept in bordered a bayou and was pretty trashy.  We filled a trash bag, by way of showing our appreciation.  It was surprisingly empty and quiet on a Friday night.

name: One Stop
description: Propane for sale here.  Nice staff.  Good place to get propane

name: Deep Creek State Recreation Area
description: Nice state campground right on the beach and Deep Creek.  Quiet, lots of openings on a Saturday in fishing season.  Lots of birds to watch, particularly eagles.  Pit toilets. $20 per night. Verizon- 4 bars LTE.

name: Three Bears Alaska
description: Good place to get groceries and propane.  Busy but large parking lot

name: Long Shaded Pullout
description: Decent pullout about 50' deep on the right side of lower whitefish road. wide enough for most vehicles, we had a ford escape. behind the pullout through a short path is a few good flat spots to pitch a tent. We camped here one night with no issues, the trees shaded us until late morning and the road isnt too busy at night. the pullout is a little dusty but the camp spots further back are perfect! 2 bars T-mobile reception, no Verizon service.

name: dispersed camping spot
description: flat spot on west side of road, evidence of a fire ring. No signs saying don't camp

name: Paper Moon Winery
description: There’s a super large gravel parking lot (plenty of turn-around room, toads, etc) in the rear where you’ll most likely run into other Boondockers enjoying this place.

name: Sinclair
description: Dump, water for no charge. Gas is less than other areas. Also propane fill.

name: Winterset Public Library
description: a nice small library with outlets and tons of places to sit. They have free public wifi that I believe you can get from the parking out front and around the side. No password needed.

name: Saulsbury Bridge Campground
description: County park with three camping areas (primitive, modern, and riverfront). Nice bathrooms with running water and showers and electricity at the modern sites. Not great cell reception, but usable (data gets better later at night). Bugs get rough right before dark

name: Fairport State Recreation Area
description: Small camping area popular with boaters during the middle of the summer with Mississippi river access. Has electricity, hot showers, and good cell signal

name: McCall Gravel Pullout and Woods
description:
This empty forested property is owned by the McCall High School (across the road) and there's a nice wide horseshoe gravel pull out on this parcel which is perfect for a night of stealth camping. All of the trees on the property also have plenty of flat ground and open space for setting up tents or hammocks out of sight from the main road. 
A bike trail goes from here directly to downtown McCall, only a 12 minute walk away.
During the summer months there's no school and so it was quiet enough. Only sporadic vehicles passing nearby on the road which dropped off as the hour got later.
One bar of 4G Verizon cell signal here.

name: Wildcat Den State Park
description: Fair cell service. Vault toilets. Running well water.  No electricity. There is a public restroom with running water at a historic gristmill about a mile away. Nice (but short) hiking for Iowa. About half the spots have a lot of shade

name: Blanchard Island
description: Poor to fair cell service. Vault toilets. No electricity. Well water. Nice views right next to the river. Floods occasionally during the spring

name: Backbone State Park
description: Poor cell service. Electricity and water vary by area of the campground. Beautiful hiking for Iowa. Nice showers in the south lake campground area

name: Sapp Bros
description: Free wifi on-site, plus great clean restrooms.

name: Bemidji laundry
description: Clean laundromat, washers are from 3.50 to 5.50. Dryers start at $2. There’s a vending machine

name: Beach cold shower
description: Cold shower at the beach small park also a bathroom near by

name: Trailer Dump Station
description: Potable water, and dump station behind the court house.

name: Street parking by the water
description:
Pretty quiet street near the water and a beautiful park. No “no parking” signs. And great Verizon signal.
Starting from the entrance/ext of boulevard park (bay view dr) almost all the way to the end of 10th street is all free overnight parking. (no parking in the actual park, you will get a knock) bay view drive is slanted so i never actually stayed the night there but i saw many others do it. there’s a small section of private/permit parking when you turn on 10th and on the off shoot streets but if you stay on 10th there are plenty of great options. bathrooms nearby and a very pleasant walk. some permanent residents at the end of 10th but very quiet and polite. 2 downsides are there’s minimal shade on hot days and the train is right there, some nights were quiet and some nights the horn was going until midnight, seemed like it depended on the operator added bonus, you can jump off the pier at any tide. people are always doing it (mostly college students) but the water is warm and it’s a super fun way to wake up or end the day

name: Luray park
description:
roadside park
2 spots
50/30/20 amp
water 
dump
picnic table and fire ring
$20

name: Storm Castle Creek
description: Around 10 primitive campsites along Squaw creek road, past Storm Castle peak trailhead and Spire Rock campground. 4-6 miles down gravel road.  This road is closed in winter/early spring.  Accessible by most vehicles, many trailers and venas here. We stayed in a site right along the creek, surrounded by forest, with a fire pit, and fit many vehicles. No service.

name: Chilton Recreation & Senior Center
description:
Rec center - day pass/showers approximately $5.25. 

very nice facility. Pool, hot tub, locker room, lounge, weight and excersize rooms, gyms and racket ball

name: Bison Cafè
description: We stopped here to check if overnight parking was allowed because we wanted to go to the Bison Range tomorrow morning. The Cafè was closed but after 5’ George ( the owner ) came out with a piece of paper with his wifi’s password on, asking us if we wanted to move from the sun where we did park and move to the shade by the trees … he did apologize for not being open because they cooked all day long for the fire fighters working on a close by wildfire. He told us we were more than welcome to fill our fresh water tank with spigot on the back of the Cafè. One of the nicest person we ever met ! Highly recommended !

name: Timber Point Lake
description: Timber point lake is in WMA and free camping is permitted. There is a small lake at the end of a well maintained dirt road. It has maybe 3 gravel campsites and parking down closer to the lake. Boat ramp, one unisex pit toilet, and a water spigot (NOT FOR DRINKING) behind the toilet. No electric hookups or drinking water available.

name: Walmart Parking Lot + Hobby Loby +Staples
description:
ATTENTION ⚠️ This Walmart Parking lot was marked closed, but is the main one only (facing Chik-Fil-A). If you park facing Hawthorne Blvd, between Walmart, Staples and Hobby Lobby you will be fine. I am saying this because I stayed here in my car for 1 week, without problems. Also, 2 RVs parked all week.
The main parking lot of Walmart is blocked with barricades, as you can see In the picture.

name: Marconi Beach parking
description:
Nice and big parking lot for Marconi Beach, toilet were accessible even at night time, exterior shower (with cabin) with cold water available for free.
Beautiful beach, no « No overnight » sign was seen… we were here with our camper van, locals arriving around 7am to have a walk on the beach or even start their bike ride from here :)

name: To good to be true
description:
A good size pull off on iron mountain road. A nice flat spot tucked in the trees. 30 ft trailer backed in no problem. Was passed by several law enforcement vehicles with only a wave. Traffic on the road stopped around 9:00 p.m. Super peaceful night too good to be true. 

Incredible view of the back of Mt. Rushmore for sunset and sunrise. Enjoyed the motorcycle parade during Sturgis!

name: Campsite off Forest Road 42
description: An awesome spot just off forest road 42. A pretty flat area better suited to smaller 4x4 rigs as the access road is a bit rough. Having said that you could probably make it in a 2wd. A small trail leads down to the river with an awesome swimming hole. Such a peaceful spot. Slept like a rock. No cell signal. Has a fire pit.

name: Silver Fir Lot
description: Great spot to pull out for the night. East on, off access to I-90

name: Walmart Chesapeake
description: Gorgeous Walmart, inside and out. Very quiet night. Internet (Verizon) 6.98/19.0 Mbps download/upload.

name: Hope Mills
description:
Hope Mills 4x4 boon-docking spot (clay, keep out in rain)

Cell - Full bars
Entrance :
One method is to take the sand/dirt road to the open area
The second method (if available) is through the TJ Robinson Life center. Please do not go when members are there. 

NOTE: 
1) You need good clearance to access via church.
2) entrance dirt road has trees, you will scrape your paint
3) once you reach the small hill, hook a right. 
4) Jeeps will make it just fine
5) I would stay away in foul weather, its clay. No grass

Things to note:
1) Houses in sight, use the high dirt walls to cover your signature
2) Atv trails throughout

name: Walmart
description: Just like every other Walmart. Park in the back as usual. They also have water jug refilling station inside by the back of the grocery section for $0.39 / gallon.

name: New hope road
description:
Large parking lot at the edge of the water without service. We spent 2 nights in total tranquility. There is a small beach and a boat launch. No prohibition. We recommend this quiet place.

-------

Grand parking au bord de l'eau sans service. nous avons passé 2 nuits dans une tranquillité totale. Il y a une petite plage et une mise à l'eau pour bateau. Aucune interdiction. Nous recommandons cette endroit tranquille

name: Oil pipeline off Old Murphy Dome Rd
description: Large flat area (surrounded by trees with the Alaska oil pipeline underneath) off unpaved Old Murphy Dome road. Visible from that road but quiet and not too far from busy Fairbanks.

name: Desire Lake Neighborhood Stay
description: This is a cute little spot near Desire Lake. There is a few pull offs but this some seems to be the most secluded & well established. No cops, & very light traffic. We only stayed one night and arrived very late at 10:30 PM. Because this is a neighborhood we wanted to be respectful to the people around us, we left around 9 AM. I wouldn’t recommend staying more than a night or two!

name: BLM site
description: Right off and below the highway very little noise actually kind of scenic in one direction. Accessible by two or 4 Wheel Dr. with medium clearance rate for an overnighter.

name: Free Tubing in Clear Creek
description: You can use your own tube or rent one locally. The GPS coordinates mark a common place to start.  Lots of places to picnic or spend the day in a park.  Easy walk from free parking.

name: S pacific Avenue
description: Quite place for one night. Free parking for the night. No signs that you have to pay.

name: Duffy Creek
description: Side road spot with firepit. flat ground. good views. no crowds except few cows roaming around.

name: Cape Flattery trailhead parking
description:
I went in the to tribal center and asked if was ok to park here overnight and they said that was fine. Parking lot was quite during the night and I found a more level spot on the side of the road just before the RV parking. 

You will need a $20 Makah permit to hike and stay in this area I did see them giving out tickets to cars that didn’t have it. 

There is no phone service in this area.

name: Little spot by Ozette Lake
description:
Small site by the lake, with a smashed picnic table from a fallen tree so we assumed it was OK to camp.
Hidden from the road if you park to the right of the entrance and level enough, but probably gets pretty muddy after a good rain.
A real gem for free camping right after the Ozette loop, cozy and tranquil with direct access to the water and driftwood for a fire.

name: Bass Pro Shop
description: They don't advertise it, but they do allow overnight RV parking. Just call to confirm and make sure you park in the correct perimeters.

name: Glen Cove Park - Drinking Water
description:
Glen Cove Park has a FREE drinking water station right near the entrance.  There are two fountains to fill up jugs, and a water spigot at the bottom!  Topped off 20 gallons into my tank fairly easily.

There is a sign at the entrance that says No “RV’s” allowed.  I would not come down here with a bigger rig.  I’m in a 144” Sprinter Van and was fine maneuvering around but wouldn’t come down here with a Van longer than 23 feet.  There is a turnaround loop at the end of the park road.

A few locals came by to fill up water jugs while I was topping off my tank.  They can still access the fountains if you’re using the spigot. 

This park also has picnic tables and a beautiful view of the ocean cove.
There are some grills to cook.
No trash, must carry-out.
Dogs welcome on leash.
No camping and I assume that includes no overnight parking.

I was just hanging out for a few hours working and the police drove through the park a few times.

name: Schilberg Public Park
description:
Water spigot on parking lot side of restroom building. Accessible by car nearly right to it although it's no parking there…there's also a water fountain and restrooms.

Park hours are probably 5am to 10pm or so

name: Dispersed site right off FR 608
description: Large, mostly level site. No muddy ruts. Ponderosa and Gambles Oak. Near the head of a pretty valley. Wonderful views. Drove a 36’ MH with trailer in. Two bars LTE Verizon

name: P63 dispersed campsite
description: 4wd to get here and is popular with bikers and probably ATVs as a huge parking area for their trailers. Go 1 mile from the paved County rd 42. Fire pit, and nice room for vehicle. I assume more campsites up the road. These coordinates are for the first one I saw that was designated.

name: Industrial Metal Supply
description: This store stocks a zillion different kinds of metal.  We came for some perforated metal sheets to put over our screens. They cut for free. They have decorative metal. Custom shapes cut. Sheet metal, bar metal, disks, raw materials, etc. If you are fabbing, this is your place.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area at the jonction of the highway, right in front of Tern Lake. Next to the highway but very quiet in the night

name: Ballston Beach
description: Parking lot easily accessible, no overnight camping but still a great place to stop by, take time to cook and have a walk on the beautiful beach. Many houses in this area, people are friendly, lot of people on the beach during sunset having a good time with friends around a campfire on the beach.

name: Rest stop near Tok
description: a lot of room, good for car camping but there are some RVs

name: Camping spots near a nice creek
description: A flat spot to park and few tent camp sites further in the forest. Fire pits already there. There seems to be another way in by car but we did not explore more. Took a nice cold shower in the creek and enjoyed the calmness. Lots of paper towels and human poop though, seems normal in dispersed campground in the National forests. We pick up some trash, please help and do it to. No internet connection.

name: fr114
description: great spot, easy with a skoolie. fish lake national forest I think the sign said 6 days.

name: Rite Aid
description: Water fill station on east side of building. $2 / per 5 gallons. Takes cash or card.

name: Armington Junction Rest Area (Reference Post 71.08)
description: Rest area with toilets, water, picnic area

name: Bay Beach Lane
description: Parking on the beach with lot of space. Between 8 am and 4 pm 20 Dollar, after this time overnight parking allowed without fee, no signs. We spent there two nights, very quiet.

name: Merwin Creek State Forest CG
description: Absolutely beautiful, 10 established sites capable of handling even the largest of rvs..  dry camping only. $13 a night self pay honor system. Hand well pump for water.  literally right on the creek. picnic tables. fire pits. badminton court. pit toilets. couldn't be happier. showed up on August 2nd and the place was empty. both Verizon and T-Mobile had at least one bar in various parts of the campground but my Weboost made them both very usable.

name: Swift Auto Body
description: Very friendly mechanic who helped us fix our safe back in place. Good for repairing bodyparts or metal work! Highly recommended!!

name: French town Laundromat
description: $2-$3 per load for washing depending on machine chosen. $0.25 per 10 minutes of drying. No restrooms or anything, but nice small town grocery store and a cafe next door while you wait.

name: Down by the river pull off
description: Large, level, gravel pull off between the road, river and two guard rails. Lots of road noise during the day but quiet throughout the night. A few small paths down to the river. Some shade and plenty of sun for solar. No cell service. Good stopping point between Tillamook and Portland.

name: Lake Easton State Park
description: Showers in both men and woman’s bathrooms near the beach/day use area. Requires DiscoveryPass to park. Runs off tokens that can be purchased opposite side of the building where you check in for camping. $1 gets you 2 tokens, each token good for 3 minute shower. Not the best shower. Takes a minute to warm up and pressure isn’t great.

name: Target parking lot
description:
Moderator Note: please ask in the Store for permission. 

This is a big parking lot with several entrances. There are no signs about overnight parking and the night that I spent here I saw 5 or 6 other cars parked overnight. It's really well lit and it feels very safe. Bonus points for being able to use the bathroom and buying supplies at target.

name: Gunnison RV Dump and Water
description:
$15 dump
$5.50 water up to 1000 gallons
the potable water is around the back.

name: City parking lot
description:
City parking lot that has 24 hour limit
Right next to a stream

name: Outflow Campground
description: The Outflow Campground, managed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, is located near the Youghiogheny River Lake. It has 63 camp sites, with or without electricity, as well as tent-only areas. Sites are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. Reservations are recommended at least three days in advance of arrival. Visit website for fees, availability, and reservations or call toll-free number.

name: Designated spots on the North Fork Wilson River
description: The road dead ends here and there are several established spots and two porta potties. On the way here there are several informal spots right along the road. Right along the river (it is pretty small at this point.  On a Monday morning in August all of the spots were full.

name: Edd‘s Mini Storage
description: The owner is an elderly German lady, the place is very safe with fences, cameras and access with pin or card only. 80 USD per month for a 10x20 feet uncovered space.

name: P. J. Hoffmaster Campground
description: nice campground  inside the state park. Good beach access. many trails. Nice showers. most sites have electric. MI passport pass required.

name: There is water and dump station here.
description: No signs , just fill up on water, but a hose is needed

name: Rest area by river
description: Big rest area, with pit toilet by river. Lots of places , there are no signs advising not to camp. A few other campers here too. Had cell service

name: on street parking overnight
description:
near interstate 91 &90
on street parking where condo tenants must park their RV and work vehicles. 
safe , well lit and not bothered.
plenty of fast food nearby

name: Walmart
description: Standard Walmart location. Multiple RVs in parking lot overnight. No signage about overnight parking

name: Cefco Gas Station
description: I didn’t actually stay here but I totally would! There’s a ton of room in the lot in the back with multiple semis parked back there now. Parking lot and area looks clean. There’s a sonic attached, and they have a few outdoor tables with umbrellas. There’s even a little fenced in dog park with tables that are also covered with umbrellas.

name: Cooley Center Pond Preserve
description: Trailhead parking lot. Quiet road. No signs prohibiting parking or overnight parking. Only saw a couple of hikers. We stayed 1 night, sleeping in our van, with no problems. It was quiet and dark and private, even though you’re close to the road. There is a house next door but you can’t see it unless you climb up the trail a bit. No WiFi but cell coverage was good.

name: Timber Mesa Dispersed Camping
description: Apache-Sitgreaves National Forest camping permitted beyond the trailhead parking lot. 14-day limit. Good Verizon signal. Some traffic noise from the highway, not terrible though.

name: Strasburg City RV stay
description:
This lot is owned by the City and offers 8 full hook-up lots for $20. It offers 50/30/20 amp and can handle large RV and trailers.
It has a shower house and 2 large shelters with full size picnic tables. 
You must contact the City of Strasburg to get a spot (please see place website for the reservation link info)

name: idot rest area
description: free wifi in the building, no password. good speed.

name: Descutes boat ramp access road
description: Pullouts along the gravel road. No amenities, pit toilets at Shearars bridge and at the raft pullout approximately 1.5 . View of the river, quiet, dark. Train tracks across the river, a few came by last night.

name: Deep woods
description: Nice flat spot . Enough space for 3 or 4 rigs. Quiet, lovely.

name: Kum n Go Gas Station - water hose
description: Fill up your water tanks with the hose on the side of the building.  We asked- and they said sure!  Free!

name: water 24 hours
description: Potable water is available using a 1 inch fill nozzle. price is 4.2 cents per gallon. 25 cents for 6 gallons, $1 for 24 gallons, $5 for 120 gallons, $10 for 240 gallons.

name: 28 mile pond
description: Suitable for 3-4 vans or small trailer. there is fish in the pond. site is quiet at night.

name: Lincoln Recycling
description: Large recycling containers by the senior center

name: arch Rock picnic area
description: Rather big spot for several cars/ vans and not too big RVs. great view, pit Toiletts Hidden next to the picnic tables. you can hear 101, but not very loud, since the oceansound is prominent. only 2 Other cars stayed next to us, felt very safe. no "no overnight parking"/ "day use only" signs, next to the picnic tables is a sign that says "no Camping".

name: Missonary Road
description: This is a large site on the right of Missionary Road. Great fire ring and level spot for rv or camper. The Road to it is easy to drive and wide enough. No problem for 2WD or low clearance. Just some washboard in the road. We stayed here 2 nights. Internetservice, Mint and AT&T are good right across the road. Great views and perfect startingpoint to go further up Missionary Road to Henderson lake.

name: Alcan Highway pullout
description: This pullout was part of the Alcan highway truss bridge. The truss bridge was replaced and the remnants are still visible. Paved spots available for camper trailers and 24 foot RVs.   pit toilets are available.  Quiet in the evening.

name: Wilmot Information Center
description: Scenic Overlook & Information Center. Has free water and dump station, picnic tables, bathrooms, tourist Information. Super clean and lovely place to rest a bit.

name: Street Parking
description: It is a safe place to stay for the night .  Near the park, quiet at night . Next to some condos

name: Trail 22 Campsite
description: 1 campsite. secluded spot in the woods. one fire ring and a picnic table. not really level but still good for a van or tent... maybe a smaller RV. 1 bar Verizon service.

name: Cummins
description: For anyone who have a Cummins generator, they have parts AND service departments.

name: Mt. Shasta Parks & Rec Baseball Field
description: The upper and lower parking lots have signs stating 96 hours is the maximum parking time. There is plenty of space (as long as a game isn't being played) for all sizes of rigs. There aren't any available facilities.

name: Story City (Iowa) Dump Station(s)
description: Dump station at north- and southbound rest areas. No potable water though.

name: Lowe's in Dubuque (IA)
description: The adjacent Walmart does NOT allow overnight parking and has signs posted as such all over its parking lot. Lowe's, however, allows boondockers. Simply check in with customer service counter and they will direct you as to where to park.

name: Target - N. Columbus (OH)
description: Talked with management over the phone and they approved boondocking if it's only for a single night. Typical parking lot lights and the sounds of I-71 off in the distance.

name: B&C Auto Center
description:
Very nice Staff at the shop. Had our brakes done here. They were able to fit us in the next day. There were an issue with our callipers and they needed to do the rest the day after, but they made it possible to put the tires back on so we haven’t had to worry about finding a place to sleep for the night.

They also offer various coupons on their website for their services.

name: Bemis hill wild camp
description: Just off the road huge open area that it looks like atv/dirt bikes use. Some big dirt mounds and a couple ponds. Haven’t seen anyone yet. Great spot for one night. AT&T has 1 to 2 bars and can access internet. There is a established campground about 5 min down the road.

name: Sonyea State Forest
description:
Beautiful free camping option not far from Letchworth state park. Theres a number of camping spots here. 3 official ones are marked. Spot #1 seems big enough for rigs larger than a van and is situated next to a nice hiking trail on an old railway bed that leads down to a river to another trail that follows the remnants of a canal.
Spots #2 and #3 can be found further down the road just along the field. less tree coverage there but more secluded from the trail traffic and decent T-mobile service. Also some spotty Verizon.
Make sure you take the main entrance as the other side of the road cuts through a corrections facility.

name: Kansas City Mine
description: From county road 110, climb a steep dirt track for 3 km with a couple of tight switchbacks (4x4 with low gear required). At the end of the track, a small stream and flat space. Great views and a nice hike (head 300 meters North from the stream and get stunning view of  Prospect guch). No cell service.

name: Sunnyside mine
description:
Several flat spots near the end of the track before the lake. Lake is empty now.
Secluded. No cell service.

name: Nodaway Lake City Park Campground
description: A nice campground at nodaway lake city park. You enter the park and the campground is on the west side of the lake. Sadly there is no swimming at the lake but you can fish. There are about 20+ spots at the campground. One side has trees/some nice shade and the other side is more open. It is $9 for a tent site and $11 for a electric site. It is first come first serve and check out is 4pm. At each site there is a fire ring and a picnic table. There is also a small little building with a mens and womens bathroom. Not sure about the mens side but the womens side has two toilets, one sink, and one shower. Nothing beautiful but it works and there is hot water. On the west side of the small white building next to where you deposit your money there is a fresh water spigot where you can fill up your tank. There is also a little free library, a playground, and a shelter. Plus before you go down the hill towards the campground/ on the north side of the gravel road there are really nice walking paths that go towards the lake greenfield rec area. There is also a dumpster but it was fairly full when I got here. The other thing to beware of is the raccoons at night, don’t leave anything out you don’t want taken. The one main down side is I did not have service in the campground but if I went up the gravel road you come in on at the top of that hill I got service.

name: Hanscombe Point camp ground
description:
6 camping sites in a farm land. 
VERY quiet. no services (no water, no electricity)
you camp under the trees or in a big grass field.
we loved our experience there!
no web site either.... only a phone number +1 843-514-1215
they charge 30$ per night though.. :(

name: Jedediah Smith ridge view
description: space for 1 van along a lightly traveled road.  excellent Verizon service.  amazing views of the ocean.

name: 6th Ave SpeedWash
description:
Just your typical laundromat
Small parking lot
Accepts cards, Apple Pay, and change
Does have a Soap dispenser
No Wi-Fi, No TV
Hours: 8 to 9 M-F; 9 to 9 Sat-Sun

name: Mcdougal lake campground
description: Forest service campground with access to a lake. 2 bars of AT&T service. $15 a night would be a good spot for a weekend no one else at the campground.

name: Caterpillar Hill Picnic Area
description:
Picnic area on the side of the highway that would work for an overnight in an emergency/pinch
Gorgeous views!
Picnic tables, no other services.  There is a sign that says no camping at the south parking area which is pavement and unlevel.  The north parking area is gravel and semi-level and there are no signs with restrictions.
4 bars strong Verizon LTE since you’re at 374 AGL

name: Dirt Lot in Pillager
description: Dirt parking lot.  Right next to the railroad tracks.  KCs bar down the street with food and bathroom.  Could also park behind the restaurant next door.

name: Brooklyn mine
description:
Pass in front of the mine then continue 100 yards. Flat spot with fire pit.
2 bars AT&T. A bit more secluded than staying on the large flat area in the curve in front of the mine

name: Oak Haven RV Park
description: Very small campground with limited services close to Homestead National Historic Park. Sites are large with water and electric. Some have fire pits and tables. No septic, no showers, no wifi. One outhouse available. It's not the fanciest campground but there aren't a lot of places to park for the night out here. $23 per night, self check in at the drop box out front. Only about a dozen sites. I called ahead and he had one spot available. There are also tent sites farther back on the property.

name: Rideshare Parking Lot
description: Paved rideshare parking lot about 500 yards off the interstate. Far enough that there’s not much traffic noise. Good for an overnight.  Parking lot is about the size of a football field, is paved and well lit. Three bars of AT&T service. No amenities.

name: Wing Mountain Road
description: Arrived after dark. No issue nice large camp space cup of fire rings circular drive plenty of space for more than one vehicle tall beautiful trees. Two bars of service. Great place.

name: Forest Road
description: This spot is a few hundred yards farther down the forest road than the other spot listed that’s closer to the highway. It has more privacy and a bigger turnaround loop. -truck camping golfer

name: Top of TV Tower Rd
description:
Along the final stretch of road, which is actually paved, just off the last and highest hairpin. Breathtaking — literally when the wind whips. But It was calm for me and my small popup truck camper til morning when the flapping flaps woke me. 2 Verizon bars. Fire pit. 360 view including Morro Bay. Room for medium RV. Stayed one night and saw only a few other vehicles and a hiker and his dog. 

Not entirely sure the

name: NF view
description:
This is a bit off the ioverlander grid. Just follow the forest road and when a lower road appears, stay on the upper road and you will end up here. All I’ve seen or heard in 24 hrs are a spectacular view and the breeze through the pines. Nobody within several miles. Wow.

2wd will suffice if dry. 3 Verizon bars. Keep it clean.

-Tony the Truck Camping Golfer (Check me out on YT)

name: Mini truck stop
description: This place saved me in winter when deep snow berms and banks blocked all other places listed if they were not already closed for winter. Just ask inside the gas station store. He put me and my small truck camper next to a snow bank where I would not bother the truckers. WiFi great.

name: Pull out
description:
Moderator Note: Please respect the wishes of the locals. No wild camping within National Park Boundary.

-----------------

small flat-ish spot for 2 vehicles max. slightly tucked away from the General Highway.

name: Lakeside Drive roadside parking
description: Roadside parking on Lakeside Drive. Wide road with shoulders, fairly level. It's somewhat noisy for all the passing traffic and revellers. A couple other vans parked overnight. Nice lake views from everywhere. Pay attention to street cleaning and day parking restrictions/signs (2h parking max from 8am-6pm)

name: street parking
description: next to a mutli-unit residential complex, so not immediately disturbing anyone's privacy or view. private houses across the street tho and pretty much the whole neighborhood. a little noisy, like any place here, but not terrible and off the main drag. no parking restrictions/signs posted

name: The Sprinter Shop
description:
The Sprinter Shop is Washington's premiere Sprinter only repair facility! If you own a Sprinter and are in need of service call, text, email or stop in! We make room and time for Full-Timers!

We only use OEM parts, are equipped with Mercedes Benz Xentry scan tool and can perform any repair required. 

14907 Murray Rd. SW Lakewood 98439

I also own A-1 Transmission and Auto Repair.


We offer free dump, water fill, trash/recycling drop off and a secure place to boondock for the night in the event of an emergency. We are avid RV's (travel trailer though) and spend about 8 night a month and one full month every year on the road. Travel is Life!

name: The Sprinter Shop
description:
Stop in to top off your tank any time!

We have a place to empty grey and black water, too!


14907 Murray Rd. SW Lakewood 98439

name: Red River State Recreation Area
description: RV and tent campsites in the middle of the city. Very quiet and clean with access to bathrooms, water, showers and within walking distance of several stores, bars and places to eat. $23 a night plus $7 a day for a state parks pass.

name: Gladstone campground
description: tent sites are 15$ super clean bathrooms and showers right on the waterfront

name: Pactola Lake pullout
description: The are several gravel pullout sites marked P. This one is big enough for a car or 1 van. This spot is lake view & completely SHADED. There are two steep trails down to a little slate rock beach area (which is pretty private) great for dogs, since no pets are allowed at the swimming area(where there are pit toilets) You can see the boats docked at the marina. Stayed 1 night, full bars verizon 4g

name: Dump by the greenhouse
description: Dump tank just in the middle of the road before it turns into a back alley. The locals told me about this spot as it is kind of hard to spot. It is right off hwy 25 by the laundromat and greenhouse. I have attached pictures to make it a little less confusing

name: Bill Heddles Rec center
description: All in one area. Showers $4.00. Across the street free dump camping and water need a water bandit tho. But next door Tractor Supply with a rv area. Only thing missing is a brewery.

name: Free rest area
description: Rest area with toilets, suitable for medium sizes RVs (probably big sizes too, I’ve slept in 9 metres RV). Probably at least 10 vehicles can fit. AT&T works but very slow.

name: Walmart
description: Has signs saying they prohibit overnight camping and yet talking to the security guard he says we’re fine and we’re in a 24 foot Class B van and we parked next to the road and the noise was low at night and during the day it was a bit louder. They don’t sell produce and overall their selection was lower than a normal Walmart and the Walmart app didn’t indicate what aisle things were on and the inside staff was not helpful.

name: Jarrett-Gordon Ford
description:
We finally found a place that would give our 2008 Ford Class C a proper oil change and fluids check. They were able to fit us in a few days after calling.
Address:
2600 Access Rd, Davenport, FL 33897
*coordinates not correct. Not sure why*

name: nacelles lookout
description: It's a great look out 2 or 3 trucks or vehicles it goes maybe a small camper stayed here one night amazing views  perfect cell reception

name: Small shaded spot
description: I preferred this spot over the others because it's covered by trees and has a bit more privacy than the pull offs. It is on the small side but does have a fire ring.

name: visitor info/Library
description: water with 2 spigots attached. looks like a hose can be attached. right next to parking lot but hidden behind bush next to round picnic table. will have to get out of vehicle to locate it. Easy to pull up to any hose could reach.

name: McLeod Park
description: We boondocked 1 night by this city park, and had no problems. It’s in a quiet residential neighborhood with minimal road noise. The park has a playground for kids, picnic tables and trash cans. It feels safe here. I had 5G cell signal.

name: city dump rome
description: dump and water. bring your own hose. its free

name: True Value Propane
description: Place to get your propane tank filled, just go in an ask and they will grab someone to help you. $2.49/gallon

name: Old Monarch Pass Road
description: Old Monarch Pass road is well marked off US50 just east of the pass. The first hundred feet or so is steep but then it’s very well graded and in great shape. Easy for almost any vehicle. Just up from US50 are several nice sites with fire rings. Farther up are more including where these coordinates are. Can barely hear the road from up here. Good ATT service but no Verizon. It is high elevation so if you are sensitive to that be aware.

name: Quick trip
description: Big rigs and RVs can fit in for fueling. There is a  parking area where you can park you car/van and crash. Store is 24/7. Idk about parking an RV over night though. None here while I was around.

name: NF 51 spur
description: Quiet spot a short distance down a spur off of NF 51. This camp is just off the side of the spur but there is little traffic, at least mid week when we were here. Good proximity to Waldport and the coast. There is a nicer spot just NW of here but it was occupied. NF 51 is narrow and I wouldn't recommend it for trailers. I drive a full size pickup and was glad I didn't meet someone coming the other way.

name: beckler river single site
description: enough room for two vehicles one tent and even a second tent area set to the side. the river is crystal clear and I would even say handicap accessible shoreline. not much traffic or noise except the river over the rocks. stayed in a minivan.

name: Safeway
description: Stayed two nights.  Quiet , no issues.  A couple others stayed as well.  2 bars cell service.

name: Clark Creek River-1st sites
description:
Along the river on the right before the bridge on the left. Google might take you to where the hwy stops in line with this spot, but drive a little further down to find the forest road. It starts off paved then gravel/dirt, then some pavement again.
This particular spot is the first spot on the left right along the river. There is a semi-steep path down to the river behind the site. To Note: This is probably the only path in the area so other people will want to walk through the site to get to it. There is one more spot to the right and one U shaped spot that looks overgrown on the right as you turn right into this section. 
This site is on the smaller side and a fire pit was made pretty much in the middle front area of the site. It may be better for an SUV/Car camping or a truck camper. However, depending on how tight you want to be two cars or an SUV and a car could maneuver themselves. There wasn't much of "living" area unless your vehicle is closer to the front of the site (for space behind them) or backed in far enough so that you use the space near the fire pit.
The river seems shallow but there is a deeper part. I was able to find some large rocks to hang onto and let my body float.
Train does go by in the early AM. I don't know what time they started but I heard 3 before 6AM, then there were more throughout the day. Some road noise while your awake but nothing that would disturb you. 
I had 2-3 bars of ATT
I enjoyed my stay. You can see others pinned spots on the other side of the bridge. would love to check them out some time. enjoy!

name: Lawrence Community Recreation Center
description: Free showers, byo towels, etc. I asked if I could pay for a shower, they said there was no charge for residents. I told them I was traveling and they said you're welcome to take a shower any time you're passing through. Very nice people.

name: Public park and playground
description: Nice public park next to the rec center. Playground,  picnic tables, lots of shade.

name: Atlantic Public Library
description: A really nice library with beautiful woodwork inside.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Huge relief when I realized Planet Fitness was all the way in Anchorage. Was able to shower and regroup.

name: Tons of Bubbles Laundromat
description: Really clean and well-maintained laundromat. The machines take cards (although 'tap to pay' wasn’t working). There’s a Starbucks and a Safeway in the same shopping center. Also right next to a Shell.

name: Kachess Lake dispersed camping
description: Flat ground outside of the official Kachess Campground. Campfire ring, no amenities, dogs allowed.

name: Kearns Community RV Dump Station
description: Two lanes, water available. No commercial dumping. Please keep very clean or will be shut down.

name: Tustumena Lake
description: Free campsites, 8 campsites, no fire ring, not waterfront but nearby, boat ramp nearby, bathrooms, no water spigot, no trash service, and cell service was spotty. Bring your bug dope or thermacell. This is a pretty excellent place if Johnson Lake is full. Come prepared.

name: West Yellowstone Library
description:
Free, secure wifi that works in the parking lot (they advertise this on their website). Go inside and they have little cut pieces of paper with the password. 

I worked remotely there for a few hours and used the wifi inside and outside the building. Was able to utilize their meeting room to work in. They also have a back patio to sit at if you don't need the privacy for work. And they have computers if you needed something like that. 

Very friendly. Very accommodating. Closed Sundays and Mondays. Most days I believe are 10am to 6pm. Also bathrooms available.

name: Henrys Lake SP
description:
$3 Hot showers. Nice facility for showers and restrooms. Easy to get: pay the fee like you would a campsite and there's parking at the bathhouse. No time limit. Restrooms across the hall. 

I know the showers are mentioned in another post, but I felt it should be searchable for just showers.

name: Free 24 hr Atlantic Parking Lot
description: There are a handful of parking lots with green circle signs that have free parking in the Atlantic ‘business district.’ If you drive around the area north of hwy 6 you will see a couple of them. The only rule is that you don’t stay longer than 24 hours. So I picked this parking lot because the City park is just a couple blocks from here and has a public restroom & water fountain that I believe is open 24/7. Well at least it was open past 9pm yesterday. Also the public library is a block away which is great for wifi and charging things. This parking lot is right next to a busy road, Poplar St, that can be loud in the early morning so if that won’t work for you I would pick one of the parking lots where it is on a less busy street. This location is perfect for car camping or camper vans basically anything that can fit into one spot and be semi incognito.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Called and spoke with management, she said on the nights that they are open 24 hours it's okay to overnight; but the nights they close at 9pm, it is not.  Also no big rigs or RVs. call ahead of time.I stayed one night had no problems.  parked in back.  not too much light, low traffic, felt safe. Close to a food and grocery. The gym is the nicer one I've visited in the area.

name: Gravel lot
description: Between the River and the road. Plowed in winter. Some T-mobile reception. Good Verizon reception.

name: Nosaeecnal finds
description: Beautiful spot on the water. Spots for …maybe 3-4 vans with no raised roofs. Very tight corners. Best for minivan/truck/suv/car. See photos attached. If they upload correctly, all photos should be a progression of spots down the trail. This is a very small and enclosed area. Yet beautiful.

name: Starbucks
description: Free wifi in Starbucks, password is by the register.

name: Water Vendore
description: Fresh Water and ice Maschine! 5Gallons for 1$

name: Porter Lake NF
description:
Primitive Camping with Pit-Toilets and Water! In Hunting-Season used as there Camp! Free 
The Florida Trail goes near by, good for hiking!

name: Water Vendor
description: When we came there was Ice only! Hope it works next time!!

name: Walmart Odessa
description:
Regular Walmart Parking 
GPS may not be correct! Laut Cars driving by!

name: Eldorado
description: Near the Schleicher Courthouse there are hookups for Campers! You should ask in the Courthouse for permission! We did not stay here.

name: former mulch dump with a view
description: good sized spot with a really nice view of the mountains! good Verizon  and googlefi reception. some mosquitoes. there are two roads in take the second one further in as that's not  steep like the first one. I'd recommend parking further back so drivers passing by can't see you.

name: Walmart Supercenter
description:
Walmart Supercenter parking lot. 
1025 GA-34 E, Newnan, GA 30265
No signs posted so we asked and were told it's fine. Plenty of other truckers, moving trucks etc. There's a Hobby Lobby next door to Walmart and many places to eat in the same lot and across the street. Good cell coverage

name: Seal Beach Parking
description: small parking lot at seal beach, maintained by the city of seal beach. no signs prohibiting overnight parking. must have paid ticket between 6:00 a.m. and 10:00 p.m. but doesn't say anything about overnight. bathrooms on site but unsure if they are locked past 10:00 p.m. busy with mild foot traffic in the late evening but reasonable enough for a great overnight on the beach.

name: Tumble Fresh Coin Laundry
description: Really nice laundry mat with bathrooms and large waiting area. can buy soaps for $1.75. several different size washing machines, smallest being $3.50 but can fit a large load of laundry! takes coin and card. very clean. open from 5am-1am

name: On route to trailhead
description: 100 yds off paved road. Shade, fire pit. Good for tent, car or van.  Quiet. Mosquitoes.

name: Palisades Dam
description: camping is allowed, with a 5-day limit. there is a wide level area with a fabulous view over the valley with the dam off to the right. The Moon rises just between a cleft in the mountains. there are shade trees nearby. ready-made stone campfire circles. Cellular service is intermittent. it comes and goes every few minutes.

name: Forest road by Hot springs
description:
A couple miles outside of Radium Hot springs, a bumpy but  doable logging road leads to this open level field.
Room for many rvs of all lengths.   A few fire pits in the area.
Very quiet and few bugs in Aug. Just a few random card driving by dirt road. 
Fast Verizon and Att
Great for a night or a week

name: Conoco Truck Stop
description: Big parking area at this gas station/truck stop. Not much traffic around and I stayed to the side, away from the idling semis so was relatively quiet overnight. There isn’t much on MT-200 for about 100 miles west of here so I was grateful for a place to stop.

name: San Isidro casa de cambio
description: Money Exchange in McAllen. Perfect to get Mexican pesos before Crossing the border

name: Mount Billy Mitchel
description: Historic site & Rest area with picnic tables with easy asphalted access from main road. No camping restrictions. Beautiful view of surrounding mountains.

name: Emergency landing strip
description: Emergency stone dust landing strip easy access from high way, lots of room but don’t park on the strip for obvious reason. Nice view of Worthington Glacier

name: Near the end of 311
