42.770186,-89.478848 small lot with dirt landing access to Sugar River

Liberty Creek Wildlife Area
Town Line Rd, Albany, WI 53502
42.756126,-89.397685 Secluded Lot way back, good sized, is signed

name: Albany Trailhead Restroom Lot
description: This is a trailhead and restroom lot in Albany. Technically it's for hikers and it is signed as such.  It has running water and a shallow sink but no hose hookups so hard to fill stuff...but it's possible. Sign says "This Parking Lot for trail user vehicles only". No hours posted.

name: Station 12 River Landing Lot
description:
Station 12 Boat Landing  Sugar River
W1580 County Highway EE, Albany, WI 53502, USA
42.733945,-89.444041

Large level parking area with a dirt/gravel boat launch to the Sugar River. The hwy is a little loud and somewhat busy as a thoroughfare. There is a public restroom in nearby Albany at GPS– 42.709634,-89.429913 2.5mi away. As well as a Mobil and Dollar General. 
Lot's of parking areas in the wildlife area all have signage though including this one. No hours posted 

AT&T service is usable but not great at 10Mb/1.5Mb

Additional parking nearby
Albany Sand Prairie
42.726378,-89.437398 Fairly secluded lot, but easily accessible off Cty E

Secluded Lot 
42.728329,-89.453141 Long driveway off Conservation Dr and rather secluded, is signed.  Close to groomed hiking trail

Tin Can Lot
42.733732,-89.467174 On Tin Can Rd, a small lot fairly level, is signed

Albany Wildlife River Access
42.724330,-89.529808 Good sized side of the road pull off kinda unlevel sloping away from the road. Steep muddy bank to river 

River Access Lot/landing Attica
Cty C Brooklyn, WI 53521
42.770186,-89.478848 small lot with dirt landing access to Sugar River

Liberty Creek Wildlife Area
Town Line Rd, Albany, WI 53502
42.756126,-89.397685 Secluded Lot way back, good sized, is signed

name: Public Parking at end of street
description: there are several spots on either side of the street. appropriate for vans or cars. there is lots of street parking around that could accommodate large rigs.

name: harbour parking
description: views of the mountains and river at quiet US harbour parking. it's on an island in the middle of the valley. No camping allowed. best view around

name: Port Imperial Ferry
description:
Big 24h parking lot (20$) just besides the ferry to New york. Great place to sleep and visit ny. Really nice view of ny too.

I would tend to think that RV longer than 21 feet won’t be able to get in as the turn to enter the lot is tight.

DO NOT PARK on the side of the river, this is not part of the parking lot. This part is private and reserved for the NY WATERWAY buses. You will get towed away. So park on the side of the street.

name: Manistee forest
description: Somewhat dedicated camp-sites near brush lake campground that are not maintained. Good for a night or three.

name: West Targee Street
description:
A wide business park road with a sidewalk. Perfect for big rigs. Quiet at night with only a few cars and semis after 11:00PM. Morning traffic after 6:00AM and from the airport. At this spot, where the north side of the street gets a little wider, there's not much slope towards the sidewalk. 

No amenities but close to Costco, Walmart and restaurants. About 10 minutes drive from downtown. Nearby side streets may have a little less road noise, but they were angle to the side more. 

I stayed here two nights with no issue. Please be courteous and don't make a mess!

name: Sleep along the River
description:
They limit the parking to two hours from 8am-6pm Monday-Friday 

The rest is unrestricted.

name: Alpine North Loop Campground
description:
National forest campground about 2 miles from Alpine, WY. Each site has a picnic table, fire ring, and bear box. We came in on a Friday evening with no reservation and there were still sites available. There are pit toilets and a water spigot with drinking water. Some road noise from the highway. Perfect cell service with Verizon. 

$17/night for standard non-electric sites. Definitely room in all sites for larger RVs.

name: Phillips 66
description: Spigot under the price sign. locals said it was potable. Sign saying to washing of vehicles.

name: Sky Ute Fairgrounds and RV park
description: Nice (enough) RV park at the fairgrounds. 64 full hookup sites. Long pull-thrus. Tent camping, showers and Laundromat. Along the Los Pinos River for fishing. $40 night. 3 bars LTE Verizon

name: Thunderbolt Creek
description: There is a fair number of flattish wild camping areas just before you get the actual campground. Whitehouse Campground which has pit toilets and a hand pump for water.

name: Beauty Beach with trucks on it
description: I camped at the pullout after “near shipwrecks point” but found this in the morning, like two pull outs later, quite spacious, and 2 guys with trucks have driven onto the beach and set up tents and made fires. It seems pretty chill here to either park in pullout or pitch a tent on beach. I didn’t see any signs

name: views near hwy 50
description: 360 views. Well maintained gravel road. Can hear some Hwy noise but traffic should be light. Convenient spot to rest for the night. Another open Turnout was even closer to the Hwy. More options likely farther down the road.

name: Applegate River in CA
description: This is a large clean site next to the Applegate River. There are several spots in both shade and sun. Several swimming holes and we hope good fishing.

name: Walmart
description: Just like every other Walmart. Now they close at 11pm

name: Cracker Barrel
description:
Large flat parking. 
Five pull through spaces for larger RV’s. Unfortunately some of the other customers will park sedans in this area as well. Full day of shade day in corner parking spot.

name: sand pit
description: it's a nice big parking lot with a hard bottom to drive... the world uses it as a dog park

name: dead end road on river
description: as title says dead end road with parking on the river. no signs posted.

name: Baldwin city parking
description: there are a couple of big lots for public parking behind the "main drag" of Baldwin. No amenities, there is one porta-potty next to the pavilion. Pretty decent Verizon signal.

name: Glidden Lake State Forest Campground
description: 20-25 wooded sites on or near Glidden Lake, approx. 10 min. from Crystal Falls and 30 min. from Iron Mountain. Sites are clustered in groups, but the groups are spaced out. $20 per night camping. Requires state vehicle pass.

name: Manzanita Public Parking
description: There is a large gravel lot here for public parking, no signs against overnight parking. People park there during the day to go to the coffee shop next door, but it's quiet at night, with a police station across the street. I stayed for 2 nights and left my van there most of the day. It's a good spot for walking around the cute little town of Manzanita. There are also restrooms across the street! (white building)

name: Walmart
description: Several other RVs already here, semi trucks, car campers. Didn’t ask store for permission because there were so many already. Parked at the back of the lot to the far left as you’re looking at the store, in the corner by a medical office building.

name: Quiet Street Next To River
description:
Great spot for a night here in Ithica. Safe neighborhood, right next to a river. You can park on the side of the street where there are no houses. Blends in well as residential may park here as well.

Quiet street, dead ends so not much through traffic. Keep it clean and respectful fellow vanlifers.

name: Blueberry Hill State Forest Campground
description: This is a MN state managed camp site (https://www.dnr.state.mn.us/state_forests/forest.html?id=sft00005#cmp00002). There are 9 sites, at least two pull-throughs large enough for my 34’ fifth wheel, and several more that could be back-ins. Drinking water is advertised but I haven’t seen it, and one vault toilet. We stayed two nights and there was one other camper in a motor home. Traffic noise can be heard, but only the loudest vehicles were really noticed, and there are train tracks across the highway that can be loud. I’d guess 5-6 trains per day?

name: Sudz Up!
description: We were able to wash our Class C 26ft easily. We did have to do a little moving around to get each side but it worked!

name: Newcastle Reservoir
description: BLM land surrounding Newcastle Reservoir. Road was graded gravel with washboard. Wouldn’t recommend for an RV because of switchback turns but cars, vans and shorter trailers should be fine. Variety of different quality of roads leading down to the water and tons of roads all around to explore for spots.

name: Willow Park
description: Small campground in the city. $20 a night. 2 night limit. No camping November 1 - April 1.

name: Chevron
description: Spigot on front pole. Asked attendant if it was ok I use it and he said yes because I have a smaller tank.

name: Maverick
description: Water at pump 8. Seems intended for filling up so I wouldn’t worry about asking attendants if it’s ok. I did and they were super friendly about it. Showed me how to use this type of pump. In case you also didn’t know… you turn the pump on then pull down on the ring where the water comes out in order to switch the water to the hose.

name: Pull off near closed road
description: This small pull off can accommodate one medium sized motorhome / van. Trailers would be difficult here. No reception on GoogleFi.

name: Samson Park
description: A beautiful park, with a playground for children, attached to the beach on the Atlantic Ocean, with very fine and pleasant sand, with clean and transparent ocean waters during most of the days of the year.

name: Tazlina Glacier View
description: Relatively flat, fire pit and views of the lake and the glacier. Quiet but convenient to Glenn Hwy. Two bars of ATT and Verizon

name: Logging Road pullouts
description: good spots to stay for a night. 2 at this location opposite sides of road.

name: Road end
description: quiet road end for overnight camping. no services

name: Bankhead National Forrest
description: Large clearing at the end of a FS road. 2 bars of 4G on ATT. 2WD accessible.

name: caseys
description: free wifi. works from the parking lot. no login, just connect.

name: Flat Top Rock
description: Free camp. Cannot be seen from highway. Soft sand entrance and on trail. Good for motorcycles or light 4WD.

name: Mt helens observatory
description: big free parking next to Observatorium.full Internet connection

name: Walmart parking lot
description: Typical Walmart. Store is open until 11 PM. A few big rigs parked tonight. Store prefers you park way back in the lot by the pizza parlor. There are a few trees to help block the sun.

name: Rue vue statue
description: Rue tranquille près de NYC, idéal pour une nuit après une visite à Time Square. Près du supermarket avec petit café idéal pour le matin. Doit partir avant 8am mais food market ouvre à 7am. Vue sur la statue et bord walk. Quelques bars à proximité mais on entends rien, très sécuritaire. Eau et wifi dispo au supermarket.

name: Shower4th
description: Petite douche à droite de l’accès à la plage public, ststionnement également.

name: Tollbridge Campground
description: Umatilla NF campground. Road in from the highway is a ~mile of washboard but low clearance is fine. No water except the river. Five sites - only two occupied on a weekend in August. $8. Very quiet pretty spot.

name: Large turnaround
description: Large gravel area visible on Google Maps. Great view.  There are a lot of shells and a burn pile, this is clearly a shooting and partying area. There were locals who drive up looking to use the spot to party but I was already parked here and they were pissed off. The road ends ¼ mile down and someone was camped there too.

name: Water stations in Gros Ventre Campground
description: multiple water stations inside the Gros Ventre campground. you can drive right in even if you’re not staying there. these are more for water jugs, and not for RV Tanks. however, i’m pretty sure there’s dump stations here (but they require a reservation at the check in office). all water stations are near the bathrooms and there are multiple ones in the campground.

name: RV Sites in Homer
description: This is a quiet, six site campground offering dry or electric/sewer sites. Fresh water available. Big rig friendly, level sites, though access is uphill. Rate is about half of the Homer Spit campgrounds.  Some road noise but not bad, fair to good views, good Wi-Fi and good to excellent Verizon reception.

name: free outdoor shower
description: one free outdoor shower at bloedel donovan park, you can control the temp but i couldn’t figure out how to make it anything but warm (not that i’m complaining). it’s a pretty busy place 95% of the time but if you go close to/after sunset you get the shower to yourself as long as you want. i went during the day a few times and got some stares but if you can handle that then it’s a great free shower. it’s nice to swim in the lake and play it off like you’re just showering bc you just swam

name: Welch Farm
description:
A working blueberry farm. Camp next to  the blueberry barrens. No hookups. Quiet with trails to the bay and scenic views. State Park beach nearby. 
186 Roque Bluffs Rd, Roque Bluffs, ME 04654, 
tel. 207 951 2437, 
https://welchfarm.com

name: Green Ridge State Forest Site 24
description: Great place for 1 or a few nights. Slight Highway noise from 68. Mostly level with a fire ring and table.

name: KOA Dodge City
description: Very new with showers and laundry.. RVs in the back. Spaces for tents or RTT. Don’t remember WiFi but in-town so mobile phone signal strength was good.

name: Stanton town dump
description: Town dump free of charge, right around the corner of the town park campground. Does the trick. thank you Stanton! NO potable water..

name: Pigeon Hill Preserve
description: Trailhead/parking lot off the road, it’s pretty far from town and fairly obscure. No one bothered us.

name: Street Parking
description:
Residential street super quiet at night.
I arrived 12:30 am, parked in front a church. Stay for 1 night, no problems at all.
Planet Fitness is about few blocks from this location, if you have gym membership and need shower.
I do not recommend stay at Planet Fitness at night because I saw a guard security there. Street Cleaning every Thursday 12:00 noon to 2pm

name: Ponderosa Campground
description: Beautiful USFS campground, primarily for hikers and bikepackers. Doesn't look like there is space at any of the sites for anything bigger than a full size pickup. Next to Negro Creek so plenty of drinking water if you have a filter. Pit toilets and a few trash cans. Road is currently closed from PCH/Big Sur side, so only access is via the Camp Hunter-Liggett side of Nacimiento Road.

name: Mt. Pilchuck Trailhead
description: There is space at the far end of the trailhead parking area for Mt. Pilchuck where one could park a van or pitch a tent, although keep in mind that the parking area, while huge, does fill up during the day on weekends. The road up here is unmaintained and cratered with hundreds of potholes so the only reason to camp here is if you were coming up here anyway to do the hike. (High clearance strongly recommended on the road.) There is a toilet, but no other amenities.

name: Campsite 4210
description: The Forest Service has decommissioned Road 4210 and this small flat spot is where that road intersected Road 42 / Mt. Pilchuck Road. There's a berm behind the campsite blocking access to what was once 4210. The site is located two miles up Road 42 from the highway (past the Heather Lake Trailhead). Suitable for tents or vans. The road to get here is cratered with potholes and is high clearance only. Convenient spot to camp if you plan on hiking Mt. Pilchuck or Heather Lake.

name: 7 Eleven - Spigot
description: Spigot is on the West side of the building.

name: National Forest extra natural
description:
Tons of good spots along this road, the road condition gets rougher past the national forest sign but I was able to do it easily in a small stock 2wd truck. 

Very low traffic up here, grass covers most of the "sites" where you'll find fire rings

name: Merrimac Ferry -Free
description:
This is a free Ferry that started privately back in 1848. Operates 24hrs a day 7 days/wk from about April to Nov as long as there's no ice. It's part of Hwy 113 and crosses the Lake Wisconsin starting in West Point/Lodi(South), to Merrimac, WI(North landing). Posted No Overnight camping


There’s ice cream on both sides. there's a wayside and flushing bathrooms on the West Point side(South). there's a dock and a few picnic tables. There's a bar on the North side with good food reasonable prices. 

Also very nearby is a free area, Gibraltar Rock on Cty Hwy V. a steep hike up to a scenic overlook and access to the Ice Age National Trail section. The East lot is small and gets pretty busy on weekends. Not much room to turn around. There's another west lot on V signed Ice Age Trail which may be less busy and may be easier to turn around in if needed. Neither lot is good for large/long vehicles/trailers. Cty V is narrow with no real shoulder so no real roadside parking. 


Just North of the ferry is Devils Lake State Park (Fee) with amazing bluff scenic views hiking and swimming. There's also 2 Campgrounds and it's the busiest park in the state normally.

name: Pullover at Cahuilla Mountain trail
description:
A pullover beside the trail. This trail is quite tough, you definitely need a 4x4 to make it. It’s on the top of a mountain.

Has good AT&T 5G

name: Griffin Park Campground
description:
Tent camping - $10 per night for; 12 years and under no charge; and additional $10 per night if you take up an electrical spot;  RV rates apply if you are plugging in air conditioners, refrigerators, multiples lights or fans, etc.

RV camping - $10 per night for; 12 years and under no charge; and additional $15 per night if you take up an electrical spot;

Weekly and Monthly rates are available.

DAY RATES River Access - $5 per adult for parking pass.  ALL VEHICLES must have pass. 

Season Pass River Access - $65 per pass; 1 pass is for 1 car, no more than 4 adults per car.

River Access includes swimming, fishing, sunning but does not cover camping .

* Use of clean restrooms and hot showers are included with purchase of camping or day pass.

name: waterfall cameron
description: large parking for hicking until waterfall (no... no overnigth sign)

name: Holiday Stationstores
description: Free Water and Dumping station. Behind the Gas station.

name: Two guns
description: This is an abandoned gas station and ruins of a past Indian tribe. There are several spots to boondocks in the back or you can park up under the covered area at the abandoned fuel station. I have stayed here a few times and it’s nice to explore a bit of the ruins. There’s a bit of road noise in a rooftop tent but should be fine in a camper

name: Panera Bread
description: Decent speed WiFi and easy to access for free. They have indoor seating but it’s a bit crowded during peak eating times. They also have a patio with umbrellas that’s much quieter.

name: Merrimac Ferry Wayside
description:
Posted No Overnight camping, no hrs posted Ferry here is 24/7 April to Nov

Wayside and flushing bathrooms, there's a dock and a few picnic tables. Across the Ferry in Merrimac there's a bar with decent food reasonable prices. 

Also very nearby is a free area, Gibraltar Rock on Cty Hwy V. a steep hike up to a scenic overlook and access to the Ice Age National Trail section. The East lot is small and gets pretty busy on weekends. Not much room to turn around. There's another west lot on V signed Ice Age Trail which may be less busy and may be easier to turn around in if needed. Neither lot is good for large/long vehicles/trailers. Cty V is narrow with no real shoulder so no real roadside parking. 


Just North of the ferry is Devils Lake State Park (Fee) with amazing bluff scenic views hiking and swimming. There's also 2 Campgrounds and it's the busiest park in the state normally.

AT&T internet is decent here with 28Mb down and 8Mb up

name: Haley dump station
description: Has 2 spigots of potable water. Dump station. Bathroom. Trash.

name: Chevron
description: Water next to gasstation! This is a second sentence to fulfill 40 chars..

name: Antler Ridge Resort
description: Well established campground. $69/night. Recommended for more than a one night stay. Great place full hookups nice, clean and organized.

name: Half moon Bay Coast Trailhead
description: Nice spot to park and rest, eat lunch, and stretch. Trails along the coast. Day use with  Enough parking space for cars, vans, small trailers and rv.

name: Picnic area water spigot
description: Water fountain next to picnic tables at the west end of the parking lot. We filled a jug, but if you have a long hose you might be able to fill your tank.

name: Above Green River
description:
Nice place overlooking Green River, 360 degree view, good cell service. 
Along the gravel are several similar places like this, easy access.

name: River Access Campsite on the Hoh
description: This is not on the road, but you can clearly hear 101 traffic. Too close to the road for my tastes for all day/overnight but has great access to the river and great ATT service so was a nice spot to pull of to enjoy the river for a bit (where you cannot hear the road). Would easily make a great overnight spot if the road noise doesn’t bother you. Large enough space for any vehicle/multiple vehicles. Fire ring.

name: Higinbotham Park
description:
Parked here overnight from 7pm-1pm. Signs posted stating “All night parking beginning after 6pm”. Not the nicest neighborhood with the police station around the corner - expect a little noise. Was quite between 12am-8am. 

Me and my partner cooked dinner on our propane stove in the parking lot next to our RV while the sunset. I also did morning yoga in the parking lot. Cops drove by and didn’t give us any issues

name: Nash St Public Access 17
description: Two outside showers and portapotty near the springmaid pier.

name: street parking
description: This was my spot, pretty dark and away from many houses. Ogallala is chock full of wide streets with overnight parking allowed, and is super quiet.

name: Lost Resort Campground and Cabins
description: A little on the pricey side, and more of a lawn approach vs. the woody that I would consider more appropriate for the setting, but this is a nice option if Ozette Campground is full (the website says they haven't turned anyone away in 20 years).  They also have 3 cabins. No wifi.

name: Patoka Lake Wild Camping
description: Paved road leading to a boat launch.  Space for a couple small vehicles if needed, otherwise nice little pull off.  There is a trail on the back of the site that leads down to the water.  There is some road traffic during the day (boaters in/out).  No bars with T-mobile.

name: Sunrise Point Lookout & Rest
description: Excellent spot to catch Sunrise & Sunset.  NP Rangers here let you stay overnight for a few days.  safe, quiet, friendly

name: Little Carr Lake
description: Rustic quiet paved road room for RV. If you have a canoe or kayak you can walk them down a short walk to the lake. I have two bars on my cellphone

name: Off of 164
description:
On the Fox River a small turnaround with space for small rigs, tents etc
No water no toilets no facilities but a nice place to stop overnight

name: Its a rustic spot. No services but a beautiful spot for small rigs tents etc no water no facilities but a great overnight
description:
you can launch kayaks 
Picnic tables 
Very peaceful just off a busy road

name: Fred Meyer Free Potable Water
description: Free city water next to the air pump station. Just checked with the attendant and all is well and water is clean and free.

name: Rest area with outhouse
description: Rest area with outhouse and information on the area

name: Al Griffin Memorial Park
description:
A small grassy park with a creek behind some houses.
An established camp area run by the small town of Bay City. It uses an honesty box for the fee. Has a wet toilet, potable water , fire rings with picnic tables & is dog friendly. Limited sites, big rig & tent friendly. It is not bookable, so first come, first served.

name: Hidden spot in the forest, easy access
description:
Very nice spot, just us and the trees. very quiet. some trash in the ground but it is ok, even with dogs. very exposed to wind, we were a bit shaked in our truck camper xD.
a fire ring is available. only accessible with truck camper, no room for a trailer, or maybe a very small one. Some other spots could be more welcoming for trailer farther on the gravel road. full LTE
we stayed 2 nights there !

name: Gibraltar Rock Park
description:
Gibraltar Rock
Cty Hwy V Lodi, WI
43.348635,-89.600340


Gibraltar Rock on Cty V. is a steep hike up to a scenic overlook and access to a section of the Ice Age National Trail. The East lot is small and gets pretty busy on weekends. It's not very level or much room to turn around. This lot has a shorter mostly paved road up to the bluff.

There's another west lot on V signed Ice Age Trail at  43.344574,-89.610340 This lot may be less busy and may be easier to turn around in if needed. Lot is fairly level. Neither lot is good for large/long vehicles/trailers. Cty V is narrow with no real shoulder so no real roadside parking.

AT&T signal is 5g and good here but internet is slow at 5Mb Down and .5Mb up in the lot.

name: Pullout Near Lighthouse
description: Large pullout on side of road near lighthouse that has no signs. Flat. Paved. No signal. There will be road noise.

name: Centennial Lake boat launch
description: Boat launch clearing with circle turnaround. We parked on grass next to established fire pit. Rainy weekday and saw no one. No Verizon service or pit toilet.

name: Merrimac Ice Age Trail lot
description:
Merrimac Ice Age Trail Lot
Cemetery Rd, Merrimac, WI 53561
43.3858784, -89.6432887

Rather small lot but manageable. No prohibiting signage. Lot is kinda sloped higher to North lower at south but a little bit even on south end about 1 car wide

AT&T internet is ok here but not great at 16Mb down and 5Mb up

name: Firehole NRA Dispersed - Beachside
description:
Okay, it’s a rocky beach, but this spot is incredible and quiet. Go past the NFS campsite and keep going. The road is fairly easy. It was washboard when we went, but nothing that any camper/car could not do at relative speed. 
Lots of place to setup. You may need some help from some rocks or wood blocks to get level. Some rock fire pits around. Super quiet.

name: Holiday Gas Dump Station
description:
Siren 
Holiday Gas Station 
24096 WI-35, Siren, WI 54872 
Phn 715-349-2410
45.788087,-92.380275
FREE as of Aug 2022, 24/7 access and store, No water Not great access probably best off Main St entrance 
Cashier said end of building sidewalk look for yellow paint. Back Corner of building near pumps(white rectangle on Satellite view)
Should be yellow X
https://www.rvdumps.com/wisconsin

name: Mobil Lucky Seven General Store
description:
Mobil- Lucky Seven General Store and Truck Stop
1030 W Hokah St, Minong, WI 54859
Phn 715-368-2436
46.1008882, -91.8390600
Fee- $5 stop in and get key
Hours 5am-10pm

On Satellite view Dump Station is on edge of lot opposite Diesel pumps. Employee claimed it's not there it's on diesel side of building back farther. Didn't sound real sure of location. Lot is huge and used by truckers for overnight. Does appear to be water

name: Colorado Vitner’s - Harvest Host
description: Great place to stay through Harvest Host - Winery with great parking area. It is near a road and train track, but the people are nice and the wine is good.

name: El Dorado State Lake
description: Reservoir in central Kansas lots of activities and close to town

name: Land Between the Lakes Recreational Area
description: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING and AMAZING!

name: Street parking on Stockton Dr
description: Street parking, no restrictions, pretty quiet at night. No public restrooms. Little pond near by. 5-7 min walk to Lake Michigan, which is a perfect sunrise spot. There’s unestablished dog park (a lot of people gathering in the same spot and let their dogs run off leash). Kids playground. Coffee shop two minutes away on Diversey Pkwy if need wifi.

name: Montana State University Library
description:
Montana State University Library
Or Renne Library 

Nice, quiet work place with free wi-fi. Open to public M-F 7-9, Sat Sun 10-5. They didn’t ask for ID or anything when I came in, you can use their study rooms on first and third floors if need quite and private space. Not sure about parking, I think you might need a permit. I happen to meet security outside so they made an exception and said I can park there. 
Clean restrooms, drinking water. 
In the summer it was empty here.

name: side of the road between Pismo Beach and RR track
description: there's a wide area of the road with plenty of space for all sizes of rigs. walk over to the beach thru the monarch Grove

name: Priest lake vista
description: Dispersed site off logging road with great views of priest lake. There are several dispersed sites along the road, all of which look nice.

name: New harbor showers
description: New showers in valdez. Go to the other shower location. Or use “harbor masters office”. As a search in google maps. You must go there first to get tokens. Then drive to this location for the nice clean new showers. 4 tokens per shower. 1$ a token.  There are 3 shower rooms with toilets. And two toilet only rooms.

name: Mouth of Salmon River
description: At the mouth of the Salmon River. Several large flat spots with incredible views of surrounding mountains. Take Main Street out of town and make right just before the dump. Road is gravel with potholes but flat and wide and should be no problem for 2WD.

name: Petro Truck Stop Shower
description: Nice and clean hot shower. Abundance of flowing water! $17 total. Saw several RVs parked overnight in the parking lot.

name: roadside parking area
description: conservation parking lot, room for about 4 vans.  beautiful view and only a couple of miles to the lighthouse.

name: Small Lot Bayside
description:
Pretty good spot for a night. Well lit so we felt safe. You got the pond on one side and the bay on the other.

Stayed here on a Saturday night so it was a bit busy until around midnight since there are some restaurants close by. Spots in the lot didn't open up in the lot until after 10, so don't expect to come here early and get the prime spot. This spot felt much better than some of the alternatives we scoped out. 

Be safe, keep it clean and stay free fam

name: Bayside Dreams
description:
Feel like staying somewhere safe, quiet and on the ocean? Look no further than this spot, humbly offered to you for free. It is only asked that you be respectful and courteous to enjoy this spot. You could probably even stay for a couple nights if you so desired!

It seems to be a place that people leave their cars overnight too, possibly for voyages out to sea. So you can blend right in with no concerns! There are some residencies nearby as well. I met one of them, a sea captain actually, and she was very welcoming. There's also a Cafe, which supposedly has great breakfast sandwiches. I think I'll go try it out.

There are also Porta potties at the time of writing.

name: Abandoned ROSS parking lot
description: The parking lot between the shut down Payless and Safeway. We park here pretty much every other night or so since I work in the area. Pretty bright overall and has some highway noise

name: glen cove camp site
description: 4wd with clearance needed to reach this little camp spot on the water. we took a little trail,( with no markings), off of the main orv trail. on the water with a rocky beach area, this spot is about 5 min walk down the shore to the  sandy glen cove beach. was here on a busy Friday and no one came down the little Trail to our site, but some people walked by along the shore but overall pretty secluded.

name: lake side pull off
description: site on schlatter lake off of high Rock bay road, open area with primitive fire ring and acces to lake down steep trail. high clearance recommended, 30 mins from town and 15 minutes to lake superior. lots of flies and mosquitos. can fit a couple cars or a smaller rv.

name: hiking trail / camping
description:
little hiking area with a small parking area. camping is allowed in the trail area so no one notices your sleeping in your car/van or small RV. 

not enough to for a big rig.

flat and level parking area right off the street, pretty quiet at night.

name: L’Anse Township Park and campground
description:
Nice campground with views of Lake Superior. Showers, water, electricity. 
Tent camping is $15 a night and $26 for everything else. 4 miles from downtown.

name: Bear Brook State Park - Beaver Pond Campground
description: Nice campground in beautiful wooded setting.  All spaces have fire ring and picnic table.  Only space 48 has power.  Quarter operated showers.  $1/5minutes and up.   $31.50/$41.50 for power.  Reserve on RESERVEAMERICA.COM.  2-3 bars cell service.

name: Crane Prairie Campground
description: NFS Campground on shore of Crane Prairie Reservoir

name: 4x4 pull offs nice trail
description: Fairly easy 4x4 trail with several nice pullout for camping

name: old collapsed mine shaft
description: small rough spur, make sure your 4x4 is capable, our 4runner did fine. spur dead ends by an old mine something or other. Decent verizon service

name: Crystal Forrest free campground.
description: Free campground outside the southern entrance to petrified national Forrest national park. Sign says clean restrooms, looks like a decent spot, hikes and par are worth it. park is dog friendly!!

name: ATT Free Wi-Fi Coldfoot
description: Open Wi-Fi network "WlanVPN" at the ATT station with green fuel tank and huts just west of the cell tower, along the north entrance to Coldfoot from the main road.

name: Walmart
description: Springville Walmart. I called and asked if I could park overnight - they said yes, to park towards the bank. Relatively quiet night.

name: Reeves Meadow Visitor Center
description: Parking lot of the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center. We asked and were told that parking is allowed 24/7. The restrooms are open 8 am to 5 pm. People start showing up to hike the trails early in the morning, but it was a safe, quiet night with no disturbances.

name: Ekalaka Campground
description: Free campground in the Custer National Forest. Several established sites with picnic tables, fire pits, and a pit toilet in the middle of the campground. Very remote and quiet, it takes you down a pretty well maintained gravel road 6 miles into the forest. You will drive by free ranging cattle, maybe on the road, but none by the campsites. Absolutely beautiful and well maintained campground, worth the drive.

name: Stellar Coffee Co
description: Great coffee and veggie egg cup. Good work environment inside and out. Although mosquitos were bad in august.

name: West Valley Granger Community Dump Station
description: At public works building. please be clean. Site closes after 6pm.

name: Forest Service Road
description: The road passes several houses and eventually turns into a forest service road. We didn't explore too much but found several decent pull outs and one small side road that went to a nice parking area. Some trash laying around is to be expected. Also lots of low branches. Our vehicle with paddle boards on it is about 11 feet and we barely made it.

name: Fairgrounds Park
description:
I haven’t slept overnight here but I don’t see any signs posted saying you can’t. The pavilions have power to charge fans/phones/computers and the park has many hose spicket locations. I’m thinking of hooking up my hose and filling my fresh water tank. 

The park itself is beautiful with a pool, basketball court and river in sight. I’ve been parking here to spend time outside during the day while I cook my food and charge my devices

name: Murphys General Store
description: Machine to fill up water outside the main doors. Pay inside

name: Uhaul of Thornton
description: Moving and storage facility. Easy transaction... just like all the uhaul locations, basically.

name: First pull-off from Andy Creek
description:
Nice little pull-off with fire ring. It was the first one I saw coming from Sandlake Rd. When the dirt road splits, go left, and then the pull-off is just a bit ahead on the right. 
The road had some potholes but totally manageable for any car as of today!

name: San Juan NF #529
description: Campsite on the right hand side off of NF road #529. A cleared area among tall Ponderosa pines, established fire ring. No cell service.

name: Fox Creek Campground
description: National Forest Service camp. Located on the Entiat River. No reservations needed. 16 campsites, vault toilets, potable water with hand pump. Pets allowed.

name: creek side camping
description: perfect spot for kids right next to the water. it's right beside a gravel road but it has minimal traffic maybe 0ne car every hour if that. our dog ran off leash with no issues which says alot. but for the love of God no glass bottles respect others and pick up your crap.

name: Aerie Crag Day Use
description: Parking overnight $19. No fires, no tents, no water, no toilet, but a legal parking spot. Plenty of parking. May use paid showers at Inyo National Forest Campground 1 mile down the road. Closed Winter

name: Inyo National Forest Drinking Water Fill Station
description: Water fill about 1 mile up on 120 out of Lee Vining. past the Mobile station.  Look for the water buckett icon sign.

name: Bridger Peak Road
description: Large parking area which has been used for decades by RVs and campers.

name: Sundance Laundry
description: This is an awesome laundromat with plenty of laundry machines, power outlets, and Wi-Fi. It is a standard retail parking lot so it would not be great for a Class A or an oversized trailer. They also sell water from one of those coin operated machines.

name: Parking Lot Beside Atigun River
description: Large,  mostly flat parking lot just south of a bridge over the Atigun River with good Verizon cell service and a view of Mount Kiev. Near Atigun Lake. No signs,  amenities or gates. Road noise is high.

name: Site 19
description:
This site is not level, but it has a path right off it, so if you have a pet this is a great site. Across the street is 2 more sites, and closer to the trail there sites 22 and 23, that's it. You'll come to the trailhead and the parking area is a loop, so if you need to turn around, then that's your place. No camping at trailhead. We made it in our 2wd Promaster. Some areas very rutted and big holes, just gotta take it easy, and know your rig is gonna be shaking.
Also buggy this time of year.

name: Constitution Park
description: Quiet and scenic overnight Parking - Next to Marina and MGH admin buildings. We paid $18.

name: dirt road
description: Dirt road, appears to be a forest service road. Just within the first mile or so are many nice turn outs and spur roads.

name: Elevation Spa
description: Not cheap, but $25 day pass to their spa gives access to gym, showers, steam room, swimming pool, hot tubs. or $50 for a week pass

name: Lizton Rest Area
description: Boondocker’s Bible lists rest areas in Indiana where camping is prohibited. This one is not on the list. I confirmed with the restroom attendant that camping is not prohibited and there are no signs prohibiting camping. Nice covered area for bbq which I used to setup my cot. Clean & green.

name: Carmel valley dog park
description: Had a pleasant stay in my camper. Got there at about 11 pm no disturbances throughout the night. There are bathrooms nearby with sinks. Plenty of parking. Just be aware of dog owners getting up early to walk their pets. I noticed people starting to come around 6:30 in the morning.

name: another entrance to facilities
description: I was able to park in the visitor center parking,  walk into the camping area to get tokens Anna use the showers right by the parking area

name: tourist Information free wifi
description: only in the building, no password, fast enough for book and Magazin download

name: Charbonneau Park on 124 near Pasco Washington
description: Army Corps of Engineers park with a couple dozen sites. Mowed green grass, trees, on lake Sacajawea part of the Snake River. Min for overnight no connections, $30, $15 seniors. I didn't need the fancy stuff so I didn't stay. There are lots of trees and many yachts moored next to the grass over in the marina. It's a nice place. 3 bars Verizon. Update: I'm too used to doondocking free that I didn't see this good value. Free showers, clean and spacious grounds, flush toilets, hosts, and security, for $15. I couldn't find anything better so I staying tonight.

name: 3447 Train Track Oasis
description: Flat gravel pull out next to the train tracks. A few trains did passed by during the night. Otherwise quiet and peaceful. Four bars of AT&T 4G and 2 bars Verizon LTE. Enough space to turn around a big rig. #SlackerVan

name: Roadside park
description:
Two flat gravel areas near an intersection. Good enough for sleeping for the night. Has a ‘no turn around for trucks’ signs. But big enough to accommodate medium size rigs. 

At&t and Verison signal

name: Kassel’s Artisan Well
description:
There is a natural artisan water well behind the gas station (Basil Rd side). Locals say is the best water in town. Mainly used to fill containers. We used our pump and a long hose to directly fill our water tank. 

No hose bib or spigot.

name: Old Indian Ford Campground
description:
Formerly part of USFS's Indian Ford Campground; now fee-free dispersed camping. The section east of the creek has been abandoned by the Forest Service, but there are still well-delineated campsites, intact picnic tables, and a double pit toilet. (Bring your own toilet paper.)

Cell phone coverage is decent. Highway noise is present.

name: Level pullout, nice views
description: Level spot nice views, no giant Mountain View but you can see the hill surrounding

name: Rest Area near Pine Bluffs
description: A small rest area. No signs about limited hours of stay. Clean bathrooms. Water available.

name: Vinton Laudromat
description: This is a great place to wash clothes!  The employee was super nice, the place was very clean, and the washers/driers worked fantastic!

name: Jones Pass Summit
description:
The summit of Jones Pass. Stayed here for a night, multiple other campervans as well. Road noise was ‘okay’, just ran a sound machine and parked further away from the road. 

No signs saying you couldn’t camp overnight, it is in the national forest. 

Level spots within parking lot. 

Full AT&T and T-Mobile service - worked awhile while sitting here.

name: Montana Dot Rest Stop - Jefferson City
description: Decent little rest stop. Decent bathrooms, plenty of parking spots. Slept in the middle by an island with big tree!  Road noise was tolerable, slept great!

name: Lemhi Hole Fishing Access
description: Great place to camp. Open gravel lot with pit toilets. Easy access to fishing on the river. Even has tent spots available

name: Sleeping Ute Mountain Rest area
description: Rest stop off highway 160. Plenty of overnight parking for cars/vans/trucks. Some highway noise but we had a great night sleep. Heated and clean bathrooms. Two bars ATT and Verizon.

name: Street parking Balboa Park
description: Street parking on sixth street right next to balboa park and close to downtown. No parking 7am to 10am on Wednesdays. Spent 1 night with no issues. Busy street during the day but relatively quiet night. Park toilets nearby

name: Dubay County Campground
description: Nice little county campground on the river. Sites with fire rings. No electric costs 20.00. Firewood is 5.00. Decent space between spots. Reservations have to be made more than 7 days in advance. However, walk inside are fine. There’s a camp host that’s super helpful. Just drive the loops and pick a spot that’s not reserved for the day you are camping. Showers and bathrooms on site. AT&T works fine. Pets allowed.

name: Visitor center
description: Got to the park around 9 PM and nobody was. At the booth. There’s no gate, so I drove in to check if there’s was anyone at the camping, but there wasn’t. There were lots of open spots but the sign said FULL at the entrance, so I didn’t want to occupy one. Drove back to the visitor center parking and saw a couple of employees who were divided between letting me stay or not. One said others had camped here before, so I stayed. No issues…

name: Open gravel field next to the road
description:
There is an open gravel field (not completely level, but some quite level spots) between Kayenta and Monument Valley. Nice place for one night. Some road noise, but it dies down during the night.
There is an old picknick bench next to it and no ‘no camping’ sign. The views are nice, unfortunately there is there is some rubbish.

name: horseshoe lake
description: i cannot see any NO signs 20 m away on a big field some noise from highway and train but for me quote comfortable for one night and swimming at daytime

name: Fresh Spring
description: Fresh spring off of Vanocker Canyon Rd. Not sure if it’s tested, but locals use it often. Takes seconds to fill a gallon, tastes so good I’m not sure if I should drink or eat it.

name: Walmart
description: I called ahead and overnight is permitted at the small lot near the gas station. The highway runs along side of the lot so expect noise.

name: Root River Trail Parking
description: Parking outside of Lanesboro downtown. Big open lot overlooking pond. Porta potties and good cell service ATT & Verizon 4 bars. Cute town. Stayed for 1 night no issues.

name: Rest area in front of the established campground
description: Two large parking lots with bathrooms and garbage drops. It is located in between the Hwy 26 and the state park campground. Day use only for a rest before getting back on the road. Signs say no overnight parking. One bar Version. Large enough for big rigs. The state park campground is $20 a night.

name: roadside pull out
description: fairly flat pullout at corner of 666 and 449. nothing special just a place to park for the night. no at&t service, a couple few bars of verizon service could work for a tent. I am in my 34' converted school bus. road was good coming in.

name: ATT Free Wi-Fi South of Yukon
description: Open Wi-Fi network "WlanVPN" at the ATT station with green fuel tank and two huts down a short driveway southwest from the Dalton Highway. Free and usable from inside a vehicle in the driveway.

name: Lamont  Reservoir
description: Space along the road rimming the reservoir with room for a few smaller rigs and vans. Not appropriate for larger rigs. Beautiful view of the reservoir.  We stayed one night and enjoyed the peace and quiet. Went for a swim in the crystal clear water before we headed out.

name: Parking behind fence with security
description: Safe parking spot for 10$/day. No overnight parking possible

name: ATT Free Wi-Fi North of Chandalar Shelf
description: Open Wi-Fi network "WlanVPN" at the ATT station with green fuel tank and two huts down a short driveway west from the Dalton Highway, separate from and north of a small pipeline facility. Free and usable from inside a vehicle in the driveway.

name: Big Springs Laundry
description: Clean place. Friendly families here. Lots of $2 machines.

name: Forest service road 7400
description: You have to drive in a bit before it officially turns into Forest road but there is lot of camping here and close to the national park. Lots of preexisting fire rings and ability for many kinds of rigs. The place we stayed at was at the end of a road and I wouldn’t attempt it in anything larger than a small truck as the turn around is barely anything. But a good quite area to spend a few days

name: Picnic area west bound I10
description:
Nice very large picnic area in the hill country. Lots of trees. Was quiet during the day. 

2 bars ATT

name: The Krafty Kup
description: Cozy coffee shop with cups of salad, yogurts, and other snacks. Nice sofa for lounging. One table with an outlet. Backyard patio that maybe open. Great spot

name: Ship Creek RV Park
description: Locate near downtown Anchorage. Next to railroad track & industrial area. However, it's small, cozy with trees with bluffs on one side. Restrooms very clean & showers are hot, included in fees. All sites have hull hook up.  There are laundry facilities for reasonable fee. Manager is friendly & works hard (hasn't had a day off in 2 months). Nice to be able to walk downtown & get right onto bike paths. Does have tent sites. No dump station as every RV site has full hookup.

name: Sand Dunes Campground Dump
description: Dump and water in day use area north of the campground. $10 self pay fee.

name: Sand Dunes Campground Dump
description: Dump and water in day use area north of the campground. $10 self pay fee for dump.

name: 5 star resort, Free!
description:
This is basically a 5 star resort, but for van lifers. Seems to be a very welcoming place for us overlanding folk, as there were quite a few other vehicles here over night. They also could be here for overnight water activities.

Was originally planning on going to the boat ramp, which is probably a fine spot, but found these pullofs before hand that parks you right on the estuary.

And what a wonderful spot this is. Very private, you can have your own waterside view unobstructed. Lots of birelife on this fine morning, of many species big and small. Feels very safe as well, we kept the door open for a bit of the night.

As always, keep it clean, be happy and remain healthy! 🐒

name: William R. Logan Conservation Area
description: Free camping in the William R. Logan Conservation Area.  Several sites to choose from. There is a short dusty road to the campground, but the sites are shady and clean. Pit toilet. No water. Ok cell signal. We stayed one night without anybody else here.

name: Powerline Access Road
description: A great spot with beautiful views. Go up Thornton Lake road and take the first left. The road is small and somewhat over-gown. I highly suggest 4-wheel drive as it is at least 20% grade and loose gravel. At the end is a circle big enough to turn around in a truck or van, definitely too small for RVs or trailers. Beautiful views and very secluded! 2-4 bars of Verizon depending on weather!

name: Regency Bridge Park
description: Private campground and RV park on almost 5 acres on the bank of the Colorado River.  RV sites have Wi-Fi, 30 & 50 amp outlets, water, sewer hookups. Restroom with shower available to campers. River access. Large rentable special events facility with full-service kitchen.

name: Desonler State Nature Preserve
description: A small state nature preserve with two hiking trails, one of which leads to a high meadow.

name: Richland Furnace State Forest APV Area Parking Lot
description: This is a parking area for a state APV area. Large gravel parking lot with a shelter house and pit toilet. Situated alongside a quiet county road.

name: Vinton Forest Hunter’s Camp
description: An established hunter’s camp located in the Vinton Furnace State Forest. Located alongside a gravel forest road. Has a pit toilet.

name: Tuttletown Recreation Area Dump Station
description: I was told by a park ranger that this dump station was available. There is a fee to use this dump station. The Glory Hole dump station is closed and will be for over a year according to the ranger.

name: S-Tree NF Campground
description: Free established campground with about 10 sites in Daniel Boone NF. Some service from T Mobile, picnic tables, fire ring and pit toilets. Great spot!

name: Kentucky Horse Park Campground
description: Huge campground with options!  Full hookups, partial hookups and primitive. All have access to bathrooms with hot showers. Great place!

name: Rock Creek Campground
description: This is an odd little campground situated within Obed Wild and scenic river area. 11 sites and you have to book on line. No way to pay when you arrive, $10.  It's situated next to the Nemo bridge and near the Nemo tunnel. Sites are TINY and most appropriate for tent or maximum a truck size vehicle. NOT big rig friendly!  If you can fit, it's a nice little spot listening to the river all night. Pit toilet and trash cans. No cel service and no potable water available. I wouldn't even attempt to filter the river water. There is a sign at the picnic area stating not to eat the fish caught in the river.

name: San Bernardino National Forest
description: Seasonal wild camping spot just off the main trail. Not good in wet weather or snow.  Looks like it would take on some water.  Four wheel drive necessary, spotty cel service.

name: BLM Wild
description: BLM wild camping. Cel service is good quiet and clean. No fires allowed. Open range cattle and burros.  Large rocks on the road, four wheel drive needed.

name: NF 83 pullout
description: Nice spot right off of NF83, tucked in the trees, can see the road, but very little traffic, convenient for Lava Canyon, or Ape caves. It has a fire ring and room for two vehicles. decent signal

name: Bear track travel center
description:
We called ahead of time and they said that we can sleep in the parking lot around the back. One truck was there in addition to us. We had a quiet night. We didn't go in the store so are not sure about facilities. 
This is also the only gas station that we found in the area, and the price was much better than in St. Mary's. It was about a fifteen minute drive from the two medicine park entrance. We had reception (T mobile).

name: Burwell, NE
description: Nice little city park right on the river with four spots for RVs. I stayed overnight in a Sprinter van. You could probably get a tow vehicle and maybe like a 25 ft or something in here. Vheck the satellite view to see what you think. Really very pleasant.

name: Moffit's
description: Car/RV dealership with propane refill service.

name: Kwik Star
description: Per the store manager, overnight parking is allowed. Check in with the store clerks if it will be for more than one night.

name: truck pull off on side of rd
description: rather long strip that looks like a truck pull off on the right side of the road between green street sign and bridge cleared area beside it makes for a great view

name: All Day Parking Lot
description:
Right in downtown Wolfville

The sign at the front says:
All Day Parking
Overnight Parking Permitted
Owner assumes all risk
Until further notice

Two Sprinters and a small tear drop trailer spent the night no problem.  Lots of other cars parked overnight.  Very quiet against the Bay and there is a lovely walking path, dogs allowed on leash.
We all had our windows open, but lights were off and all campers remained low-key.  I didn’t see a bathroom anywhere, but we have our own.  Please remain self-contained and do not come here if you cannot fit within a regular parking spot.

That means that if you use a generator, put out slides, set up chairs outside:  go to the nearby Walmart so you don’t ruin it for everyone else.

name: Ingebretson Park Campground
description: 20/30AMP service, newer playground equipment, short walk to disc golf course/picnic area, sites reasonably level, gravel pads, well-maintained park, nice bathroom w/shower, small dump station, water available, no reservation taken. Open spring, closes in fall, don't know dates. Only have 4G phones, unsure about 5G.  We arrived late at night.  The county worker came by early morning to collect fee.

name: Brevort Lake Campground
description: Beautiful little campground. Rustic, on little brevort lake. $20 a night. Verizon cell service available.

name: Elk River Camp & RV
description: Mostly RV park, however has many tenting and vehicle spots for overnight or long term. Some sites have pavilions and most have fire pits. Potable bathrooms and no showers but has water and electric, septic if needed. Owner is very nice and there is a phone number at the entrance to call if it’s after hours 24/7. Inexpensive and two miles off highway 79. Campground is on the Elk River which has many fishing spots and kayaking.

name: Walmart
description: Just thought I would put this on the iOverlander map for y’all

name: River spot
description: Nice stretch of a dirt pull-off right off a river. No signs for “no over-night camping”. Real quiet, just don’t go across the street because then it becomes private property.

name: Just outside Death Valley
description: Spent the night here, conveniently close to Death Valley, right before you enter the fee area  for the National park. There was a short RV, and a few vans parked along the way too and no one had any trouble. There are no signs preventing overnight camping, and seems no one cares. Decent view, and fairly nice dirt road had no trouble with our transit or low clearance car.

name: Oasis RV Resort
description: Great game room w/ AC, ping pong, pool, poker, puzzles, etc…easy to pull thru spots, lots of clean bathrooms and laundry facilities (bring quarters - $2 wash/$1.50 dry), small dog park, propane fill ups, gift shop, very close to Love’s gas station.

name: Green Box Recycling site
description: Recycling site including cardboard, paper, aluminium, metal, white goods and trash. No tin can, plastic or glass recycling that we could find.

name: Denali View North free camping for two-wheelers
description:
There are three free walk-in tent campsites here, each with a fire pit and a picnic table. Good for bicyclists or maybe other two wheel machines.

The trail back to the first site is flat and wide. The site appears to be maintained.

There are two more sites if you continue back on the trail, but the trail gets worse the farther back you go.

name: Sea Pines RV Resort & Campground
description: We spend a week per year here meeting with friends who are long term. Can be costly but fine if you book ahead. Nice bike trail that runs along the campground and goes pretty far down to Cape May.

name: Kaibab Forest
description: Easy to access, quiet, spacious, level. 10 out of 10. Good Verizon service.

name: bluebird | coffee | library | etcetera
description:
parking can be tough, but the beta is to use the free ramp just on the NW side

bluebird market has ice cream, coffee, an library, restaurants, game room and ice cream

great place to work w/ a co-working coming soon sign as well

name: VA741 Dispersed
description: Site with Fire Ring. Mnt Rogers Rec Area. Great spot within 2 miles to AT TrailHeads. Accessible for most vehicles.

name: Port of Dubuque
description: Large parking lot located next to Dubuque Star brewery and Riverwalk museum and Stone Cliff winery

name: Pilot
description: free water just in front of the store........

name: Joe T Fallini campground
description:
$14 per night. Water and electric. Paved roads so anything can come through. I didn’t count but maybe 20 sites. First come. It’s 9pm and several still open. Massive valley view with the cliffs on one side and the reservoir on the other. Water is low but still clean and cool and swimmable. Rocky shore. Toilets on site and a dump station.  Some sites have shade awnings, all have bbq pit and hook ups. Boat ramp with dock as well. 
Road is close but few cars and I honestly can’t hear it past the crickets. Swimmers paradise for your water logged doggie.  Was 82 degrees today. There is dispersed camping north on the bluffs over the lake. With 5-6 big rigs but didn’t stop to check it out. Roads looked fine for any rig, maybe a little narrow but open sage brush so go slow and your fine. 
Eva (my doggie) swam for 2 hours. Quiet and the mountains to the east are beautiful to gaze upon. A few Miles south and you can get prime rib in mackay, we didn’t go but it looked good.
Verizon has two bars but download speed hasn’t been an issue.

name: Walmart
description: Ended up at this Walmart after trying another spot that didn’t work out. The security was really nice and there were several others that were obviously staying a night or two. Lots of shade trees, shopping, and grass to spend a full day and night or two here!

name: Wal-Mart & Lowe's
description: basic Wal-Mart & Lowe's parking lot. only signs I see are the cameras in use signs. fairly quiet.

name: Kanuti River
description: Beautiful colors at this time of the year. Big parking and a boat ramp. No amenities. A sign explaining about the river and wildlife.

name: Exxon Dump Eureka
description: Dump station behind Exxon station with water spigot right next to it. Not potable, just rinsing.

name: Park N Go
description: This place was amazing! I was looking for a cute little mountain town just like this one. The parking is walking distance from a few cafes and a beer garden, sort of on the end of the "downtown" area. no one bothered us, more curious about the van and swapped van stories with us. It is labeled "free and rv parking" Perfect spot of solar, only a few trees around, enough to make the pup comfortable though. Highly recommend, we stayed here 3 nights. Beautiful views of Pikes Peak!

name: Small lot between DQ and BW
description: There's some small paved lots between Dairy Queen and Best Western that don't seem to belong to either. Stayed for a night along with random other cars and boat trailers parked. Didn't get bothered and no signs. Close to Safeway.

name: Lincoln Dog Park
description: Hose Bibb near western most gazebo. 30sec. walk.

name: Deep Creek Campground
description: Near flaming gorge, this is an undiscovered jewel. Plenty of free sites on the road in, but this campground is worth the extra miles. It’s on two creeks. There is a fee but twice now we’ve had the place to ourselves on a weekday. Pit toilets. No potable water and no trash. All the sites seem to be level. There are a few pull through sites.

name: City Park Rest Area
description: Parking lot next to park and tennis courts. Stayed a night with another van and some cars. Saw police drive by in the morning who didn't care. Can also park along Fairway Dr or in the Lodge Parking lot on the other side which is huge and mostly empty. There is a tiny sign by the bathrooms that overnight parking is not allowed but it doesn't seem to bother anyone and there's options in this same area.

name: Street Parking at Holiday Inn
description: The road to the Holiday Inn dead ends and has plenty of street parking. Saw a Skoolie one night. Pretty quiet and no one gets bothered. Close to all the shopping. No parking restrictions.

name: Bayview Park
description: Water spigot right next to parking area. Attached to a wooden post near the bathrooms. You can hook up your hose and fill your tank with a beautiful view of Lake superior.  Picture attached

name: Parking near Homewood Suites
description: Parking lot between Signature Stadium 14 and Homewood Suites is lit and has signs for no parking. However you're right next to the hotel and there are plenty of cars parked every night incl. trailers,  vans,  trucks etc. Easy to blend in. No security or police came by to check. Quiet.

name: Old Town Center Parking lot
description: Big lot at shopping center. No signs prohibiting parking. Stayed at the southern end away from most shopping and businesses. No issues. Plenty of cars parked overnight.

name: Castaic Sports Complex Aquatic Center
description: City Public Pool. Got a free shower for asking, has day passes if you want to swim. Water was warm with great pressure.

name: parking lot
description: Nice quiet parking lot. Nice trees. No one ever uses this parking lot.

name: The Fresh Market Parking Lot
description: parking lot for many stores. no one bothers you

name: leasing office. only Friday or Saturday night.
description: Very quite really nice spot. leasing office is closed on the weekend. very hidden and dark.

name: Cedarville public water
description: Free water from a well in cedarville right across from the boat launch.

name: Fargo Downtown Library
description:
Large parking lot east of the library and adjacent to City Hall. Sign in parking lot says, "Open to public 9:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m." Daytime hours City Hall and Library visitors only. Quiet at night but traffic starts about 6:00 a.m.

WIFI available near Library.
Strong 5G cell service

name: Quiet and level
description: Was looking for another site but google maps took me down the wrong road! This one is quiet and pretty - I arrived last night around 7p and it’s now 10am, haven’t seen anyone at all. It’s quite a drive down forest service roads - my van made it but definitely had to squeeze through overgrown bushes a few times. Lots of potholes but I think any vehicle under 20’ should make it up here fine. 2 bars of Verizon LTE, more with my cell booster. Not a lot of places to turn around up here so be careful where you choose to go! Definitely no big rigs, RVs. My camper van is the biggest thing I think should try to get up here.

name: Manzana Trailhead
description:
Trailhead and parking slot, beautiful open view to Mt. Hood, big rigs and tent friendly.

Sharing a drop from your beer, wine or soda  with Robert Behrman will get you a quit night.

name: Publix
description: so I wasn't even planning on staying here but then my car broke down. I noticed that there was a typical vanlife sprinter van here so I thought I would take a chance. I've been here for a week now and never any problems. I've seen semi trucks stay here, some sprinter vans. it's a strip mall that has a Publix and a McDonald's. both nice places to sit, eat, and charge devices. both have good WiFi for computer stuff and quick downloads. there is a planet fitness here for showers if you have a membership. there is a bus stop that goes downtown kinda a long ride tho. many restaurants nearby. great place 👍

name: Hart Ranch Camping Resort Club
description: Massive place with nearly 500 sites.  Fifteen minutes from Rapid City.  Zero road noise; no trains.  Playgrounds, golf course, tennis courts, club room in which to relax.  Gas station, convenience store,.  Green and grassy with lots of trees, if little shade,  No privacy, but green grass between each site, each site with level concrete pad and picnic table.  So-so WiFi.  Poor signal on Google Fi.  Propane or charcoal fires only.  Scheduled activities.  Clean facilities, all sites with full hookups (50a).  Expensive.  $79 for a back-in site that could easily accommodate a 40' trailer with tow vehicle.

name: Toutle River South Bound
description: South bound rest area. Washrooms, vending machines. Plenty of parking spots. Seems a little less busy than north bound. Water fountain works, but none of the taps do. Good Verizon signal. No camping, but ok to stay for 8 hours in your car, van or RV

name: East West Express Trail Old Scenic Viewpoint
description: Just off the highway, large loop with multiple places to park. Old and overgrown/abused(full of garbage) pit toilets. No signs prohibiting overnight camping. Good for dry camping only. 3 bars of AT&T. I can hear the highway from back of loop but cannot see it.

name: Train station/public parking lot.
description: Durango is not RV friendly. No street parking between 2am & 5am. This public parking is open all day. In the back,  it's for the Durango / Leviston train ride. If you leave your rig there, it's $10/car or $15/RV. Got here the night before, late, paid $15 in the morning, went for the train ride during the day, slept a second night but left at 6am the morning after. So, $15 for 2 nights, it's reasonable. Wanted to park there the next night but security guy came to me at 9pm and told me I wasn't allowed to park overnight. If you pay the $15 fee, before the booth closes, I wonder if they would let you stay overnight,  I didn't ask.

name: Coldfoot
description: Paid 7.49 for diesel today. Two bucks more than Fairbanks… You got to leave your card in, and then come back to pay after fueling.

name: View from top of the hill
description: Tu is is a superb view from a spot you can access with your rig, but you have to backward. No space to turn around and it’s all cliffs on all sides. I’m doubt, park on the main entrance right off the highway.

name: Malibu Library public wifi
description: public library wifi available after hours and accessible from the parking lot.

name: Montrose-San Juan RV Resort
description: Nice campground on Highway 550. They have campsites, RV spots and cabins available. The place is clean and there is a shuffleboard court and a small basketball court. Highway noise. Running water and a nice shower room with electricity for drying hair. Laundromat too.

name: Albee Creek Campground SP
description: Beautiful established State Park campground nestled between second growth Redwood forest with flush toilets, quarter operated hot showers, picnic tables, fire rings and treated water. Open mid-May through mid-October - Cost $35 per night!

name: Pullout on Skyland Rd
description: Nice pullout on Skyland Rd, off the busy Hwy2. Stayed one night. No traffic whatsoever. Stayed with a small van, would fit smaller RVs. Not entirely level.

name: Roosevelt lake overlook
description:
Amazing view on Roosevelt lake.
Quiet. Flat. Fire pit near the cliff. Watching the sunset from here is great. 3 bars AT&T.

name: Dominguez Campground
description: Very beautiful canyon and campground trees and creek. Gravel road in good shape made in with two wheel drive car.

name: Holiday Gas Station
description: Water spigot here. I filled RV after fill up. They said it was OK after I asked.

name: Spring Creek Vista
description: One very large flat area with plenty of sun with the back to a mountain and trees, and another spot more secluded in the trees for smaller rigs and more off camber. Great views, and a small babbling brook about 30 ft away at this time of year. FYI the reservoir is drained so the wild camping to the north of that is not so picturesque. Several large established fire pits. Picture added of the empty reservoir.

name: Forest Road 651N
description: At the end of FR651N, room to park 3 small vehicles. Almost flat. No traffic. Cool temperature during summer. 4 bars LTE AT&T

name: North Gorge Campground
description: Small cg on the fabulous Columbia River. Tables, fire-pits and paved sites. Many on the water. Boat launch. Reservations required. Beautiful spot! $23 night, 1/2 with a pass.

name: Pull offs along 3A
description: Many beautiful pull offs along Kootenay  Lake for smaller vans. Beautiful views and shade.

name: Hwy 3A rest stop
description: Great, large, free,  rest spot overlooking the lake with water and mountain views.  No ‘NO’ signs. Not much road noise, clean surroundings but the trash bins have not been emptied for awhile so if you arrive with this situation, please pack it out. No place to set up a tent. Spectacular spot for an overnighter. We love Canada!

name: 4-20 Wycliff Conservation parking lot
description: Small, gravel parking lot in habitat location  maintained by government Wildlife Mgt. Unit. Shady and remote, impeccably clean. Pack it out, please. Some distant road noise. Next to Wycliffe Butte hiking trail and across from Northstar rails to trails path.  One night limit should be enough. Do not overstay.

name: Kettle Falls Campground
description: Kettle Falls Campground has 70 sites in a forest location on the side of Lake Roosevelt.  My site was right on the river (loop 3, 66). It cost $23 a night and on a Weds night before labor day there were plenty of spaces.  Easy to find and easy access.  T-mobile 5G was blazing fast.   I usually look for free camping and drove to the Walmart in Colville first and didn't see a single overnighter and there was a cop in the lot at 10pm so I didn't bother to ask and headed here.  Happy I did. Well worth the $23

name: Horsfall Beach Sand Camping
description: This is a site in the dunes that must be reserved and there is a small fee to stay here $18). It is a fun drive through the sand dune trails to get here, recommend 4x4 and airing down. You can access the beach for exploration but can’t camp there. There is frequent ATV use on the trails through the dunes but that dies down after dark. 2 bars AT&T.

name: Bewicke Ave
description: Good parking spot at the end of a residential street. The road is no outlet so there is no through traffic. End of the road is a large wall of trees. Park there.

name: Roadside shelters
description: A few retro pavilions next to river. Great for one night. No amenities. Pack it out, please.

name: 10 Mile Sno-park
description: 4 miles past the 6-mile sno-park. This one is much bigger. Many trails leading off the asphalt lot. The lot itself is a U shape.  Easy in and out. Adjacent to main road, but noise is mostly blocked by lots of tall pines. Also, very little traffic after dark. Beautiful, dark night skies. Could see the Milky Way. Pit toilet. I stayed 3 nights. Two nights someone else showed up to spend the night, the last night I was there alone. So easy and comfortable. Good Verizon signal.  You need permits during the winter months, but not in the summer

name: A ways up but very quiet!
description: Kept driving up this road til I found a level pull out. There’s plenty of places to park on the side of the road on the way up. Narrow in places but passable by anything 20’ and under I’d imagine. Blazing fast Verizon at this spot. Room for a couple vehicles, not more. Good for a night or two. Nice views across the valley.

name: Cedar pass
description: Beautiful but crowded.  No level spot. Not bad for rv’s

name: Picnic area north bound
description: Covered picnic tables. No bathrooms. Nice stop.

name: Wal-Mart
description: typical Walmart,  there are a lot of other people parked here. 18 wheelers, van lifers, RV or two, even a couple cars.

name: McGruff Park
description: Public park that is open 24hrs. Bathrooms close by 8pm and open at 7am. Parked overnight and was alone. There were plug ins by the dumpster for regular outlets. I was able to charge my BLUETTI with no issue. Trash comes Tuesday so don’t black the dumpster. Keep it clean and quiet and I think this could be a great spot for car/van stealth camping.

name: Near lovers point
description: This area has signs posted - 2 hour limit between 9am -6pm - no other restrictions.  It’s right next to the water.  You can hear the waves and barking seals.  It’s residential so stealth is key.  I pulled in at 10pm - Super quite - light traffic.

name: Alder Lake Campground
description: Showers at the group sites. I’m not staying at the campground. Just stopped to use their dump station and asked about their showers. Quarter operated. No change machine but they will give you change at the gate. $1 gives you 12 minutes

name: Cracker Barrel
description:
This right off the expressway 
You do have road noise 
So internet from cb but slow

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store.  Rocky Top, TN
description: Quiet overnight RV parking behind the Restaurant.  Called ahead and asked permission to stay.  We are 30 ft. and a small toad, just fit.  About 7 spaces available.  Only one other campers all night

name: dumping and water free
description: Nice dumping with drinking water and garbage  for free

name: Ed Carlson Memorial Field
description: Water spout next to old airplane with tail number N62AB/Airport Office

name: Truck Stop
description: A large gravel lot next to a gas station. There is a small sign that says 'local trucks only', but the server at Subway told us that cars/campers can also park here overnight. Good T-mobile reception. Will update in the morning.

name: Ramp road park
description: Park where fisherman’s arrive early in the morning. Quiet at night.

name: Kamar-Taj
description:
Owner Nomad Green Welcomes Family,
         Please practice patients and empathy for the community. Spaces outside fence are available for parking, Services situation dependent.
    Kind Regards,
           Green

name: Spring Creek Welcme Center
description:
Interstate Rest area 
Restrooms are clean but the water is a brownish yellow

name: S & L automotive
description: very good diesel mechanic. my 21 ft short bus (Ford 6.0 powerstroke) broke down at the base of the canyon on hwy 6 and S&L got it looked at and fixed the next day. I'm so grateful to the entire shop, but shout out to the owner James who explained the systems that were failing and how they interacted with other systems in the bus. I'm so relieved that we were able to make it home, and it's all thanks to S&L auto!

name: Tioga Dam Fish & Wildlife lake
description: Great spot beside Tioga lake. 2 picnic pavilions, no pit toilets or trash bins. Quiet and away from roads at night. Loud traffic noise in AM. Nice sunsets and birds on the lake. In fact, there are other sites around this lake to stay!

name: ORV Park Wild Camping
description: Big ORV park with lots of space for camping. We asked a local if the land was private and he said it’s public and free to camp on! Lots of oil rigs near by, but noise was minimal at night. Only noise on the evening was from the dirt bikes and side by sides.

name: Highway pull out near Drummond
description: When heading west on i90, take exit for Drummond. Turn right at the stop sign and a dirt pull out is up the dead end on the right. Good for one night and fits one vehicle.

name: Moscow Recreation Park
description: Large parking lot next to beach volley fields. Very private. Dogs are welcome and have space to run freely. Nice mountains view and surrounded by trees.

name: Traihead Parking outside
description:
outside the Gates. 
Very quiet and relax place to sleep, it's open. No problem. very recomended, fresh. have pavement.

name: creek plateau
description: nice private plateau overlooking Frazier Creek

name: Lake Almanour RV Dump and Water
description: There's actually four dump stations a bunch of potable water stations and a bunch of waterrinse spring tower thingies without threaded nozzles on the end. Right off the highway on the west side of the lake. Beautiful drive. There was a board that said fee and there was envelopes/drop safe but there was no instructions and no writing on the envelopes. There are a number of campgrounds nearby so it could have been for that too, tt wasn't clear.

name: Bald Ridge Creek
description: Beautiful campground owned by US Core of Engineers.  Located on Lake Sidney Lanier.  Swimming, and boating.  AT&T and TMobile service aren’t that great.  Only complaints is a lot of people don’t dispose of dog waste like they should.  Booked on Rec.gov

name: Country Inn Mall of America
description: I asked permission at the front desk and they very openly told me I was ok!! Park between Homewood Suites and Country Inn for the quietest spot in the lot

name: Dumont Lake Campground
description: NFS Campground. Not really big rig friendly but there are a couple of spots that would do. No water at the moment but the are working on it. Price is reduced to $10 instead of $12 until they get the water back on. No view of the lake from the campground, but it's a short walk. They saved the best views for the adjacent picnic areas. Reservations online, but a few spots are first come

name: Kaibab N.F FR 12
