description: West of FR 12  . Unmarked road that leads to older campsite .  Quiet on the weekdays but FR12 can get busy with off road vehicles.  Meadow on the east side of FR12  with water hole for cattle and wildlife.  Cell reception is almost non existent here through Verizon .

name: Costco Diesel
description: If you have a Costco membership it's the cheapest diesel we could find in town.

name: Moffett Beach Campground
description: Beautiful campground on the lake.   Hot Showers,  dump station,  wooded setting.   Pets OK. $28.50/ night for non NY residents. Decent cell service.

name: Thunder Canyon Campground
description: Big Rig Friendly, 54 campsites.  John & Mercedes Condon of the RV Odd Couple founded the RV Odd Squad in 2018. The RV Odd Squad started as loving nickname for their Youtube following. The group has evolved and now the RV Odd Squad is a Membership of RV’ers who help others considering the RV Lifestyle.

name: Living water
description: Fee based water dispenser 5gal for $1.75

name: Harrisonburg View Alternative Site
description: The main site was taken so I grabbed this alternative about 100m to the north and it's absolutely wonderful! Enough space for two vehicles

name: curbside pull off next to park
description: nice quiet location, only a few cars drove by during the night. it's on the opposite side of a dog park

name: camping World
description: not currently working but they'll probably fix it soon. there's also a water spigot here.

name: Blackfeet Indian Memorial
description: Large turnout/gravel lot for the Blackfeet Indian Memorial Park. Just 5-10 minutes outside of the St Mary entrance to Glacier National Park. We stayed here for one night in our class A motor home (27ft). Did not experience any issues. There was a tour bus that showed up in the morning, but we were about to leave by that point.

name: Park side street
description:
Quite street behind a park with a nice picnic bench and hammock spot next to your van. Quieter then other spots listed 

*if it’s summer time I highly recommend going to John Topits park just down the road for some nice hiking trails and tons of free huckleberry picking

name: Cafe Khao Neow - Laotian Cuisine
description: Super good food and awesome service here!

name: Bigelow trailhead
description: Threaded tap next to the toilet hut. Potable water. Fresh and good flow

name: Old Mt Lemmon road
description: One of many spots along the old Mt Lemon road. Access road requires high ground clearance. This spot is large , flat, with a fire pit. Very close to the road but very few traffic during the day and no traffic at night. 4 bars AT&T.

name: Jubilee State Park
description: State park Campground that has a dump station. $5 dump for those not staying at the Campground.

name: Harbor Plaza Street Parking
description: This is public street parking and there are no "no overnight parking" signs. It's near a paved bicycle trail head and a restroom. We stayed here for one night because it's near the Carnival Cruise Ship Terminal and we were catching a carnival cruise to Mexico the next day. It is near a main road used to get out of the harbor so it was a bit noisy even late at night. The bike trail does have a small area of no parking signs to ensure vehicles do not park in front of the trail where it crosses the road, but it's clearly marked. It is right next to Harry Bridges Memorial Park.

name: Near Joshua Tree BLM
description: Far enough away from the Interstate that it’s not too loud, but still can hear it. End of a dirt/sandy road off of the main road to Joshua Tree. Great spot close to the park. The first part of the road is semi loose sand but after that turns into hard dirt/sand making for east travel.

name: Shodack Island State Park
description: 6$ for day use on weekends, free on weekends. No clue about overnight camping costs but we showed up late (10pm) and left early (6am) and we did not have to pay.

name: Hellgate Campground
description: There is a potable water hydrant in the day use/ boat ramp area, close to the boat ramps on a little hill. Big rig friendly, plenty of room.

name: Lusk Fairgrounds
description: Two Frost-frees in the corners next to the white corrals on the parking lot side

name: Temple Forest Campground
description:
This is one of the best rustic sites I've found, please try to keep it this way! Camping along the river, informal sorts of sites on top of the dune descent to the river. No amenities at all, but also no fee's. Verizon 1 bar 1.8mpbs At&t 3 bars 1.5mbps 

Big rigs and RVs, the road is small (someone is reversing if two vehicles are headed opposite directions) and gets progressively sandy the further back you go, there was a 30ish ft towable trailer back here when I visited.

name: Maine rest area
description: looks like a good place to stop for the night in Maine and then head to New Hampshire done

name: Manistee National Forest
description: Decided to camp at USFS Diamond Point  campground on Friday. Two spots for paid camping ($10/site) were occupied. Turned around and found this dirt road and got to this spot. looks like campers  had camped here before. The dirt road end has a gate that clearly indicates  that beyond this point individual property starts. stayed overnight, nice, peace and quiet. Mosquito repellant did wonders. Nice shady spot. will definitely  come back here.

name: jackman rest area
description: looks like good place to sleep on way to new hampshire

name: Fr 222 off of Hwy 180
description: beautiful area with lots of room even for large rigs. Tall Douglass Pines will provide lots of shade. Some sunny spots moving with the sun throughout the forest. 1-2 bars of Verizon and T-mobile.

name: Lakefront - 4th and Tunis
description:
Great place for a C class. Very shady all day. Level, then an easy 5-10 mins walk away. 

No services but 3 bars LTE on t-mobile

name: Wellfleet Town Pier
description: Big marina parking lot with public toilets and a shower.

name: White Horse Lake Campground
description: Established campsites with lake in view.  Pit toilets, water at Host entrance. This is a paided campground with reservations and some first come campsites. Non motorized boats, fishing, hiking trails in the tall pines. Weekdays , quiet .

name: Starbucks
description: Pasamos un par de noches sin problemas , mucho espacio hay wifi de la tienda

name: Clear Creek Spur
description: Short gravel track turning off of Munson Slough Road, ending almost on the bank of Clear Creek. Surrounded by mature mixed Birch and conifer forest. Fits up to 32 ft rig but the initial approach is very steep so watch your overhangs. Some noise from the Richardson Highway through the woods. No traffic on Munson when we stayed. No signs or gates. No Verizon signal.

name: Pollina access road off NFS road
description: A nice spot not to far from highway 2. A little loud from highway noise and not super easy to get level but great for a night or two! There may be more spots up the FSR I didn’t check. Good Verizon!

name: Agua potable
description: Lugar para cargar agua en la carretera vía a Ángeles

name: Benton Lake Campground  USFS
description: Nice campground with access to water and toilets. $22/night. Half with Senior pass discount

name: Grass Bluff Above the Ocean
description: Might very well be the same as the one north and south, but it deserves to be here twice. Amazing grass bluff with tons of room. No amenities. US Cellular 3-4 Bars.

name: Pay by App parking
description: Middle of downtown. Across from museums and park. Easy walk to Capitol and restaurants. $10 all day parking. per receipt the "Day" ends at 0600. adjacent gas station has restroom. lots of traffic during day. Ran genny during heat with no problems. Early departure is a must or I guess you could pay for another day. there appears to be monthly parking here so there are several cars overnight. Not much boondocking in Boise so for $10 this was a pretty good option.

name: Safeway fuel station, Anderson
description: Free dump site at fuel station. When you first pull in, to the right. Yellow painted curbs. Believe there is also water here. Not sure. Free!

name: Pacific Gophersnake
description: We parked here by the road next to a nice Farm Shop. It is a dead end road going directly off highway 101. I think it is only accessible when going south. You can still hear the highway but otherwise a very peaceful place.

name: The Water Mill - $ 0.25 Per Gallon
description: Just a standard filtered water dispenser. Easily accessible, easily fit my 6 gallon jerry can.
